loans.name: Theresa

texts.en:
Theresa is 41 years old and married with five children. She earns her living by selling bags.

She hopes to receive a loan in the amount of N80,000. With these funds, she wishes to purchase more bags to sell.

She sends her thanks.

loans.use: To purchase more bags to sell

loans.name: Rose

texts.en: Rose is a 46-year-old restaurant operator. She is married and blessed with seven children. With the income from her business, she has provided for five of her children to graduate from high school. In her restaurant, she prepares and sells local foods like rice balls, fufu and banku. Fufu is prepared from pounded cassava and plantain and eaten with all kinds of soup. Banku is prepared from milled maize grains and is eaten with hot pepper or soup. Rose says that the price of raw materials has gone up significantly and she needs the support of a loan to enable her to meet her production expenditures. She wants to use the loan to buy more ingredients like bags of maize, baskets of cassava, plantain, meat, fish, rice, vegetables and firewood. Rose is a member of a group called Sure Trust Group. In this group, members guarantee and provide support to one another to repay their loans.

loans.use: To purchase food ingredients.

loans.name: Helen

texts.en: Helen E. sells provisions, drinks and foodstuffs. She is 38 years old and married with five children. She hopes for a loan of 80,000 nairas to purchase more stock to sell. She thanks you.

loans.use: To purchase more provisions, drinks and foodstuffs to sell

loans.name: Eunice

texts.en: Eunice O. sells palm oil. She is 36 years old and married with two children. She is requesting a loan of 80,000 nairas to purchase more palm oil to sell. She says thank you to all Kiva lenders!

loans.use: To purchase more palm oil to sell

loans.name: Justina

texts.en: Justina A. sells children's clothes. She is 34 years old and married with five children. She hopes for the loan amount of N40,000 to purchase more children's clothes to sell. She says thank you.

loans.use: To purchase more children's clothes to sell

loans.name: Mujeres Luchadoras Group

texts.es:
Este comité se formo a traves de la Sra. Jorgelina L. de Valdez, quien se entero acerca de la  Fundacion Paraguaya y del programa gracias a las integrantes de otro grupo.

Una de las integrantes es Sra. Isidora E. de Garcia.  Ella tiene 46años y tiene 8 hijos.  Ella es una mujer sacrificada, hace 11 años que se dedica en la venta de chipas en la zona de Lambare.  Tambien ella recorre para vender su chipa en los barrios y otras localidades. Ella hace 2 años que esta en el grupo, y actualmente ya cuenta tambien con un negocio en su casa.

Ella valora y agradece esta iniciativa de Comité de Mujeres Emprendedoras porque a partir de esto ella puede ayudarle al marido para los gasto de la casa y tambien para los gastos escolares de los hijos y dice que solo hay que poner ganas y perseverar en el objetivo trazado porque ella siempre soñaba con tener su propio negocio en su casa y ahora es un sueño hecho realidad.

Las otras integrantes son:  

Jorgelina Lopezde Valgez.	Vta de ropas
Maria N. R. de Vargas. 	Coprtin
Isidora E. de Garcia.	Venta de chipas
Juliana A. M.  	Copetin
Liliana Beatriz A.. 	Vta de caramelos y reciclaje.

Maria Vicenta V..	 Vta de bebidas
 Martina M..	Manicurista
Carolina S.A.. 	Venta de ropas
Juana F.C. . 	Vta de reciclaje
Maria N.F..
	Vta de bebidas
Maria A.Gamez. 	Vta de producto alimenticio
Natividad V..	Vta de osmeticos
Rosalia I.M. L.	Vta de hamburgesa
Van E.B. M.  	Vta de helado
Renira R.B. M.  	Vta de cosmeticos 
Mirian B. O. V.	Vta de ropas
Ramona G. M. S. 	 Vta de bebidas
 Maura M. Ferreira M.	Vta de comida
 Diana B.G. E.	Copetin
Anacleta A. 	Despensa
texts.en:
This group formed via Jorgelina L. de Valdez. She found out about the Fundacion Paraguaya and the program thanks to members of another group. One of the members, Isidora E. de Garcia, is 46 and has eight children. She is a self-sacrificing woman. For eleven years she has been selling chipas, a typical corn-bread street snack in Paraguay, in the Lambare zone. She also travels to the neighborhoods and other places to sell her chipas. She has been in the group for two years. She currently has a business in her house as well. She values and is thankful for this initiative by the Comité de Mujeres Emprendedoras. Because of this she can help her husband with the household expenses and the children’s school expenses. She says you just have to set your mind to it and persevere to meet your objective. She has always dreamed of having her own business in her house, and now her dream has become a reality. The other members are: Jorgelina Lopezde Valgez. Clothing sales Maria N. R. de Vargas. Small Fast Food Stand Isidora E. de Garcia. Sells chipas Juliana A. M. Small Fast Food Stand Liliana Beatriz A.. Sells candy and recycling Maria Vicenta V.. Sells drinks Martina M.. Manicurist Carolina S.A.. Clothing sales Juana F.C. . Recycling Maria N.F.. Sells drinks Maria A.Gamez. Sells nutrional products Natividad V.. Sells cosmetics Rosalia I.M. L. Sells hamburgers Van E.B. M. Sells ice cream Renira R.B. M. Sells cosmetics Mirian B. O. V. Clothing sales Ramona G. M. S. Sells drinks Maura M. Ferreira M. Sells meals Diana B.G. E. Small Fast Food Stand Anacleta A. Small grocery store

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Cosmetic sales:  lipstick, creams, shampoos, deodorants, colognes, etc.;  Sale of merchandise: slippers, bracelets, earrings, barrettes, make up holders, powder, cotton, etc

loans.name: Mecedes

texts.es:
La señora Mercedes es socia del banco comunal “Las Fronterizas” en el distrito de Desaguadero, Provincia de Chucuito, Departamento de Puno; de  31 años de edad, tiene dos hijos y posee estudios de secundaria incompleta (segundo de secundaria).
Trabaja desde hace tres años con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos e inicio su negocio de preparación de jugos con su primer préstamo de S/. 300.00 Nuevos  soles y se siente contenta porque le permitió ayudar con los gastos del hogar.
Con este préstamo de S/. 3000.00 Nuevos soles podrá ampliar su negocio de venta de jugos, comprará nuevos equipos y accesorios; así como insumos, comprará frutas como naranjas, plátanos, piñas, papayas, y otros insumos como azúcar, algarrobita, huevos; de esta manera contribuirá a mejorar la calidad educativa de sus hijos,
texts.en:
Mercedes is a member of the community bank “Las Fronterizas” in the Desaguadero district, in the province of Chucuito, in the Puno department. She is 31 years old, has two children, and has an incomplete secondary education. She has worked for three years with the Manuela Ramos Movement and started her juice business with her first loan of 300 soles. This made her happy because it helped her cover her household expenses. With this loan of 3,000 soles, she will be able to grow her juice selling business by purchasing new equipment, accessories, and fruit such as oranges, bananas, pineapple, and papaya. She will also purchase other ingredients such as sugar, carob, and eggs. This will contribute to improving the quality of education of her children.

Translated from Spanish by Josh Wilcox, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase new equipment and accessories, such as necessary ingredients to grow her business like bananas, pineapple, papaya, sugar, oranges, carob, and eggs

loans.name: Florent

texts.fr: N. Florent est né le 04/07/1974 à Lalo dans le Département du Couffo. Florent est marié à AKOWANOU Célestine, revendeuse de tissus bazin à Dantokpa, grand marché international du Bénin. Florent et Célestine ont un seul enfant du nom de Béni,âgé de quatre (4)ans déjà inscrit à la maternelle. Florent vit avec sa famille à Cotonou, Capitale Économique du Bénin au quartier Gbèdjromédé. Florent eut un bref parcours académique et alla ensuite en apprentissage de couture. Après l'obtention de son diplôme de fin de formation Florent exerça la couture pendant six ans seulement. Florent s'est en effet lancé dans vente des produits congelés et des boissons de la brasserie. Florent vend ses produits au marché AIDJEDO, un marché de la Commune de Cotonou. Florent a besoin d'augmenter le volume de son activité pour mieux satisfaire sa clientèle de plus en plus importante. C'est la raison pour laquelle Florent sollicite ce premier prêt pour renforcer son activité.
texts.en:
N. Florent was born on July 4, 1974 in Lalo in the county of Couffo. Florent is married to Akowanou Célestine, who sells "bazin" (damask cloth) in Dantokpa, the big international market of Bénin. Florent and Célestine have an only child, Béni, 4 years old and already in pre-school. Florent lives with his family in Cotonou, economic capital of Bénin in the Gbèdjromédé neighborhood. Florent went to school for a brief period and then went into an apprenticeship in tailoring. After receiving his diploma at the end of the apprenticeship, Florent worked as a tailor for 6 years only. Then he got into selling frozen foods and beer. He sells his products at the Aidjedo market, a market of the township of Cotonou. He needs to scale up his business to satisfy his ever-growing clientele. This is why he is requesting this first loan to bolster his business.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: 25 crates of beer, 150 kg of fish, 50 kg of chicken

loans.name: Nalda Estrella

texts.es:
La Señora Nalda es socia del banco comunal “Las Fronterizas” en el distrito de Desaguadero, Provincia de Chucuito, Departamento de Puno; tiene 37 años de edad y es de la ciudad de Huacho, es  madre de dos hijos, estudio hasta el 4to nivel universitario.

Trabaja con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos desde hace dos años, e inicio su préstamo con S/. 300.00 Nuevos soles, que le sirvió de capital en su negocio de elaboración de jugos.

Debido a la necesidad de ampliar su negocio por la demanda, ahora desea un préstamo de S/. 3000.00 soles para adquirir mas insumos, comprará frutas como platanos, papayas, piñas, naranjas e insumos: azúcar y leche; ello le permitirá incrementar sus utilidades y ayudar al bienestar de sus hijos, por lo  mismo agradece al Movimiento Manuela Ramos por la confianza  y su apoyo a las mujeres.
texts.en:
Nalda is a member of the "Las Fronterizas" communal bank in the district Desaguadero, Chucuito Province in the state of Puno. She is 37 years old and from the city of Huacho. She is the mother of two children and completed four years of university study. She has worked with Movimiento Manuela Ramos group for two years and started with a loan of 300 Nuevos Soles, which served as capital for her juice making business. Due to the need to expand her business because of increase demand, she currently is requesting a loan of 3,000 Nuevos Soles to purchase more ingredients such as bananas, papayas, pineapples, oranges, sugar, and milk. This will allow her to profits and help the well being of her children and she is very grateful to Movimiento Manuela Ramos for the confidence and support they give to the women in the group.

Translated from Spanish by Donald Allen, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of ingredients such as bananas, papayas, pineapples, oranges, sugar and milk

loans.name: Nolberta

texts.es:
La señora Nolberta es Socia del banco comunal “Las Fronterizas” en el distrito de Desaguadero, Provincia de Chucuito, Departamento de Puno; de 54 años de edad, es madre de 4 hijos y tiene estudios de secundaria completa.
Trabaja desde hace 8 años con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos y su primer prestamo fue de S/.300 soles, monto que le sirvió para adquirir más mercadería en su tienda de abarrotes.
Con este préstamo de S/. 2,500.00 nuevos soles podrá adquirir una variedad de productos como arroz, azúcar, conservas, leche, aceite y enlatados. Ello le permitirá tener mejores ingresos y ayudará con los ingresos en su economía familiar
texts.en:
Nolberta is a member of Las Fronterizas Communal Bank in the Desaguadero district of Chucuito in the state of Puno. She is 54 years old, the mother of four children and a high school graduate. For the past eight years she has worked with the Manuela Ramos Movement and her first loan was for 300 soles, money she used to buy more merchandise to sell in her general store. With this loan of 2,500 soles she will be able to purchase a variety of products like rice, sugar, milk, cooking oil and canned goods. This will help her to have a better income which contributes to the income of her family.

Translated from Spanish by Hugh Yarbrough, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase rice, sugar, milk, cooking oil and canned goods to sell in a general store

loans.name: Lidia

texts.es:
La señora Lidia, pertenece al Banco Comunal “Rio Desaguadero” del distrito de Desaguadero, Provincia de Chucuito, Departamento de Puno; tiene 24 años de edad y 1 hijo. Posee estudios de secundaria incompleta (tercero de secundaria). 

Trabaja con el movimiento Manuela Ramos desde hace 4 años e inicio su negocio de abarrotes con un préstamo inicial de S/. 300.00 nuevos soles, el cual invirtió como capital adicional.

Debido a la demanda de sus clientes, actualmente ella requiere un préstamo de S/. 2500.00 nuevos soles, para poder invertir en la compra de  mercadería variada (arroz, azúcar, fideos, enlatados, conservas, aceites, mantequilla, conservas, etc.), esto le permitirá incrementar sus ganancias y ayudar a su familia.
texts.en:
Lidia belongs to Rio Desaguadero Communal Bank located in the district of Desaguadero of the Chucuito province in the state of Puno. She is 24 years old and has one child. She did not finish high school (12th grade). Lidia has worked with the Manuela Ramos Movement for the past four years and started her general store with an initial loan of 300 soles, money used to invest in additional working capital. Due to the demand of her customers, she now requires a loan of 2,500 soles to be able to purchase a variety of merchandise (rice, sugar, pasta, canned goods, cooking oil, butter, etc.) so she can increase her earnings and help her family.

Translated from Spanish by Hugh Yarbrough, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase rice, sugar, pasta, canned goods, cooking oil, butter, etc.

loans.name: Mujeres Victoriosas Group

texts.es:
Una integrante de este comite es la Sra. Mariza M. L..  Ella tiene 27  años y tiene dos hijos. Es una mujer muy emprendedora y se didica en la confecion de ropas y lleva a vender en la ciudad de San Lorenzo a un comercio. A la venida ya compra la tela de la tienda para confecionar.  Tambien ella tiene su pequeño comercio en su casa.  Mariza agradece a la Fundacion Paraguaya por el apoyo que se les da a travez del prestamo grupal porque mediante eso estan saliendo adelante.

Las otras integrantes son: 

Maria Elena Vazquez.	Venta de merceria
Elida V.. 	 Venta de merceria
Maria Fulvia M..	Venta deropa
Maria Irene M.. 	Vendedora Ambulante
Luciana G..	Venta de verduras.

Maria del C..	Vta de comida.
Isabel L.. 	Venta de ropas.
Marta O.. 	Venta de frutas.
 Fermina A..	Venta de ropas.
 Miryan A..	Recicladora.
Liz O..	Venta de Bebidas.
Teresa T..	Despensa.
Ancia C..	Venta de articulos varios.
Yohana G..  	Reciclaje.
Maria Natalia T.. 	Venta de plateria. 
Angela O.. 	Copetin.
Mariza M.. 	 Modista. 
Ester A.. 	Venta de frutas.
texts.en:
One member of this group is Mrs. Mariza M. López. She is 27 years old and has two children. She is a very enterprising woman and works making clothing that she takes to sell to a business in the city of San Lorenzo. Before she returns, she buys the fabric she needs from the store. She also has a small business in her home. Mariza thanks Fundación Paraguaya for the support it gives through the group loan because with it they are getting ahead. The other members are: María Elena Vázquez - General merchandise sales Elida V. - General merchandise sales María Fulvia M. - Clothing sales María Irene M. - Traveling sales Luciana Gómez - Fruit sales María del C. - Food sales Isabel López - Clothing sales Marta O. - Fruit sales Fermina A. - Clothing sales Miryan A. - Recycler Liz O. - Beverage sales Teresa T. - General store Ancia C. - General merchandise sales Yohana G. - Recycler María Natalia T. - Silver sales Angela O. - Beverage sales Mariza M. - Seamstress Ester A. - Fruit sales

Translated from Spanish by Hugh Yarbrough, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase a wide variety of merchandise to sell

loans.name: Robertha

texts.es:
La señora Roberta  es socia del Banco Comunal “Yunga Uyo” en  Distrito de Yunguyo, la  provincia de Chucuito, departamento de Puno, ella tiene 38 años de edad, estado civil casada, con 3 hijos, Vive en el Barrio Bolognesi Calle 7 de Junio  s/n, ella tiene estudios de primaria completa.

Trabaja con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos desde hace 4 años, su primer préstamo fue de S/ 300.00 nuevos soles, ella tiene un negocio de compra venta de muebles.

Actualmente ella desea un préstamo adicional de S/ 500.00 nuevos soles,  con los cuales comprara muebles y si se da el caso comprar madera para su confección (realizada por su esposo), para la venta en el mercado local.

Su deseo es continuar trabajando para mejorar su negocio y así poder darles una profesión a sus hijos.
 
Asimismo ella nos comenta lo  que más le gusta de su Banco Comunal son los ahorros y las charlas ya que aprende muchas cosas.
texts.en:
Señora Robertha is a member of the Yunga Uyo Communal Bank in the Yunguyo District, Chuchito Province, Department of Puno. She is 38 years of age and in a civil marriage with three children. She lives on 7 de Junio Street in the Bolognesi neighborhood. She has a primary school education. Señora Robertha has been working with the Manuela Ramos Movement for four years, and her first loan was for 300 New Sols. She has a business buying and selling furniture. Presently she would like an additional loan of 500 New Sols with which to buy furniture and, should the opportunity present itself, to buy lumber to build some (her husband would do this) in order to sell it in the local market. Her wish is to continue working to improve her business and thus to be able to provide an occupation for her children. She also tells us that what she likes best about the Communal Bank are her savings and the discussions from which she has learned many things.

Translated from Spanish by Daniel Kvaka, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy furniture, and lumber to build furniture.

loans.name: Marie Claire

texts.en:
Greetings from U. Marie Claire, a 29-year-old married woman. She and her husband have two children, one who is 4 and another who is 5 months old, and 3 orphans, who are 8, 9 and 12 years old. She lives in the Byumba sector of the Gicumbi district in the northern province of Rwanda.

This entrepreneur does her business in the Gicumbi district, where she owns a small mixed-retail shop of mostly spare parts. She is able to earn $175 monthly profit from her business. Her husband does not have a fixed monthly income or salary because he is a mechanic and works accordingly. This entrepreneur is requesting her first loan worth 400000 Rwf from Vision Finance Company, a Kiva partner, which will help her to buy more spare parts. U. employs two workers in her business, which she started in 2004.

U. will reinvest the increased profits in the same business, pay school fees for her children and have more savings.

loans.use: Expand the business

loans.name: Marie

texts.fr:
T. Marie est née le 02/10/1970 à Cotonou, Capitale Économique du Bénin. Marie est originaire de la Commune d'Abomey-Calavi. Marie est mariée à HONVOU Siméon, employé à l'ambassade des USA au Bénin. 
Marie est mère de trois enfants: Loïc, Antoine et Denise tous scolarisés. Marie habite Hêvié, une agglomération située à quelques kilomètres de Cotonou. Marie a fait une formation en imprimerie et en informatique et elle a été secrétaire pendant huit ans dans ne société de transis. Aujourd'hui, Marie vend de la friperie et toute sorte d'articles d'occasion venus de l'Occident(vêtement, chaussures, appareils électroménagers, etc.) dans une boutique au domicile familial de son mari au quartier Agontinkon à Cotonou. Marie sollicite ce premier crédit à ALIDé pour agrandir son activité afin de mieux répondre aux attentes de sa clientèle.
texts.en:
T. Marie was born on October 2, 1970 in Cotonou, economic capital of Bénin. Marie comes from the township of Abomey-Calavi. She is married to Honvou Siméon, who is an employee of the US Embassy in Bénin. Marie is the mother of 3 children: Loïc, Antoine and Denise, all enrolled in school. Marie lives in Hêvié, a settlement situated some kilometers from Cotonou. She did studies in printing and computer sciences and was a secretary for 8 years in a transit company. Today, Marie sells used clothing and all sorts of other bargain items from the West (clothing, shoes, electric appliances, etc.) in a little shop in the family home of her husband in the Agontinkon neighborhood in Cotonou. Marie is requesting her first loan from ALIDé to expand her business so as to satisfy the needs of her clientele.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase of 4 bales of used clothing

loans.name: Ablaye

texts.fr: ABLAYE S. 	est un commerçant il vend des cassettes et radio à la gare routière de Mbour  depuis plus de cinq  5 ans.il a quitté l’école très top .pour gagner sa vie il s’est converti dans le commerce il a débuté par le commerce ambulants à travers les rues de Mbour avant d’ouvrir une boutique a partir de ses économies. Il a est a son troisième prêt au niveau de la caisse. Célibataire sans enfant il compte avec ses économies se marier et construire une maison. Avec le prêt qu’il sollicite il souhaite renforcer  en achetant plus de marchandises pour accroitre ses revenus.
texts.en:
Ablaye S. is a merchant who has been selling cassettes and radios at the Mbour bus station for over five years. He left school very early to earn his living. He got converted to commerce, starting off with going door-to-door through the streets of Mbour. Later, he opened a shop starting with his savings. Ablaye is on his third loan with the bank. He is unmarried and has no children. He intends to use his saving to get married and to build a house. With the loan he's requesting, he would like to bolster his business by buying more merchandise, so as to grow his revenues.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Awudu

texts.en: Awudu R. is thirty-seven years old. He is married and has seven children with his wife. Two of the children are males and three are females. Some are in the primary school while others are yet to start school. He lives with his wife and children in a rented apartment in Goaso in the Brong Ahafo Region. Goaso is one of the busy business centres in the region. His wife is a trader. Awudu deals in livestock. He buys livestock – goats, sheep, cattle, etc. all the way from the northern part of the country and sells to butchers and restaurant operators in his community. Awudu has been in business for eleven years. He is hopeful to give his children a good education.

loans.use: To buy livestock

loans.name: Eric

texts.en:
Eric owns and operates a grocery shop and sells items like rice, evaporated milk, canned foods and drinks, assorted cooking oils, etc. He is 58 years old and married with seven children. Two of his children are still in school. 
He wants to use this loan to buy more rice, canned foods and drinks, and milk etc. to expand his business. He believes that with increased working capital he will have the capacity to purchase more good quality groceries to serve his customers. He will raise more income to finance his children’s education and provide them with more opportunities in life than what he had. 
He belongs to the community group called Hosaiah Trust Group. In this group, members guarantee for one another as social collateral to access loans and there is peer pressure to repay the loans.

loans.use: To restock grocery store

loans.name: Kwame

texts.en:
Kwame is fifty year old man, married and the father of four children. He trades in cassava, plantain, maize, millet, palm oil, and yam. Kwame is convinced that his business can grow with increased working capital. He is requesting loan to buy baskets of tomatoes, groundnuts, bags of maize, and tubers of yam to increase his stock. He hopes to improve his income so he can finance the education of his children. 

Kwame belongs to the community group called Sure Trust Group. In this group, members guarantee for one another to act as social collateral to access a loan, and provide encouragement to repay it.

loans.use: To procure food items

loans.name: Patricia

texts.en: Patricia O. is a 34-year-old married mother of three children. She has one son and two daughters; the youngest two are currently in primary school. She lives with her husband and the children in a very busy commercial town called Goaso in the Brong Ahafo region of Ghana. Both Patricia and her husband are traders. She trades in slippers, which she buys from Kumasi and other towns to resell. She has been in business for three years. She hopes to expand her business and increase her profit margin. It is her desire to sponsor her children through high levels of school.

loans.use: Purchase slippers

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth Z. is 48 years old. She is married with five children who are currently schooling. She is a supplier and wholesaler, trading in foods like onions, pepper, and salt. Elizabeth treks to near by villages and communities to purchase her inventory, which she then resells to her retail customers at the busy market of Agbloboshie, near where she lives.  She is requesting a loan to buy more stock to scale up her business. She would like to buy more bags of beans and onions to increase her inventory. 

Elizabeth hopes to double up savings to take care of her kids in school. She belongs to the community loan group called Hosaiah Trust Group. In this group, members guarantee the loan for one another and encourage each other to repay.

loans.use: Purchase food to sell to retailers

loans.name: Janet

texts.en:
Janet B. trades in ladies’ wear – underwear, tops, jewels, etc. She buys from Kumasi and hawks the clothes in her community. Janet also treks to other towns to sell on their market days. 
She is 27 years of age, married and the mother of two children – a son and a daughter. She says at the moment both of the children are in primary school. She lives with her husband and the children in a very busy commercial town called Goaso, in the Brong Ahafo region of Ghana. Her husband works at the local district assembly. 
She has been in business for three years. Janet is hoping to expand her business and increase her profit margin. It is her desire to sponsor her children through school to high levels.

loans.use: To buy ladies’ wear

loans.name: Eliza

texts.en:
Eliza, age forty-nine, is a married woman with five children who are in school. Eliza lives with her family in Kasoa, Ghana. She runs a grocery shop in her neighborhood. She also sells food items, such as pepper, fish, eggplants, spices, and tomatoes, on a table-top in front of her shop. She has been in business for fifteen years.

Eliza buys her goods from wholesalers in the city and sells them retail to her customers. She wants to buy the goods in bulk to save her the problem of frequent trips. Eliza is in a group called “Best.” The group members guarantee for one another as collateral to access the loans and provide assistance to one another to repay their loans.

loans.use: To purchase groceries.

loans.name: Ayishetu

texts.en:
Ayishetu is thirty-five years old. She is married and has five children. Currently, all of her children are in school. She is a food vendor and sells "waakye," which is cooked rice and beans enjoyed with stew, macaroni and fish. It is sold in the mornings as breakfast. It is very tasty and satisfying and almost all tribes in Ghana enjoy waakye.

She wants to use the loan to buy more bags of rice, beans, and vegetables to increase her stock of goods. She is a member of a community group called the Best Trust Group. In this group, members guarantee for one another as social collateral to access loans and to provide peer pressure to repay the loans.

loans.use: To buy food ingredients

loans.name: Aurore

texts.fr: A. Aurore est née le 22/11/1978 à Cotonou, Capitale Économique du Bénin. Aurore est originaire de Dassa-Zoumè dans le Département des Collines au Centre du Bénin. Aurore est célibataire avec un enfant: Saturnine. Après un bref cursus scolaire, Aurore apprit à faire la couture et la layette mais elle n'exerça pas ce métier. En effet, Aurore ouvrit une petite boulangerie grâce à l'aide de ses parents. Mais quatre (4) ans après, Aurore a dû fermer à cause de son ex-mari à qui elle a confié la gestion alors qu'elle était malade et qui a détourné tous ses fonds. Actuellement Aurore vend des bijoux et tissus bazin à son domicile à Vèdoko, un quartier populaire de la Commune de Cotonou. C'est pour développer son activité que Aurore sollicite ce premier prêt de ALIDé.
texts.en:
A. Aurore was born on November 22, 1978 in Cotonou, the economic capital of Benin. She traces her roots to Dassa-Zoumè, in Collines County in central Benin. She is unmarried and has a child, Saturnine. After a brief degree course, Aurore learned the trade of sewing and making infant clothing, but she didn't work in the trade. Actually, she opened a small bakery, thanks to the help of her parents. Four years later, she had to close it because of her ex-husband, to whom she entrusted the managing of it when she was ill, who then embezzled all the funds. Currently, Aurore sells jewelry and damask cloth out of her home in Vèdoko, a populated district of the town of Cotonou. To develop her business, she's requesting this first loan from ALIDÉ.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy damask cloth and jewelry to sell

loans.name: Akosua

texts.en:
Akosua A. is thirty-seven years of age and is a married mother of six children – three sons and three daughters. Some of the children are in the senior high school while others are in junior high and the primary schools. She lives with her husband and children in a very busy commercial town called Goaso in the Brong Ahafo region of Ghana. Her husband is a farmer.

Akosua is a trader. She trades in food items such as yams, rice, eggs, oil, etc. She buys her goods from Kumasi and sells them on a table top in the market square. Akosua says she also treks to other towns to sell on their market days. She has been in business for seven years and wants a loan to buy goods in bulk. She hopes to expand her business and increase her profit margin. It is her desire to sponsor her children in school to high levels.

loans.use: To buy food items

loans.name: Doris

texts.en:
Doris is a 29-year-old trader. She is married and has one child who is currently in school. She has been selling used clothes in the local market of Kasoa for eight years. With income from her business, Doris supports her child in pre-school.

Her major business challenge over the years is finding enough funds to expand her business. She has lots of marketing experience and is very confident that a loan would enable her to achieve remarkable business progress. She wants to use the loan to buy more bales of used clothes to serve her customers. She hopes to save enough to support her children while they complete school.

Doris is a member of a community group called the Sure Trust Group. In this group, members guarantee for one another as social collateral to access loans and provide peer pressure to repay the loans.

loans.use: To purchase used clothes

loans.name: Esi

texts.en:
Esi A. is forty-seven years old. She is a divorced mother of three children – all daughters. The youngest is in the senior high school while the rest are out of school. She lives with the children in a rented apartment in a very busy commercial town called Goaso in the Brong Ahafo Region of Ghana.

Esi is a trader. She sells cosmetics such as pomades, body spray, powder, and body lotion, and she also sells footwear. She buys her goods from Kumasi and hawks (sells door-to-door) in her community. Esi also treks to other towns to sell. She has been in business for over ten years and wants a loan to buy goods in bulk. She hopes to expand her business and increase her profit margin. It is her desire to sponsor her youngest daughter to the higher levels of academia.

loans.use: To buy cosmetics

loans.name: Felicia

texts.en:
Felicia is 29 years old. She has two children who are in school. She is a very hard-working and resourceful mother. She is a supplier and retailer of charcoal in her neighborhood. Charcoal is very popular source of energy for cooking in almost all traditional Ghanaian homes. Felicia obtains her supply of charcoal from the surrounding village of Dukope in the northern region of Ghana and retails them to her customers.

Felicia wants to use the loan to buy a bulk supply of charcoal to sell to her customers. She hopes to increase her savings to pay her children’s educational fees. She belongs to the community group called the “Thank you” trust group. In this group, members guarantee for one another as social collateral to repay their loans.

loans.use: To purchase charcoal in bulk.

loans.name: Kwame

texts.en:
Kwame A. is fifty-one years old. He is married and is the father fourteen children, eight males and six females. Some are the children are finished with school while others are in training colleges, senior high school and junior high school. He lives with the wife and some of the children in a family house in Goaso in the Brong Ahafo Region. Goaso is one of the busy business centres in the region. His wife is a farmer.

Kwame is a commercial driver and a trader. He runs a grocery store by the road side. He buys his groceries from Kumasi. Kwame has been in business for twelve years and wants a loan to buy goods in bulk to increase his stock. He hopes to expand his business and give his children a good education.

loans.use: To buy groceries

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is fifty years old. She is a wife and the mother of one child. Mary is a resourceful mother and successful businesswoman. She works hard to support her child in school.

Mary sells matches, combs, soap and small items, but she doesn't have enough working capital to expand her business. She believes that, with this loan, she will have more resources to supply her customers with available, quality stock. She hopes to earn a good income to support her family. She also want to add the sale of sachet water. She belongs to the community group called the Thank You Trust Group. In this group, members agree to guarantee for one another as social collateral to repay their loans.

loans.use: To purchase matches, combs, soaps and small items.

loans.name: Florence

texts.en:
Florence B. is fifty years old. She is a widowed mother of six children, two sons and four daughters. Some of her children are in the senior high school while others are in the junior high school and the primary school. She lives with some of her children in a family house in Goaso in the Brong Ahafo Region of Ghana. Goaso is one of the busy business centres in the region.

Florence runs a drug store by the road side in her community. She buys her drugs from Kumasi. She has been in business for over ten years and wants a loan to buy drugs in bulk to increase her stock. She hopes to expand her business and give her children a good education.

loans.use: To buy drugs

loans.name: Afia

texts.en:
Afia S. is forty-four years of age. She is a divorced mother of three children, one daughter and two sons. Some of her children are in the junior high school while others are in the primary school. She lives with the children in a rented apartment in a very busy commercial town called Goaso in the Brong Ahafo Region of Ghana.

Afia is a food vendor. She cooks and sells rice and stew. She prepares the food in her house and hawks (sells door-to door) in her community. She buys bags of rice and other ingredients from shops in her town. Afia also trades in infants’ layettes. She has been in business for seven years and wants a loan to buy goods in bulk. She hopes to expand her business and increase her profit margin. It is Afia’s desire to sponsor her children to high levels in school.

loans.use: To buy bags of rice

loans.name: David

texts.en: David M. runs a drugstore in his community. His store is by the roadside. He buys his medicines from Kumasi. David is 52 years old, married and has eleven children: six sons and five daughters. According to him, some of the children are in senior high school while others are in junior high and primary schools. He lives with his wife and children in a house in Goaso in the Brong Ahafo region. Goaso is one of the busiest business centres in the region. David has been in business for over 27 years and wants a loan to procure medicines in bulk to increase his stock. David is hoping to expand his business and give his children a good education.

loans.use: To buy medicines

loans.name: Adèle

texts.fr: E. Adèle est née vers 1981 à Abomey dans le Département du Zou. Adèle est mariée à AGBODJALOU Jean-Marie, un cuisinier de profession. Adèle et Jean-Marie ont deux enfants: Falonne et Mariella. Falonne est scolarisée et Mariella n'a pas encore l'âge d'aller à l'école. Adèle habite avec sa famille le quartier AGLA à Cotonou, Capitale Économique du Bénin. C'est la coiffure que Adèle mais elle n'a jamais exercé. Adèle s'est plutôt lancée dans la vente de vêtements et de tissus. C'est de façon ambulante à travers Cotonou, Capitale Économique du Bénin que Adèle vend ses articles. Adèle va s'approvisionner en vêtements et tissus à Lomé, Capitale du TOGO, pays frontalier au Bénin. Adèle a déjà eu deux crédits de ALIDé pour renforcer son fonds de roulement. Aujourd'hui encore, Adèle sollicite ce troisième prêt pour agrandir son étalage de tissus.
texts.en:
E. Adèle was born around 1981 in Abomey, in Zou County. She is married to AGBODJALOU Jean-Marie, a cook by profession. Adèle and Jean-Marie have two children: Falonne and Mariella. Falonne is in school, and Mariella is not yet old enough to go to school. She lives with her family in the AGLA district of Cotonou, the economic capital of Benin. Adèle is a hairdresser but never working in that trade. Rather, she got started in selling clothing and fabrics. In an itinerant manner, she goes throughout Cotonou selling her merchandise. She goes to stock up on clothing and fabrics in Lomé, the capital of Togo, a country bordering Benin. Adèle has already had two loans with ALIDÉ for boosting her working capital. Today, she's requesting this third loan to expand her display of fabrics.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy 20 bolts of Hitarget cloth (12 meters each)

loans.name: Kwaku

texts.en: Kwaku A. runs a provision store. His store is by the roadside. He buys his provisions from Kumasi. He is 38 years old, married and has two children: a boy and a girl. Both of his children are currently in  primary school. His wife is a trader. He lives with his wife and children in a rented apartment in Goaso, in the Brong Ahafo Region. Goaso is one of the busiest business centres in the region. Kwaku has been in business for seven years and wants a loan to procure goods in bulk to increase his stock. He is hoping to expand his business and give his children a good education.

loans.use: To buy provisions

loans.name: Salina

texts.en:
Salina A., 37, is a married mother of two girls. She says at the moment, both of her daughters are in primary school. She lives with her husband and the children in a very busy commercial town called Goaso in the Brong Ahafo region of Ghana. Her husband works at the local district assembly.

Salina is a trader. She trades in ladies clothing like underwear, tops, etc. Salina buys from Kumasi and hawks to sell in her community. She says she also treks to other towns to sell on their market days. She has been in business for more than 15 years. Salina hopes to expand her business and increase her profit margin. It is her desire to sponsor her children in school to high levels.

loans.use: To buy ladies wear

loans.name: Akua

texts.en: Akua A. is a food vendor. She runs a chop bar. She prepares and sells all kinds of local dishes at her restaurant. She buys food items such as cassava, plantain, rice and other ingredients from the local market. She is 44 years of age, divorced and the mother of three children – one daughter and two sons. She says her children are in senior high and primary schools. She lives with the children in a rented apartment in a very busy commercial town called Goaso in the Brong Ahafo Region of Ghana. Akua has been in business for one year now and wants a loan to procure goods in bulk. Akua is hoping to expand her business and increase her profit margin. It is her desire to sponsor her children through school to high levels.

loans.use: To buy foodstuffs

loans.name: Enrique

texts.es:
El señor Enrique G. es casado y todavia no tiene hijos.  Inició su negocio con un capital de Gs. 3.000.000. - son $ 260.- aproximadamente, en el rubro de compra venta de divisas y compra de tarjetas para teléfonos celulares.  Su capital fue ampliando con el correr de los años ya que cuenta con una amplia clientela, porque la zona en la que se encuentran es muy poblada y muy concurrida. Su negocio se encuentra en la Terminal de Omnibus de Asunción, y desde hace más de 12 años.

El señor Enrique G. retira el préstamo para la compra de divisas, de esta forma ofrece sus servicios para dar satisfacción a todos los clientes, quienes son en su mayoría turistas y extranjeros.  Uno de sus apiraciones es poder abrir un salón comercial próximamente, refaccionando su vivienda y asi podría ampliar el negocio en lo que se refiere  al equipamiento o mobiliario y poder ofrecer un ambiente más cómodo y ameno a sus clientes.
texts.en:
Enrique G. is married, but does not have children yet. He started his business with approximately $260. He changes currency and sells cards for cell phones. With the passage of the years, his capital has been growing because he has a large client base. This is because his zone is very crowded and heavily populated. His business has been located in the Terminal de Omnibus de Asunción for over twelve years. Enrique G. will use the loan to buy currencies and provide services to satisfy all of his customers. The majority of his customers are tourists and foreigners. One of his aspirations is to open a commercial place of business. Then, he would refurbish his house. This way he would be able to expand his business with new equipment and furniture. Then he could offer his customers a more comfortable and pleasant atmosphere.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy and sell currencies, buy cards for cell phones

loans.name: Mamadou Moussa

texts.fr: Mamadou moussa S. vend des pièces détachées pour automobile.il est installé à la gare routière de la ville côtière de Mbour. Quarante neuf (49) ans, il est marié et père de cinq enfants. Les revenus tirés du commerce lui permettent tout juste de nourrir sa famille. Pour renforcer son activité il a  déjà bénéficié de deux prêts de la caisse. Avec ce troisième prêt qu’il sollicite il veut acheter des pièces détachées pour de nouvelles marques de véhicules qui lui sont souvent demandées.
texts.en:
Mamadou Moussa S. sells spare parts for automobiles. He is situated at the bus station of the coastal city of Mbour. He is 49 years old, married, and the father of five. The revenues derived from the business just allow him to feed his family. For bolstering his business, he already benefited from two loans from the bank. With this third loan he is requesting, he wants to buy often-requested spare parts for new brands of cars.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy spare parts for new brands of cars

loans.name: Joyce

texts.en: Joyce M. is married and has 3 children. She has received schooling through junior high. Joyce sells cookies like spring rolls, chips and doughnuts in Elmina, which she has done since 2005. Her husband is a teacher whose income is too small to support the family. Joyce uses all her income to help her husband in paying the children's school fees. Joyce will use the loan to purchase more flour, oil and other baking ingredients for baking and frying her food. With the new profits from her expanded business, Joyce plans to save and buy a plot of land for building.

loans.use: Ingredients for food production

loans.name: Anibal

texts.es:
El Sr. Anibal tiene 36 años y esta casado con la Sra. Rosana Paez.  Ellos tienen 4 hijos, todos en edad escolar.

El Sr. V. es contratista de obra de construccion y esto lo viene realizando desde el año 1996. Este oficio lo aprendio trabajando como jornalero de una empresa constructora.

Este credito lo solicita para comprar materiales para la contruccion de una casa cuyo presupuesto ya fue aceptada por el propietario.

Su objetivo es contar con una camioneta para poder transportar sus equipos y herramientas por que actualmente viene pagando por los servicios de fletes.
texts.en:
Señor Anibal is 36 years of age and married to Señora Rosana Paez. They have four school-age children. Señor V. is a building contractor and he's been doing this since 1996. He learned this trade while working as a day laborer for a construction company. The loan he requests is to buy materials to build a house, the budget for which has now been accepted by the owner. His goal is to obtain a pickup truck so he can transport his equipment and tools because he currently has to pay to hire that.

Translated from Spanish by Daniel Kvaka, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy cement, lime, bricks, tile, etc.

loans.name: Ibrahima

texts.fr: Ibrahima Traoré  est enseignant dans une école primaire situé dans la banlieue de Mbour ville côtière situé à 70 km de Dakar. Pour appuyer le village dans l’organisation des cérémonies familiales  et culturelles il a acheté des chaises qu’il loue. Son premier prêt lui avait permis d’acheter une centaine de chaises pour le village. Face à la forte demande en chaises des populations il sollicite  un nouveau prêt  au niveau prêt à la caisse. Les revenus  tirés de cette activité lui permettent d’arrondir les fins du mois.
texts.en:
Ibrahima Traoré is a teacher in a primary school in the suburbs of the coastal city of Mbour, located 70 km from Dakar. To support his village with organizing family and cultural ceremonies, he bought chairs that he rents out. His first loan had allowed him to buy a hundred chairs for the village. Faced with a strong demand for chairs from the population, he's requesting a new loan from the bank. The revenues derived from his business enables him to make it to the end of each month.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy chairs

loans.name: Nana

texts.en:
Nana Y. is married and has 4 dependents. She did not receive a formal education. Nana is a fish monger and sells smoked fish in Duakyenim, which she has done since 2008. Her husband is a salt miner. Nana uses all her income to help her husband pay the children's school fees. Nana will use the loan to buy fresh fish to smoke and sell. With the new profits from her expanded business, Nana plans to save and use the money to further the children's education.

In the picture is Nana preparing some fishes for processing.

loans.use: For fresh fish to smoke and sell

loans.name: Gabriela

texts.es:
La Sra. Gabriela  tiene 50 años.  Ella es madre soltera y tiene dos hijas mayores que ya estan casadas y con familia.

La Sra. Gabriela se dedica a la confeccion de almoadones, cortinas, manteles, colchas, toallas, etc., desde hace 18 años en su domicilio particular en la ciudad de Capiata.  Anteriormente, Gabriela tenia una pequeña despensa que tuvo que cerrar por que no podia atender los dos negocios a la ves ya que su mayor pedido era siempre la de confeccion.

El credito será  destinado a la compra de materia prima para la fabricacion de los productos citado mas arriba y de esta forma cumplir con la demanda actual.
texts.en:
Gabriela, 50, is a single mother. She has two grown daughters who are married and have their own families. For eighteen years Gabriela has been making pillows, curtains, tablecloths, bedspreads, towels, etc. in her home in the city of Capiata. Previously, Gabriela had a small grocery store. She had to close it because she could not take care of two businesses at once. Her largest orders were always for handicrafts. The loan is to buy raw materials to make the products mentioned above. This way she can keep up with the current demand.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy fabric

loans.name: Maame Aba

texts.en: Maame Aba A. sells soft drinks such as Coca Cola, Fanta, Sprite and assorted fruit juices in Duakyenim. Maame Aba has no formal education. She is married with three children. Her husband is a petty trader whose income is insufficient to satisfy the family’s demands. Maame Aba has been selling soft drinks since 2006. She will use the loan to buy more soft drinks for resale. She hopes to save a portion of the new profits earned from her business and use the rest to build a house.

loans.use: to buy more soft drinks for resale

loans.name: Amy

texts.fr: Amy  S.  âgée de trente  six (36) ans est une marchande ambulante elle vend des chausses et des habilles dans les maisons de quartier.les revenus tirés de son activité lui permettent de payer les frais de scolarités de ses enfants mais aussi de participer aux frais d’entretien de la maison au même titre que son mari. Elle jamais eu de prêt avec ce premier prêt elle compte accroitre son fonds de roulement en achetant plus de marchandises et réduire les couts de transport.
texts.en:
Amy S., age 36, is an itinerant merchant. She sells shoes and clothing to homes in the area. The revenues derived from her work enables her to pay the school fees for her children and also to help with the costs of maintaining the house, just like her husband does. She has never had a loan before. With this initial loan, she intends to grow her working capital by buying more merchandise and reducing transport costs.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Marciano

texts.es:
El Sr. Marciano L. tiene 43 años. El es padre soltero y tiene una hija mayor de edad casada.

El Sr. L. se dedica a la compra y venta de mercaderias en general y a la cobranza en forma semanal, quincenal y mensual.  Hace 2 años en forma independiente antes trabajaba como cobrador de una casa comercial que luego salio para independisarse y formar su propio negocio.

Actualmente esta actividad lo realiza en forma personal pero su objetivo mas adelante es el de tener mas vendedores y asi poder agrandar su zona de trabajo y llegar a tener mayor ingreso.

El credito será  destinado a la compra de mercaderias.
texts.en:
Marciano L. is 43 years old. He is a single father and has one adult daughter who is married. Mr. L. is involved in the purchase and sale of general merchandise and he allows repayments from his clients on a weekly, biweekly and monthly basis. For the past 2 years he has worked selling general merchandise, prior to that he worked in a commercial concern before setting out on his own and forming his own business. Currently this activity is done in person, but his goal is to have more vendors and thus enlarge his territory and generate higher income. The credit will be used to purchase goods.

Translated from Spanish by Tim Hassett, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy jeans, quilts, sheets, towels, tablecloths, etc. ..

loans.name: Comfort

texts.en: Comfort Q. is married with four dependants and has no formal education. She is a fish monger who sells smoked fish in small quantities in Duakyenim. She has been in this business since 1999. Her husband is a salt miner whose income is insufficient to meet the family’s expenses. Comfort uses all her income to support her husband in paying her children’s school fees. Comfort will use the loan to purchase more smoked fish for resale. She plans to save and reinvest the new profits earned from her expanded business.

loans.use: To purchase more smoked fish for resale

loans.name: Tomás

texts.es:
El sr Tomas L. esta casado con la Sra Manuela Figueredo.  Ellos tienen 1 hijo menor. 
Don Tomas se dedica a la fabricacion de menajes de aluminos como vasos, cacerolas, bandejas, champañeras etc.

El sr Tomas tiene su propia fabrica en su domicilio y la venta lo realiza en los comercios de San Lorenzo, Ita, Capiata, y Asuncion.  Esta profesion lo aprendio de su anterior trabajo donde se desarrollaba como empleado y luego decidio independizarse, luego de muchos años de trabajo.
En el futuro sueña con un local mas amplio donde pueda dar mas trabajo y seguir educando a su hijo.
texts.en:
Señor Tomás L. is married to Señora Manuela Figueredo. They have one young son. Don Tomás works at fabricating aluminum kitchenware, such as cups, pans, trays, champagne buckets, etc. Sr. Tomás has his own workshop in his house and he sells his products in the stores of San Lorenzo, Itá, Capiatá and Asunción. He learned this trade at his previous job where he was trained on the job, and later he decided to work independently after many years of work. In the future he dreams of having a larger shop where he would be able to do more work, and to continue educating his son.

Translated from Spanish by Daniel Kvaka, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy aluminum.

loans.name: Deborah

texts.en: Deborah C. is married with three children and has received schooling through junior high school. Deborah sells rubber products such as rubber bags and plastic bowls, and ripe fruits such as banana in Duakyenim. She has been in this business since 2008. Her husband is a fisherman whose income from fishing is insufficient to meet the family expenses. Deborah will use the loan to purchase more bananas and other rubber products for sale. Deborah plans to save and reinvest the new profits earned from her expanded business.

loans.use: To buy more bananas and other rubber products for sale

loans.name: Cayo

texts.es:
El sr Cayo V. esta acompañado con la Sra Liz Ojeda.  El es propietario de un taller mecanico de vehiculos. Con mucho esfuerzo logro abrir su propio taller, ya que antes era empleado de una empresa del mismo rubro.

El credito que se le otorga utilizara en el arreglamiento de su taller. Sueña con tener su local propio y dar mas fuente de trabajo.
texts.en:
Mr. Cayo V. is married to Liz Ojeda. He is the owner of an auto mechanic shop. With a lot of effort he achieved his goal of opening his own shop; before he was an employee of a company doing the same type of work. The loan will be used to fix up his workshop. He dreams of his owning outright his shop location and providing more jobs to others.

Translated from Spanish by Donald Allen, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Expansion of auto workshop

loans.name: Diego

texts.es:
El Sr Diego M. es soltero y vive con su madre. Eel se dedica a la compra y venta de mercaderia como sabana, toalla, calzado deportivo, y accesorios de merceria.

El credito que se le otorga la Fundacion sera utulizada en la compra de los productos que el vende.  Diego sueña con abrir su local propio y dar fuente de trabajo.
texts.en:
Diego M. is single and lives with his mother. He buys and sells merchandise like sheets, towels, athletic shoes, and sewing supplies. The loan from the Foundation will be used to buy the products he sells. Diego dreams of opening his own place and providing a source of work.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy sheets, athletic footwear, towels, etc.

loans.name: Pablo Avelardo

texts.es: Pablo Avelardo C. P. de 37 años de edad reside en Candelaria en el municipio de Cuscatlán, habita en ese lugar hace más de 12 años y vive junto a su esposa y su única hija. El posee un negocio de decoración y trabaja por contratos en diferentes departamentos del país. Pablo es una persona muy responsable, el cual se esfuerza por brindarles todo lo necesario a su familia, ya que ha pesar de poseer dicho negocio, también tiene un trabajo como auxiliar de diferentes servicios que se prestan en la unidad de salud de su lugar de residencia. Pablo solicita un préstamo, ya que desea comprar nuevas herramientas para su negocio, tales como: taladro, clavos, tornillos, pintura, escalera, entre otras herramientas la cuales son fundamentales para desempeñar su trabajo.
texts.en:
Pablo Avelardo C. P., 37, lives in Candelaria in the Cuscatlán municipality. For twelve years he has lived in this place with his wife and their only daughter. He has a decorating (construction) business, and he works for contracts in different departments of the country. Pablo is a very responsible person, and he works hard to give his family what they need. Besides having the decorating business, he also has work as an aide for different services given by the health unit in his place of residence. Pablo is asking for a loan because he wants to buy new tools for his business. He wants tools like a drill, nails, screws, paint, a ladder, and other tools that are fundamental to the doing his work.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy construction tools

location.town: Candelaria en el departamento de Cuscatlán

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary E. is married and has 2 children. She has received schooling through senior high. Mary has sold provisions such as Milo (a brand of malted milk) and sugar in Elmina since 2005. Her husband is a teacher whose income is too small to support their family. Mary uses all her income to pay utility bills.

Mary plans to use this loan to purchase more groceries to sell in her store. With the resulting profits, Mary plans to save and buy a container shop where she can sell her provisions.

loans.use: Purchase additional goods to sell

loans.name: Diana

texts.en:
Diana O. is divorced and has four dependents. She completed her senior high school education and has been a food vendor since 2008. She works in Elmina, selling food like cooked rice and stew. As a single parent, she is responsible for paying her children's school fees and the family utility bills.

She will use her loan to buy bags of rice and gallons of oil for cooking. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to save for a building project.

loans.use: To buy bags of rice and gallons of oil.

loans.name: Angélica

texts.es:
Mrs. Angélica S. de Ojeda is 47 years old and has been married to Mr. Valetín Ojeda for more than 26 years.  They own a house in __ in Carapeguá.  They have five children, three that are very young and two that are in school.  

           From a very young age Mrs. S. de Ojeda has been interested in moving forward in an independent way.  She married at the age of 20, and her first son was born a year alter.  As they did not have a steady source of income, her husband had to travel to Argentina to work as a building worker and with that income he could support his new family.  Mrs. S. de Ojeda helped by knitting traditional mattress covers and comforters and then selling them to street vendors from the area.  Today, with much sacrifice, the family has been able to build its own life and supply the basic necessities of a dignified life.  

          Mrs. S. de Ojeda is applying for this loan in order to purchase hammocks and comforters to sell.
texts.en:
Mrs. Angélica S. de Ojeda is 47 years old and has been married to Mr. Valetín Ojeda for more than 26 years. They own a house in Carapeguá. They have five children, three that are very young and two that are in school. From a very young age Mrs. S. de Ojeda has been interested in moving forward in an independent way. She married at the age of 20, and her first son was born a year after. As they did not have a steady source of income, her husband had to travel to Argentina to work as a building worker and with that income he could support his new family. Mrs. S. de Ojeda helped by knitting traditional mattress covers and comforters and then selling them to street vendors from the area. Today, with much sacrifice, the family has been able to build its own life and supply the basic necessities of a dignified life. Mrs. S. de Ojeda is applying for this loan in order to purchase hammocks and comforters to sell.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: The purchase of hammocks and comforters

loans.name: Florence

texts.en:
Florence N. is married and has four dependents. She completed schooling through senior high school and has sold filtered water in Elmina since 2006. Her husband is a trader whose income is too small to provide for the family. Florence uses all her income to support her husband in paying their children's school fees.

Florence will use this loan to purchase more filtered water to sell. With the new profits from her expanded business, Florence plans to save and reinvest back into her trade.

loans.use: To purchase more filtered water.

loans.name: Rita

texts.en:
Rita Y. is divorced and has two children. She received schooling through junior high school and has been selling charcoal, gari, and red oil in Elmina since 2006. As a single parent, Rita uses all her income to pay for the children's school fees and the family's utilities bill.

Rita will use this loan to buy more charcoal, gari, and oil for resale. With the new profits from her expanded business, Rita plans to save more for the children's education.

loans.use: To buy more charcoal, gari, and oil for resale.

loans.name: Lisandro

texts.es:
El Sr. Lisandro tiene 44 años, esta casado y tiene 3 hijos.  Vive en la compañia Costa Pucu de la Ciudad de Caacupe que queda aproximadamente a 4 kilometrs del centro. El sr. Lisandro es taxista mas de 11 años.  La parada esta ubicado el centro de la ciudad detras de la Basilica de Caacupe: un punto estratejico para su negocio.

El cliente cuenta con una buna clientela ya formada durante los años, tambien cuenta con 6 compañeros taxista en la parada que tienen buenos vehiculos. Lisandro dice que no puede estar menos que sus compañeros por que los clientes se mudarian con unos de ellos. 

Para que no ocurra eso tiene que mantener en buenas condiciones su vehiculo, y para ello Lisandro realiza prestamos con la instucion y asi mantener en buenas condiciones su vehiculo y mejorar el servicio para sus clientes.
texts.en:
Lisandro, 44, is married and has three children. He lives in the Compañia Costa Puca in the city of Caacupe, which is approximately four kilometers from the center. Lisandro has been a taxi driver for over eleven years. His stop is located in the center of the city behind the Basilica de Caacupe, which is a strategic location for his business. He has a good client base that has formed over the years. He also has six colleagues in this stop, and they have good vehicles. Lisandro says that he cannot be there less than his colleagues or the customers will move to one of the other taxi drivers. In order for this not to happen, he needs to keep his vehicle in good condition. That is why Lisandro has loans with the institution – to be able to keep his vehicle in good condition and improve the service he gives his customers.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To repair his vehicle

loans.name: Maria Auxiliadora Group

texts.es:
El comité Maria Auxiliadora cumple actualmente su 2do ciclo del program de Mujeres Emprendedoras de la Fundacion Paraguaya.  Sus integrantes ya realizan una actividad productiva, por lo que ya se desenvuelven cada una en su propia microempresa, reciben un crédito promedio de 500.000 y lo utilizan para  fomentar y variar la actividad que ya estan realizando como ser: compra de insumos para la fabricacion de comestibles, compra de leche, azucar, yerba, harina, sal, panificados y verduras para su posterior venta, y compra y venta de bebidas como refrescos, gaseosas, cervezas, vinos etc. 

Las otras integrantes son: 

Myrian R..	Vta de mercría.
Maria del Carmen G.. 	Vta de cosméticos.
Sabina L..	Vta de carbón.
Carolina I..	Vta de verduras y frutas.
Lidia I.. 	Vta de manualidades.
Sinthia F.. 	Vta de cosmeticos.
Maria Balbina R..	Vta de comestibles.
Claudia G..	Vta de mercería.
Noelia S.. 	Vta de ropas.
Marta S..	 Vta de articulos varios.
Nilda D..	 kiosko.
Myrian A..	 Vta de merceria.
Maura A.. 	 Vta de mercaderias varias.
Angelica B.. 	Vta de mercaderias varias.
Maria V..	Vta de cosméticos.
Justina M.	Vta de ropas
Hilda B.	Vta de cosmeticos
Myrian T.	Vta de comestibles
Karen M.	Vta de comestibles
Amelia G.	Vta de comestibles
texts.en:
The Maria Auxiliadora committee just completed its second cycle in the Women Entrepreneurs program of the Fundacion Paraguaya. They already have productive activities, that they each develop on their own, and receive an average loan of 500,000 to enhance and vary their current activities such as: the purchase of supplies for producing foodstuffs, buying milk, sugar, tea, flour, salt, vegetables and baked goods for subsequent sale and the purchase and sale of beverages such as soft drinks, soda, beer, wine etc. The other members are: Myrian R.. Haberdashery sales. Maria del Carmen G.. Sale of cosmetics. Sabina L.. Sale of coal. I. Carolina. Sale of vegetables and fruits. Lidia I.. Handicraft sales Sinthia F.. Sale of cosmetics. Balbina Maria R.. Sale of foodstuffs. Claudia G.. Haberdashery sales. Noelia S.. Clothing sales. Marta S.. General merchandise sales. Nilda D.. Kiosk. Myrian A.. Haberdashery sales. Maura A.. General merchandise sales. Angelica B.. General merchandise sales. Maria V.. Sale of cosmetics. Justina M. Clothing sales Hilda B. Sale of cosmetics Myrian T. Grocery sales Karen M. Grocery sales Amelia G. Grocery sales

Translated from Spanish by Tim Hassett, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy and sell second hand clothes, buy and sell handmade jewelry, buy and sell vegetables and fruit, buy and sell wine, oil, rice production and sale of groceries, buy and sell items such as: sausage, sausage tortillas, empanadas, croquettes, etc.

loans.name: Matthew

texts.en:
Matthew A. is married and has five dependents. He received schooling through senior high school and has been selling wood and firewood in Terterim since 2003. His wife is a fishmonger.

Matthew will use this loan to buy more wood and firewood in large quantity for resale. With the new profits from his expanded business, Matthew plans to save and build.

loans.use: To buy more wood and firewood.

loans.name: 15 De Abril Group

texts.es:
El comité 15 de abril nace hace poco mas de dos semanas gracias a la gestión y unión de varias vecinas que ya estuvieron trabajando con la Fundación Paraguaya y cuyos comités terminaron hace un tiempo.  Las mujeres decidieron empezar de nuevo, en base a la experiencia adquirida. 

Este comité es de la zona de Paì Ñu, y las integrantes son: 

Liz O..	Peluquería.
Myrian F..	    Venta de Ropas.
Angelica M.. 	Venta de panes.
Irene V.. 	Kiosko.
Migdonia A.. 	Kiosko.
Amanda C.. 	Venta de Verduras.
Blanca G.. 	Macatera.
Belen Saldivar. 	Venta de ropas.
Isabel I..	Venta de perfumes.
Ramona R..	Costura.
Milka G.. 	Venta de ropas.
Daniela A.. 	Venta de perfumes.
Angelica M..	Venta de empanadas.
Ana G..  	Venta de minicargas.
Gladys S.. 	Venta de remedios herbales.
texts.en:
The April 15 committee was created a little over two weeks ago thanks to the cooperation and management from various neighbors who had been working with the Fundación Paraguaya in the past, but whose committees ended some time ago. The women decided to start again, based on experience they had gained. This committee is in the area of Pai nu, and the members are: Liz O.. Barber. Myrian F.. Sale of clothing. Angelica M.. Sale of bread. Irene V.. Kiosko. Migdonia A.. Kiosko. Amanda C.. Sale of vegetables. Blanca G.. Flowerpots. Belen Saldivar. Selling clothes. Isabel I.. Sale of perfumes. Ramona Rolón. Sewing. Milka G.. Selling clothes. Daniela A.. Sale of perfumes. Angelica M.. Selling empanadas. Ana G.. Selling "minicargas". Gladys S.. Sales of herbal remedies.

Translated from Spanish by Tim Hassett, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: The sale of the following is done both at home and in the surrounding neighborhoods: Buying shoes, slippers, sandals, buying hair dyes, purchase of soaps, perfumes, buying sugar, pasta, meat, beverages, oil , flour, buying clothes for ladies and gentlemen and underwear for them, buying orange, banana, tomato, lettuce, locote, potato, onion. Purchasing cards for cell phones and fabrics for the manufacture of garments

loans.name: Bertila

texts.es: Bertila tiene 25 años, vive con su esposo y sus 2 hijos en su casa propia. Desde hace 4 años se dedica a la agricultura, junto a su esposo, quien es el que diariamente  realiza el trabajo más pesado en el campo, así como el pastoreo de los animales que poseen. Bertila recoge diariamente alfalfa para la alimentación de los animales menores que crían, como cuyes y gallinas, luego preparara los alimentos para irse junto con su esposo a sus tierras de cultivo y pastorear a sus animales hasta el atardecer, cuando oscurece vuelven a casa para descansar y comenzar al otro día con fuerzas renovadas. Cuando llega la época de cosecha, los cultivos de papa, zapallo y rocoto que tienen serán llevados al mercado central de la ciudad más cercana a su comunidad, para que de esa manera su familia tenga la recompensa de todos los meses de arduo trabajo. Para más adelante, Bertila está planeando incrementar su producción agrícola, así como mejorar la raza de sus animales. Es la primera vez que tiene un préstamo con MFP, y tiene grandes expectativas de realizar un trabajo solidario con los demás integrantes de su banco comunal, por su parte se compromete a ser parte de ese trabajo. Con el dinero que viene solicitando comprará abono y medicinas adecuadas para sus animales.
texts.en:
Bertila is 25 years old and lives with her husband and 2 children in their own home. For the past 4 years she has worked in agriculture, with her husband, who each day does the heavy work on the farm such as grazing the animals they own. Bertila collects alfalfa daily to feed the small animals they raise like guinea pigs and chickens, and then prepares the food to take to her husband on their land where they graze their animals until the evening, then after dark they go home to rest and begin the next day with renewed strength. At harvest time, their potatoes, pumpkins and pimentos will be carried to the central market of the city closest to their community, in that way their family is rewarded for all the months of hard work. Later, Bertila is planning to increase her agricultural production and improve the breed of their animals. It is the first time she has taken a loan with MFP, and she has high expectations of doing work in solidarity with other members of their community bank, for her part she is committed to being part of this work. With the requested money she will buy fertilizer and appropriate medicines for her animals.

Translated from Spanish by Tim Hassett, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of fertilizer and medicines for her animals

loans.name: Ermelinda

texts.es: Ermelinda tiene 29 años, vive con su esposo y su pequeño hijo de un año. Se dedica a la agricultura desde que era niña, ya que aun vive en su pueblo natal, todos los días se levanta muy temprano para preparar los alimentos, y posteriormente, junto a su esposo, ir a sus tierras de cultivo, donde debe estar pendiente de que sus plantaciones estén libres de plagas, así como de abonar para que aumente su producción. El producto principal que cultiva es la papa, que luego de 6 meses de larga espera, llegada la cosecha vende en el mercado principal de la ciudad más cercana a su comunidad. Ermelinda vende al por mayor, es decir, es una de las abastecedoras del mercado. Para más adelante, sus deseos son de continuar y mejorar su producción, sembrando otras variedades de papa. Este es su primer préstamo con MFP, y también la primera vez que trabaja en un banco comunal, donde se compromete a ser puntual en sus reuniones y con pago de sus cuotas. El dinero que solicita es para la compra de semilla de otras variedades de papa, además de sacos de abono, todo esto, para incrementar su próxima producción.
texts.en:
Ermelinda is 29 years old and lives with her husband and little one-year old son. She has been involved in agriculture since she was a child and still lives in her home town. She gets up early every day to prepare food, and then, with her husband, they go to their land, where they make sure their plantations are free of pests and use fertilizer for increased production. The main product that is cultivated is potatoes, that after 6 months of long wait, are harvested and sold in the main market of the city closest to their community. Ermelinda sells at wholesale, that is, she is one of the suppliers to the market. Later, her wishes are to continue to improve production by planting other varieties of potato. This is his first loan with MFP, and also the first time working in a community bank, where she commits to be punctual at meetings and payment of her dues. The money requested is to purchase seed of other varieties of potatoes and bags of fertilizer to increase the next crop yield.

Translated from Spanish by Tim Hassett, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase seed and fertilizer

loans.name: Kweku

texts.en:
Kweku A. is married and has four dependents. Kweku did not receive any formal education. He has sold fresh fish and variety of soft drinks in Elmina since 1994. His wife is a petty trader. Kweku uses his income to paying for utilities, such as water and electricity.

Kweku will use this loan to purchase fish in large quantity for resale and also to increase his stock of soft drinks for sale. With the new profits from his expanded business, Kweku plans to save to buy a truck.

loans.use: To purchase fish in large quantity and increase his stock of soft drinks.

loans.name: Rosa Berta

texts.es: Rosa Berta H. de 37 años de edad, reside en la colonia Altavista en el municipio de San Martín, vive únicamente junto a su hija de 11 años de edad, su esposo reside en Los Estados Unidos y envía dinero constantemente, lo cual es un gran apoyo para Rosa.  Ha pesar de lo anterior Rosa se caracteriza por ser una mujer que se esfuerza por sacar adelante a su hija, ya que es ella la que la impulsa a trabajar diariamente. Rosa se dedica a la cosmetología, y posee su propio salón de belleza. Ella solicita un préstamo a través del cual pueda renovar sus herramientas de trabajo, ya que desea comprar nuevas y modernas secadoras y planchas de cabello, de manera que pueda estar a la vanguardia en cuanto a sus servicios y de esta manera obtener más clientes.
texts.en:
Rosa Berta H., 37, lives in the Altavista colony in the San Martin municipality. She lives with her eleven year old daughter. Her husband lives in the United States. He sends her money all of the time, and that is a big help to Rosa. In spite of this, she is a woman who works to take good care of her daughter. It is her daughter that motivates her to work every day. Rosa is a cosmetologist, and she has her own beauty salon. She is asking for a loan to be able to modernize her work tools. She wants to buy new and modern hair dryers and flat irons. This way her salon will be state-of-the-art, and she will get more customers.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy hair dryers and flat irons

loans.name: Efua

texts.en: Efua O. is married and has five dependents. She has received schooling through primary school. Efua sells smoked fish in Elmina, which she has done since 1998. She uses her income to pay utilities including electricity and water bills. She will use the loan to purchase more fish to sell. With the new profits from her expanded business, Efua plans to save and further the children’s education.

loans.use: To purchase more fish to sell

loans.name: Hilarion

texts.es: Hilarión tiene 49  años, vive con su  esposa y sus 4 hijos en su casa propia. Desde su niñez se ha dedicado a las tareas del campo, las cuales realiza de manera incansable, todos los días, al lado de su esposa y sus hijos. Cultiva principalmente la papa, ya que este tubérculo es un producto principal de abasto para los mercados de las ciudades aledañas a su comunidad donde las comercializa. Una vez que cosecha vende tanto al por mayor, como en menores cantidades, es por ello que se da el trabajo de seleccionar su cosecha en calidades y tamaño, para que de acuerdo a ello, ponga los precios a sus productos. Para el futuro, Hilarión quiere seguir con esta actividad, e ir poco a poco incrementando su producción. Esta es la primera vez que tiene un préstamo con su banco comunal, donde tiene muchas expectativas de emprender un trabajo solidario con el resto de integrantes de su grupo. El dinero que solicita será para comprar semillas mejoradas de papa y abono para fortalecer  sus tierras de cultivo.
texts.en:
Hilarión is 49 years old. He lives with his wife and their four children in their own house. Since he was a child he has worked in the fields; today he continues to do so tirelessly every day along with his wife and their children. He He mainly grows potato, since this tuber is a main ingredient supplied to the markets in nearby cities. Once he harvests, he sells his harvest both wholesale and retail. For this reason he has to separate his harvest by quality and size and price them accordingly.

In the future, Hilarión wants to continue with this activity and gradually increase his production. This is the first time that he has borrowed with a communal bank. He has many hopes of working collaboratively with the rest of the members of his group. The money that he requests will be to buy higher quality seeds for potatoes and fertilizer for his land.

Translated from Spanish by Jennifer Chong, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying seeds and fertilizer

loans.name: Julita

texts.es: Julita tiene 37 años, vive con su esposo y sus 4 hijos en su casa propia casa. Desde hace 10 años, junto a su esposo se dedica a la agricultura, desde entonces no ha descansado, con la idea de crecer económicamente a través de esta actividad. Principalmente produce papa, rocoto y zapallo, los cuales, luego de varios meses de trabajo, cosecha y lleva a vender a los comerciantes de verduras de un mercado de la ciudad más cercana de su localidad. Julita se levanta muy  temprano para observar sus tierras de cultivo y asegurarse de que todo esté andando de la manera correcta, para que la producción pueda tener un precio que le genere buenas ganancias. Para el futuro, Julita desea seguir invirtiendo su tiempo y dinero para incrementar, cada vez más, su producción. Esta es la primera vez que tiene un préstamo con MFP, y está muy conciente de que el trabajo con su banco comunal debe realizarlo en equipo, y es lo que se compromete a emprender. El dinero que está solicitando será invertido en la compra de 6 sacos de abono.
texts.en:
Julita is 37 years old and lives with her husband and 4 children in their own home.
