For the past 10 years, she has, along with her husband, been engaged in agriculture with the idea of economic growth through this activity and has not rested since. She produces mainly potato, pumpkin and pimento, which, after several months of work, she harvests and sells to the traders in a vegetable market in the city nearest her. Julita gets up early to watch their land and make sure everything is going well, so that the produce will bring a price that will generate good profits. For the future, Julita wants to continue investing her time and money to constantly expand her production. . This is the first time she has taken a loan with MFP, and is well aware that working with her community bank should be done as a team, which she is committed to do. The money she is requesting will be invested in the purchase of 6 bags of fertilizer.

Translated from Spanish by Tim Hassett, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase fertilizer

loans.name: Araba

texts.en:
Araba A. is married and has five dependents. She has received schooling through primary school. Her husband is a fishmonger.

Araba sells smoked fish in small quantities in Elmina, which she has done since 2003. She uses her income to support her husband in paying the children’s school fees.

Araba will use the loan to buy more fresh fish, smoke the fish, and sell it in small quantities. With the new profits from her expanded business, she plans to save and pay the children’s school fees.

loans.use: To buy more fresh fish to smoke and sell

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: Sale of Cosmetics such as lipsticks, creams, shampoos, deodorants, colognes etc. Dressmaking and Tailoring and sales of clothing and sheets and cleaning products such as detergents, shampoos, cream rinse.

loans.name: Sabino

texts.es: Sabino tiene 55 años, vive con su esposa y sus 8 hijos en su casa propia. Hace más de 20 años decidió vivir de la agricultura, y junto a su esposa consolidaron su hogar en base a esta actividad, la cual hasta ahora, les ha brindado lo suficiente para sus gastos familiares. Sabino y toda su familia, trabajan arduamente en el cultivo, abonado y cuidado de sus tierras hasta que llegue el tiempo para la cosecha, y en esa época se intensifica su labor, porque se debe recoger el producto, encostalarlo y transportarlo a la ciudad más cercana para su comercialización. Para el futuro, Sabino está planeando mejorar su producción sembrando otras variedades de papa. Es la primera vez que tiene un préstamo con MFP, ha escuchado que este trabajo es solidario, y su deseo es cumplir este principio en su banco comunal. El dinero que solicita es para la compra de abono y semilla de papa, en una variedad mejor calidad a la que ha sembrado en la campaña anterior.
texts.en:
Sabino is 55 years of age and lives with his wife and eight children in their own house. More than 20 years ago he chose the agricultural life. Together with his wife they organized their household around this activity and up until now it has provided them what they need for their family's expenses. Sabino and his entire family work very hard at cultivating, fertilizing and caring for their fields until harvest time arrives. Then their labor intensifies because they have to harvest the crop, package it into sacks, and transport it to the nearest city to sell it. For the future, Sabino is planning to increase his production by planting other varieties of potatoes. This is the first time he has taken a loan with Microfinanzas PRISMA. He has heard that this effort is based on solidarity and he hopes to fulfill this principle in his communal bank. The money he requests is for the purchases of fertilizer and seed potatoes of a better quality than he has sown in the past season.

Translated from Spanish by Daniel Kvaka, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy seeds and fertilizer.

loans.name: Cecilia

texts.en:
Cecilia A. sells smoked fish in Terterim. Cecilia has received schooling through junior high. She is married and has two children. Her husband is a carpenter on a small income which cannot support the family.

Cecilia has been selling smoked fish since 2002 and supports her husband in paying the children’s school fees. Her loan will be used to buy more fish to smoke and resell. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to save and build a house.

loans.use: To buy more fish to smoke and resell

loans.name: Timoteo

texts.es: Timoteo tiene 45 años, vive con su esposa y sus 2 hijos en su casa propia. Desde su niñez se ha dedicado a realizar las tareas agrícolas, cultivando la tierra para luego vender sus cosechas; el producto que cultiva es la papa nativa de su región; siembra en grandes extensiones de terreno que luego de 6 meses de trabajo dan sus frutos con las ventas que realiza en el mercado de la ciudad más cercana a su comunidad. En esta agotadora labor, Timoteo no está solo, ya que tiene el apoyo incondicional de su esposa y sus 2 hijos menores, y esto lo anima para seguir dedicándose a la agricultura, mejorando cada año en su producción y en la variedad de papa que ha de sembrar. Este es su primer préstamo con MFP, y considera que su experiencia en su banco comunal será muy enriquecedora para su vida, por lo que se compromete a pagar sus cuotas con puntualidad y responsabilidad. El dinero que está solicitando será invertido en la compra de sacos de abono, funguicidas y una mochila fumigadora, lo cual utilizará para la mejora y cuidado de sus cultivos.
texts.en:
Timoteo is 45 years and old lives with his wife and their two children in their own house. Since childhood he has worked in agriculture, cultivating the land and then selling his crops. The product he grows is the potato native to his region. He plants large tracts of land and then after six months of work sells the fruit of his labor in the market of the city nearest his community. In this exhausting work Timoteo is not alone since he has the unconditional help of his wife and their two young children, which inspires him to continue working in farming, each year increasing his production and the variety of potatoes he plants. This is his first loan with MFP. He thinks that his experience with his community bank will enrich his life and commits to make his repayments punctually and responsibly. The money he is requesting will be invested in the purchase of sacks of fertilizer, fungicides, and a knapsack sprayer which will be used for the care and improvement of his crops.

Translated from Spanish by Daniel Burke, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase fertilizer and a knapsack sprayer

loans.name: Patience

texts.en:
Patience O. is a small fishmonger in Elmina. Patience has received has no formal education. She is married and has six dependents. Her husband is a carpenter who lives on a small income.

Patience has been smoking fish since 1999 and supports her husband in paying the children’s school fees. Her loan will be used to buy more fish to smoke and resell. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to save and further the children’s education.

loans.use: To buy more fish to smoke and resell

loans.name: Waner

texts.es: Waner tiene 22 años, vive con sus padres en casa de los mismos. Desde su niñez ha estado implicado en las tareas de la agricultura, su familia tiene esta actividad como la base de su economía, y todos estos años han sido un tiempo de capacitación para que ahora que está encargado de velar por el bienestar de sus padres, aplique lo aprendido, en las duras tareas del campo. Adicionalmente, su familia también cría animales, de lo que Waner también se ocupa, para que estén en buen peso y tamaño para obtener buenas ganancias cuando llegue el momento de venderlos, ya que este dinero sirve para sostener a la familia mientras llega la época de cosecha. Es la primera vez que Waner tiene un préstamo con MFP, por lo que se compromete a ser un integrante activo y solidario de su banco comunal. El dinero que está solicitando es para la compra de semillas para sembrar alfalfa, además de comprar medicinas para sus vacas.
texts.en:
Waner, 22, lives with his parents in their house. He has been involved in farm work since he was a child. It is his family’s primary source of income. All of these years have been a time of training for the present. Now he takes care of his parents’ well being. He applies what he has learned about working hard in the fields. His family also raises animals. Waner makes sure the animals are a good weight and size so that they get a good price when they are sold. This money sustains the family while they wait for the harvest. This is the first time that Waner has had a loan with MFP. He promises to be an active and supportive member of his community bank. The money is to buy seeds to plant alfalfa. He will also buy medicine for his cows.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy seeds and medicine for his animals

loans.name: Carlos Francisco

texts.es:
En la ciudad de Masaya, el señor Carlos Francisco L. se dedica con gran empeño a su actividad de zapatería donde tiene su propio negocio el cual ha logrado mantener desde hace 10 años siendo este su única actividad que le ha permitido mantener a su familia.

El señor Carlos L. actualmente ha acudido a Ceprodel para solicitar un crédito para la compra de los materiales de trabajo ya que le urge adquirirlo para así continuar con su trabajo de reparación de zapatos para todas las edades y para damas, caballeros y niños.
texts.en:
Carlos Franciso L. has his own business in the city of Masaya. He works very hard as a cobbler, and has had the business for ten years. It is the only activity that has allowed him to support his family. He currently has approached Ceprodel for a loan to buy work materials. He needs the loan urgently to be able to continue his shoe repair work. He repairs shoes for all ages, women, men, and children.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy work materials

loans.name: Primicia Group

texts.es:
El comité “Primicia” se formo con la intencion de progreso y superacion de sus integrantes.  La mayoria ya realizan una actividad productiva y reciben un crédito promedio de 500.000.  El credito lo va a utilizar para ampliar y diversificar lo que ya estan realizando como ser: compra de insumos para la fabricacion de comestibles, compra de leche azucar,yerba,harina,sal panificados y verduras para su posterior venta,compra venta de bebidas como refrescos , gaseosas ,cervezas, vinos etc. 

Todas las integrantes desean que sus hijos no pasen las mismas carencias acdemicas y laborales que ellas pasaron por eso se esfuerzan el doble para lograr sus objetivos.

Las integrantes son:  

Zunilda P..  	Vta de mercaderías  varias. 
Marcia G.. 	Modista.  
Graciela A.. 	Vta de carbón. 
Pabla G.. 	Vta de cosméticos.  
Lourdes M.. 	Vta de artesanias.  
Luz A..	Vta de artesania.  
Norma E..  	Vta de ropas. 
Maria P.. 	Vta de artesania.  
Sol y mar G..	Vta de comestibles.  
Lourdes L..	Vta de merceria.  
Anatolia E.. 	Vta de Chipas.  
Susana P.. 	Vta de comestibles.  
Balbina A.. 	Vta de ropas.  
Lilian F.. 	Vta de chipas.  
Mercedes E.. 	Fca y venta de productos de limpieza.  
Blanca B..  	Vta de comestibles.  
Claudia F..	Vta de comestibles.
texts.en:
The members formed the Primicia committee with the intention of progressing and improving. The majority of them are involved in activities that are productive, and their average loan is $99. The loan is to increase and diversify their current activities. For example, to make meals they will buy milk, sugar, herbs, flour, salt, bread, and vegetables. They will also buy drinks such as soft drinks, beer, wine, etc. to sell. All of the members hope that their children do not experience the same lack of education and jobs that they have experienced. This is why they work twice as hard to achieve their objectives. The members are: Zunilda P.. Sells various merchandise Marcia G.. Seamstress Graciela A.. Sells coal Pabla G.. Sells cosmetics Lourdes M.. Sells handicrafts Luz A.. Sells handicrafts Norma E.. Sells clothes Maria P.. Sells handicrafts Sol y mar G.. Sells food Lourdes L.. Sells merchandise Anatolia E.. Sells chipas, a typical corn-bread street snack in Paraguay Susana P.. Sells food Balbina A.. Sells clothes Lilian F.. Vta Sells chipas Mercedes E.. Makes and sells cleaning products Blanca B.. Sells food Claudia F.. Sells food

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy milk, sugar, rice, noodles, bread.  Make and sell typical food like sausages, tortillas, empanadas, croquettes, etc

loans.name: Sonia Milagros

texts.es: Sonia Milagros S. M. de 46 años de edad reside en Ahuachapán, junto a su esposo el cual trabaja como motorista y sus tres hijos los cuales se dedican a estudiar. Sonia posee una tienda de productos perecederos y también comercializa ropa usada, la cual la vende en su lugar de residencia. Sonia solicita un préstamo con el fin de poder obtener el capital necesario para surtir su tienda de muchos más productos, así también desea comprar más ropa y de esta manera percibir mayores ganancias lo cual beneficie a sus tres hijos.
texts.en:
Sonia Milagros S. M. is 46 years of age and lives in Ahuachapán with her husband, who works as a driver, and with her three children who are in school. Sonia has a store for perishable goods in her place of residence and where she also sells used clothing. Sonia is requesting a loan so as to obtain the necessary capital to restock her store with many more products and to buy more clothing as well. In this way she would receive greater profits which would benefit her three children.

Translated from Spanish by Daniel Kvaka, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To stock up her store.

loans.name: Santos Del Pilar

texts.es: Santos del Pilar M. Hernández tiene la edad de 43 años, es madre soltera. Tiene 4 hijos y todos estudian. Santos es una mujer con todo el deseo de superarse. Es una vendedora de mercadería en general. Hace más de 19 años que se dedica a este negocio. Y por medio de un sobrino fue que decidió ingresar en este negocio, es mujer muy activa ya que siempre esta pendiente de lo que sus clientes solicitan. Por lo que su vida ha cambiado ya que de esta manera obtuvo estabilidad económica. Este dinero le ayudara a la compra de calzado, bolsos, ropa interior, cosméticos. Su mayor desafío es cuando tiene que buscar los productos en  Managua por que se expone a muchos peligros. Sus sueños son de establecer un negocio en su vivienda.
texts.en:
Santos del Pilar M. Hernández is 43 years of age and a single mother with four children, all of whom are still in school. Santos is a woman who really wants to better herself. She is a saleswoman for general merchandise and she's been in this business for more than 19 years. It was because of a nephew that she decided to get into this business. She's a very active woman who is always thinking about what her customers are requesting. As a result, her life has changed since she has attained economic stability. This money would help her to buy footwear, purses, underwear and cosmetics. Her greatest challenge is when she has to go to look for products in Managua where she is exposed to many dangers. Her dream is to set up a business in her home.

Translated from Spanish by Daniel Kvaka, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: For working capital.

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Juan Agustin

texts.es: Don Juan Agustin con residencia  en el canton Poxlajuj del departamento D. Totonicapán  desD. joven aprendio el oficio D. tejedor, hoy cuenta con su pequeño taller  con cuatro telares y su principal producción es la elaboracion D. cortes tipicos para damas las cuales los  venD. en los municipio D. Totonicapán, Salcaja, y Chimaltenango, hoy necesita D. un credito para l compra D. materiales ya que tiene un pedido que entregar para el mes D. agosto ya que se celebra la fiesta D. la comunidad,
texts.en:
Don Juan Agustin lives in the Poxlajuj district in the department of Totonicapán. When he was young he learned how to weave. Today he has a small workshop with four looms where he weaves traditional clothes for women, which he sells in the municipalities of Totonicapán, Salcaja, and Chimaltenango. The loan will be used to purchase materials to fulfill an order to be delivered in August for a community festival.

Translated from Spanish by Matthew Raimondi, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Vicente Ramón

texts.es: Vicente Ramón Vázquez M. tiene 40 años de edad y vive con su esposa y sus 2 hijos. Es un padre de familia que se preocupa por sostener a su familia. La actividad a la que se dedica es una pulpería. Desde hace mas de 9 años que se dedica a este negocio. Sus dificultades económicas impedían que pudiera surtir el negocio, con el transcurso del tiempo las ganancias obtenía ha surtido su pulpería, la ubicación de su negocio esta dentro del mercado municipal. Trabajar con Fundación León 2000 ha sido de mucha ayuda. Solicita este financiamiento para comprar más productos y satisfacer las necesidades de sus clientes. Sus deseos son de establecer otro negocio para que su esposa se haga cargo.
texts.en:
Vicente Ramón Vázquez M. is 40 years old and lives with his wife and two children. He's a father who's always worrying about how to support his family. He has a grocery store and he's been in this business for more than nine years. His economic difficulties have gotten in the way of him being able to build up his business. As time goes by the profits he obtains are used to stock up his grocery store which is located inside the municipal market. Working with Fundación León 2000 has been very helpful. He is requesting this loan in order to buy more products and satisfy the needs of his customers. He would like to establish another business for his wife to run.

Translated from Spanish by Daniel Kvaka, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: For working capital.

loans.name: Sebastiana Petrona

texts.es: Doña Sebastiana con residencia en la aldea de Nimasac Totonicapán  casada con sesis hijos ella tiene su pequeña tienda de consumo diario, servico de fotocopiadora,  molino de nixtamal con los ingreso que ha obtenido ha dado de comer a sus hijos ser persona profesionales y empresarios, visita las oficina de Asdir en donde solicita  un credito que lo invertira en la compra de articulos de consumo diario, papel para la fotocopiadora, hasta fecha aumentado la demanda de los producto, ya que se encuentra una escuela, cerca de la tienda.
texts.en:
Mrs. Sebastiana resides in the small village of Nimasac Totonicapán and is married with six children. She has a small store of daily items, photocopy services, and the grinding of hominy. With the income she has generated she has fed her children and is a professional, enterprising person. She visits the office of Asdir to ask for a loan that she will invest in the purchase of daily consumed articles and paper for the photocopier as there is increasing demand for copies since there is a school near the store.

Translated from Spanish by William Gray, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: The purchase of products

loans.name: Sonia Del Carmen

texts.es: Sonia del Carmen S. D. C., resiD. en San Luís Talpa, vive junto a sus tres hijos los cuales dependen exclusivamente D. ella. Sonia posee una venta D. ropa, así también posee una cafetería la cual la abre únicamente en la noche, ya que en el día se dedica a vender ropa para damas. Ella es una mujer muy trabajadora la cual se esfuerza el doble para obtener todo lo necesario para su familia, es por ello que Sonia solicita un préstamo, con el fin D. poder comprar más ropa y materia prima para su cafetería.
texts.en:
Sonia del Carmen S. D. C. lives in San Luís Talpa with her three children who are economically dependent on her. Sonia sells women's clothing during the day and she also has a cafe which is only open at night. She is a very hardworking woman who gives twice the effort to get what she needs for her family. That's why Sonia is requesting a loan with the goal of being able to buy more clothing and supplies for her cafe.

Translated from Spanish by Daniel Kvaka, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy supplies for her businesses.

location.town: San Luis Talpa,  departamento de La Paz.

loans.name: Alda Lucia

texts.es:
La Señora Alda M. tiene 51 años de edad, vive en Laureles Sur
En la capital de Managua, tiene tres hijos su compañero le ayuda económicamente.Los planes es tener un patrimonio seguro en donde exista la protección que seria la terminación de su casa.Se desempeña trabajando en su profesión de modista, tiene 10 años de experiencia.  Iniciando desde muy joven y con sus fondos propios en la compra de la maquina de coser y las primeras telas para elaborar vestidos y venderlos.Unos de los proyectos que tiene es montar su propio taller en donde también parta clase de costura.Gracias al préstamo en Afodenic lograra construir una pared y entechar un cuarto para brindar seguridad a sus seres queridos, este es su noveno ciclo en la institución y se ha beneficiado para hacer mejoras a su casa, a si como en su negocio. Su meta es lograr tener una casa digna.

loans.use: Comprar materiales de construccion para hacer una pared

loans.name: Samuel Antonio

texts.es: Samuel Antonio Martínez tiene 47 años, tiene 2 hijos que asisten a una escuela. La actividad económica de Samuel es brindar el servicio de Nintendo. Hace más de 5 años que se dedica a este negocio. Inicio con solamente con 1 televisor y un video juego, pero con las ganancias obtenidas fue invirtiendo en la compra de otro televisor, además con la ayuda de los financiamientos logro reunir el dinero que le hacia falta para la compra de mas equipos. En Fundación León 2000 encontró la oportunidad de crecer en su negocio ya que por medio de Fundación obtiene la ayuda de las organizaciones amigas. Por lo que el dinero lo solicita para la compra de equipos ya que los modelos de los videos juegos son más modernos. Los sueños de Samuel son de seguir mejorando su vivienda para que sus hijos tengan un lugar adecuado para vivir.
texts.en:
Samuel Antonio Martiniz is 47. He has two children who attend school. His business is renting out Nintendo (video game). He has had this business for over five years. He started with only one television and one video game. But, he was investing his earnings in another television. Also, with help from loans, he was able to get together the money he needed to buy more equipment. In the Fundación León 2000 he found the opportunity to make his business grow. Through the Fundación he gets help from the partner organizations. The loan is to buy equipment because the video games are now more modern. Samuel’s dream is to keep improving his home so that his children have a suitable place to live.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Norlan Antonio

texts.es: El joven Norlan L.,  tiene 22 años de edad, vive en el barrio Villa Reconciliación en la capital de Managua, casado su esposa se desempeña como operadora en unas de la empresa de la zona franca, tiene un hijo de tres meses. Tiene como planes comprar su propia casa. Don Norlan tiene su venta de lácteos desde hace un año, iniciando con fondos propios, comercializando su mercadería entre sus compañero de trabajo, Su visión es ofrecerle mejor calidad y servicio a sus clientes colocando su puesto de venta en puntos específicos. Gracias al préstamo en Afodenic comprara productos como: queso, crema, quesillo y cubriendo mayores demandas de productos.
texts.en:
The young Norlan L. is 22 years old, and lives the Villa Reconciliación neighborhood in the capital city of Managua. Norlan is married and his wife works as an operator in one of the factories in the Franca Zone; he has son who is 3 months old. He has plans of someday buying his own house. Norlan has sold dairy products for the past year; he began his business with his own funds, selling his merchandise to his work friends. His vision is to offer better quality and service to his clients, and to put his sales stand at key places. Thanks to the loan from Afodenic he will purchase products such as: cheese, cream, and quesillo, in that way covering his most demanded products.

Translated from Spanish by Mariela Cedeno, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase dairy products, such as: cheese, cream, and quesillo.

loans.name: Maura Mercedes

texts.es: Maura Mercedes R. López tiene 47 años, es una mujer casada. Y que le gusta su trabajo. La actividad económica es la venta de medicina de manera ambulante. Hace más de 20 años que se dedica a este negocio. Maura es una mujer muy luchadora y siempre le ha gustado trabajar, a pesar de su trabajo implica caminar muchas cuadras, además viaja en los diferentes buses para ofrecer sus productos y cada día que pasa incrementan sus clientes, y ella le brinda el mejor medicamento que ellos necesitan. Esto le ha permitido sobrevivir en la vida y poder mantener su negocio. El dinero lo solicita para ampliar su capital de trabajo. El mayor sueño es poseer un casa propia en la que pueda vivir feliz y cómodamente.
texts.en:
Maura Mercedes R. López is 47 years old. She is a married woman and she likes her work. Her job is selling medicine as a street vendor. She has been in this business for more than 20 years. Maura has a lot of fight in her. She has always liked working even though her job means walking many blocks. She even travels on different busses to sell her products. Each day that goes by she increases her customers and she offers them the best medicine that they need. This has helped her survive and keep up her business. She is applying for money to increase her working capital. Her biggest dream is to own her own house where she can live happily and comfortably.

Translated from Spanish by Susan Haynes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Maria Auxiliadora

texts.es: María Auxiliadora M. Narváez tiene 58 años de edad, ella tiene 3 hijos y todos trabajan de manera independiente. La actividad de María es un taller de costura. Inicio hace más de 40 años. A pesar de las dificultades por las que tuvo que atravesar, para dedicarse a este negocio ya que algunas veces no tenia tiempo de comer, por lo que tenia que cumplir con todos los encargos realizados por sus clientes, y fue la etapa mas difícil por la que tuvo que atravesar, a pesar de esto María dice estar muy contenta con su negocio. Y es así como solicita el financiamiento destinado para capital de trabajo y cubrir los gastos en materia prima. Sus sueños son de establecer un taller para no perder este tipo de negocio, ya que a ella le ayudo mucho en su vida.
texts.en:
María Auxiliadora M. Narváez is 58. She has three children; they all work independently. María’s job is in a sewing shop. She started over forty years ago. Being in this business was difficult. Sometimes she did not have time to eat because she had to finish all of the orders for her customers. It was the most difficult period that she had. In spite of the difficulties she had to go through, María is happy with the business She is asking for a loan for working capital to cover the costs of raw materials. Her dream is to establish a shop to not lose this type of business. It has helped her so much in her life.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Leonor

texts.es: Leonor García tiene la edad de 57 años, su estado civil es casada. Doña Leonor tiene 3 hijos y todos trabajan. La actividad económica es venta de ropa y pollo. Hace más de 5 años que se dedica a este negocio. Leonor inicio este negocio por la necesidad de llevar un sustento diario a su hogar, y contribuir en la formación de sus hijos. La ubicación del negocio es en su vivienda y poco a poco es que ha aumentado su negocio. Los propósitos de Leonor son de predominar en el mercado. El financiamiento es para la compra de productos variados. Los sueños de Leonor son de lograr establecer otro negocio.
texts.en:
Leonor García is 57 years old. Her marital status is married. Mrs. Leonor has 3 children and all are working. She works selling clothes and chicken. She has been in this business for more than 5 years. Leonor began this business because of her need to earn a daily living for her home and to contribute to her children’s education. The business is located in her house and little by little it has grown. Leonor’s goal is to dominate the market. The financing is to buy varied products. Leonor’s dream is to establish another business.

Translated from Spanish by Susan Haynes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.es: Elizabeth tiene 41 años, vive con su esposo, el cual es obrero textil, y con sus hijos; Luis de 15, María Elena de 14 y Flavio de 5. Desde hace 5 años, junto a su esposo, se dedica a la elaboración y venta de polos, empieza su jornada diaria después de enviar a sus hijos al colegio y darse un tiempo para la elaboración de los alimentos para el almuerzo. Después de esto empieza con la confección de las prendas, que usualmente dura hasta altas horas de la noche, ya que es ahí donde puede trabajar más tranquila, debido a que descansa de las labores del hogar. Felizmente su trabajo trae frutos, ya que los pedidos son muchos, obteniendo muy buenos ingresos económicos, de los cuales siempre guarda una parte para seguir invirtiendo en su negocio. En el futuro le gustaría tener un taller grande para incrementar su producción y por ende sus ingresos económicos, y así brindarle una mejor calidad de vida a su familia. Elizabeth regresa después de una temporada a Microfinanzas Prisma, ya que anteriormente estuvo más abocada a su familia, pero ahora que regresó con fuerza a su negocio solicita este préstamo para implementarlo comprando telas, hijos, entre otros materiales para dar a sus polos acabados mucho más novedosos.
texts.en:
Elizabeth is 41. She lives with her husband, a textile worker, and her children; Luis is 15, María Elena is 14, and Flavio is 5. She has worked with her husband for five years making and selling polo shirts. She starts her work day after sending her children to school and taking some time to make the food for lunch. Afterward, she starts making the clothes. This usually lasts until late at night. That is when she can work more peacefully because she can rest from the housework. Happily, her work bears fruit. There have been many orders which give them very good earnings. She always takes a part of the earnings to invest in her business. In the future she would like to have a big shop to increase production and income. This way they can give their family a better quality of life. Elizabeth returned from spending some time at Microfinanzas Prisma. Previously she was more wrapped up in her family, but now she has returned with vigor to her business. The loan is to buy fabric and needles among other materials to make her finished polo shirts much more original.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy materials to make clothes

loans.name: Noemi

texts.es: Noemí S. Gutiérrez tiene 32 años, su estado civil es casada. Tiene 2 hijos y todavía no asisten a escuela por ser menores de edad. Noemí tiene la actividad económica de una pulpería. La ubicación de su negocio es en su casa de habitación. Hace más de 3 años que se dedica a este negocio. Ella dio inicio a este negocio con una pequeña cantidad de vestuario, sin embargo su Mama fue quien le enseño que el negocio de la pulpería seria mucho más rentable, por lo que esto le favorecería porque estaría cuidando a sus hijos. El financiamiento que solicita es destinado para capital de trabajo y así comprar productos como granos básicos, golosinas, pan y refrescos naturales. Sus sueños son de darle la educación necesaria a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Noemí S. Gutiérrez is 32 and married. She has two children who are not yet school age. Noemí has a mini market, which is located in her house. She has had this business for over three years. She started this business with a small amount of clothes. Nevertheless, it was her mother who taught her that a mini market would be much more profitable. This would suit her because she would be taking care of her children. The loan she is asking for is for working capital to buy basic grains, sweets, bread, and natural soft drinks. Her dream is to give her children the necessary education.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Julia Maria

texts.es: Doña Julia María M. es una muy trabajadora de 35 años de edad. Ella se dedica al destace de cerdo, y lo procesa para luego distribuirlo de manera ambulante, por lo que tiene que correr muchos kilómetros para ofrecer sus productos. Se ha dedicado a este negocio desde hace 15 años, Julia es madre de 4 hijos varones, de los cuales todos estudian con el esfuerzo de ella y de su esposo, que trabaja brindando el servicio de transporte en un triciclo. El crédito solicitado es para la compra de cerdos además, tiene que pagarle a un señor para que recorra con ella los diferentes lugares donde le ofrecen los cerdos a un mejor precio. Los sueños de Julia son de salir adelante para que  a sus hijos no les falte el pan de cada día.
texts.en:
Doña Julia María M. is a very hard working 35 year old. She butchers pork and then processes it to later distribute as a street vendor. She has to cover many kilometers to offer her products. She has been doing this for fifteen years. Julia has four sons. Through her efforts and her husband’s efforts (he works with a tricycle in the transportation service) the children go to school. The loan is to buy more pigs. Also, she needs to pay a man to travel with her to the different places where they sell pigs at a better price. Julia’s dream is to get ahead so that her children do not lack their daily bread.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Reynaldo Jose

texts.es: Reynaldo José G. tiene la edad de 43 años, su estado civil es soltero. Don Reynaldo tiene 2 hijos y todos estudian. La actividad económica de Reynaldo es el servicio de carpintería. Hace más de 12 años que inicio este negocio. Inicio por cuenta propia y con pequeños trabajos de carpintería y a medida que obtenía más clientela empezó a comprar equipos y herramientas de trabajos como sierras para cortar madera, taladros y ahora maneja un pequeño taller de carpintería. Reynaldo es un hombre muy trabajador. Y sus propósitos son de proporcionarle a su negocio las herramientas necesarias. El financiamiento es solicitado para capital de trabajo para la compra de madera, lijas, clavos, pega entre otras cosas. Los deseos de Reynaldo son de seguir creciendo con su negocio y así darle mejores condiciones de vida a su familia.
texts.en:
Reynaldo José G. is 43 and single. Reynaldo has two children who go to school. Reynaldo is a carpenter. He started this business over twelve years ago. He started on his own with small carpentry jobs. As he got more customers, he started to buy equipment and work tools like saws to cut wood and drills. Now he runs a small carpentry shop. Reynaldo is a hard worker. He plans to supply his business with the necessary tools. He is asking for a loan for working capital. He will buy wood, sanders, nails, and glue, among other things. Reynaldo wants to have his business continue to grow. That way he will be able to give his family better living conditions.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Cindy

texts.es: Cindy tiene 21 años, es soltera y su mayor interés es ayudar a su familia con la que vive, ya que trata de aporta para los gastos del hogar. El amor por su madre ha sido uno de los aspectos determinantes para empezar a trabajar desde muy joven, ya que aun cuando no culminaba sus estudios, trabajó en diversos oficios. Con los ahorros de estos trabajos invirtió en la instalación de una tienda en un colegio de su distrito, la cual es atendida por ella, su madre y su hermana, quienes se han convertido en sus socias, y juntas trabajan desde las 7 de la mañana hasta las 6 de la tarde. Pero sin duda, lo más difícil de esta actividad es la rapidez al vender, ya que en las horas de receso o recreo, los alumnos y profesores se amontonan en su puesto, por lo que es complicado atenderlos a todos al mismo tiempo, a pesar de contar con el apoyo de sus dos socias. Para el futuro, Cindy tiene proyectado mejorar su cafetín y ambientarlo con un espacio más cómodo, donde los alumnos y maestros puedan consumir sus productos sentados en las mesas y le posibiliten un tiempo adicional para atenderlos. Este es su primer crédito con Microfinanzas PRISMA, y espera demostrar ser una cliente confiable para la institución. Los 2500 soles que solicita serán invertidos en la compra de mercadería para cumplir con los pedidos y exigencias de sus clientes.
texts.en:
Cindy is 21 and single. Her primary concern is helping her family; she lives with them. She tries to contribute to the household expenses. Her love for her mother was one of the reasons for Cindy to start working from a young age. Even when she had not yet finished her studies, she worked at various jobs. With the savings from these jobs, she set up a store in one of the schools in her district. Cindy, her mother, and her sister tend the store. They have become her partners, and together they work from seven in the morning until six at night. Without a doubt, the hardest thing about this work is how quickly you have to sell. In the recess hours the students and professors gather at her stand. Even with the help of her two partners, it is hard to wait on all of them at the same time. In the future, Cindy has plans to improve her snack bar and make it a more comfortable space where students and teachers can consume her products seated at tables. This will give her extra time to wait on them. This is her first loan with Microfinanzas Prisma. She hopes to show herself to be a trustworthy client of the institution. The 2,500 PEN she is asking for are to buy merchandise to meet her customers' needs.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase merchandise

loans.name: Women Of The Lighthouse Group

texts.es:
catorce mujeres conforman la asociación “Señoras del Faro” , hace mas de tres años  se reúnen cada dos semanas en el centro focal Villa Tejada ubicado en la ciudad de El Alto. La mayoría están casadas y con familias numerosas, afirman que necesitan ayudar a sus parejas a cubrir los gastos en sus hogares.
Diversas son las actividades de este grupo, María que es la presidenta tiene un puesto en una escuela donde vende dulces y meriendas, Julieta se dedica a la zapatería, otras elaboran tortas y masitas, también venden ropa en la feria de las mañaneras de la C. Tumusla.
La asociación Señoras del Faro, necesita de mayor capital para comprar mercadería al por mayor, de este modo sus ventas aumentaran y obtendrán mayores ingresos, esto les permitirá sostener económicamente a sus hogares.
texts.en:
Fourteen women make up the "Women of the Lighthouse" association. For more than three years they have met every two weeks in the Villa Tejada meeting center located in the city of El Alto. Most are married with numerous family members, and agree that they need to help their partners cover the household expenses. The activities of this group are diverse. Maria, who is the president, has a stand in a school where she sells sweets and snacks. Julieta works in shoe repair and others make cakes and pastries. They also sell clothing in the morning market of Tumusla street. The "Women of the Lighthouse" association needs more capital to buy merchandise at wholesale. This way their sales will increase and they will obtain more income which will permit them to financially sustain their homes.

Translated from Spanish by Daniel Burke, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy merchandise at wholesale

loans.name: Magali Del Rosario

texts.es: Magali del Rosario U. tiene 44 años de edad, Es madre soltera. Tiene 2 hijos y estudian. Su actividad económica es una pulpería, hace más de 11 años que inicio este negocio. Con muy pocos productos, debido a que no poseía mucho capital de trabajo,  Magali es una mujer muy humilde y trabajadora a pesar de que su trabajo no le genera muchas ganancias, ella dice que le gusta mucho atender a sus vecinos y en sus pensamientos esta el seguir adelante con este negocio. Por lo que solicita el financiamiento para capital de trabajo y comprar los productos básicos para su pulpería. Su deseo es incrementar sus ingresos par que sus hijos puedan tener mejores condiciones de vida.
texts.en:
Magali del Rosario U. is 44 years old. She is a single mother with 2 children, both of whom are in school. Her business is a pulpería (convenience store) that she started more than 11 years ago; she began with very few products because she did not have much working capital. Magali is a very modest and hard-working woman, and even though her business doesn’t generate much profit, she says that she enjoys attending to her neighbors and thinks she can get ahead with her business. She plans to use the loan she is requesting for working capital and to purchase basic products for her store. Magali’s wish is to increase her income so that her children can have a better standard of living.

Translated from Spanish by Christopher Knutson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Maria

texts.es: María tiene 50 años, es soltera, tiene 5 hijos; Fran de 30, Nicson de 28, Marisa de 26, Mirella de 24 y Michel de 12 años, siendo este con el único que vive a su lado, ya que los mayores se encuentran en las ciudades de Tacna y otras ciudades del norte del país. Desde hace 18 años se dedica a la confección de prendas de vestir, empezó desde muy joven motivada por una importante razón, sus hijos, a los cuales desde muy pequeños enseñó a ayudarle y a trabajar duro para conseguir lo que se necesite. Ahora, con ellos ya independientes, María quiere dedicarse de lleno a su trabajo y a seguir expandiéndolo mucho más, ya que comenzó con muy poco y hoy en día tiene varios clientes. En este momento se encuentra trabajando en un pedido de buzos para alumnos de una escuela cercana a su casa, resultándole cada vez más rentable su negocio. A futuro quiere tener un taller grande y varias personas que trabajen para ella, y así generar una fuente de trabajo. María ha tenido 4 préstamos en Microfinanzas Prisma, y su banco comunal “Los amigos del Futuro” siempre ha sido muy puntual en el pago de sus cuotas, trabajando siempre en equipo. El dinero que solicita comprará telas, cierres y demás materiales para elaborar los 720 buzos de su actual pedido.
texts.en:
María is 50 years old, is single, and has 5 children: Fran 30, Nicson 28, Marisa 26, Mirella 24, and Michel 12. Michel is the only one that lives at her side, now that the older ones are found in the city of Tacna and other cities in the north of the country. For the last 18 years she has dedicated herself to dressmaking, she began when she was young, motivated by an important reason - her children, who since they were young she taught to help her and work hard to obtain what they need. Now, with the children independent, María wants to dedicate herself fully to her work and continue expanding it a lot more, as she started with very little and today has various clients. At the moment you will find her working making tracksuits for students of a school near her house, resulting each time in making her business more profitable. In the future she wants to have a big workshop and various people that work for her, and like this generate a fountain of work. María has had 4 loans with Microfinanzas Prisma, and her communal bank 'Los Amigos del Futuro' has always been very punctual in the payment of their loans, always working as a team. With the money she requests she will buy fabric, zips, and other materials to make the 720 tracksuits in her order.

Translated from Spanish by Jane McCrory, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy materials to make tracksuits

loans.name: Cisnes De Casacada Group

texts.es:
En la urbanización 6 de junio de la ciudad de El Alto se encuentra el centro focal Cascada a este pertenece la asociación “Cisnes de Cascada”, integrado por doce miembros, trabajan junto a Pro-Mujer hace mas  de ocho años cumpliendo sus actividades internas de forma responsable.
Diversos son los negocios que hay en este grupo, por ejemplo se dedican al trenzado de mantas, confección de polleras, venta de ropa de invierno, venta de gorras, entre otros.
Necesitan comprar materia prima y/o mercadería para poder aumentar sus ventas, de este modo generar mayores ingresos que les permita cubrir necesidades básicas en sus hogares.
texts.en:
In the housing development 6 de Junio in the city of El Alto, you will find the focal centre of Cascada, to which pertains the association 'Cisnes de Cascada'. Made up of 12 members, they have worked together with Pro-Mujer for more than 8 years, achieving their domestic activities in a responsible way. The businesses that exist in this group are diverse, for example some work plaiting blankets, selling chickens, selling winter clothing, selling hats, among others. They need to buy raw material and/or groceries to be able to increase their sales, and by this mode generate better income which will permit them to cover the basic necessities of their homes.

Translated from Spanish by Jane McCrory, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy raw material and/or groceries

loans.name: Ida

texts.es: Ida es madre soltera, tiene 52 años, es técnica laboratorista y trabaja en un hospital desde hace 23 años, vive junto a sus dos hijos, quienes cursan estudios universitarios y su casa es propia. Como especialista en el arte de las manualidades elabora muñecos de peluche, bordados en tela, adornos en diversos materiales, entre otros. Actividad que viene realizando desde hace 9 años y cuenta con un pequeño taller dentro de su casa donde también capacita a un grupo de madres solteras en diferentes estilos de manualidades para que puedan solventarse económicamente. A Ida le gusta mucho su trabajo porque se relaciona con todo tipo de personas, además le es lo suficientemente rentable para solventar los gastos de su hogar. Para más adelante, Ida quiere tener una empresa de elaboración de insumos de limpieza, adicional a su negocio de manualidades. Este es su 5to préstamo con MFP, y le gusta trabajar con su banco comunal porque son todas mujeres trabajadoras y con ganas de superación. Con el dinero que solicita comprará materiales (telas, pedrerías, hilos, etc) e insumos para empezar  a preparar lo que aprendió, como líquidos desinfectantes, ambientadores y limpiadores.
texts.en:
Ida, a single mother, is 52, is a laboratory technician, and has worked in a hospital for 23 years. She lives with her 2 children, who study courses at university, and her house is her own. As a specialist in the art of handicrafts, she makes plush dolls, bordered in material, adorned with diverse material, among others. She has done this activity for 9 years and has a small workshop in her house, where she also trains a group of single mothers in different styles of handicrafts, so that they can be covered economically. Ida really likes her job because she meets every type of person, and it is also profitable enough to cover the expenses of her home. For the future, Ida wants to have a cleaning product business, additional to her handicraft business. This is her fifth loan with MFP, and she likes to work with her communal bank because they are all working women with the desire to overcome their problems. With the money she is seeking she will buy materials (fabric, precious stones, threads etc) and consumables to begin to prepare what she has learned to start her cleaning business, such as disinfectant liquids, air fresheners, and cleaning products.

Translated from Spanish by Jane McCrory, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy materials and consumables for business

loans.name: Dorothea

texts.en: Dorothea A. is from the village of Canicapan, Clarin Misamis Occidental. She is 59 years old, married, and has six adult children. Dorothea raises crops, primarily planting and harvesting rice for sale. She has been engaged in her business for over fifteen years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month for these activities. In 2008, Dorothea joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. Dorothea has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from GDMPC. Dorothea is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding her business. This loan will be her second loan from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. About GDMPC: GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding her business

loans.name: Nancy

texts.en: Nancy C. is from the village of Gata Diot, Clarin Misamis Occidental. She is 50 years old, married, and has nine adult children. Nancy owns and operates a business raising chickens for sale. She has been engaged in her business for over seven years and earns approximately 20,000 PHP a month for these activities. In 2007, Nancy joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from GDMPC. Nancy is requesting a new loan of 25,000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding her business. This loan will be her 14th loan from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business and to pay for her family's basic needs. About GDMPC: GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding her business

loans.name: Minervas Group

texts.es:
En la ciudad de el alto se encuentra ubicado el centro focal Alto Lima a este pertenece la asociación “Minervas”, formado por quince mujeres, trabajan junto a la familia de Pro Mujer hace cinco años.
Este grupo tiene diferentes negocios, se dedican al tejido de chompas,confecion de cortinas,elaboracion de comida, servicio de te, venta de maletas, venta de dulces en kioscos y de forma ambulante. Ahora Afirman que necesitan de créditos para comprar  materia prima y/o productos en mayor cantidad, para ampliar sus ventas, tienen la seguridad que generaran mejores ganancias
texts.en:
The communal association “Minervas” finds its focal center in Alto Lima, in the city El Alto in La Paz, Bolivia. Minervas is comprised of 15 women who have worked alongside the Kiva field partner Pro-Mujer (For Women) for the past five years. This group has different businesses. They are dedicated to making sweaters, creating curtains, cooking meals, serving tea, selling luggage, and selling sweets via ambulatory kiosks. Now they state that they need credit in order to purchase raw materials and / or products in bulk in order to increase their sales. This will ensure that they can generate more revenue.

Translated from Spanish by Debra Faszer-McMahon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase raw materials and/or products

loans.name: Ronnie

texts.en: Ronnie L. Sr. is from the village of Poblacion 3, Clarin Misamis Ocidental. He is 30 years old, married, and has three infants. Ronnie manufactures and sells homemade ice cream to local businesses and to community members. He has been engaged in his business for over two years and earns approximately 15,000 PHP a month for these activities. In 2009, Ronnie joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and his ability to engage in business activities. He has successfully repaid a previous loan of 20,000 PHP from GDMPC. Ronnie is requesting a new loan of 20,000 PHP which will be used to purchase ingredients to make homemade ice cream to sell. This loan will be his third loan from GDMPC. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand his business and to pay for his family's basic needs. About GDMPC: GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase ingredients for making homemade ice cream

loans.name: Lilia

texts.en:
Lilia O., a 48-year-old married mother of four school-aged children, is from the town of Plaride, where she operates a fishing business. The main source of income for the business comes from harvesting and selling ocean-caught fish in the local community. Engaged in this enterprise for over 15 years, Lilia earns approximately 2,000 PHP a month.

In 2007, Lilia joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She successfully repaid a previous loan of 10,000 PHP from PMPC and is now requesting a new loan of 5000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This loan will be her third from PMPC, and she plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

She has been engaged in her business for over seven years and earns approximately Php 2,000 a month. In 2008, Marciana joined Paglaum Coop to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She is requesting a loan of Php 7,000 which will be used to purchase piglets to raise and sell. This is her first loan from Paglaum Coop. About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. loans.name: Ni Ketut Wiriasih

texts.en:
"Ni Ketut Wiriasih - (DNR.M-0680), a 43 year-old woman living in the town of Tuwed – Melaya, is married and has one school-aged child. To making a living, Ni Ketut Wiriasih owns and operates a business raising livestock; her main source of income for the business comes primarily from raising pigs for sale. Ni Ketut Wiriasih has been engaged in this business for over 11 years and earns approximately 500,000 IDR a month.

In 2008, Ni Ketut Wiriasih joined DINARI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She is now requesting a loan, her second, from DINARI, of 5,000,000 IDR which will be used to purchase baby livestock to raise and sell. Ni Ketut Wiriasih plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business.

About DINARI:

The mission of DINARI is to strive for the preservation of the environment, to empower the poor, and to provide socio-economic development opportunities to small business owners.

loans.name: Analy

texts.en: Analy A. is from the city of Plaridel. She is 35 years old, married, and has four school-aged children. Analy owns and operates a general store, primarily selling daily-use products such as shampoo, soap and toothpaste in the local community. Analy has been engaged in her business for over six years. In 2007, Analy joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. Analy has successfully repaid a previous loan of 4,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. Analy is requesting a new loan of 7,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be her second loan from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. texts.en:
Ni Ketut Sumadi - (DNR.M-0681), a 40 year-old married mother of two school-aged children, lives in the town of Sari Kuning – Melaya, where she owns and operates a business raising livestock. While not the only means of generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from raising pigs for sale. Ni Ketut Sumadi has been engaged in this business for over six years and earns approximately 500,000 IDR a month.

In 2008, Ni Ketut Sumadi joined DINARI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Ni Ketut Sumadi is now requesting a loan, her second from DINARI, of 5,000,000 IDR, which will be used to purchase baby livestock to raise and sell. Ni Ketut Sumadi plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to pay the tuition fees of her children.

About DINARI:

The mission of DINARI is to strive for the preservation of the environment, to empower the poor, and to provide socio-economic development opportunities to small business owners.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. loans.name: Marilyn

texts.en:
Marilyn J. owns and operates a business making and selling charcoal. She is 50 years old, married and has seven school-aged children. She is from the town of Santa Maria, Tangub city. Marilyn has been engaged in her business for over 14 years and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month.

In 2009, Marilyn joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living conditions and enable her to engage in business activities. Marilyn is requesting a loan of 4000 PHP which will be used to purchase coconut shells for manufacturing charcoal. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Marilyn from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business for family needs and for the support of her children's education.

About GDMPC: GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines.

Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. loans.name: Ni Ketut Narti

texts.en: Ni Ketut Narti (DNR.M-0682) is a 53-year-old female living in the town of Sari Kuning, Melaya. She is married and does not have any children. Ni Ketut Narti raises pigs for sale. She has been engaged in this business for over two years and earns approximately 600,000 IDR a month. In 2008, Ni Ketut Narti joined DINARI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. Ni Ketut Narti is now requesting a new loan of 5,000,000 IDR which will be used to purchase piglets to raise and sell. The loan will be her second loan from DINARI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. About DINARI: The mission of DINARI is to strive for the preservation of the environment, to empower the poor, and to provide socio-economic development opportunities to small business owners. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in Bahasa while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders. ***************************************************** Ni Ketut Narti - (DNR.M-0682) merupakan 53 tahun wanita. Dia (perempuan) tinggal di kota sari Kuning - Melaya. Dia (perempuan) menikah dan tidak memiliki anak. Untuk membiayai hidup, Ni Ketut Narti memiliki & menjalankan usaha. Bisnis beroperasi di sektor pertanian. Tujuan utama bisnis tersebut adalah memelihara ternak. Meskipun bukan satu-satunya sarana untuk menghasilkan pendapatan, sumber utama penghasilan bisnis tersebut terutama berasal dari beternak babi untuk dijual. Ni Ketut Narti sudah menjalankan bisnis ini selama lebih dari 2 tahun. Dari kegiatan-kegiatan ini, Ni Ketut Narti menghasilkan sekitar 600,000 IDR sebulan. Dalam 2008, Ni Ketut Narti bergabung DINARI untuk mendapatkan akses ke layanan keuangan untuk membantu meningkatkan -nya kondisi kehidupan dan kemampuan untuk menjalankan kegiatan bisnis. Ni Ketut Narti telah berhasil melunasi pinjaman sebelumnya dari DINARI. Dia (perempuan) sekarang meminta pinjaman baru sebesar 5,000,000 IDR. Pinjaman saat ini akan digunakan untuk untuk membeli bibit ternak untuk dibesarkan & dijual di masa mendatang. Pinjaman ini akan menjadi 2nd pinjaman yang diambil oleh peminjam dari DINARI. Ni Ketut Narti berencana untuk menggunakan pendapatan tambahan yang dihasilkan dari bisnis untuk meningkatkan/memperluas bisnis peminjam. Tentang DINARI: Misi DINARI adalah memperjuangkan kelestarian lingkungan, memberdayakan kaum miskin, dan menyediakan kesempatan pembangunan sosial ekonomi bagi pemilik usaha kecil. *Catatan: Untuk memaksimalkan efisiensi & menurunkan biaya, pinjaman ini ditempelkan menggunakan templat sehingga dapat diterjemahkan otomatis oleh Kiva. . Mengingat bahwa terjemahan manual atas profil memakan biaya besar, Kiva menciptakan templat ini untuk Mitra Lapangan untuk memungkinkan mereka terus menempelkan pinjaman dalam Bahasa sambil memberikan informasi yang bermutu & akurat kepada para pemberi pinjaman Kiva.

loans.use: To purchase piglets to raise and sell

loans.name: Dul's Group

texts.en:
This is a small loan for four women who live in Phnom Penh City, Cambodia. Mrs. Dul S., age 57, has been selected to be group leader by the other members. She is a widowed mother who has given birth to three children who are single. Two of her children are employed in different occupations.

Dul S. has been a domestic tailor for three years. She also sews a small amount of cloth to be decorating products for sale. She generates an average income of $3 each day and has been running her tailoring business since early 2001.

Due to the lack of raw materials to support her business actions, Dul S. requested a loan in order to purchase a small amount of cloth to continue making the products to sell.

The other borrowers who have joined this loan are the following:

P. will use the loan to repair her husband's taxi.

S. will use the money to expand her business selling fish.

P. will use the loan to buy groceries to sell.

loans.use: To purchase a small amount of cloth

loans.name: Myrna

texts.en:
Myrna U. lives in the village of Usocan. She is 43 years old, married and has five adult-aged children. To make a living, Myrna raises livestock, primarily pigs. Myrna has been in this business for more than five years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month from her work.

In 2007, Myrna joined PMPC to gain access to financial services that will help her improve her living conditions and ability to engage in business. Myrna has successfully repaid three loans, and is requesting a new one to buy livestock feed and other supplies. She plans to use the additional income made possible by this loan to improve the living conditions of her family. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

loans.use: to buy livestock feed and other supplies

loans.name: Ian

texts.en:
Ian G. lives in the village of Cabungaan Clarin Misamis Occidental. He is 30 years old, married and has three young children. To make a living, he owns and operates a farm whose main crop is coconuts. Ian has been in his business for more than three years.

In 2008, Ian joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services that could improve his living standards and ability to engage in business activities. Ian has successfully repaid previous loans from GDMPC, and is requesting a new one to invest in expanding his business. This loan will be his fourth from GDMPC. He plans to use the additional revenue made possible by this loan to meet his growing family's basic needs. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines.

In 2008, Gozelle Mae joined PMPC to gain access to financial services that can help her improve her living conditions and ability to engage in business. loans.use: to buy additional products to sell

loans.name: Renalyn

texts.en:
Renalyn O. lives in the village of Solinog, Calamba Misamis Occidental. She is 30 years old, married and has two young children. To make a living, Renalyn owns and operates a small  retail stall where she sells home utensils and school supplies. Renalyn has been in this business for over four years and earns approximately 8,000 PHP a month from her work.

In 2009, Renalyn joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services that will help improve her living conditions and ability to engage in business. Renalyn is requesting a loan, her first, to buy additional products to sell in her retail stall. She plans to use the additional income made possible by this loan to expand her business and meet her family's basic needs.

loans.use: to buy additional products to sell

loans.name: Glen

texts.en:
Glen L. lives in the town of Lopez Jaena. She is 33 years old, married and has four school-aged children. To make a living, she runs a general store where she sells products people use every day, such as shampoo, soap and toothpaste. Glen has been engaged in this business for over eight years and earns approximately 7,000 PHP a month from her work.

In 2006, Glen joined PMPC to gain access to financial services that could help her improve her living conditions and ability to engage in business. Glen has successfully repaid previous loans, which she used to expand her product offering. She is requesting this new loan, her sixth, to buy additional items to sell. She plans to use the income made possible by this loan to pay her children's tuition.

loans.use: to purchase new products to sell to her customers

loans.name: Delia

texts.en:
Delia M. is from the town of Plaridel. She is 49 years old. Delia is widowed and has 3 adult children. To make a living, Delia raises livestock. Her main source of income is raising pigs for sale. Delia is just starting this business.

In 2008, Delia joined PAGLAUM COOP to access financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Delia has successfully repaid a previous loan of Php3,000 from PAGLAUM COOP. Delia is requesting a new loan of Php7000 which will be used to purchase piglets to raise and sell in the future. This loan will be the 2nd loan taken out by Delia from PAGLAUM COOP.

loans.use: To purchase livestock to raise and sell in the  future

loans.name: Rustam

texts.en: B. Rustam is 26 years old and is married. He owns a shop in which he sells spare moped engine parts, a business he has been running for the last two years. The income he earns allows him to support his family including his parents. To meet his customers’ constantly growing demands, Rustam would like to increase his shop’s capacity. The profits from these sales will allow him to continue to improve his living conditions. The loan will greatly improve Rustam’s income and his family's living standards. More about Tajikistan and IMON International Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium B.C. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions. But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty. IMON's History Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: To purchase more spare parts to increase his range of goods

loans.name: Rahmatullo

texts.en: Rahmatullo T., a 52-year-old father of three children, is married to a housewife and so is the sole income earner of the family. He has been farming for the last 22 years on his piece of land growing wheat, rice, tomato, cucumber and watermelon. Rahmatullo would like to adopt new farming technology to boost his agricultural yield as he needs to be able to meet the financial responsibility of educating his children and maintaining his family. But he lacks the capital. He therefore requests a 4,000 Somoni loan to purchase seeds and fertilizer for growing his crops. He is very responsible and promises to repay the loan on time. loans.use: To purchase seeds and mineral fertilizer for his farm

loans.name: Moinposho

texts.en:
G. Moinposho is an enterprising woman with a big desire to improve the quality of life for her family. She is married and the mother of three children. Moinposho has been a seamstress since she was very young, learning in her mother's office. She was able to open her own shop at her home 13 years ago and has been successful because her customers have recognized the high quality of her products. In this way, she constantly adds new clients and has seen her business grow. Today Moinposho is applying for a loan to IMON International for the seventh time. She is requesting 4000 Somoni that she will spend to purchase summer fabrics for sewing national dresses. You can help improve the quality of life of Moinposho’s family. She sincerely appreciates your support and thanks you!

loans.use: To purchase summer fabric

loans.name: Bahodur

texts.en:
M. Bahodur is 30 years old. Together with his wife, they are raising three children. Bahodur has been running a drug store already for five years. He is selling only certified medicines. The drug store is located in the center of the town, which allows him to have many clients and customers. Bahodur has been a client of IMON for a year. Now he requests 4000 Somoni. Being a very accurate person by nature, Bahodur is sure, and would like to ensure the lenders, that he is able to pay the loan on time without any violations. Your generosity can change their lives.

loans.use: To purchase more medicine to expand his business

loans.name: Barnokhon

texts.en:
U. Barnokhon is a single woman with no children. She lives with her parents and runs her own business. She sells kid’s clothing in the central market of Dushanbe. She has a wide variety of merchandise combined with reasonable prices. Barnokhon has been in this trade for 11 years. She is trying to do everything she can to provide for the well-being of her family. That is why she wants to continue expanding her business and growing her trade by increasing the number of her vending locations. Barnokhon is requesting a loan of 4000 Somoni to sustain her business and help ensure it continues to provide enough income to live on.

loans.use: To purchase more goods to increase her stock

loans.name: Hojikurbon

texts.en:
B. Hojikurbon is a diligent and tenacious farmer who strives to meet his family’s needs. His wife does not work, and thus he carries the burden alone to meet his family’s needs through his farming income. Hojikurbon works on a 1-hectare farm owned by his parents. His harvests are sometimes not maximized because his cultivation method and seeds are not the best. Better farming supplies, seeds and fertilizer require a larger capital, which he didn’t have. Hojikurbon is now relieved that IMON International is helping him get the loan he needs to improve his farming. This loan will be used to buy superior seeds, organic fertilizers and pesticides. Hojikurbon is waiting for his next harvest, which he hopes will yield better results than his previous harvests. He will use his farming income to support his children’s educational needs, and if there is still some money left, he really hopes to fix his unfinished house.

loans.use: Purchasing seed and mineral fertilizer

loans.name: Saifiniso

texts.en:
E. Saifiniso is 52 years old and comes from a large and humble family. She is a widow and the loving mother of two children. Her father's hard and demanding character showed her, from the time she was young, the significant value of work, and therefore she has been successful in various activities throughout her life. Now she dedicates herself to raising and selling cows. With the income she generates she provides a better quality of life for her children, who are her greatest joy and have become her best friends. Saifiniso asks for a loan of $700 USD in order to buy more young cattle to later sell when they are fully grown. With this investment Saifiniso will be able to substantially grow her earnings and improve her quality of life. Let’s support this dedicated mother's proposal.

loans.name: Dilshod

texts.en:

The business is stable and generates the main and considerable income for Dilshod’s family, improving their living conditions. Currently his minivan needs some repairs. He needs a loan of $800 USD to purchase the spare parts. Dilshod thanks everyone supporting him and promises to repay the loan with accuracy. The well-being of this family is in your hands.

loans.use: To purchase parts to repair his minivan.

loans.name: Anvarali

texts.en:
J. Anvarali is 29 years old. He is married and lives with his wife and two little children. He is a very hard worker, and works cultivating different kinds of vegetables, an activity which he has practiced for 4 years. He enjoys his work for the contact with nature, and also because vegetables sell very well in the markets and are valued within his community. Currently Anvarali needs a loan of $800 USD for his business. With this loan, he will buy seeds and fertilizers to improve the farm and get better production.

loans.use: To purchase seed and fertilizer

loans.name: Jeffie

texts.en:
Jeffie E. is from the village of Mialen Clarin Misamis Occidental. He is 22 years old and married. To make a living, Jeffie owns and operates a business venture in the services sector, operating transportation services. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from operating a tricycle for transportation services. Jeffie has been engaged in this business for over 1 year and earns approximately 9300 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Jeffie joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and his ability to engage in business activities. Jeffie is requesting a loan of 8000 PHP, which will be used for additional payment for his motorcycle for transportation services. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Jeffie from GDMPC. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of his family.

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines.
