loans.use: For additional payment for his motorcycle

loans.name: Nabila Muhammad Akram Group

texts.en:
Nabila baji is the wife of M. A. and has lived in Multan, Pakistan, for the past ten years. Multan is famous for its shrines. Her husband is a welder by profession.

Nabila baji runs a decorative-embroidery business. She earns income by preparing embroidered dresses on orders which she collects from the clothes shops. She does this work to pay off the utilities. She is applying for a loan to buy a welding machine for her husband. 

She is the group leader of two other women from her locality:

Talat naheed baji wants a loan to buy materials (beads, clothes and colored thread) for her decorative-embroidery business.

Rozina baji wants a loan to buy a welding machine.

loans.use: To buy a welding machine for her husband's business

loans.name: Sehar Zafar Asghar Group

texts.en:
Zahida baji wants a loan to buy vehicle spare parts to sell. Parveen akhtar baji wants a loan to buy groceries for her grocery shop. Another Parveen akhtar baji wants a loan to buy fruits for her fruit-selling business. Ameer baji wants a loan to buy material (beads, colored thread and clothes) for her decorative embroidery business.

Sehar baji is the group leader of these above mentioned ladies. They all belong to a city named Multan, Pakistan. Multan city is famous for its shrines. They all are very responsible and hardworking ladies. They handle their own businesses and support their families. Sehar baji operates a business sewing clothes to pay for utilities. Her husband works in a factory for a monthly wage. Sehar baji wants a loan to buy an electric sewing machine so that she is able to complete orders on time and earn a good income.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To buy an electric sewing machine for sewing clothes

loans.name: Shazia Khan Abdul Salam Group

texts.en:
Sabiha naz baji wants a loan to buy edible items (chips & biscuits) to sell. Malkana baji wants a loan to buy a sewing machine for sewing clothes. Ruqaiya baji wants a loan to buy material (beads, colored thread and clothes) for her decorative embroidery business. Rafiqa khatoon baji wants a loan to buy animals (goats) for her butcher shop.

Shazia khan baji is the group leader of these ladies mentioned above. They all live in a city named Multan, Pakistan. Multan city is famous for its shrines. They all are ladies who are struggling. They run their own businesses to manage their financial expenses. Rafiqa baji runs a boutique in the community. She prepares simple and designer clothes and displays them in the boutique and sells them. She is applying for a loan to buy material (beads, clothes, and colored thread) to increase the profit of her boutique.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To increase the profit of boutique

loans.name: Lubna Qaiser Aleem Qureshi Group

texts.en:
Alia naz baji wants a loan to buy groceries for her grocery shop. Tahmina baji wants a loan to buy cosmetics to sell. Shabnam baji wants a loan to buy a lath machine.

Lubna baji has been a citizen of a city named Multan, Pakistan for the past 10 years. Multan city is famous for its shrines. She is the group leader of these ladies mentioned above. Lubna baji is a very hardworking and responsible lady. She runs her own boutique in the community to share the financial burden of her husband. In the boutique she displays her handmade collection of stitched & embroidered dresses. People like her collection so much and give her orders. She is applying for a loan to buy materials (beads, clothes and colored thread) to complete the order of her customer and to increase the profit of her boutique.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

Note: "Grocery shop belongs to Alia naz baji".

loans.use: To increase the profit of her boutique

loans.name: Irma Haydee

texts.es: Irma Haydee R. L. de 29 años de edad, reside en el municipio de Turín en Ahuachapán. Ella posee una venta de tortillas y una venta de productos para el cabello y cuidado personal, la cual se la heredó su madre hace cuatro años. Actualmente ella está trabajando en San Salvador pero ha contratado a una persona la cual se encarga de realizar el trabajo en el negocio. Irma solicita un préstamo con el fin de obtener el dinero para comprar más maíz para sus tortillas y leña para cocinarlas, ella desea mejorar sus ganancias en el negocio, ya que este es un trabajo el cual le brinda una ayuda extra para poder solventar todos sus gastos.
texts.en:
Irma Haydee R. L. is 29 years old and lives in the city of Turín in Ahuachapán, El Salvador. She owns a tortilla shop. She also sells hair care and personal care products, a business that she inherited from her mother four years ago. Currently she is working in San Salvador, but she has contracted someone who helps her with the other business. Irma is asking for a loan in order to purchase more corn for her tortillas and wood for cooking them. She hopes to increase her earnings from the business, since this is a job that gives her a little extra help to be able to manage her expenses.

Translated from Spanish by Debra Faszer-McMahon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase corn

loans.name: Gulmahmad

texts.ru: Мирзоев Гулмахмад имеет два магазина, где занимается торговлей. Торгует он в основном продуктами питания и стройматериалами. Этим видом бизнеса занимается более 3 лет. До этого он 15 лет работал колхозником. Гулмахмад проживает в районе Явана. Возраст 43 года. Женат, имеет 4 детей. Клиент просит у нас кредит, чтобы отремонтировать магазин и закупить сторойматериалы.
texts.en:
Gulmahmad M. has two stores where he sells mostly groceries and construction supplies. He has been in this type of business for over three years. Before this he worked for 15 years on a collective farm. Gulmahmad lives in the Yavan district. He is 43 years old, married, and has four children. He is requesting a loan to renovate one store and buy construction supplies.

Translated from Russian by Anna Brown, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase working capital

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Teresa De Jesús

texts.es: Teresa de Jesús R. H. de 48 años de edad reside en La Libertad junto a sus dos hijas. Ella posee desde hace 14 años su negocio de comida y tortillas, el cual es su única fuente de ingresos para sostener a su familia. Teresa Solicita un préstamo con el fin de poder comprar un microondas para su negocio, así también comprar granos básicos para la elaboración de los alimentos. Teresa espera mejorar las ventas y así mejorar las ganancias, con lo cual mejorara la situación económica a la que se enfrenta.
texts.en:
Teresa de Jesús R. H. is 48 years old and lives in La Libertad with her two daughters. For 14 years she has had her business selling food and tortillas, which is her only source of income for supporting her family. Teresa is requesting a loan for the purpose of buying a microwave for her business. She will also buy basic grains for making her foods. Teresa hopes to improve her sales and thereby her earnings, with which she will improve the economic situation she confronts.

Translated from Spanish by Jennifer Day, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Compra de un microondas y granos básicos

loans.name: Rosalio

texts.es: Rosalio R. D. P. D. 48 años D. edad, resiD. en nueva San Salvador junto a su compañera D. vida y sus tres hijos menores D. edad, los cuales se dedican a estudiar. El trabaja como taxista y posee su propio vehículo, es una persona muy respetuosa, el cual se preocupa por brindar un buen servicio a sus clientes, es por eso que cada año Rosalio le da un mantenimiento completo a su taxi D. manera que su servicio sea más seguro. Por lo anterior es que Rosalio solicita un préstamo, con el fin D. comprar nuevas piezas a su automóvil.
texts.en:
Rosalio R. D. P. is 48 years old, and lives in Nueva San Salvador with his wife and their three young children, who are in school. He works as a taxi driver and owns his own vehicle. Rosalio is a very respectful man who makes sure that he provides good service to his customers. Rosalio performs complete maintenance on his taxi every year so that his taxi service will be safer. It is for this reason that Rosalio is asking for a loan, which he will use to purchase new parts for his automobile.

Translated from Spanish by Christopher Knutson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchasing spare parts for his taxi

loans.name: Eva Lilian

texts.es: Eva Lilian P. de 57 años de edad reside en Antiguo Cuscatlán junto a su hijo de 28 años de edad, a su nuera y nietas. Eva posee un comedor llamado “Lilian” el cual lo posee hace 35 años, para ella este es su manera de subsistir diariamente, es por esto que solícita un préstamo a través del cual pueda obtener el dinero necesario para comprar arroz, maíz, frijoles, azúcar entre otros más para realizar los alimentos que vende para almuerzos y cenas. Ella desea seguir adelante con su negocio ya que a pesar que es su única fuente de ingresos también siente mucho aprecio por este, ya que a través de las ganancias que obtuvo de su negocio en el pasado, pudo brindarle todo lo que su hijo necesito en su niñez.
texts.en:
Eva Lilian P. is 57 years old and she lives in Antiguo Cuscatlán with her 28 year-old son, her daughter-in-law and her granddaughter. Eva owns a small restaurant called “Lilian”, which she has had for 35 years. This is her daily subsistence. She is requesting a loan with which she can obtain the money necessary to buy rice, corn, beans, and sugar, among other ingredients for making the foods she sells for lunches and dinners. She wants to continue in this work not only because it is her only source of income, but also because she much appreciation for it because with the income she obtained from this business in the past, she was able to provide everything her son needed during his childhood.

Translated from Spanish by Jennifer Day, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy ingredients for her business

loans.name: Munavara

texts.ru: Пирова Мунавара проживает в районе Явана. Возраст 22 года. Замужем, имеет 1 ребенка. Муж находится на заработках в России. Мунавара более 2 лет работала колхозницей. Вот уже более 2 лет занимается выращиванием овощей. Клиентка просит кредит, чтобы закупить удобрения и семена для посева овощей. И в дальнейшем для продажи.
texts.en:
Munavara P. lives in the Yavan district. She is 22 years old, married, and has one child. Her husband is working in Russia. Munavara has been working on a collective farm for more than two years, and for more than two years she has been growing vegetables. She is seeking a loan to buy fertilizer and vegetable seeds. And for sales in the future.

Translated from Russian by Anna Brown, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Seed and fertilizer purchase

loans.name: Reina Esmeralda

texts.es: Reina Esmeralda V. C. de 39 años de edad, reside en Atiquizaya en el departamento de Ahuachapán, vive junto a sus padres y un hijo. Ella posee una venta de carne de cerdo desde hace diez años, tiempo en el que ha recibido muy buenas ganancias gracias a sus ventas, ya que su carne es de primera calidad. Reina desea obtener un préstamo a través del cual pueda comprar más carne de cerdo. Ella desea seguir aumentando las ganancias de su negocio el cual está ubicado en el mercado municipal del lugar, y solo es a través de dicho préstamo como ella podrá surtirlo con muchas más carnes.
texts.en:
Reina Esmeralda V. C. is 39 years old and lives in Atiquizaya in the department of Ahuachapan. She lives with her parents and her son. For the past 10 years, she has run a business selling pork and has been able to earn a good income through her sales since her pork is high-quality. Reina would like a loan to be able to purchase more pork. She would like to continue increasing her revenues of her business which is located in the town's central market; it is only through a loan that she will be able to supply her store with more meat.

Translated from Spanish by Scott Crandall, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of more pork

loans.name: José Luis

texts.es: José Luis E. M. de 46 años de edad reside en San Martín junto a sus cinco hijos todos menores de edad y su esposa. El posee una tienda en la cual vende productos perecederos y también posee un comedor, este es un negocio familiar, ya que su esposa colabora junto a él para atenderlo y sus hijos ayudan cuando no están estudiando. La ubicación de su negocio es muy buena ya que está en la carretera de oro, la cual es una de las principales arterias vehiculares del país, obteniendo muy buenas ganancias. José Luis solicita un préstamo con el fin de poder mejorar las condiciones de su negocio como también mejorar sus productos con el fin de brindar un mejor servicio a sus clientes y obtener mayores ganancias, ya que toda su familia depende de las ingresos obtenidos de este negocio.
texts.en:
Jose Luis Elias Morroquin is 46 years old and lives in San Martin with his five young children and his wife. He runs a store selling perishable products and also runs a small restaurant. It is a family business as his wife helps tend to customers and his children help when they are not studying. His business is located in a very good area right on the Gold highway--one of the principal roadways of the country--which helps him generate greater revenues. Jose Luis is seeking a loan to improve his business' conditions and improve his products in order to offer better service to his customers and generate greater income, since his whole family depends on the earnings from the family business.

Translated from Spanish by Scott Crandall, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Investment in his business

loans.name: Naseem Zahoor Ahmad Group

texts.en:
Shahnaz baji, Kaniz fatima baji and Munawar sultana baji each want a loan to buy materials (colored thread, clothes and beads) for preparing embroidered dresses. Mukhtayar baji wants a loan to buy electrical supplies (wires, switch boards and switches) for her electric shop.

Naseem baji is a wife of Z. A. who has lived in a city named Multan, Pakistan for the past 10 years. Multan city is famous for its shrines. Her husband is a driver by profession. He drives a rented auto-rickshaw (a local three-wheeled motor vehicle). He is a very hardworking man. He drives the vehicle day and night but he couldn't get the reward for his struggle. Naseem baji is a very soft and caring lady. She encourages her husband to fight against the circumstances and never get demotivated. She is applying for a loan to buy an auto-rickshaw (a local three-wheeled motor vehicle) so that her husband gets the whole income of his struggle.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To buy an auto-rickshaw (a local three-wheeled motor vehicle)

loans.name: Shodigul

texts.ru: Абдукаримова Шодигуль проживает в городе Яван. Возраст 54 года, замужем и имеет шестерых детей. Муж находиться в России на заработках , поэтому весь груз по обеспечению семьи лежит на ее плечах. Работает в дехканском хозяйстве. Засеяла пшеницу. Кроме того планирует посев овощей и для этого она решила получить кредит для покупки семян , удобрений и салярки. это поможет ей своевременно произвезти посев.
texts.en:
Shodigul A. lives in the city of Yavan. She is 54 years old, married, and has six children. Her husband is working in Russia, so she must shoulder all of the responsibility for raising the family. She works on a small farm. She has planted wheat. She also plans to raise vegetables, so she decided to request a loan to buy seeds, fertilizer, and diesel fuel. This will help her to complete the sowing on time.

Translated from Russian by Anna Brown, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of seeds, fertilizer, and fuel

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Miguel Ángel

texts.es: Miguel Ángel C. R. de 47 años de edad, reside en San Pedro Masahuat en el departamento de La Paz, vive únicamente junto a su hijo de 12 años de edad, ya que la madre del joven los dejo hace mucho tiempo atrás. Miguel ha trabajado duramente para brindarle lo mejor a su hijo, ya que como padre soltero debe trabajar y encargarse de su hijo al mismo tiempo, demostrando ser una persona muy responsable. El solicita un préstamo con el fin de obtener el dinero necesario para hacer todos los arreglos necesarios a su casa, ya que empezó a hacerle algunos cambios como construirla de ladrillos, debido a que anteriormente estaba hecha de láminas, pero debido a su reducido presupuesto no pudo seguir construyéndola. El desea mucho este préstamo ya que es solo a través de este como podrá brindarle una vivienda más adecuada a su único hijo.
texts.en:
Miguel Angel C. R. is 47 years old and lives in San Pedro Masahuat in the department of La Paz. He lives with his 12 year old son since his wife left them many years ago. Miguel has worked hard to provide a better life for his son since, as a single father, he must work and take care of his child at the same time--so he has proved to be a very responsible person. He is requesting a loan in order to make necessary improvements to his home; he started to make some improvements like building it with bricks, since before it was only made of metal plates; but when his salary was decreased, he could not continue building their home. He would really like this loan since it is the only way that he will be able to provide a proper home for his only child.

Translated from Spanish by Scott Crandall, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Home improvements

loans.name: Saima Muhammad Raza Group

texts.en:
Salma baji and Waziran baji each want a loan to buy materials (colored thread, beads and clothes) for their decorative embroidery business.

Saima baji is a wife of M. R.. They have been citizens of a city named Multan, Pakistan for the past 15 years. Multan city is famous for its shrines. Saima baji is a very efficient and a hardworking lady. She manages all the household works efficiently. She takes care of the needs of her family. Her husband is a driver and drives a rented auto-rickshaw (a local three-wheeled motor vehicle), but he couldn't get the whole amount for his struggle. Saima baji is applying for a loan to buy an auto-rickshaw for her husband.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To buy an auto-rickshaw (a local three-wheeled motor vehicle)

loans.name: Lorenzo

texts.es: Lorenzo L. de 50 años de edad, reside en San Martín junto a su esposa y su única hija de 11 años de edad, la cual se dedica a estudiar. El posee un negocio en su lugar de residencia llamado “confecciones L.”, en el cual se encarga de hacer ropa para todas las edades. Lorenzo es muy reconocido en el lugar por su excelente trabajo y es preferido por la mayoría de personas en el lugar. Lorenzo solicita un préstamo con el fin de obtener el capital necesario para comprar más hilos, botones, telas, entre otros productos más, lo cual contribuya a mejorar su trabajo.
texts.en:
Lorenzo L. is 50 and lives in San Martín with his wife and their only daughter, who is 11 and goes to school. He has a business in his home which he calls "Confecciones L.," where he makes clothing for all ages. Lorenzo is very well-known in his community because of the excellent work he does, and he is preferred by the majority of the people there. Lorenzo is requesting a loan with the aim of obtaining the necessary capital to buy more thread, buttons, fabric, and other products to improve his work.

Translated from Spanish by Tanya Harper, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase supplies for his work

loans.name: Joyce Nakimbugwe ‘S Group

texts.en: Joyce is a leader of a group with 4 members.  She is 31 and is married, with two children aged between 8 and 10 years; both of her children go to school. She resides and rents a two-roomed house where she lives with her family. Joyce doesn’t take care of additional family members There is electricity but no piped water at her home.  The family gets three meals a day. She resides and works in a semi- urban area which is on the outskirts of Kampala. Joyce sells smoked fish in the Kalerwe market, one of the Kampala suburbs. She sells to an average of 25 people a day and to all categories of people. She works seven days a week. Joyce buys fish from the Gaba market and uses public transport to and from shopping. Her major monthly expenses include rent for her shop. She has been in this business for the last seven years. Her main challenge is the rainy season  which stops her customers from coming to her. Joyce has been with MCDT for over five years and is using her tenth loan, working all this time with the same group members. She wants to use this loan to buy more fish and partly to pay school fees. Joyce aspires to see her business grow and to own her shop.

loans.use: To buy more fish and partly to pay school fees for her children

loans.name: Maritza Carolina

texts.es: Maritza Carolina P. I.  de 39 años de edad reside en colonia AltaVista, junto a su esposo y una hija. Ella posee una tienda en la cual comercializa productos de primera necesidad. Ella solicita un préstamo con el fin de surtir su negocio con muchos más productos, esto con la esperanza de mejorar sus ventas, ya que para ella y su familia es  muy importante dicho negocio, ya que contribuye a la manutención de su hogar.
texts.en:
Maritza Carolina P. I. is 39 and lives in the town of Alta Vista with her husband and daughter. She has a store where she sells basic goods. She is requesting a loan with the aim of supplying her business with many more products in hopes of improving her sales. This business is important for her and her family because it helps them support their home.

Translated from Spanish by Tanya Harper, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase more products for her business

loans.name: Farzana Aftab Ahmad Group

texts.en:
Kalsoom baji and Khadija iram baji each want a loan to buy materials (beads, colored thread and clothes) to prepare embroidered dresses to sell.

Farzana baji is a wife of A. A. who has lived in a city named Multan, Pakistan for the past 10 years. Multan city is famous for its shrines. Her husband runs a cloth selling business. He buys clothes for low rates and sells to the community. Farzana baji also has a business of preparing embroidered dresses. She prepares emboridered dresses on order and earns income. She is applying for a loan to buy materials (beads, colored thread and clothes) to prepare embroidered dresses to complete the orders of her customers.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To buy material for preparing embroidered dresses

loans.name: Daysi Verónica

texts.es: Daysi Verónica R. A. de 31 años de edad, reside en La Libertad junto a su madre y un hermano. Ella posee una tienda de productos de primera necesidad, en la cual junto a su madre trabajan mucho para obtener las ganancias necesarias para solventar los gastos del hogar, esta tienda está ubicada en un lugar muy estratégico, ya que está en calle principal. Daysi solicita un préstamo para poder surtir más su tienda, debido a que ella considera necesario poder mejorar los productos que se venden para obtener mayores clientelas.
texts.en:
Daysi Verónica R. A. is 31 and lives in La Libertad with her mother and one of her brothers. She has a store where she sells basic goods. She works there with her mother to earn enough income to pay for their home's expenses. This store is in a very strategic location on the main street. Daysi is requesting a loan to be able to supply her store. She thinks it is necessary to be able to improve the products she sells to obtain a bigger clientele.

Translated from Spanish by Tanya Harper, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To supply her store

loans.name: Josue Antonio

texts.es: José Antonio C. L. de 22 años de edad Reside en Cojutepeque, junto a su padre y su esposa, la cual se dedica a la cosmetología. El tiene un negocio de venta de repuestos de celular y reparación de estos mismos. José Antonio solicita un préstamo con el fin de aumentar los productos que comercializa, debido a que desea ampliar su negocio con nuevos artículos como cuadernos y ropa. El desea poder mejorar su negocio, ya que espera brindarle un mejor estilo de vida a su esposa.
texts.en:
José Antonio C. L., 22, lives in Cojutepeque with his father and his wife who is a cosmetologist. He has a business selling parts and repair for cell phones. José Antonio is requesting a loan with the goal of adding to the products that he sells, wishing to increase his business with new items such as notebooks and clothing. He wants to be able to improve his business, in order to provide a better life style to his wife.

Translated from Spanish by Susan Sanford, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To supply his shop with new items

location.town: Cojutepeque en el departamento de Cuscatlán

loans.name: Manuel De Jesús

texts.es: Manuel de Jesús R. G., de 42 años de edad, reside en Santa Tecla junto a su esposa y dos hijos menores de edad. El posee un negocio de reparación de relojes, dicho negocio tiene muchos años de poseerlo y es a través de este como la familia a logrado  sostenerse desde ya hace mucho tiempo. Manuel solicita un préstamo con el fin de obtener el dinero para comprar más brazaletes para relojes, batería y otros repuestos especiales.
texts.en:
Manuel de Jesús R. G., 42, lives in Santa Tecla with his wife and two young children. He has a watch repair business that he has had for many years, and that has supported the family for a long time. Manuel is requesting a loan in order to get money to buy more watch bands, batteries, and other specialized supplies.

Translated from Spanish by Susan Sanford, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of watch repair supplies and tools

location.town: Santa Tecla, departamento de La Libertad

loans.name: Khalid Parveen Muhammad Afghan Group

texts.en:
Khalida parveen baji has been a citizen of Multan, Pakistan, for the past ten years. Multan is famous for its shrines. Her husband’s name is M. A. and he runs a clothes-selling business.

Khalida baji also has a clothes-sewing business. She sews clothes on orders which she collects from her neighbors. She charges $2 per dress. She saves her income in a committee and plans to renovate her house with the committee amount.

She is applying for a loan to buy an electric sewing machine so that she is able to sew the clothes on time.

The other member of the group, Aziz mai baji, wants a loan to buy groceries for her grocery shop.

loans.use: To buy an electric sewing machine for sewing clothes

loans.name: Teopista Namaganda ‘S Group

texts.en:
Teopista is the leader of a group of 4 women.  She is 47 years old, and is widowed with five children, aged between 18 and 26 years. All her children go to school. She rents a one-roomed house where she lives with seven people. Teopista takes care of additional family members. There is electricity but no piped water at her home. The family gets three meals a day. She lives and works in a semi-urban area, which is on the outskirts of Kampala. Teopista has a poultry farm of about 300 laying birds in Kisaasi, one of Kampala's suburbs She sells to an average of 10 people a day and sells to all categories of people.  She works six days a week. Teopista buys her chicks from UGACHICK Poultry Breeders in Uganda and uses public transport to and from shopping. Her major monthly expenses include medication for both her family and her birds, She has been in this business for the last fifteen years.  Before her poultry business, she sold firewood at her home. Her main challenge is the rainy season which stops her customers from coming to her. Teopista has been with MCDT for over six years and is using her twelfth loan, working all this time with the same group mates. She wants to use this loan to buy more chicks and chicken feed. Teopista aspires to see her business grow and to own about 1000 birds 
.	
	


 



.

loans.use: To buy more chickens and chicken feed

loans.name: Waziran Riaz Ahmad Group

texts.en:
Waziran mai and Saiqa baji are both citizens of Multan, Pakistan, a city famous for its shrines.

They are both involved in a decorative-embroidery business. They take orders from the clothes shops and prepare an embroidered dress in fifteen days to earn income. Their families are very happy with them. They respect each other a lot. There's just one difference between them otherwise they are equal: Waziran baji is the leader of Saiqa baji.

They both are applying for a loan to buy material (beads, colored thread and cloth) to expand their decorative-embroidery business.

loans.use: To buy material for preparing embroidered dresses

loans.name: Luy

texts.en: Luy M. is 44 and lives in a rural area of Phnom Penh City, in Cambodia. She is a good homemaker who cares for the children and cooks delicious food for her family. The entire family’s expense are covered by her husband who works selling natural medicines. He buys his medicines at the cheapest price from the people who live around the forest located far from his house. The couple has three children: two are married and one is single. Luy M. is a very responsible mother who wants her single child to attain a suitable job but she is unable to make that possible because she has no capital. Therefore, she has decided to ask for a loan for capital to purchase a motorcycle for her child to begin running a taxi service.

loans.use: To purchase a motorcycle

loans.name: Zamzam

texts.en:
Zamzam has been a clothing seller in the Mikunguni neighborhood of Zanzibar for 3 years. She belongs to the Sote Tushikamane group (Group code 2002).  She currently earns an average monthly profit of approximately $65. Every day she works at her business for 8 hours.  

She is requesting her third loan from BRAC Tanzania so that she can buy more clothes for resale. She is hoping that through this loan, her profit will increase and she will be able to grow her business and save money and get more food for her family.  


Zamzam is 50, is married, and has nine  children: the first eight children are aged 30, 28, 26, 24, 22, 18, 16, 11 (she was unable to provide the ninth child's age). She also cares for three additional dependents.

loans.use: To buy more clothes for resale.

loans.name: Mwanaisha

texts.en:
Mwanisha has been a clothing seller in the Mikunguni neighborhood of Zanzibar for 1 year. She belongs to the Subira Ina Mpaka group  (Group code 2062).  She currently earns an average monthly profit of  approximately  $40. Every day she works at her business for 3 hours.  

She is requesting her second loan from BRAC Tanzania so that she can  buy more clothes for her business. She is hoping that through this loan, her profit will increase and she will be able to grow her business and save money for future use.  

Mwanaisha is 29  and is married. She takes care of one dependent.

loans.use: To buy more clothes for resale.

loans.name: Ork's Group

texts.en:
This small loan is made up of three borrowers; all of them are people living in Phnom Penh City. Mr. Ork S., 38, has been recruited to be leader by the members. Ork S. currently works driving a trailer motor taxi (tuk tuk). Almost of his customers are local traders who work selling merchandise in the market. He starts providing his service in the early morning and finishes his work in the late evening and with much income. He is married with three children, while his wife is a homemaker. Recently, Ork S. can’t take on as many customers as before since his motor has problems frequently. Thus, he is applying for a loan on Kiva in order to repair his old motor taxi.  The other two borrowers are:
Mrs. S., who will be using the loan to purchase a motorbike for her family’s touring needs.
Mr. S., who is looking for a loan to buy a used motor in order to make his family’s transportation easier.

loans.use: To repair his old motor taxi

loans.name: Pura

texts.en:
Pura M. is from the village of Migcawanay, Tangub City. She is 49 years old. Pura is married and has six school-aged children. To make a living, Pura owns & operates a business raising livestock. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from raising pigs for sale. Pura has been engaged in her business for over three years and earns approximately 5000 PHP a month.

In 2009, Pura joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Pura is requesting a new loan of 5000 PHP which will be used to purchase food for the pigs to sell. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Pura from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business and to support the needs of her family. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase food for her pigs

loans.name: Tujikwamue Group

texts.en:
Kisira has been a clothes and other items seller in the Mikunguni neighborhood of Zanzibar for six years. She belongs to Tujikwamue group loan (Group code 2074).  Every day she works at her business for 12 hours.  


She is requesting her second loan from BRAC Tanzania so that she can buy more clothes and other items for her business. She is hoping that through this loan, her profit will increase and she will be able to grow her business and save money for future use.  


Kisira is 40 years old and married. She takes care of three dependents. She will be sharing this loan with her fellow group member, Fatma, who has her own small business selling mixed food and charcoal in Zanzibar.

loans.use: To buy more clothes for resale

loans.name: Nachia

texts.en:
Nachia has been a bites (maandazi and bread) seller in the Mikunguni neighborhood of Zanzibar for 10 years. She belongs to Uvivu si kazi group loan (Group code 2005). She currently earns an average monthly profit of approximately US$ 90. Every day she works at her business for 6 hours.

She is requesting her third loan from BRAC Tanzania so that she can buy more wheat flour, sugar and cooking oil for her business. She is hoping that through this loan, her profit will increase and she will be able to grow her business and save money for future use.

Nachia is 36 years old, married, and has seven children, aged betwee 18 and 3. She also cares for one other dependent.

loans.use: To buy more wheat flour, sugar and cooking oil for her business

loans.name: Oeun's Group

texts.en:
There are two borrowers who have joined this small loan group, and Mr. Oeun B., 34, was selected to be leader by the other member. Oeun B. is a married man and the father of four children, who are single and attend school. Presently, he is a domestic statue carver, who is earning an average of US$ 7 a day to cover his family’s daily expenses. The other income source comes from his wife who sells a few groceries from home.

Oeun B. is running his business smoothly and a lot of customers recognize the good quality and beauty of the statues he makes. In order to make the business more successful, Oeun B. requested a loan to purchase a piece of wood to make a more statues to sell. The other borrower is Mrs. Chan T., age 49, a vegetable seller, who is applying for a loan for capital to grow her business. The two borrowers (pictured) are village people living in Phnom Penh City.

loans.use: To purchase a piece of wood for carving

She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business and to support her family's basic needs.

Fatma is requesting her first loan from BRAC Tanzania so that she can buy more soap and khanga for resale. She is hoping that, through this loan, her profit will increase and she will be able to grow her business and save money for future use.

Fatma is 29 years old, married, and has three children: ages 6, 3 and 1.

Fatma will be sharing this loan with her fellow group member, Riziki, who has her own small business selling perfumes and body oil in Zanzibar.

She currently earns an average monthly profit of approximately $225. Every day she works at her business for twelve hours.

She is requesting her first loan from BRAC Tanzania so that she can buy more clothes for resale and to do some small maintenance on her car. She is hoping that, through this loan, her profit will increase and she will be able to grow her business.

Scola is 34 years old, married, and has three children: ages 10, 6 and 2.

loans.use: To buy more clothes for resale and to pay for maintenance on her car

loans.name: Benkadi Group

texts.fr:
Les quatre membres du groupe Benkadi sont des femmes mariées ayant en moyenne  29 ans et  2 enfants. Elles vivent dans des familles nucléaires avec leurs enfants et leurs époux dans le quartier  Médine au cœur de la ville de Bougouni qui relève de la troisième région administrative de la république du Mali.
Elles se sont connues par des relations de commerce et  sociale. 
En vue d’acheter des balles de friperie au comptant et de fournir leurs clients en produits de qualité, elles ont décidé d’adhérer au programme crédit de l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso. Elles sont à leur septième prêt de groupe et tous les prêts précédents ont été correctement remboursés. 
Avec ce prêt elles comptent acheter, 7 balles de friperie et 300 kg de haricot. Les friperies sont achetées auprès des grossistes de Bamako et le haricot est acheté dans les villages environnants de Bougouni auprès des producteurs. Tous ses produits sont revendus dans le marché de Bougouni en détail et au comptant à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes. 
Elles espèrent avoir chacune un bénéfice mensuel de 30 000 FCFA qui sera utilisé pour le remboursement des intérêts du prêt et subvenir aux frais de santé et d’entretien des enfants.
texts.en:
The four members of the Benkadi group are married women on average 29 years old, with an average of two children. They live in nuclear families, with their children and husbands, in the neighborhood of Médine in the heart of the town of Bougouni, which is part of the third administrative region of the Republic of Mali.

They met each other through commercial and social relationships.

They decided to participate in the loan program of the financial institution Soro Yiriwasso in order to buy bales of used clothing for cash and to provide their customers with goods of quality. This is their seventh group loan and all the previous loans have been repaid fully.

With this loan, they are planning to buy 7 bales of used clothing and 300 kg of beans. The used clothing is purchased from wholesalers in Bamako and the beans are bought from local producers in the neighboring villages of Bougouni. All these goods are then sold on the Bougouni market, retail and for cash to customers who are women and men.

They hope to each make a monthly profit of 30,000 FCFA [about USD 50], which will be used to reimburse the loan and to provide for the health care and well being of the children.


Translated from French by Véronique Fourment, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of used clothing and beans

loans.name: Nambusi Allen's Group

texts.en:
Allen is the leader of 5 members of a group. She is 27 and a single mother of four children, aged between 2 and 8 years. Three of her children go to school. She rents a one-roomed house where she is staying with five people. Allen doesn’t take care of any additional family members. There is electricity but no piped water at her home. The family gets three meals a day. She resides and works in a semi-urban area which is on the outskirts of Kampala.

Allen sells second-hand clothes in Nakulabye Market, in one of Kampala's suburbs. She sells to an average of 15 people a day and sells to all categories of people. She works seven days a week. Allen buys these clothes from Owino market, one of the busiest markets in Uganda. She uses public transport to and from shopping.

Her major monthly expenses include medication for the family, rent, school fees, and feeding the family. She has been in her business for the last ten years. Her main challenge is the rainy season which stops her customers from coming to her.

Allen has been with MCDT for over five years and is servicing her thirteenth loan, working all this time with the same group mates. She wants to use this loan to buy more clothes, aspiring of seeing her business grow bigger and owning a pemanent home which will act as business premises. .

loans.use: to buy more clothes to sell

loans.name: Keji

texts.en: Keji G. is 40 years old and married with 2 children. She sells provisions and medicines. She is requesting the loan amount of N 80,000 to purchase more medicines to sell. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchases more medicines to sell

loans.name: Nanfuka Zaituni's Group

texts.en:
Zaituni is the leader of 4 members of a group. She is a 42-year-old married woman with five children aged between 10 and 18 years. All her children go to school. She owns a four-roomed house where she is staying with seven people. Zaituni takes care of additional family members. There is electricity but no piped water at her home. The family gets three meals a day. She resides and works in a semi-urban area which is on the outskirts of Kampala.

Zaituni sells charcoal at her home in Kisaasi, one of Kampala suburbs She sells to an average of 15 people a day and sells to all categories of people. She works seven days a week. Zatuni buys from home from delivery trucks which get charcoal from villages and so she doesn’t incur any transport costs. Her major monthly expenses include medications and school fees and feeding the family.

She has been in her business for the last ten years Prior to this business, she sold only bananas at her home. Her main challenge is the rainy season which stops her customers from coming to her. Zaituni has been with MCDT for over six years and is servicing her fourteenth loan, working all this time with the same group mates. She wants to use this loan to buy more sacks of charcoal and bananas. Zaituni is aspiring of seeing her business grow bigger and staring to get charcoal directly from the producers.

loans.use: To buy more sacks of charcoal

loans.name: Benkan Group

texts.fr:
Avec une moyenne d’âge de 30 ans et de 3 enfants, le groupe Benkan est composé de cinq  femmes mariées vivant dans des familles conjugales nucléaires avec leurs enfants et époux. Ces femmes résident dans le quartier Torakabougou de la ville de Bougouni, région de Sikasso république du Mali. Les femmes du groupe Benkan se sont connues par des relations de voisinage et de commerce. 
Dans le souci d’augmenter leurs stocks et de servir plus de clients, elles ont décidé d’adhérer à  l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso  et cela pour faire le commerce des pagnes et des chaussures. Elles sont à leur cinquième prêt de groupe. Tous les précédents prêts ont été correctement remboursés. Avec ce nouveau prêt, elles comptent acheter 30 pièces de six pagnes et 50 paires de chaussures de toutes qualités. Les marchandises sont achetées à Bamako pour être ensuite revendues en détail au comptant ou à crédit dans la ville de Bougouni en ambulant ou au marché, à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes.
Avec ce prêt les femmes  envisagent obtenir chacune un bénéfice de 35 000 FCFA par mois qui sera utilisé pour augmenter leur chiffre d’affaire.
texts.en:
Averaging 30 years of age and 3 children each, the group Benkan is composed of five women living in conjugal nuclear families with their children and husbands. These women reside in the Torakabougou district of Bougouni City (Sikasso region, the Republic of Mali). They know one another by business and community ties. Concerned about increasing their inventory and serving their customers more, they decided to join the micro-finance institution Soro Yiriwaso to do commerce in pagnes (colorful West African cloth) and shoes. They are on their fifth group loan. All the preceding ones have been correctly repaid. With this new loan, they intend to buy thirty bolts of pagnes and fifty pairs of shoes of any grade. The merchandise is purchased in Bamako and then resold retail, cash or credit accepted, door-to-door in Bougouni City or at the marketplace. The customers are composed of men and women. With this loan, the women each envision obtaining a profit of 35,000 francs CFA per month that will be used to increase their turnover of goods.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy cloth and shoes

loans.name: Laydou Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe Laydou est composé de femmes mariées qui ont une moyenne d’âge de 32 ans et  4 enfants. Elles vivent dans des familles conjugales monogames avec leurs enfants et époux dans le quartier Hèrèmakono de la ville de Bougouni qui relève de la 3eme région administrative de la république du Mali. 
Ces femmes se sont connues à travers des relations  socio professionnelles et font généralement  le commerce des condiments alimentaires.
Dans l’intention d’augmenter leur ressource financière et de faire assez de stocks enfin de satisfaire le besoin de leur clientèle elles ont décidé d’adhérer à  l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso. 
Elles sont à leur  premier prêt de groupe, qu’elles comptent utiliser pour acheter, 50 boites de 2 kg de concentrée de tomate, 20 sacs de 25 kg de sel de cuisine, 30 paquets de 100 morceaux de cube maggi et divers  sortes de condiments. Les produits sont payés auprès des grossistes de Bougouni pour être ensuite revendus dans le grand marché de la même ville à une  clientèle  composée essentiellement de femmes, en détail au comptant ou à crédit. 
Avec ce prêt les femmes  espèrent réaliser chacune  un bénéfice mensuel de 20 000 FCFA  qui sera  investis  dans les activités.
texts.en:
The Laydou group is made up of married women who are on average 32 years old and have an average of four children. They are married and live in monogamous families with their children and husbands. They live in the neighborhood of Hèrèmakono in the town of Bougouni that is part of the third administrative region of the Republic of Mali.

These women met each other through socio-professional relationships and they usually sell condiments [spices, seasoning].

Their intent is to increase their financial resources and obtain enough stock to meet the needs of their customers, thus they decided to be a part of the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwasso.

This is their first group loan, and they are planning to use it to buy 50 2kg cans of tomato concentrate, 20 25kg bags of table salt, 30 boxes of 100 pieces each of Maggi cubes [all purpose seasoning condiment] and various kinds of seasonings. The goods are purchased from wholesalers from Bougouni to be sold on the grand marketplace of the same town. They sell retail to customers made up mostly of women who pay either by cash or on credit.

With this loan the women hope to each make a monthly profit of 20,000 FCFA [about USD 30], which will be invested in the business.


Translated from French by Véronique Fourment, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of various seasonings

loans.name: Abdoul Karim

texts.fr:
Monsieur Abdoul Karim D. est  âgé de 57 ans et père de 6 enfants. Il vit avec sa femme et ses enfants dans le quartier Hèrèmakono Nord de  la ville Bougouni (troisième région administrative de la république du Mali).
Après l’école coranique au village, Monsieur Abdoul Karim D. décide de s’installer dans la ville de Bougouni pour mener une activité génératrice de revenus. Il  tenta  pendant des années, différentes activités sans succès.  Finalement Abdoul optera pour la petite restauration avec la vente du café, du lipton et des fritures de viande et du foie etc à la gare routière de Bougouni. Cette activité fut apprise auprès d’un de ses amis.  Avec 3 années d’expériences, Monsieur Abdoul Karim D. maîtrise bien cette activité et il est très  apprécié et sollicité par les jeunes,  les travailleurs de la gare et les routiers (voyageurs, chauffeurs, apprentis, convoyeurs etc). 
Dans ses recherches de ressources financières complémentaires, il décide de rejoindre l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso avec qui il est à son premier prêt individuel 
Il compte acheter,  tous les jours du pain, du sucre, des boîtes de café et de lait, de la mayonnaise, du foie de la viande, du lipton etc.
Il s’approvisionne à Bougouni auprès des grossistes et effectue sa vente à la gare routière à une clientèle composée de plusieurs catégories socio professionnelles.
Avec ce prêt, Monsieur Abdoul Karim D. compte réaliser un bénéfice mensuel de 22 500FCFA qui lui permettra d’améliorer non seulement son entreprise mais et surtout de subvenir aux dépenses de la famille. 
Il ambitionne ouvrir une boutique de  commerce générale à Bougouni.
texts.en:
Mr. Abdoul Karim D. is 57 years old, and the father of six. He lives with his wife and children in the Hèrèmakono Nord district of Bougouni City (third administrative region of the Republic of Mali). After Koran school in the village, he decided to get situated in Bougouni City to earn an income. For years, he tried different kinds of work unsuccessfully. In the end, he opted for an eatery business selling coffee, Lipton, and fried meat and liver at the Bougouni bus station. He learned this business from one of his friends. After three years of experience, he has a good command of it and is highly appreciated and in demand by young people, workers at the station, and drivers (travelers, chauffeurs, apprentices, couriers, etc.) In his search for supplemental financial resources, he decided to join the micro-finance institution Soro Yiriwaso and is now on his first individual loan. Each day, he intends to buy bread, sugar, containers of coffee and milk, mayonnaise, liver, meat, Lipton, etc. Supplies are gotten in Bougouni from wholesalers, and sales are made at the bus station to customers composed of several socio-professional groups. With this loan, Mr. D. plans to realize a monthly profit of 22,500 francs CFA that will enable him to improve not only his enterprise but particularly the care and support of his family. His ambition is to open a general store in Bougouni.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy bread, milk sugar, coffe, mayonnaise, meat, etc.

loans.name: Merly

texts.en:
Merly P. is from the village of Danao. She is 39 years old. Merly is married and has 3 school-aged children. To make a living, Merly owns and operates a business venture in the food sector, operating a fishing business. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from harvesting and selling ocean-caught fish in the local community. Merly has been engaged in her business for over 13 years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2006, Merly joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Merly has successfully repaid a previous loan of 15,000 PHP from PMPC. Merly is requesting a new loan of 7000 PHP which will be used to purchase a fishing boat. This loan will be the 6th loan taken out by Merly from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase a fishing boat

loans.name: Adama

texts.fr:
Monsieur Adama Niaré un homme marié de 27 ans et père de 2 enfants qui vit dans une famille monogame avec sa femme  et ses enfants dans le quartier Dialanicoro de la ville de Bougouni (troisième région administrative de la république du Mali).
Après l’école coranique, Monsieur Adama se lance dans le commerce. Il a fait la commercialisation des céréales pendant 4 ans au grand marché de Bougouni. Cette activité ne lui a pas réussie, c’est ainsi qu’il décida de commencer la vente des condiments alimentaires au même grand marché de Bougouni.
Avec 5 années d’expérience, Monsieur Adama Niaré maîtrise bien cette activité qu’il a appris auprès d’une  de ses sœurs.
Dans le souci de satisfaire sa nombreuse clientèle, il décide de collaborer avec Soro Yiriwaso. Il est à son premier prêt individuel et compte acheter,  une importante quantité de condiments alimentaires de différentes sortes.
Il s’approvisionne à Bougouni et à Bamako (capitale de la république du Mali) auprès des grossistes et effectue sa vente au grand marché de Bougouni en détail au comptant et à crédit à une  clientèle majoritairement  constituée de femmes.
Avec ce prêt, Monsieur Adama Niaré compte réaliser un bénéfice mensuel de 26 500FCFA qui sera utilisé pour agrandir son entreprise et subvenir aux besoins de la famille.
 Il envisage dans les années à venir ouvrir une boutique.
texts.en:
Mr. Adama Niaré is a married man, 27 years old, and the father of two. He lives in a monogamous family with his wife and children in the Dialanicoro district of Bougouni City (third administrative region of the Republic of Mali). After Koran school, he got started in commerce. He has been marketing grains for four years at the grand marketplace of Bougouni. This business wasn't successful, so he decided to begin selling condiments at the same marketplace. With five years of experience, he has a good command of this business, which he learned from one of his sisters. Concerned about satisfying his numerous customers, he decided to collaborate with Soro Yiriwaso. He is on his first individual loan and intends to buy a sizable quantity of condiments of different types. Supplies are gotten in Bougouni and in Bamako (capital of Mali) from wholesalers. And sales are made retail at the same marketplace, cash or credit accepted, to mostly women customers. With this loan, Mr. Niaré intends to realize a monthly profit of 26,500 francs CFA that will be used to expand his enterprise and to meet his family's needs. He envisions opening a shop in the years to come.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy condiments

loans.name: Saima

texts.en:
Saima D. is from the village of Danao. She is 25 years old. Saima is married. To make a living, Saima owns and operates a business venture in the food sector, operating a fishing business. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from harvesting and selling ocean-caught fish in the local community. Saima is just starting this business.

In 2009, Saima joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Saima is requesting a new loan of 7000 PHP which will be used to invest in starting up the business. This loan will be the 1st loan taken out by Saima from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to make improvements to her house.

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to invest in starting up a business

loans.name: Mariam

texts.fr:
Âgée de 41 ans, Madame Mariam Sangaré vit dans une famille polygame avec ses 8 enfants, son mari, et sa coépouse dans le quartier Faraba de la ville de Bougouni (troisième région administrative de la république du Mali). 
Elle a vite abandonné l’école au profit des activités génératrices de revenus auprès de sa grande mère qui vendait des condiments. Ayant assimilé les tenants et aboutissants du commerce, Mariam  décide de s’installer de la vente de légumes. Avec ses 17 années d’expérience, elle maîtrise cette activité et y est très appréciée et sollicitée. 
C’est dans le souci de satisfaire sa clientèle qui ne cesse d’augmenter, qu’elle décide de rejoindre  Soro Yiriwaso avec qui elle est à son à son  prêt individuel.
Elle compte acheter, une grande quantité de légumes dans les villages environnants de Bougouni, à Bamako (capitale de la république du Mali) et à Sikasso. Ses ventes sont réalisées au marché de Bougouni au comptant en détail et à crédit à une clientèle essentiellement composée de femmes. 
Elle envisage réaliser  avec ce prêt un bénéfice mensuel de 25 000 FCFA. Avec ce bénéfice elle compte agrandir son entreprise afin de devenir une grossiste.
texts.en:
Ms. Mariam Sangaré, age 41, lives in a polygamous family with eight children, her husband, and her co-wife in the Faraba district of the city of Bougouni (third administrative region of the Republic of Mali). She soon dropped out of school in favor of earning an income at the side of her grandmother, who used to sell condiments. Having assimilated the ins and outs of commerce, Mariam decided to get situated with selling vegetables. With her 17 years of experience, she has a command of this business and is highly valued and in demand because of it. Concerned about satisfying her ever-growing customer base, she decided to join Soro Yiriwaso and is now on her ... individual loan. She intends to buy a large quantity of vegetable in the villages surround Bougouni, in Bamako (capital of Mali), and in Sikasso. Her sales are made, cash or credit accepted, at the Bougouni marketplace at the retail level. Her customers are composed essentially of women. With this loan, she envisions realizing a monthly proit of 25,000 francs CFA that is intended for expanding her enterprise, so that she can become a wholesaler.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy vegetables

loans.name: Evelyn

texts.en:
Evelyn is 32 years. She is married with two kids. Currently both her children are in school. She lives with her family at Kasoa in the central region of Ghana. She has been selling aluminum buckets and plastic materials like plates, buckets, bowls, etc. for the past two years. She says prices of commodities have increased and for that reason she is not able to buy more stock from the market, making it difficult to make profit to expand the business. She buys her stock of goods from the city center of Accra and retails them at the community market where she lives.

Evelyn is requesting a loan to augment her working capital to buy more stocks of aluminum buckets and plastic materials to sell. She believes the loan will enable her to raise more income to support her family. Evelyn is a member of a community group called “Ezekiel” Trust Group. Members in this group guarantee and provide assistance to one another to repay the loan.

loans.use: To buy more aluminum buckets and plastic materials to sell

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Married with four kids who are currently in school, Mary S. is 33 years old. She sells vegetables such as peppers, tomatoes, eggplants, onions, etc. and dried fish in the local market of Kasoa where she lives with her family. She has been selling for the past three years; she has gained a lot of selling experience to win customers.

Mary is an achiever and her focus is on saving enough to provide her kids with quality education for their future career. With the loan, she wants to purchase increased stocks of vegetables and dried fish, etc. to serve her customers. Her only hope to realize her dreams is your loan support. She is a member of the community group called Ezekiel Trust Group. In this group members assist one another to provide support in handling repayment.

loans.use: purchase increased stocks of vegetables and dried fish, etc.

loans.name: Benk Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe Benk est composé de dix femmes mariées qui ont une moyenne d’âge de 34 ans et  5 enfants. Elles vivent dans des familles conjugales traditionnelles élargies avec leurs frères, sœurs, époux et enfants dans le village de Djoutièbougou dans la préfecture de Bougouni, région de Sikasso  république du Mali.
Elles se sont connues par des relations professionnelle et de mariage et  font essentiellement le commerce de condiments alimentaires de toutes sortes. 
Dans l’intention d’augmenter leurs capacités  financières enfin de faire assez de stocks, elles ont décidé d’adhérer à  l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso. Elles sont à leur cinquième prêt de groupe et elles n’ont connues aucun problème de remboursement.
Avec ce prêt elles comptent acheter, 200 kg de beurre de karité, 300 kg de graines de néré. Les produits sont achetés auprès des paysans du village de Djoutièbougou et environs pour être ensuite revendus sur le marché de Bougouni en détail au comptant ou à crédit à une clientèle composée essentiellement de femmes et de revendeurs.
Avec ce prêt ces femmes  envisagent chacune obtenir un bénéfice de 20 000 FCFA par mois qui sera réinjecté  selon elles dans leur activité.
texts.en:
The group Benk is composed of ten married women who average 34 years of age and 5 children each. The women live in traditional extended conjugal families with their brothers, sisters, husbands, and children in the village of Djoutièbougou, in Bougouni prefecture, Sikasso region, the Republic of Mali. They know one another by ties of profession and marriage. And they essentially do commerce in condiments of all sorts. Intending to increase their financial capabilities in order to have enough inventory, they decided to join the micro-finance institution Soro Yiriwaso. They are on their fifth group loan and have experienced no problems at all making loan payments. With this loan, the group members intend to buy 200 kg of shea nut butter and 300 kg of néré nuts. The goods are purchased from village peasants in and around Djoutièbougou and then are sold retail at the Bougouni marketplace to customers composed essentially of women and retailers, cash or credit accepted. The group members each envision obtaining a profit of 20,000 francs CFA per month that will be re-injected into their business.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy and sell condiments

loans.name: Rico

texts.en:
Rico T. of Clarin, Misamis Occidental, is 37 years old and single.He is very talented at printing shirts, streamers and other things. He has been a member of Paglaum MPC since 2008 with a very good repayment performance. Now he is applying for a loan amounting to Php 25,000 to purchase additional equipment, tools and materials needed in the printing business.

Rico's dream is to have a family someday and a successful business.

loans.use: to additional equipment and tools for his business

loans.name: Logie

texts.en:
Logie G. is from the village of Danao. She is 33 years old. Logie is married and has 3 school-aged children. To make a living, Logie owns and operates a business venture in the food sector, operating a fishing business. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from harvesting and selling ocean-caught fish in the local community. Logie has been engaged in her business for over 4 years and earns approximately 8,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2001, Logie joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Logie has successfully repaid a previous loan of 7,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to to invest in expanding the business. Logie is requesting a new loan of 10000 PHP which will be used to purchase fishing equipment including hooks and nets. This loan will be the 2nd loan taken out by Logie from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase fishing equipment including hooks and nets

loans.name: Sela

texts.en:
Sela L. is 38 years old and a member of Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative from Tudela, Misamis Occidental. She is married with 2 children. She is very industrious and takes care of raising their hogs with the help of her husband. She personally manages their hog-raising business, which is doing well. She is a savvy business woman, and the ups and downs of the business are normal to her. Sometimes they have business losses, sometimes a good return.

Now she sees a good opportunity to expand their business. She is requesting PHP 30,000 from Paglaum MPC to buy hog feed and vitamins. She hopes deeply to own a bigger concrete piggery someday and become successful hog supplier to the market.

loans.use: to purchase feed and vitamins for the hogs

loans.name: Youssouf

texts.fr:
Marié sans enfant, Monsieur Youssouf S. a  25 ans et vit  avec sa femme dans le quartier Massablacoura de Bougouni(troisième région du Mali)
Pour des raisons sociales (la pauvreté extrême de ses parents), Monsieur Youssouf S. décida d’abandonner l’école (à l'âge de 15 ans) pour mener des activités génératrices de revenus afin  d’aider ses parents à subvenir aux dépenses de la famille.
Après plusieurs années de commerce tout azimut, il  décide finalement de s’installer dans la vente d’articles  divers de boutique dans son quartier. Avec ses 4 années d’expériences,  Youssouf S. maîtrise bien son activité.
Afin d’étoffer son fonds de commerce, il décide de collaborer avec Soro Yiriwaso avec qui il est à son premier prêt individuel.
Il compte acheter divers articles de boutique à Bamako (capitale de la république du Mali) auprès des grossistes et effectuer sa vente dans sa boutique sise à Massablacoura à une clientèle riche et variée.
Avec ce prêt, Monsieur Youssouf S. espère réaliser un bénéfice mensuel de 25 000 FCFA qui servira à  agrandir sa boutique  et subvenir aux besoins de la famille.
texts.en:
Married and having no children, Mr. Youssouf S. is 24 years old and lives with his wife in the Massablacoura district of Bougouni (third administrative region of the Republic of Mali). For societal reasons (his parents' extreme poverty), he decided to drop out of school (at age 15) to earn an income in order to help his parents provide for the family. After several years of all kinds of commerce, he decided in the end to get settled in selling various shop goods in his district. With his four years of experience, he has a good command of his business. To expand his working capital, he decided to collaborate with Soro Yiriwaso and is on his first individual loan. He intends to buy various shop goods in Bamako (capital of Mali) from wholesalers. And he'll make his sales to a rich and varied customer base out of his shop located in Massablacoura. With this loan, he hopes to realize a monthly profit of 25,000 francs CFA for expanding his shop and for meeting the needs of the family.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy various goods for his shop

loans.name: Marilou

texts.en:
Mrs. Marilou A. is a 38-year-old member from Tudela, Misamis Occidental, married with one child. Abject poverty is inevitable to them and therefore she began a sari-sari (variety) store. Neighbors, relatives and friends are her customers.

A. was hooked on the idea of putting up the sari-sari store. She thinks their daily needs can be supplied by the income from the store. Not having enough capital to start a sari-sari store she joined Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative last April 2009 to access loan credit for additional capital.

loans.use: To use as additional capital for her sari-sari store

loans.name: Tessie

texts.en:
Mrs. Tessie T. is 42 years of age, married, and a bonafide resident of Tudela, Misamis Occidental. She is blessed with four children, all of whom are still studying. She has been a member of Paglaum MPC since April 2009.

She is busy with her corn, root crops, and vegetables plantation. These crops are all in their yard, cultivated and managed both by Tessie and her husband. Now she has requested another loan from the Paglaum MPC intended for fertilizer and payment for labor.

loans.use: To purchase corn fertilizer and to pay for labor

loans.name: Ema

texts.en:
Ema L., a 43-year-old mother of eight children, is married to a craftsman. Because living on only her husband’s income has been very difficult, and given that the education of their children is a priority, Ema decided to lend a hand in their pottery business. The different designs of pottery that they produce are well known in neighboring towns because of their uniqueness and quality. 
It all comes down to a matter of "diskarte" (strategies) on how to live life, and Ema believes that one has to work hard and make sacrifices. Having become a member of Paglaum MPC in September 2008, she and her husband hope that their business will grow strongly. Today, Ema is requesting a loan of PHP 9,500 to buy materials for pottery. To put up a decent home and have their children established in their own careers is the dream of the L. family.

loans.use: additional capital for handicraft business

loans.name: Mary Dave

texts.en:
Mary Dave C. is from the village of Danao. She is 21 years old and is married. To make a living, Mary Dave owns & operates a fishing business. While not the only means for generating revenue, her main source of income comes from harvesting & selling ocean-caught fish in the local community. Mary Dave has been engaged in her business for over 3 years and earns approximately 2,500 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2008, Mary Dave joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation. Mary Dave is requesting a loan of 7000 PHP which will be used to purchase fishing equipment including hooks & nets. This will be her first loan from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase fishing equipment including hooks & nets

loans.name: Loreta

texts.en:
Mrs. Loreta L. is 47 years old and is from Dolores, Clarin, Misamis Occidental. She is married to a farmer and they have four children: 2 are married and the other 2 are still studying at the secondary level. She has been a member of Paglaum MPC since 2005  and has a very excellent repayment record.
Now she is applying for a loan of Php 55,000.00 to purchase a motorcycle to deliver their farm harvest to the market.

loans.use: to purchase motorcycle for transportation

loans.name: Diamadjigui Group

texts.fr:
Composé de cinq femmes, les membres du groupe Diamadjigui sont tous des femmes mariées  vivant en majorité  dans des familles élargies traditionnelles avec leurs maris, co-épouses, frères, sœurs et enfants. Elles ont une moyenne d’âge de 36 ans, 5 enfants et résident  toutes dans le village de Djoutièbougou qui relève de la commune rurale de Kola, préfecture de Bougouni, région de Sikasso république du Mali. 
Dans le souci d’augmenter leurs chiffres d’affaires et mieux satisfaire les clients, elles ont adhéré à l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso avec qui  elles sont à leur cinquième prêt de groupe. Les prêts  précédents n’ont  connus aucune difficulté de  remboursement. 
Elles veulent acheter avec ce prêt, 200 kg de graine de dah, 150 kg de graines de néré, 100 kg de graine d’arachide, 200 kg de maïs et une quantité importante des feuilles vertes de baobab très appréciées dans les sauces africaines. Tous les produits sont achetés auprès des paysans soit sur place, soit dans les villages environnants de Djoutièbougou pour être  revendus ensuite dans le grand marché de Bougouni en détail et au comptant à une clientèle composée essentiellement de femmes. 
Elles comptent obtenir chacune un bénéfice de 20 000 FCFA par mois qui sera réinjecté dans les activités.
texts.en:
Composed of 5 women, the members of the Diamadjigui group are all married, mostly living in extended traditional families with their husbands, co-spouses, brothers, sisters, and children. They have an average age of 36, on average 5 children, and all live in the village of Djoutièbougou which belongs to the rural community of Kola, prefecture of Bougouni, Sikasso region, Republic of Mali.

With a view to augmenting their turnover and better satisfying their customers, they joined the micro-finance institution Soro Yiriwaso, with whom they are on their 5th group loan. The preceding loans have been reimbursed without difficulty.

With this loan they want to buy 200 kg of "dah" (dried hibiscus flowers), 150 kg of "néré" (tree seeds used in making a condiment), 100 kg of peanuts, 200 kgs of maize, and a big quantity of green baobab tree leaves which are much appreciated in African sauces. All these products are bought from the rural folk where they live, or in the villages surrounding Djoutièbougou to be resold in the big open-air market of Bougouni, retail and for cash, to a clientele composed essentially of women.

They each hope to make a profit of 20,000 F CFA per month which will be reinvested in their businesses.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase of various articles for re-sale

loans.name: Falilatou

texts.fr: K. Falilatou est née vers 1954 à Adjohoun dans la vallée de l'Ouémé. Falilatou est mariée à KOUTCHIKO Bouraïma, un gardien de profession. Falilatou est mère de quatre enfants dont deux seulement sont encore à sa charge. Falilatou vend des condiments de sauce (tomates fraîches, gombo, huile de palme et huile d'arachide, les légumes, oignons, piments, épices, sel, cubes) et les produits vivriers( maïs, mil, sorgho, haricot, farines de manioc)à PK10-Vivoten à Cotonou, Capitale Économique du Bénin. Falilatou a besoin de moyens financiers pour développer son activité afin de mieux satisfaire sa clientèle. C'est la raison pour laquelle Falilatou sollicite auprès de ALIDé un prêt.
texts.en:
K. Falilatou was born around 1954 in Adjohoun, in Ouémé valley. She is married to KOUTCHIKO Bouraïma, a guard by profession. She is the mother of four children, of whom only two are still in her care. Falilatou sells sauce condiments (fresh tomatoes, okra, salt, cubes) and staple foods (corn, millet, sorghum, beans, cassava flour) at PK10-Vivoten in Cotonou, the economic capital of Benin. She has need of funds to develop her business, so as to do better in satisfying her customers. For this reason, she's requesting a loan from ALIDÉ.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy five baskets of fresh tomatoes, a 50-kg sack of onions, some spices, two 50-kg  sacks of corn, and a 50-kg sack of cassava flour

loans.name: Walim

texts.fr:
Cette femme est mariée et a 01 enfant. L’activité qu’elle exerce est le commerce de produits cosmétiques, elle a démarré ce commerce en 2006 et s’approvisionne au grand marché de lomé. Elle reçoit des commandes des coiffeuses et des esthéticiennes. Son stock actuel ne lui permet pas de satisfaire convenablement ses clients. 
Voulant se réapprovisionner, elle sollicite de WAGES son premier crédit pour acheter 7 cartons de  crème « Afro chic », 5 cartons de crèmes « noble chic », 18 parfums de différentes marques et divers produits de beauté.
texts.en:
This is a woman who is married and has a child. Her work involves commerce in cosmetics. She started this business in 2006 and stocks up at the grand marketplace of Lomé. She receives orders from hairdressers and beauticians. Her current inventory prevents her from satisfying her customers appropriately. Wanting to resupply herself, she's requesting her first loan from WAGES to buy seven boxes of "Afro Chic" cream, five boxes of "Noble Chic" cream, 18 perfumes of different brands, and various beauty products.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy creams and various beauty products

loans.name: Namayanja

texts.en: Namayanja M. is 48 years old, and is widowed with two children. She started her business in 2006. She is using the loan to purchase stock for her shop, such as different types of mattresses, suitcases, bags, men shoes, etc. She wants to expand her business and her dream is to prosper in her business.

loans.use: To purchase stock for her store, different types of mattresses, suitcases, bags, men shoes, etc

loans.name: Kodjo
