texts.fr: Ce jeune homme est un célibataire, afin de se prendre en charge il a appris la menuiserie , depuis 2006 il a fini sa formation et a commencé à exercer ce métier. Il fabrique lui-même des meubles en aluminium qu’il expose et vend à ses clients. Certains de ses matériaux de travail sont vétustes ce qui freine son activité, il souhaite les renouveler, il sollicite alors de WAGES son premier cycle de prêt pour acheter une tronçonneuse, une perceuse et 9 profilets.
texts.en:
This young man is single. In order to support himself, he learned furniture-making. In 2006 he finished his apprenticeship and began to work in his chosen trade. By himself, he makes aluminum furniture that he displays and sells to his customers. Certain of his material is worn out, which slows down his work. He would like to replace some tools, so he is asking for his first loan to buy a cross-cut saw, a drilling machine, and 9 T-sections for his metal work.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase of tools

loans.name: Magdalena

texts.en: Magdalena N. is 50 years old and is widowed with eight children. She started her business in 1999. She is using the loan to purchase jerrycans of high quality local brew to attract customers. Her dream is expansion of her business.

loans.use: To purchase 150 to 200 jerrycans of high quality local brew

loans.name: Haseeb

texts.en:
Haseeb is 48 years old and lives in Beirut, the capital of Lebanon, with his wife and their four children. Haseeb sells oil and olives to all sorts of customers and has requested a loan of $700 USD from Kiva partner, Al Majmoua, in order to purchase oil.

This is Haseeb's second loan cycle and he has always paid on time. His previous loan helped him improve his business. When Haseeb first started out, he had financial issues. In the future, he plans on improving his business.

loans.use: To purchase oil to sell

loans.name: Kara Bet

texts.en:
Kara Bet is 50 years old and lives in Beirut, the capital of Lebanon, with his wife and their three children. He has been working as a car repairer for 24 years. Kara Bet decided on this line of work because of his experience, and when he first started his business he didn’t face difficulties. His customers are friends and neighbors, and his business is successful because he does his work well.

Kara Bet has requested a loan of $1500 USD from Kiva partner, Al Majmoua, in order to purchase spare parts. This is Kara Bet's second loan cycle and he has always paid on time. His previous loan helped him to improve his garage.

loans.use: To purchase spare parts

loans.name: Oksana

texts.en:
Oksana is married with a son and lives in Zaporozhye. She sells clothing in the local market called Voznesenovskyi and a runs a small store in the main Lenin Avenue. She offers affordable merchandise at reasonable prices and invests much of her time in development of her business. She has been in business for 15 years. Oksana currently has about 10,000 Grivnyas in gross income. 

Oksana is requesting a loan of 12,000 Grivnyas to purchase additional merchandise (tunics, t-shirts and tops) to increase her sales and profits this summer. She is hoping to invest her newly-generated profits in further expansion of her venture.

We believe Oksana’s responsible approach to business and current financial assistance will be beneficial for her business by keeping it competitive and promoting growth so that it will continue to provide necessary income for her and the family.

loans.use: To increase her inventory for summer

loans.name: Elmast

texts.en:
Elmast is a 46-year-old divorcee who lives in Beirut, the capital of Lebanon, with her child. She sells accessories from her car and is successful in her work because she does it well. Her customers are friends, neighbors and shops. Elmast embarked on her business because she wanted to improve her financial situation. When she first started out, she had difficulty networking.

Elmast has requested a loan of $1200 USD from Kiva partner, Al Majmoua, in order to purchase merchandise for her business. This is her fourth loan cycle and she has always paid on time. Her previous loans helped her diversify her range of stock. In the future, Elmast plans on expanding her work.

loans.use: To purchase merchandise for her accessories business

loans.name: Galina

texts.en:
Galina is a small entrepreneur from Drogobych. She runs a retail business selling newspapers and magazines. Moreover, she owns three additional vending locations selling office supplies and toys. One of the best attractions of her business is reasonable wholesale prices that make her business competitive in the market.

Galina launched her trade about seven years ago. Back then she was one of the first vendors working with this type of merchandise. Publications sales which is her major business trend is a specific business with a non-standard work day. It requires close and accurate management of copies for sale, and up-front payment for all printed matter. Galina has to calculate everything very thoroughly to make sure printed issues are not wasted causing her unexpected losses. 

Galina is a Christian. She always adds a little word of blessing as her customers buy from her. This always helps her have personal interaction, build a relationship, and establish a bond. This time Galina is requesting a loan of 14,500 Gryvnyas to re-stock her inventory.

loans.use: To re-stock her inventory

loans.name: Angelina

texts.en:
Angelina S. is engaged in a charcoal-vending business. Aside from her charcoal selling, she also maintains a hog-raising business. Her husband manages a motorcycle transport in their village.

Angelina is requesting to borrow PHP 5,000 in order to maintain her businesses and be able to generate higher income for her children who are all studying at the moment. Her two children are Crescene Joy and Langon.

The couple works together to make their businesses successful and to increase their family’s standard of living. Currently, Agelina and her family are happily living in the mountainous village of Liwayway Diffun, Quirino Province.

loans.use: To maintain her businesses and generate higher income

loans.name: Kadiatou

texts.fr: Kadiatou, 28 ans est célibataire avec 01 enfant en charge. Son activité est l’élevage de volaille. Elle vend aussi des crèmes glacées et des glaces. Pour renforcer son activité elle veut acheter des sujets, des produits pour l’entretient du poulailler  et des provisions pour préparer les crèmes glacées
texts.en:
Kadiatou, 28, is single and raising one child. Her business is raising chickens. She also sells ice cream and ice. To bolster her businesses, she wants to buy chicks, products to maintain her henhouse, and raw materials to use to prepare ice cream.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: raising chickens and selling ice creams and ice

loans.name: John

texts.en:
M. John is 32 years of age and married with two children. He is the owner of Kalisizo Town Boutique located at Old Masaka Road, Kalisizo Town Council. It is a retail shop dealing with new clothes for both men and women. He is using the loan to purchase more clothes, shoes and women’s handbags.

His future hope is to rent a bigger shop that will deal in all types of clothes, both new and secondhand.

loans.use: To purchase more clothes, shoes and women’s handbags

loans.name: Oumar

texts.fr: oumar D. est né en 1980 à thies;il est célibataire et loge chez ses parents:il est électricien de profession et est employé dans une entreprise de batiment et travaux publics:avec le pret qu'il sollicite il veut terminer les travaux d'un batiment qu'il démarré sur fonds propres;
texts.en:
Oumar D. was born in 1980 in Thies. He is single and lives with his parents. He is a trained electrician and is employed in a company that does building and Public Works. With the loan he is requesting, he wants to finish off a building that he began with his own funds.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: finishing off a building

loans.name: Aurelio Jr.

texts.en:
Aurelio is managing a welding shop in their village of Rizal Santiago City. He has managed the business for about seven years.

Having enough financial assistance for his business will enable him to improve his business. That is why he is requesting a loan of PHP 10,000 to supply the needs of his family and to continue to support the schooling of his two children who are Marc Ceasar - 15 years old, third year high school student, and Vaneza Rose - 9 years old, grade three pupil in the elementary school.

He is hoping that he can obtain the loan he is requesting to also use in purchasing materials for his welding shop. Aurelio is 40 years old and happily married to Jolly M..

loans.use: To use in purchasing materials for his welding shop

loans.name: Angélique

texts.fr: Angélique, 51 ans est mariée avec 08 enfants en charge. Son activité est la préparation et vente de crèmes glacées et de glaces. Elle veut acheter du sucre, du bissap, du pain de singe (fruit du baobab) et entretenir son activité. Elle paie des vendeurs pour la distribution de ses produits.
texts.en:
Angélique, age 51, is married and has 8 children to support. Her business consists in making and selling ice cream, and she wants to buy sugar, hibiscus, monkey bread (fruit of the baobab tree) to strengthen it. She pays salespersons to distribute her products.

Translated from French by Patrick Stadelmann, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy sugar, hibiscus, and monkey bread (fruit of the baobab tree) to make ice cream

loans.name: Lamine

texts.fr: LAMINE S. EST NE EN 1954 à thies;il est marié et est père de trois enfants ;actuellement il est chauffeur dans une école privée et fait parallèlement du commerce;il dispose d'une quincaillerie chez et y vend des matériaux de construction:avec ce pret il veut renforcer son fonds de roulement
texts.en:
LAMINE S. was born in Thiès in 1954. He's married and the father of three children. He's currently a driver in a private school. Besides, he runs a hardware store where he sells construction materials. With this loan, he wants to bolster his working capital.

Translated from French by Patrick Stadelmann, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To bolster his working capital

loans.name: Jeanne D'arc

texts.fr: Jeanne d’Arc N., 52 ans est divorcée avec 04 enfants en charge. Elle veut acheter des oignons, du sucre et divers condiments de cuisine pour renforcer son commerce. La vente se fait sur table et  cette activité lui permet d’améliorer les conditions de vie de sa famille.
texts.en:
Jeanne d’Arc N., age 52, is divorced and has four children to support. She wants to buy onions, sugar, and various kitchen condiments to bolster her business. Sales are made from a table, and this business enables her to improve her family's living conditions.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy and resell food items

loans.name: Benilda

texts.en:
Benilda is 49 years old and is happily married to Pedro D. C. of Liwayway Diffun Quirino.

Benilda has two businesses: the first is selling snacks at the elementary school; the second is managing a sewing business where she tailors clothes such as uniforms, as well as curtains and clothing repairs, etc. Benilda is thankful for having her businesses, for it helps her family with a lot of their necessities. She hopes to improve her business, so she is requesting a loan of PHP 7,000.

Benilda wants all her children to be able to finish their tertiary level of education because she believes that providing them the best education is the only treasure they can give their six children. She is really doing her best to maintain her business and make it sustainable in the future. Especially now that the new school year is fast approaching, she really needs to prepare for her school vending business while also continuing her sewing business.

loans.use: To use as business capital to improve her businesses

loans.name: Faustina

texts.en:
Faustina A. is divorced and has two children. She has received schooling through junior high. Faustina sells soft drinks such as Fanta, Coca Cola, and assorted fruit juices in Elmina, which she has done since 2007. Faustina uses all her income for paying school fees.

Faustina will use the loan to purchase more drinks to sell. With the new profits from her expanded business, Faustina plans to save and re-invest in the business.

loans.use: To purchase more soft drinks to dell

loans.name: Aminata

texts.fr: Aminata, 30 ans est mariée avec 02 enfants en charge Son activité est la vente de tissus et de pâte d’arachide. Elle veut renforcer son commerce de thioub (tissus teintés) pour améliorer l’entretient de sa famille
texts.en:
Aminata, age 30, is married and has two children to support. Her work involves selling cloth and peanut butter. She wants to bolster her business selling thioub (dyed cloth) to care better for her family.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To sell dyed cloth and peanut butter

loans.name: Modou

texts.fr: MODOU G. EST MEMBRE DE LA MUTUELLE DEPUIS UN AN .IL EST CHAUFFEUR DE TAXI ET FAIT PARALLELEMENT DE l'aviculture ;cette activité est gérée par un de ses fils au village ;avec ce pret il veut renforcer son fonds de roulement pour satisfaire sa clientèle qui est basée à dakar;
texts.en:
Modou G. has been a member of the mutuelle for a year. He is a taxi driver, and he concurrently raises poultry, a business managed by one his sons in town. With this loan, he wants to boost his working capital to satisfy his customers, who are based in Dakar.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To sell poultry

loans.name: Angelina

texts.en: Elena Antonio’s main business is raising hogs. The business has become a big help with sending her children to school. She is 28 years old and is married to Eduardo Antonio Jr. In order to purchase more feed for her pigs, Elena is requesting a loan of PHP 5,000. She will use the extra income she earns from her larger pigs to meet the needs of her family. The couple is working very hard together to increase their income so that they can send their children to college. At the moment, Elena lives in the village of Liwayway Diffun, Quirino, with her happy family. She is hoping that her business will expand in the future and their standard of living will increase.

loans.use: To purchase more feed

loans.name: Maame

texts.en: Maame Y. is married and has one child. She did not receive a formal education. Maame sells soft drinks such as Fanta, Coca-Cola and assorted fruit juices in Elmina, which she has done since 2004. Maame uses all her income for paying utility bills. Maame will use the loan to buy more soft drinks to resell. With the new profits from her expanded business, Maame plans to save and reinvest.

loans.use: Maame will use the loan to purchase more soft drinks to resell

loans.name: Binta

texts.fr: Binta D., 29 ans est célibataire avec 01 enfant en charge   Son activité est la vente d’effets vestimentaires. Elle veut renforcer son commerce de thioub (tissus teintés) pour améliorer ces conditions de vie.
texts.en:
Binta D., age 29, is unmarried and has one child to support. Her work involves selling clothing and accessories. She wants to bolster her business selling thioub (dyed cloth) to improve living conditions.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To sell clothing and accessories

loans.name: Imelda

texts.en: Imelda is a 59-year-old vendor of vegetables in the village of Barangay Liwayway Diffun Quirino. She acts as both a mother and a father to her seven children. Out of her seven children, five of them are now married. Two aren’t married and work to help her pay for daily necessities. Her children never entered high school because of financial difficulties. Imelda would like to have additional capital to buy more vegetables to sell in her village and earn a bigger income to sustain her daily needs and to have some savings for future medical expenses. Imelda is requesting a loan from ASKI and Kiva amounting to PHP 9,000. She believes that her business will become a successful one by simply being humble and patient in conducting her work.

loans.use: Business capital

loans.name: Nafi

texts.fr: madame nafi D. est une femme divorcée qui a cinq enfants à charge;elle fait du commerce depuis 1985.elle est membre de la mutuelle depuis deux ans et a déja bénéficié de crédit;avec ce pret elle veut renforcer son stock de marchandises composé d'huile de palme;de miel ;de tissus et de chaussures!
texts.en:
Ms. Nafi D. is a divorced woman who has five children to support. She has been working in commerce since 1985. She has been a member of the mutuelle for two years and has already benefited from a loan. With this loan, she wants to bolster her stock of merchandise composed of palm oil, honey, cloth, and shoes!

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To bolster working capital

loans.name: Ama

texts.en:
Ama A. is married and has seven dependents. She did not receive any formal education. Her husband is a Fisherman whose income is too small to support the family.

Ama smokes fish in Terterim, which she has done for the last 15 years. she will use the loan to buy more fish to smoke and sell. With the new profits from her expanded business, she plans to save and buy a fishing boat.

loans.use: To buy more fish to smoke and sell

loans.name: Esmeralda

texts.en:
Esmeralda said that managing a business is an easy task if it is managed patiently and strategically. Esmeralda is 49 years old and happily married to Dionisio B. of Barangay Liwayway Diffun Quirino.

Esmeralda is engaged in a general store business and hog raising at the same time. According to Esmeralda, her businesses at the moment are doing great. However, she still wants to expand them further and increase her daily income. She is asking for a loan of PHP 12,000 as additional working capital. 

Her husband is working as a forest ranger in their mountainous village. They help each other to provide for the education of their youngest child, Jonelyn who is 18 years old and in second-year college. They want her to graduate like her three older siblings so that she can have a good and successful life.

loans.use: To use as additional working capital

loans.name: Ekua

texts.en: Ekua Y. is divorced and has 5 dependents. Ekua received no formal education. Since 1995 Ekua has smoked and sold fish in small quantities in Terterim. Ekua uses her small income to support the children in paying their school fees. To buy more fish in larger quantities for processing and sale. With the new profits from her expanded business, Ekua plans to save and build a house.

loans.use: To buy more fish in larger quantities for processing and sale.

loans.name: Mamour

texts.fr: mamour H. est né le 23 février 1976 à hanéne;il est marié et est père d'un enfant ;il travaille comme chauffeur livreur dans une boulangerie depuis 11 ans et vend aussi du pain au lait;avec ce pret il veut renforcer son activité et améliorer ses revenus;
texts.en:
Mamour H. was born on February 23, 1976 in Hanéne. He is married and the father of a child. He has been working as a delivery driver with a bakery for eleven years, and he also sells bread with milk. With this loan, he wants to bolster his business and to improve his revenues.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To sell bread

loans.name: Cosmos

texts.en:
Cosmos A. is 29 years old. He is married and the father of two kids age four and one. He lives with his family in their own house at Goaso, a farming community in the Brong Ahafo region of Ghana, where most of the inhabitants are farmers.

Cosmos operates a pharmaceutical shop in his neighborhood and sells various kinds of medicine like blood tonic, pain killers, malaria drugs etc. Many local people patronize his shop for first aid and cures when they are sick. Cosmos has time for every customer that visits his shop. He usually inquires about the symptoms of sickness to offer the right medicine and advise on its usage. He has been in operation for the past six years and has assisted in the cure of a number of common diseases such as malaria, cholera, typhoid, etc.

He requests a loan to top up his working capital so he can purchase more medicine to serve his community and, in the process, raise more income to support his family. He would be grateful for your assistance.

loans.use: To procure assorted pharmaceutical drugs.

loans.name: Emerthe

texts.en:
Greetings from Emerthe M., a 47 year-old married woman. She and her husband have 7 children aged 24, 18, 15, 14, 12, 8, and 5 years old. They live in the Nyarugenge district of Kigali, the capital of Rwanda.

Mrs. M. has owned a restaurant in Nyarugenge district since 2000. Mrs. M. starts her business at 7:00 AM and finishes at 8:00 PM daily; she has 4 full-time employees to help her run her business smoothly. She is seeking her first loan worth 300000 Rwf from Vision Finance Company and she has no other source of income.

Before this loan Mrs. M. had a monthly profit of approximately $185. With this loan she will purchase other many products for her restaurant and she will reinvest the increased profit in her business.

loans.use: To expand her restaurant business.

loans.name: Sarkis

texts.en:
Sarkis is a 41 year old man who lives in Beirut, capital of Lebanon with his wife and their three children. Sarkis is a car painter and repairer. He has requested a loan of 2000 US dollars from Al Majmoua in order to purchase tools for his work. This is his fourth cycle and he has always paid on time. 
His previous loans helped him improve. His clients are his friends and neighbors. He decided on doing his business because he learned it when he was young. In the future, he plans on improving his shop.

loans.use: Sarkis will use the loan to purchase tools for his work.

loans.name: Maxey

texts.en:
Maxey K. is 42-years old and widowed with four children all in school. She is the owner of Kijjana Pearl Gardens located on old Masaka Road, Kalisizo Town Council. She has a bar and restaurant business selling all kinds of beers and different foods.

She will use her loan to repair her fridge, to purchase a machine for preparing chips, to acquire DSTV, and then she will use the balance to purchase more beers and spirits. Her future dream is to obtain a bigger bar selling beers, wines, spirits and a variety of food types.

loans.use: To repair her fridge, purchase a machine for preparing chips, acquire DSTV,  and use the balance to purchase more beer and spirits.

loans.name: Bilal

texts.en:
Bilal is a 46 year old man who lives in Beirut, the capital of Lebanon, with his wife and their three children. Bilal has been selling chocolate and he also does chocolate design. He has requested a loan of 1000 US dollars from Al Majmoua in order to start a new business selling ice cream. This is the first time that Bilal has requested a loan.
Bilal is special in his work because he does nice designs. His clients are his friends, neighbors and tourists. He decided on doing his business because of his experience. In the future, he plans on expanding his work by selling ice cream.

loans.use: Bilal will use the loan to start a new business selling ice cream.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy goods

loans.name: Teddy

texts.en:
Teddy N. is 50 years old, married with four children in school. She is the owner of London shoes retail shop dealing with second hand shoes and clothes. This shop is located on Kiddukanya Road in Kalisizo Town Council and has been running for 14 years so far.

She will use her loan to purchase more stock -- to buy different types of shoes and bring in more blouses and womens trousers. Hopefully, in the future, she wants to have a very big business dealing on both a retail and wholesale basis.

loans.use: To purchase more stock -- different types of shoes and more blouses and womens trousers.

loans.name: Iman

texts.en:
Iman is a 34 year old woman who lives in Beirut, capital of Lebanon. Iman has owned a sportswear clothing shop. She hasrequested a loan of 1000 US dollars from Al Majmoua in order to purchase merchandise for the summer season. This is the first time that Iman has requested a loan. 
Iman is special in her work because she knows how to treat her clients and her shop is well positioned. Her clients are people from her region. Iman decided on doing her business because of her experience in sales. In the future, she plans on expanding her shop by selling sports accessories.

loans.use: Iman will use the loan to purchase merchandise for the summer season.

loans.name: Seynabou

texts.fr: seynabou F. est une femme mariée née en 1980 à thies ;elle fait de l'élevage de poulets depuis des années et les vend à ses voisins;avec ce pret elle veut renforcer son stock de poulets pour satisfaire sa clientèle;
texts.en:
Seynabou F. is a married woman who was born in 1980 in Thies. She has been raising poultry for years and sells them to her neighbors. With this loan, she wants to bolster her stock of hens to satisfy her customers.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To sell hens

loans.name: Widad

texts.en:
Widad is a 51 year old woman who lives in Beirut, capital of Lebanon, with her husband and their child. Widad owns a hairdressing salon. She has requested a loan of 2000 US dollars from Al Majmoua in order to purchase merchandise for her salon. Widad has been a microcredit client for ten years now and has always paid on time.  
Her previous loans helped her improve her work, as well as her financial situation. Widad is special in her work because she knows how to treat her clients well. Her clients are her friends and neighbors. Widad decided on doing her business because of her experience in sales. In the future, she plans on improving her salon.

loans.use: Widad will use the loan to purchase merchandise for her hairdressing salon.

loans.name: Abbas

texts.en:
Abbas is a 38 year old man who lives in Bint Jbeil, southern Lebanon with his wife and their two children. Abbas has been working as a mason since 1985. He is requesting a loan from Al Majmoua in order to purchase tools for his work. This is his third cycle and he has always paid on time. 
His previous loans helped him improve his work as well as his financial situation. Abbas is special in his work because he does it well. His clients are people from his region. When he first started his business, he didn’t have experience and it wasn’t easy for him to build a network of clients, but he has worked hard to learn new techniques in order to face his competition. Abbas decided on this business because he wanted to work independently. In the future, he plans on improving his business.

loans.use: Abbas will use the loan to purchase tools for his work.

loans.name: Ali

texts.en:
Ali is a 32-year-old man who lives in Bint Jbeil, southern Lebanon. Ali has been working as a mason for 10 years. Ali is requesting a loan from Kiva's partner Al Majmoua in order to purchase tools and electrical wire for his work. This is his third loan cycle and he has always paid on time.

His previous loans helped him improve his work as well as his financial situation. Ali is special in his work because he does it well. His clients are people from his region. When he first started his business, he had financial issues. Ali decided on doing his business because he wanted to have independent work. In the future, he plans on expanding his business.

loans.use: Ali will use the loan to purchase tools and electrical wire for his work

loans.name: Ramona

texts.es: Ramona tiene 58 años, es viuda y tiene 5 hijos, 3 de ellos mayores de edad y dos que aún están a su cargo y que a la vez le ayudan en la despensa con mucha responsabilidad. Se dedica al comercio (despensa) hace más de 15 años y posee una clientela formada que está conformado de personas muy humildes, trabajadores y responsables de la zona.  Con el crédito de la Fundación Paraguaya Ramona compra mercaderías de consumo como azúcar, aceite, y bebidas como; gaseosas, jugos y cerveza. Con esto mejorarían sus ingresos y por ende elevaría la calidad de vida de su familia y la suya.
texts.en:
Ramona is a 58-year-old widow who has 5 children, 3 of them adults and 2 of them still under her care. The 2 younger children are very responsible in helping her at her grocery store. Ramona has run a grocery store for more than 15 years and has an established clientele that includes very modest, hard-working, and responsible people from her neighborhood. Ramona will use the loan from Kiva partner Fundación Paraguaya to purchase consumer merchandise, including sugar, oil, and beverages such as soft drinks, juices, and beer. These products will help Ramona to increase her income and thus improve her family’s quality of life as well as her own.

Translated from Spanish by Christopher Knutson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchasing sugar, oil, and beverages to sell

loans.name: Ali

texts.en:
Ali is a 22 year old man who lives in Bint Jbeil, southern Lebanon. He has owned a bakery for two years where he makes saj and mankoucheh. The saj is the metal oven where you make the saj bread and the saj bread is a traditional Lebanese bread used to make markouk (a thin bread) and doughy confections or mankoucheh. A mankoucheh looks like a folded pizza. Its most common toppings are zaatar (thyme), jebneh (cheese) and lahm bi ajin (minced meat). You can eat it any time of the day, but somehow it tastes better in the morning.

Ali is requesting a loan from Al Majmoua in order to purchase merchandise and raw material for his bakery, as well as to purchase a car. This is the first time that Ali has requested a loan.

Ali is special in his work because he knows how to treat his clients and he is known for the good taste of his mankoucheh. His clients are his friends, neighbors, and tourists. Ali decided on opening a bakery because he wanted to have an independent job and he always wanted to have a bakery. When he first started, he didn't have the startup capital. In the future, he plans on expanding his business by opening a snack bar and selling sandwiches.

loans.use: To purchase merchandise and raw material for his bakery and to purchase a car.

loans.name: Jean Claude

texts.en:
Greetings from B. Jean Claude. This entrepreneur does his business in Gasabo district where he sells shoes. He has 6 years of experience in this business and has hired two employees to help him. Mr.B. earns $230 as monthly profit in his business and his wife produces a monthly income of $230. He starts his daily business at 6:00 am and finishes at 6:00 pm.

Mr. B. is a 27-year-old married man and he and his wife have four children, age 12, 10, 8 and 6 years old. He lives in Jali sector, Gasabo district, in Kigali, the capital city of Rwanda. He is seeking his first loan of 500,000 RWF from Vision Finance Company. With this loan he will buy two containers of shoes and he will reinvest his profit in the business.

loans.use: To buy two containers of shoes

loans.name: Ali

texts.en:
Ali is a 36 year old man who lives in Bint Jbeil, southern Lebanon with his wife and their three children. Ali has owned a pick up for 18 years. He is requesting a loan from Al Majmoua so he can do some maintenance work on his pick up. This is the first time that Ali has requested a loan.

Ali decided on his business because he wanted to work independently. When he first started his business, he had financial issues. Ali is special in his work because he does it well and has competitive prices. His clients are his friends and neighbors. In the future, he plans on expanding his business.

loans.use: To do some maintenance work on his pick up.

loans.name: El Hadj Mamadou Cisse

texts.fr: MR G. est né le 26 janvier 1950 à foundiougne;il est enseignant et est actuellement le chef de la scolarité de l'école nationale d'agriculture ;avec ce pret  il veut acheter des meubles pour sa maison.
texts.en:
Mr. G. was born on January 26, 1950 in Foundiougne. He is a teacher and is currently the head of education of the national school of agriculture. With this loan, he wants to buy furniture for his house.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Furniture

loans.name: Ali

texts.en:
Ali is a 24 year old man who lives in Bint Jbeil, southern Lebanon. He has been working as a furniture painter for five years. Ali is requesting a loan from Al Majmoua so he can purchase tools and paint, and electrical wire for his work. This is the first time that Ali has requested a loan.

Ali is special in his work because he does it well and he is punctual with his work. His clients can be anybody from his region. Ali decided on his business because of his experience in his work. When he first started his business, he didn't have the startup capital. In the future, he plans on expanding his business.

loans.use: To purchase tools, paint, and electrical wire for his work.

loans.name: Abbass

texts.en:
Abbass is a 24 year old man who lives in Bint Jbeil, southern Lebanon. He has owned a barber shop for six years. Abbass is requesting a loan from Al Majmoua in order to purchase a seat and beauty products for his salon. This is the first time that Abbass has requested a loan.

Abbass decided on doing his business because of his experience. When he first started his business, he had difficulty finding the proper place to open his salon. Now Abbass is special in his work because he is well located (in the middle of town). His clients are his friends and neighbors. In the future, he plans on increasing the number of his clients.

loans.use: To purchase a seat and beauty products for his salon.

loans.name: Hugo

texts.es: Hugo tiene 55 años, está casado y tiene 4 hijos, de los cuales 2 ya están casados y dos aún dependen él. Es vendedor ambulante y posee un vehiculo con el cual sale a hacer sus ventas por las zonas de Caacupé y una vez por semana hacia la zona de San Pedro.  Cuenta con clientela formada ya que hace casi 2 años que se dedica a esta actividad.  El crédito lo utiliza para compra de embutidos, golosinas y fideos, y con esto aumentara su stock y posibilitara que satisfaga gran parte de su demanda, y mejorar sus ingresos que con el cual cubre las necesidades básicas de su familia y los gastos de la universidad de sus hijos.
texts.en:
Hugo is 55 years old, married, and the father of 4 children -- 2 of whom are married, and two of whom are still dependent on him. He is a traveling salesman, and has a car he goes out with to make his sales in the Caacupé area, and, once a week, the San Pedro area. He has a developed clientele, since it has been almost 2 years since he started this business. The loan will be used to buy sausage, candy, and pasta, which will increase his stock and make it possible for him to meet much of his demand and improve his income so he can cover basic family needs, and college fees for his children.

Translated from Spanish by Hannah Lily, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase sausage, candy, and pasta.

loans.name: Naief

texts.en:
Naief is a 54 year old man who lives in Bint Jbeil, southern Lebanon with his wife and their two children. Naief has been working as a taxi driver for 20 years. He is requesting a loan from Al Majmoua in order to change his car tires and oil and do some maintenance work on his car. This is Naief's second cycle and he has always paid on time. His previous loan helped him improve his work.

Naief decided on doing his business because he wanted to have an independent job. He is special in his work because of his punctuality and he knows how to treat his clients. His clients are his friends and neighbors. When he first started his business, he had financial issues. In the future, he plans on expanding his business.

loans.use: To change his car tires and oil and do some maintenance work on his car.

loans.name: Youssef

texts.en:
Youssef is a 47 year old man who lives in Bint Jbeil, southern Lebanon with his wife and their two children. Youssef has owned a grocery store for 10 years. Youssef is requesting a loan from Al Majmoua in order to purchase merchandise for his store.

This is Youssef's third loan cycle and he has always paid on time. His previous loans helped him improve his store by diversifying his merchandise.

Youssef is special in his work because of his store location. His clients are his friends and neighbors. Youssef chose his business because of his experience in trading. When he first started, he didn't have a lot of capital. In the future, he plans on expanding his business and opening a restaurant.

loans.use: To purchase merchandise for his store.

loans.name: Ziad

texts.en:
Ziad is a 27 year old man who lives in Bint Jbeil, southern Lebanon with his wife and their child. Ziad owns livestock and sells milk. He is requesting a loan from A. Majmoua in order to increase his livestock. This is the first time that Ziad has requested a loan.

Ziad decided on his business because it is a demanding work in his region. When he first started, he faced the competition. He is speciA. in his work because of his experience with livestock. His clients are people from his region. In the future, he plans on increasing his livestock.

loans.use: To increase his livestock.

loans.name: Zouhair

texts.en:
Zouhair is a 24 year old man who lives in Bint Jbeil, southern Lebanon. Zouhair has been working as a motorcycle repairer for seven years. He also sells motorcycle spare parts. Zouhair is requesting a loan from Al Majmoua in order to purchase stands for his work because he doesn't have enough space in his garage. This is the first time that Zouhair has requested a loan.

Zouhair chose his business because of his experience in his work and he is special in his work because he does it well. His clients can be anybody from his region. When he first started his business, he didn't have the startup capital. In the future, he plans on expanding his business.

loans.use: To purchase motorcycle stands to repair motorcycles.

loans.name: Elie

texts.en:
Greetings from M. Elie, a 45 year-old married man. He and his wife have 3 children of the following ages: 9, 7 and 1, and 4 orphans. This entrepreneur lives in Jabana sector, Gasabo district of Kigali city, the capital of Rwanda.

Mr. M. owns a barbershop in his neighborhood called Jabana in Kigali city. He started this business in the year of 2006 and he has 4 workers who run this business. This entrepreneur has a monthly profit of approximately $120 and his wife produces an income of $165 per month.

Mr. M. is requesting his first loan worth 500,000 Rwf from Vision Finance Company. With this loan M. will expand his barbershop by buying other required equipment in order to be able to provide services to women. He intends to reinvest the increased profit in the same business.

This entrepreneur’s daily business starts at 7:00 A.M and finishes at 9:00 P.M.

loans.use: Expand the business.

loans.name: Evarito

texts.es:
Evarito tiene 35 años, está casado y tiene 2 hijos. Se dedica a la fabricación y venta de artículos en cuero (fundas para armas de todos los calibres, cintos de cuero, y porta celulares de cuero). El cuenta con clientela fija y posee un taller en su domicilio en donde fabrica estos artículos y las entrega por pedido y a la vez realiza ventas a personas particulares o negocios que los vuelve a vender.

El crédito lo destinara a la compra de materia prima (cuero vacuno). Con esta actividad mantiene a su familia con los gastos básicos y también cubre los gastos del colegio de sus hijos.
texts.en:
Evarito is 35, is married, and has 2 children. He makes and sells items out of leather (gun cases, belts, and cell phone cases). He has a fixed clientele and has a shop in his home where he makes these items. He takes orders for them and sells them to individuals or to business that resell them. This credit will go towards purchasing raw materials (leather from cattle). With this work, he supports his family and also pays for his children's educational expeneses.

Translated from Spanish by Tanya Harper, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase leather

loans.name: Adnan

texts.en:
Adnan is a 54 year old man who lives in Tyre, southern Lebanon with his wife and their six children. Adnan has been selling electrical items since 1988. He requests this loan from Al Majmoua in order to purchase merchandise for his work.

This is Adnan's third loan cycle and he has always paid on time. His previous loans helped him improve his business.

His clients are his friends and neighbors. When Adnan first started his business, he didn't have a lot of cash. He chose his business because he wanted to have an independent job. In the future, he plans on improving his work.

loans.use: To purchase merchandise for his electrical goods store.

loans.name: Nelly

texts.es:
Nelly es socia del Banco Comunal Rosas.
Nelly es casada, tiene 36 años y 3 hijos, Nelly tiene un cafetín ubicado en la escuela de Santa Ana, en donde vende golosinas, bebidas y también prepara comida, actividad que realiza de lunes a viernes con la ayuda de su esposo.
Nelly necesita un préstamo de 1000 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de golosinas.
Nelly sueña con ampliar su negocio, comprar un terreno para la construcción de su casa.
texts.en:
Nelly is a member of Banco Comunal Rosas. She is married, 36, with 3 children. She has a cafe located in the Santa Ana School, where she sells candies, drinks and also prepares meals. She does this from Monday to Friday with the help of her husband. Nelly needs a loan of $350 to invest in more candy. Nelly dreams of enlarging her business and of buying land to build her house.

Translated from Spanish by Susan Sanford, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of candy

loans.name: Emilia

texts.en:
G. Emilia knows agriculture. For most of her 48 years, this mother of four children from the Cimislia town has walked barefoot to her agricultural land, pausing only to hike up her skirt and wade through the brackish streams that criss-cross her path. When the spring rains come the streams swell, often washing out the bridge. Emilia will balance her lunch on her head, sing a soft song, and, with water up to her necklace, walk straight through it. She's grown up with the soft mud of the paddy between her toes. Growing vegetables, it's safe to say, is in her blood. She remembers sitting in the fields as her grandmother worked, banging pots and shouting away the birds that treated the fields as a buffet table.

Emilia knew if she didn't get help she wouldn't have enough tomatoes to feed the eight people who live in her compound or enough to sell for extra money. But that wouldn't be enough to cover the cost of water and heating she spends for greenhouses.

But Microinvest gave Emilia a loan to buy fertilizer, something she had never used on her harvest. She said she thought that wood and film was enough, but with a field full of gnawed tomatoes stalks, Emilia was desperate; the fertilizer couldn't have come at a better time. Emilia should grow more than 22 tons of tomatoes to ensure enough harvest will be on the market for next year. In this way she will be able to return money back to Microinvest.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and develop her business

loans.name: Manal

texts.en:
Manal is a 34 year old woman who lives in Tyre, southern Lebanon with her husband and their two children. Manal has had a mobile shop for a year. She requests this loan from Al Majmoua in order to purchase merchandise and phone accessories.

This is Manal's second loan cycle and she has always paid on time. Her previous loan helped her improve her business.

Manal chose her business because she wanted to have an independent job. Her clients are people from her region. When she first started her business, she had family problems. In the future, she plans on improving her business.

loans.use: To purchase merchandise and phone accessories.

loans.name: Abdou Khadre

texts.fr: mr D. est instituteur depuis 7 ans ;parallèlement à ses fonctions il fait de l'aviculture chez lui pour renforcer ses revenus mensuels; avec ce pret il veut renforcer ses stocks de poulets de chair pour satisfaire sa clientèle;
texts.en:
Mr. D. has been a teacher for seven years. Along with that role, he raises poultry at home in order to bolster his monthly income. With this loan, he wants to bolster his stock of fryer hens to satisfy his customers.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To sell poutry

loans.name: Namagembe

texts.en:
Namagembe C. is a 40 year old single mother of two children who are going to school. She operates a wholesale business of a grocery shop which she started in 1995. She is using the loan to purchase grocery commodities such as biscuits, cooking oil, soap, dry cells, smearing jelly, books, etc. thereby increasing the stock of her business.

Her future hopes are to build a big wholesale grocery store and create more chains of wholesale grocery stores in the neighboring local villages of Kyotera.

loans.use: To purchase grocery commodities such as biscuits, cooking oil, soap, dry cells, smearing jelly, books, etc.

loans.name: Fouad

texts.en:
Fouad is a 41-year-old man who lives in Tyre, southern Lebanon with his wife and their three children.

Fouad has been selling and repairing exhaust systems since 1992. He requested a loan of $1,500 from Al Majmoua in order to purchase exhaust inventory and tools for his work.

Fouad has been a microcredit client for nine years now and has always paid on time. His previous loans helped him improve his business, as well as his financial situation. His clients can be anybody. When he first started his work, he didn’t face difficulties. He decided on his business because of his experience. In the future, he plans on expanding his work.

loans.use: To purchase exhaust parts and tools for his work

loans.name: Fouad

texts.en:
Fouad is a 41 year old man who lives in Tyre, southern Lebanon with his wife and their four children. Fouad has been working as a mason for three years. He requested a loan of 1000 US dollars from Al Majmoua in order to purchase electrical wires and pay for his children school tuition. This is his second cycle and he has always paid on time. 
His previous loan helped him improve his business. His clients are his friends and neighbors. When Fouad first started his work, he had difficulty building networking and pay for his work equipment. In the future, he plans on improving his work by purchasing more sophisticated tools.

loans.use: Fouad will use the loan to purchase electrical wires and pay for his children school tuition.

loans.name: Teresa

texts.es:
Teresa es socia del Banco Comunal Rosas.
Teresa es soltera, tiene 38 años y 1 hija, Teresa tiene un puesto en el mercado F. Vivanco en donde vende jugos de frutas, que ella misma prepara, actividad que realiza todos los días. Teresa tiene proyectado ampliar su negocio.
Teresa necesita un préstamo de 1000 soles dinero que será invertido para la refacción de otro puesto.
Los sueños de Teresa son tener una tienda en su casa y brindar una buena educación a su hija.
texts.en:
Teresa is a member of Banco Comunal Rosas. Teresa is 30, single, with 1 daughter. She has a stand in the F. Vivanco Market where she sells fruit juices that she prepares herself, working every day. Teresa plans to enlarge her business and needs a loan of $350 to invest in the refurbishment of another stand. Teresa's dreams are to have a shop in her home and to provide a good education to her daughter.

Translated from Spanish by Susan Sanford, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Refurbishment of a second stand

loans.name: Khaled

texts.en:
Khaled is a 48 year old man who lives in Tyre, southern Lebanon with his wife and their five children. Khaled has owned a coffee shop. He requested a loan of 1000 US dollars from Al Majmoua in order to purchase a new coffee machine and some merchandise for his shop. This is the first time that Khaled has requested a loan. 
Khaled is special in his work because he knows how to treat his clients and clients feel comfortable going to his coffee shop. His clients are his friend, neighbors and others. When he first started his business, he didn’t face difficulties. Khaled decided on doing his business because he wanted to have an independent work and he always wanted to have a coffee shop. In the future, he plans on expanding his work.

loans.use: Khaled will use the loan to purchase a new coffee machine and some merchandise for his shop.

loans.name: Damian

texts.es:
El señor Damián tiene 40 años, esta casado con la Sra. Nancy Bogarin.  Ellos tienen 3 hijos y viven en la Compañía Cabañas, cual es situada a 5 kilómetros de la ciudad de Caacupé en casa propia. Damián se dedica a la actividad de vender flores hace más de 20 años. 

El negocio esta ubicado en su domicilio y realiza la producción de plantas, o las compra para su posterior venta. Lo cual la realiza en su propio vehiculo, en zonas del interior. El cliente cuenta con una buna clientela ya formada.

El préstamo lo invirtió en la compra de plantas variadas tales como, mango, naranjas, pomelo, orquídeas. Con los ingresos que le genera este negocio, le permite cubrir los gastos propios de su familia además de los gastos de los estudios de sus Hijos. 
 
El  comenta que esta muy conforme con la ayuda que le brinda la Fundación Paraguaya y por la confianza que depositan en el al concederle los créditos
texts.en:
Señor Damián, 40, is married to Señora Nancy Bogarin. They have 3 children and live in their own home in Compañía Cabañas, located 5 km. from the city of Caacupé. Damián has sold flowers for more than 20 years. The business is located in their home, and he either grows the plants or buys them for sale. He uses his own vehicle to deliver to areas of the interior. He already has a good, well-formed clientele. He will invest the loan in purchasing various plants such as mango, oranges, grapefruit, and orchids. The income generated from this business allows him to cover the family expenses as well as the education expenses of his children. He says that he is very satisfied with the help given to him by Fundación Paraguaya and for the confidence they have in him in giving him credit.

Translated from Spanish by Susan Sanford, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of orchids, roses, and fruit plants

loans.name: Dominga Fortunata

texts.es:
Fortunata es socia del Banco Comunal Rosas.
Fortunata es conviviente, tiene 44 años y 2 hijos, Fortunata tiene una tienda en su casa en donde vende abarrotes en general, verduras, frutas, actividad que realiza hace 6 meses, sus ventas están mejorando.
Fortunata necesita un préstamo de 2500 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de arroz, azúcar y bebidas.
Los sueños de Fortunata son comprar un carro para que trabaje su esposo y educar a su ultimo hijo.
texts.en:
Fortunata is a member of the communal bank "Rosas" (Roses). She lives with her husband, is 44, and has 2 children. Fortunata has a store in her home where she sells general groceries, vegetables, and fruits. She has done this for 6 months, ane her sales are improving. Fortunata needs a loan of 2,500 PEN, which will be invested in the purchase of rice, sugar, and beverages. Fortunata's dreams are to buy a car so her husband can work and to educate her youngest son.

Translated from Spanish by Tanya Harper, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase rice, sugar, and beverages

loans.name: Virginia

texts.en:
Greetings. Mrs. M. Virginia is a 27 year-old married woman.  She and her husband have 4 children aged as follows: 20, 17, 5 and 3 years old.  They also have 2 orphans of the following ages: 13 and 12 years old. She lives in Jali sector, Gasabo district of Kigali city, the Capital of Rwanda.

This entrepreneur has a plot in Kimisagara market in Nyarugenge district and she sells small fish dried in that market. Mrs. M. is requesting her first loan worth 500,000 Rwf from Vision Finance Company. Previously she used to make $330 as her monthly profit and her husband has income of $330 per month as well. This entrepreneur worked in this sector of business for 5 years and she has 3 workers to help her in that business.

With this loan from Vision Finance Company, Mrs. M. will buy five sacks of small dried fish to expand her business and with the increased profit she will reinvest in the same business.

loans.use: Expand her business

loans.name: Jhanet Rosa

texts.es:
Jhanet es socia del Banco Comunal Rosas.
Jhanet es conviviente, tiene 23 años y 1 hijo, Jhanet vende cosméticos por catálogos, sus ventas son al crédito y ofrece a amigos y familiares. Jhanet estudia educación inicial en un instituto.
Jhanet necesita un préstamo de 1000 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de cosméticos.
Los sueños de Jhanet son tener una casa, local propio y que su hijo estudie.
texts.en:
Jhanet is a member of the communal bank, "Rosas" (Roses). She is married, is 23, and has 1 son. Jhanet sells cosmetics by catalog. She makes her sales on credit to friends and family members. Jhanet is studying early education at a school. She needs a loan of 1,000 PEN, which she will invest in the purchase of cosmetics. Jhanet's dreams are to have her own home, her own location for her store, and for her son to go to school.

Translated from Spanish by Tanya Harper, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase cosmetics

loans.name: Ali

texts.en:
Ali is a 21 year old man who lives in Bourj El Barajneh, southern suburbs of Lebanon. Ali has owned a barber shop since 2006. Ali requested a loan of 1000 US dollars from Al Majmoua in order to purchase tools for his shop like scissors, hairdryer, as well as change the décor of his house. This is the first time that Ali has requested a loan. 
Ali is special in his work because he knows how to treat his clients and is always aware of hair’s fashion. His clients are his friends and neighbors. When he first started his business, he didn’t face difficulties. Ali decided on doing his business because of his experience since he learned it when he was young. In the future, he plans on expanding his business by opening another barber shop.

loans.use: Ali will use the loan to urchase tools for his shop like scissors, hairdryer, as well as change the décor of his house.

loans.name: Mahdi

texts.en:
Mahdi is a 27 year old man who lives in Bourj El Barajneh, southern suburbs of Lebanon. Mahdi has selling fruits and vegetables for two years. Mahdi requested a loan of 700 US dollars from Al Majmoua in order to purchase merchandise for his shop. This is the first time that Mahdi has requested a loan. 
Mahdi is special in his work because he knows how to treat his clients and has a good quality of merchandise. His clients are his friends and neighbors. When he first started his business, he had to face the competition. Mahdi decided on doing his business because he wanted to have an independent work. In the future, he plans on expanding his business.

loans.use: Mahdi will use the loan to purchase merchandise for his shop.

loans.name: Abed El Karim

texts.en:
Abed Al Karim is a 21 year old man who lives in Bourj El Barajneh, southern suburbs of Lebanon. Abed Al Karim has been working as a motorcycle repairer. Abed Al Karim has requested a loan from Al Majmoua in order to purchase tools for his work. This is the first time that Abed Al Karim has requested a loan.  
Abed Al Karim is special in his work because he does it well. His clients can be anybody from his region. When he first started his business, he didn’t face the competition. Abed Al Karim decided on doing his business because of his experience in his work. In the future, he plans on expanding his business.

loans.use: Abed El Karim will use the loan to purchase tools for his work.

loans.name: Mercedes

texts.es:
Mercedes es socia del Banco Comunal Rosas.
Mercedes es conviviente, tiene 32 años y 2 hijos, Mercedes estudia antropología y vende ropa variada, artefactos dependiendo de los pedidos de sus clientes, sus ventas los realiza de casa en casa y en instituciones, sus productos los adquiere en las ciudades de Tacna, Moquegua.
Mercedes necesita un préstamo de 1000 soles dinero que será invertido como parte de pago de un artefacto.
Los sueños de Mercedes son tener un local estable y propio, culminar sus estudios y sacar adelante a sus hijos con una mejor educación.
texts.en:
Mercedes is a member of the Rosas (Roses) Communal Bank. Mercedes has a partner, is 32 years old, and has two children. Mercedes studies anthropology and sells assorted clothes and devices, depending on the orders of her customers. She makes her sales door to door and in institutions. She acquires her products in the cities of Tacna and Moquegua.

Mercedes needs a loan of 1000 PEN which will be invested the partial payment of a device. Mercedes’ dream is to have her own stable location, complete her studies, and to get her children ahead with a better education.

Translated from Spanish by William Gray, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: As partial payment for a device

loans.name: Mohamad

texts.en:
Mohamad is a 63 year old man who lives in Bourj El Barajneh, southern suburbs of Lebanon with his wife and their child. Mohamad has been working as a taxi driver; he also works as a car painter. Mohamad requested a loan of 2000 US dollars from Al Majmoua in order to purchase a car for his work. Mohamad has been a microcredit client for eight years now and has always paid on time. 
His previous loans helped him improve his financial situation. Mohamad is special in his work because he knows how to treat his clients. His clients are his friends and neighbors. When he first started his business, he didn’t face difficulties. Mohamad decided on doing his business because he wanted to have an independent work. In the future, he plans on expanding his business.

loans.use: Mohamad will use the loan to purchase a car for his work.

loans.name: Celia

texts.es:
Celia tiene 21 años, es soltera sin hijos, y vive en el Barrio Kennedy, cual es situada a 2 kilómetros de la ciudad de Caacupé.  Celia es una joven emprendedora que empezó el negocio hace un año atrás junto con su hermano que es de profesión panadero.

El local de la panadería es alquilada ya que no tienen recursos sufiente para montar un local propio por el alto costo.

Ella se encarga de la administración y también en el empaque de los productos realizados (panificados en general) para su posterior venta que también lo realiza con vehículos pagados con porcentaje según venta, mientras que su hermano se encarga de la producción. Al inicio comenta, que fue muy duro y difícil iniciar este negocio ya que no contaba con capital, y  las primeras inversiones realizadas fueron gracias a sus ahorros y con la ayuda de sus padres quienes les facilitaron el capital.

Celia con el acompañamiento de su hermano, quien esta con ella en todo momento para atender el negocio, hoy día están saliendo adelante. Su meta es la de tener un local propio.  

Ella comenta que esta muy contenta con la ayuda que le brinda la Fundación Paraguaya con los créditos que le han otorgado y por la confianza que depositan en ella al concederle los créditos para la compra de materia prima (Harina, Huevo, Anís, Levadura, Manteca Vegetal, etc.)
texts.en:
Celia is 21 and is single without children. She lives in the Kennedy neighborhood, which is located 2 kilometers from the city of Caacupé. Celia is a young businesswoman who started her business one year ago with her brother, who is a professional baker. They rent their location since they don't have enough resources to have their own due to the high costs involved. She manages the business and also packs their finished products for their later sale. They use delivery vehicles to make their sales, which they pay for with a percentage of the sales they make. Her brother makes their products. When they started their business, Celia says it was difficult because they didn't have any capital. Their first investments were made thanks to their savings and help from their parents. Celia, along with her brother, who is always attending to their business, are getting ahead. Their goal is to have their own location. She says she is very happy with the help that Fundación Paraguaya has offered them through their credits and the confidence that they have in her. She uses the credits to purchase supplies (flour, egges, anise, yeast, butter, etc.).

Translated from Spanish by Tanya Harper, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase flour and butter

loans.name: Mhmad

texts.en:
Mhmad is a 39 year old man who lives in Bourj El Barajneh, southern suburbs of Lebanon. Mhmad has a minimarket for almost two years. Mhmad requested a loan of 1000 US dollars from Al Majmoua in order to purchase merchandise for his shop. This is the first time that Mhmad has requested a loan.  
Mhmad is special in his work because he knows how to treat his clients. His clients are his friends and neighbors. When he first started his business, he didn’t face difficulties. Mhmad decided on doing his business because he wanted to have an independent work. In the future, he plans on expanding his business.

loans.use: Mhmad will use the loan to purchase merchandise for his shop.

loans.name: Husein

texts.en:
Husein is a 48 year old man who lives in Bourj El Barajneh, southern suburbs of Lebanon with his wife and their three children. Husein has been working as a refrigerator repairer for three years. Husein requested a loan of 800 US dollars from Al Majmoua in order to purchase tools and spare part for his work. This is the first time that Husein has requested a loan.  
Husein is special in his work because he knows how to treat his clients and he does it well. His clients are his friends and neighbors. When he first started his business, he didn’t have a lot of cash. Husein decided on doing his business because he wanted to have an independent work. In the future, he plans on expanding his business.

loans.use: Husein will use the loan to purchase tools and spare part for his work.

loans.name: Egide

texts.en:
Greetings from H. Egide, a 28 year-old married man with 4 children of the following ages: 9, 7, 5 and 3 years old. He lives in Jali sector, Gasabo district of Kigali city, capital of Rwanda. This entrepreneur owns a retail shop in Jali district. This shop contains different kinds of merchandise. This entrepreneur is seeking his first loan worth 500,000 Rwf from Vision Finance Company and with this loan Egide will buy more mechandise especially a lot of sugar and salt and soaps. This entrepreneur has the monthly profit of approximately $310 and his wife does not produce an income.

Mr. H. started this business in the year of 2003 and he has 2 regular workers to help in running this business. He opens his shop at 7:00 A.M and closes at 7:00 P.M every day. With the increased profit he will reinvest in the same business.

loans.use: Expand the business.

loans.name: Maroun

texts.en:
Maroun is a 59 year old man who lives in Bourj El Barajneh, southern suburbs of Lebanon with his wife and their five children. Maroun has owned a barber shop for eleven years. Maroun requested a loan of 2000 US dollars from Al Majmoua in order to purchase tools for his shop like scissors, hairdryer, as well as his children school tuition. Maroun has been a microcredit client for nine years now and has always paid on time.  
His previous loans helped him improve his salon. Maroun is special in his work because he knows how to treat his clients and is always aware new haircuts. His clients are his friends and neighbors. When he first started his business, he didn’t face difficulties. In the future, he plans on improving his work.

loans.use: Maroun will use the loan to purchase tools for his shop like scissors, hairdryer, as well as his children school tuition.

loans.name: Jovita

texts.es:
Jovita es socia del Banco Comunal Rosas.
Jovita es casada, tiene 37 años y 2 hijos, Jovita tiene una ferretería llamada Renzo, en un local alquilado, actividad que realiza todos los días con la ayuda de su hermana.
Jovita necesita un préstamo de 1000 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de accesorios de tubería.
Los sueños de Jovita son ser empresaria, ampliar su negocio y tener un local propio.
texts.en:
Jovita is a member of the Rosas (Roses) Communal Bank. Jovita is married, 37 years old, and has two children. Jovita has a hardware store called Renzo in a rented location where she works everyday with the help of her sister.

Jovita needs a loan of 1000 PEN which will be invested in the purchase of piping accessories. Jovita’s dream is to be a businesswoman, grow her business, and to have her own location.

Translated from Spanish by William Gray, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: For the purchase of piping accessories.

loans.name: Kamil

texts.en:
Kamil is a 52-year-old man who lives in Bourj El Barajneh, southern suburbs of Lebanon, with his wife and their four children. Kamil has been working as a car repairman for fifteen years. Kamil requested a loan of 1000 US dollars from Al Majmoua in order to purchase spare parts and electrical wires for his work. This is his fourth cycle and he has always paid on time. 
Kamil is special in his work because he does it well. His clients are his friends and neighbors. When he first started his business, he didn’t face difficulties. Kamil decided on doing his business because he has experience. In the future, he plans on expanding his business.

loans.use: To purchase spare parts and electrical wires for car repair business.

loans.name: Angelina

texts.es:
La srta. Angelina tiene 27 años y es soltera con un hijo.  Ella vive en el Barrio San Rafael de la ciudad de Caacupé. Ella es una joven muy emprendedora que empezó el negocio hace dos años atrás junto con la ayuda de su hermana.

Ella se dedica a realizar decoraciones infantiles, quince años, casamiento, con su hermana se encargan de todos los detalles para dicha actividad, es muy activa y le gustan los desafíos.  Al inicio comenta, que fue muy duro y difícil iniciar este negocio ya que no contaba con capital, y las primeras inversiones realizadas fueron gracias a sus ahorros y con la ayuda de sus padres quienes le facilitaron un pequeño capital.

La inversión del préstamo lo destina a la compra de telas, cartulina, y adornos decorativos. En este emprendimiento Angélica tiene el apoyo constante de sus padres.  Ella comenta que esta muy contenta con la ayuda que le brinda la Fundación Paraguaya con los créditos otorgados y por la confianza que depositan en ella al concederle los créditos.
texts.en:
Señorita Angelina is 27, is single, and has one son. She lives in the San Rafael neighborhood in the city of Caacupé. She is a very enterprising young woman and started her business 2 years ago with the help of her sister. She makes decorations for children, quinceañeras (birthday celebrations for 15-year-old girls), and weddings. Her sister is in charge of all of the details of their work. She is very active and enjoys challenges. At the beginning, their business was difficult because they didn't have any capital. Their first investments were made thanks to their savings and help from their parents. This loan will go towards buying fabric, cards, and embellishments. Angelina tells us that she is very happy with the help that Fundación Paraguaya offers her, the credits she receives, and the confidence that they have in her.

Translated from Spanish by Tanya Harper, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase fabric and paper

loans.name: Cheikh

texts.fr: MR D. est un maçon de profession depui presque 30 ans:il travaille avec ses enfants qui sont appelés à prendre la relève ;avec ce pret il veut acheter des planches car il en a besoin pour ses chantiers;
texts.en:
Mr. D. has been a mason by profession for almost 30 years. He works with his children, who are called upon to take his place. With this loan, he wants to buy planks because he needs them at his construction sites.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy boards

loans.name: Mahmoud

texts.en:
Mahmoud is a 34-year-old man who lives in Saida, southern Lebanon, with his wife and their two children. Mahmoud has been working as a taxi driver since 1995. Mahmoud requested a loan of 1500 US dollars from Al Majmoua in order to do some maintenance work on his car and pay his car debt. This is his second cycle and he has always paid on time. 
Mahmoud is special in his work because he has a clean car and he knows how to treat his clients well. His clients can be anybody. When he first started his business, he didn’t have a lot of cash. Mahmoud decided on doing this business because he didn’t continue his school education. In the future, he plans on expanding his business by purchasing another taxi car and renting it.

loans.use: Car maintenance and debt on his car.

loans.name: Ahmad

texts.en:
Ahmad is a 25-year-old man who lives in Saida, southern Lebanon, with his wife. Ahmad has been selling and repairing furniture for four years. Ahmad requested a loan of 1000 US dollars from Al Majmoua in order to purchase a saw and some old furniture. This is the first time that Ahmad has requested a loan.
Ahmad is special in his work because he does it well. His clients are his friends and neighbors. When he first started his business, he didn’t have a lot of cash to purchase sophisticated tools. Ahmad decided on doing this business because of the experience he had learning it when he was at school. In the future, he plans on expanding his business.

loans.use: To purchase a saw and some old furniture.

loans.name: Samir

texts.en:
Samir is a 42-year-old man who lives in Saida, southern Lebanon, with his wife and their three children. Samir has owned a barbershop for twenty-five years. Samir requested a loan of 1000 US dollars from Al Majmoua in order to change his salon’s décor. This is the first time that Samir has requested a loan.
Samir is special in his work because he does it well and has competitive prices. His clients are his friends and neighbors. When he first started his business, he didn’t face difficulties. Samir decided on doing this business because of his experience since he learned it when he was young. In the future, he plans on improving his business.

loans.use: To change his salon’s décor.

loans.name: Rechdieh

texts.en:
Rechdieh is a 59-year-old woman who lives in Saida, southern Lebanon, with her husband and their four children. Rechdieh has owned an accessory shop for nine years. She sells home equipment, toys, makeup and other accessories. Rechdieh requested a loan of 1000 US dollars from Al Majmoua in order to purchase merchandise for her shop. This is her third cycle and she has always paid on time. 
Her previous loans helped her diversify her merchandise. Rechdieh is special in her work because she sells a lot of products. Her clients are her friends, neighbors and others. When she first started her business, she didn’t face difficulties, especially since she owns the shop. Rechdieh decided on doing this business because she likes working and wanted to depend on herself. In the future, she plans on expanding her business.

loans.use: To purchase merchandise for her shop.

loans.name: Mhammad

texts.en:
Mhammad is 31 years old and lives in Saida, southern Lebanon with his wife and their child. Mhammad owns a mobile phone shop. Mhammad requests a loan of 1500 US dollars from Al Majmoua in order to purchase mobile phones and phone accessories. This is the first time that Mhammad has requested a loan.
Mhammad is respected because he does the job well and has competitive prices. His clients are his friends and neighbors. When he first started his business, he didn’t face difficulties. Mhammad decided on doing his business because of his experience. In the future, he plans on improving his business and hopes to start a new business selling cars.

loans.use: Mhammad will use the loan to purchase mobile phone and phone accessories.

loans.name: Niño Jesus Group

texts.es:
Una integrante del comite Nino Jesus es la Sra. Maria I..  Ella tiene 34 años y tiene dos hijos. Es una Sra muy sacrificada que se dedica en la venta de comidas. La compra de sus productos lo realiza en el mercado de abasto para la preparación de los alimentos. Sus hijos le ayuda en los trabajos de la casa y ella dice que con la ayuda que la Fundacion Paraguaya le dio está mejorando su situación económica y ayuda a su pareja con los gastos de la casa, tambien en los gastos escolares.    

Las otras integrantes de este grupo son: 

Sebastiana G..	 Reciclaje.
Martha S. de M. 	 Venta de merceria.
Basilia R.G..	Venta deropa.
Sonia R.V. G. 	Vendedora Ambulante.
Teofila A. R.	Venta de verduras.
Maria D. I..	Vta de comida.
Maximina G. R. 	Venta de ropas.
Eugenia M.. 	Venta de frutas.
 Olga M.. 	Venta de ropas.
 Elvira B.. 	Recicladora.
Marta A..	Venta de Bebidas.
Mirta C..	       Despensa.
Ines G..    	Termos Forrados.
Patricia B..   	Reciclaje.
Pamela V.. 	        Modista. 
Margareth V..  	Modista.
Lidia G..	 Venta de Bijouteri. 
Lucia T.. 	Venta de ropa.
Mercedes M..	Venta de Carbon.
 Nelly Z..	Venta de hamburguesa.
texts.en:
One member of the Niño Jesús Group is Mrs. Maria I.. She is 34 years old and has two children. She is a very self-sacrificing woman who works selling food. She buys the products she needs to prepare her foods in the supply market. Her children help her with the housework and she says that with the help that Kiva partner Fundación Paraguaya has given her, her financial situation is improving and she helps her husband with the household expenses and school costs. The other members of the group are: Sebastiana G. - Recycling Martha S. de M. - Sale of sewing supplies Basilia R.G. - Clothing sales Sonia R.V. G. - Street vendor Teofila A. R. - Sale of vegetables Maria D. I. - Food sales Maximina G. R. - Clothing sales Eugenia M. - Sale of fruit Olga M. - Clothing sales Elvira B. - Recycling Marta A. - Beverage sales Mirta C. - Dispensary Ines G. - Insulated Thermoses Patricia B. - Recycling Pamela V. - Dressmaker Margareth V. - Dressmaker Lidia G. - Jewelry sales Lucia T. - Clothing sales Mercedes M. - Sale of charcoal Nelly Z. - Hamburger sales

Translated from Spanish by Laura Westin, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy and sell clothing: pants, traditional skirts, t-shirts, blouses, shirts; Sale of detergent for home use; Dispensary sale of: noodles, rice, flour, oil, powdered soap

loans.name: Iacob

texts.en:
This is P. Iacob and he is a beginner entrepreneur in growing vegetables. He lives in Calarasi district, Tibirica village.

"The soil here is very poor," says Iacob. "If you don't have a cart and organic fertilizer, you can't harvest anything. And if you don't have the means to buy fertilizer, you will harvest nothing."

He and his wife have families to support, children to keep healthy. Many families here do not eat fresh food, and children don't get the micro-nutrients they need. 

So when Microinvest experts came to them and proposed the idea of growing tomatoes, along with other fruits, Iacob and Ana were willing to try. "We grew up in the culture of fruits," he says. Iacob grew fruits like plums, grapes, apples and strawberries.

Now, Microinvest has granted him a loan to purchase all the building materials for two greenhouses.

loans.use: To start to grow vegetables

loans.name: Houria

texts.en:
Houria is a 35 year old woman who lives in Saida, southern Lebanon with her husband and their three children. Houria has been working as farmer for eighteen years. She plants and sells fruits and vegetables. Houria requests a loan of 1500 US dollars from Al Majmoua in order to purchase new tools and seed. This is her fourth cycle and she has always paid on time. 
Her previous loans helped her diversify her production. Houria is respected because she sells good quality food. Her clients are her friends, neighbors and fruit and vegetable shops. When she first started her business, she didn’t face difficulties. Houria decided on this business because of her experience - she learned it since she was young. In the future, she plans on expanding her business.

loans.use: Houria will use the loan to purchase new tools and seed.

loans.name: Kamal

texts.en:
Kamal is a 21 year old man who lives in Saida, southern Lebanon. Kamal owns a barber shop. Kamal requested a loan of 1000 US dollars from Al Majmoua in order to purchase a new seat and beauty products for his salon. This is the first time that Kamal has requested a loan.
Kamal's salon is popular because he cuts hair well and is aware of new haircut styles. His clients are his friends and neighbors. When he first started his business, he didn’t have a lot of cash. Kamal learned his business in an academy and by experience. In the future, he plans on improving his business.

loans.use: Kamal will use the loan to purchase a new seat and beauty products for his salon.

loans.name: Ndiaye

texts.fr: madame ndiaye P. est une femme mariée qui habite au quartier cité senghor de thies;elle fait du commerce de produis aloé vera depuis quelques mois;avec ce pret elle compte acheter un lot de produits pour satisfaire sa clientèle;
texts.en:
Ms. Ndiaye P. is a married woman who lives in the Cité Senghor district of Thies. She has been doing commerce in aloé vera products for a few months. With this loan, she intends to buy a quantity of products to satisfy her customers.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To sell cosmetics

loans.name: Ali

texts.en:
Ali is a 34 year old man who lives in Saida, southern Lebanon with his wife and their two children. Ali owns a snack stand. He makes all type of sandwiches and he is famous for his sandwiches.  His clients are his friends and neighbors. Ali requests a loan of 1000 US dollars from A. Majmoua in order to purchase merchandise for his snack stand. This is the first time that Ali has requested a loan.
When he first started his business, he didn’t have a lot of cash and had to face the competition. Ali decided on doing this business because of his experience  -  he learned it when he was young. In the future, he plans on improving his business.

loans.use: Ali will use the loan to purchase merchandise for his snack stand

loans.name: Khaled

texts.en:
Khaled is a 56-year-old man who lives in Saida, southern Lebanon, with his wife and their two children. Khaled has been working as a car repairman and painter for twenty-nine years. Khaled requested a loan of 1000 US dollars from Al Majmoua in order to purchase tools for his garage. Khaled has been a microcredit client for five years now and has always paid on time.  
His previous loans helped him improve his garage. His clients are his friends and neighbors. When he first started his business, he didn’t face difficulties. Khaled decided on doing this business because he has experience. In the future, he plans on expanding his business.

loans.use: To purchase tools for his garage.

loans.name: Joaquin

texts.es:
Joaquín A. es una persona que se dedica netamente a la fotografía desde muy joven, lleva 10 años en esta profesión y comenta que desde muy pequeño le gustaba sacar fotografías.
