El negocio lo tiene a media cuadra de la Basílica de la ciudad de Caacupé y la atención del negocio lo realiza el mismo con la ayuda de una asistente por tener siempre cumpleaños infantiles y eventos en las escuelas y colegios de Caacupé.

Joaquín nos comenta que últimamente está viajando mucho por las distintas ciudades del país gracias al buen servicio que ofrece y a la calidad de su trabajo ya que constantemente se está capacitando en los cursos de fotografías que se dan en Asunción. 

El préstamo otorgado por la Fundación Paraguaya lo invertira en la remodelación y decoración de su estudio fotográfico que tiene en su local.  Nos comenta también que utiliza todo tipo de estrategias para la publicidad de su servicio, busca auspiciantes y lanza revistas con las fotografías de sus eventos.

El Cliente manifiesta su agradecimiento a la Fundación Paraguaya por el préstamo otorgado así va adquiriendo sus herramientas de trabajo.
texts.en:
Joaquín A. has been dedicated to photography from a young age; he has been working in this profession for 10 years and comments that from a very young age he liked to take photographs. His business is located half a block away from The Basilica in the city of Caacupé and he runs this business himself with the help of assistant because they always have children’s birthday parties, and school events to work in Caacupé. Joaquín comments that lately he has been traveling a lot to the different cities of the country thanks to the good service that he offers and the quality of his work that he maintains by constantly taking photography courses offered in the city of Asunción. The loan granted to him by the Paraguayan Foundation will be invested in remodeling and decorating his photographic studio that he has in his locale. He also comments that he will also use the loan to carry out various strategies to publicize his service, search for a logo, and launch magazines with photographs of his events. Joaquín expressed his gratitude for the loan that will be granted to him by the Paraguayan Foundation, which has helped him slowly gain important work tools.

Translated from Spanish by Mariela Cedeno, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To remodel and decorate his photographic studio.

loans.name: Joaquina

texts.es:
Joaquina es socia del Banco Comunal Sumaq Huayta que significa Flor Bella.
Joaquina es conviviente, tiene 43 años y 5 hijos, Joaquina junto a su esposo se dedican a la ventad e medicina natural, tienen una tienda en una calle céntrica el cual es alquilado, actividad que realizan todos los días.
Joaquina necesita un préstamo de 2500 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de jarabe, aceites.
Joaquina sueña con brindar una buena educación a sus hijos para que sean profesionales y tener uh laboratorio de medicinas naturales.
texts.en:
Joaquina is a member of the Sumaq Huayta Communal Bank, which means “Beautiful Flower.” Joaquina is a common-law wife, 43 years old, and has 5 children. She works alongside her husband selling natural medicine. They have a rented store in a centrally-located street where they work every day. Joaquina needs a loan of 2,500 soles, money which will be used to buy syrups and oils. Joaquina dreams of giving her children a good education so they may become professionals, and of having a natural medicine laboratory.

Translated from Spanish by Laura Westin, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy syrups and oils

loans.name: Yaw

texts.en:
Yaw O. is twenty-seven years old. He is married and has three children: two daughters and a son. All are in the primary school. He lives with the wife and children in a rented apartment in Goaso in the Brong Ahafo Region. Goaso is one of the busy business centres in the region. His wife is a trader. She trades in plantain.

Yaw is into livestock trading. He buys livestock – goats, sheep, cattle, etc. all the way from the northern part of the country and sells to butchers and restaurant operators in his community. He has been in business for three years. Yaw is hopeful to give his children a good education.

loans.use: To buy livestock

loans.name: Sara

texts.fr: K. Sara est née vers 1984 à Adjohoun dans le Département du l'Ouémé. Mais Sara vit avec sa famille à Cotonou, Capitale Économique du Bénin. Sara est mariée à AHOVI Aubin. Sara a un seul enfant qui n'est pas encore en âge d'aller à l'école. Sara vend de l'huile et des légumes chez elle à la maison. C'est à Dantokpa, grand marché international du Bénin que Sara va faire ses achats et revient chez elle pour proposer ses produits à la population de son quartier. Sara a eu déjà de crédit de la part de ALIDé pour développer son activité. Sara a fini de rembourser le premier crédit qu'elle a pris à ALIDé et demande actuellement un deuxième crédit auprès de ALIDé pour continuer de développer son activité dans le but de mieux satisfaire la demande de sa clientèle.
texts.en:
K. Sara was born around 1984 in Adjohoun, in Ouémé County. But Sara lives with her family in Cotonou, the economic capital of Benin. She is married to AHOVI Aubin and has just one child who is not yet old enough to go to school. Sara sells oil and vegetables out of her house. At Dantokpa, the grand international marketplace of Benin, she makes her purchases and comes back home to offer her merchandise to the people in the district. She has already had a loan from ALIDÉ and is currently asking for a second loan to continue developing her business with the goal of satisfying the customer demand better.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy six 25-liter drums of peanut oil and a hectare of vegetables

loans.name: Nicolaza

texts.es:
Nicolaza es socia D. Banco Comunal Sumaq Huayta que significa Flor Bella.
Nicolaza es viuda, tiene 78 años y 10 hijos, Nicolaza tiene un taller textil de bordados y tejidos, para lo cual tiene 10 bordadoras, sus productos los comercializa de acuerdo a pedidos y en el puesto de su hija en el mercado Artesanal, también  sus productos los envía a las ciudades de Cuzco y Lima.
Nicolaza necesita un préstamo de 2000 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de lanas.
Los sueños de Nicolaza son continuar ayudando a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Nicolaza is a member of the Sumaq Huayta Communal Bank, which means “Beautiful Flower.” She is a widow, 78 years old, and has 10 children. Nicolaza has a textile workshop where embroidery and weavings are made. She has 10 embroiderers and sells her products by order and at her daughter’s stall in the Artesanal Market. She also sends her products to the cities of Cuzco and Lima. Nicolaza needs a loan of 2,000 soles, money that will be used to buy wool. Nicolaza dreams of continuing to help her children.

Translated from Spanish by Laura Westin, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy wool

loans.name: Lamine

texts.fr: MR LAMINE G.  EST TAILEUR DE PROFESSION.IL A OUVERT SON atelier depuis deux ans ;il achète  des tissus avec lesquels il confectionne des habits prets à porter pour les revendre;avec ce pret il veut acheter des tissus pour améliorer sa marge bénéficiaire;
texts.en:
Mr. Lamine G. is a tailor by profession. He opened his workshop two years ago. He buys cloth with which he makes ready-to-wear clothing for resale. With this loan, he wants to buy some fabrics to improve his profit margin.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To sell ready-to-wear

loans.name: Yaa

texts.en:
Yaa S., fifty-one years of age, is a divorced mother of five children: two sons and three daughters. She says some are in the university, senior high, junior high and the primary schools. She lives with the children in a very busy commercial town called Goaso in the Brong Ahafo Region of Ghana.

Yaa is a trader. She works very hard to provide for the children. She trades in ladies’ wear: underwear, blouses, etc. She buys from Kumasi and hawks (goes door to door) to sell in her community. Yaa says she also treks to other towns to sell on their market days. She has been in business for five years.

She is hopeful to expand her business and increase her profit margin. It is her desire to sponsor her children in school to high levels.

loans.use: To buy ladies’ wear to sell

loans.name: Victoria

texts.es:
Victoria es socia del Banco Comunal Llamkasum que significa Trabajemos en quechua.
Victoria es separada, tiene 41 años y 4 hijos, Victoria viaja a las diferentes ferias de la región en donde vende abarrotes en general, frutas, ropa y de las ferias compra cereales y animales menores, los cuales comercializa en los mercados de la ciudad de Ayacucho.
Victoria necesita un préstamo de 2100 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de abarrotes.
Los sueños de Victoria son que sus hijos sean profesionales y aumentar su negocio.
texts.en:
Victoria is a member of the Communal Bank Llamkasum, which means “Lets Work” in Quechua. Victoria is separated, 41 years old, and has 4 children. Victoria travels to the different regional markets where she sells general groceries, fruits, and clothing, and from the markets she purchases grains and small animals that she sells in the markets of the city of Ayacucho. Victoria needs a loan of 2100 PEN, money that will be invested in the purchase of groceries. Victoria dreams that her children become professionals and that she expands her business.

Translated from Spanish by Mariela Cedeno, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase groceries.

loans.name: Aurora

texts.es:
La señora Aurora tiene 40 años y tiene 2 hijos menores de edad. Esta casada con el señor Alcides Areco, quien se dedica a la construcción de viviendas. Los dos mantienen su hogar con mucho sacrificio.  Se levantan muy temprano y salen a sus trabajos.  Ella se dedica a la venta entre semana y cobra los fines de semana.

Ella recorre las calles casa por casa ofreciendo sus productos, sin importar el frío o calor pues de esto dependen sus hijos.

En el futuro desea comprar una motocicleta para realizar sus cobranzas. Ella necesita del crédito para la compra de mercaderías, ya que tiene muchos pedidos por la temporada.
texts.en:
Aurora is 40 years old and has two underage children. She is married to Alcides Areco who works in home construction. Both support their household with a lot of sacrifice. They wake up very early and leave to their jobs. She dedicates herself to sales during the week and goes to collect her payments on the weekends. Aurora goes around from house to house offering her products regardless of the cold or the heat since her children depend on her. In the future she would like to purchase a motorcycle to carry out her money collection. She needs this loan to purchase merchandise, given that she has a lot of orders this season.

Translated from Spanish by Mariela Cedeno, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase athletic shoes, jeans, t-shirts, shirts, capris, blankets, sheets, etc.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchasing goods

loans.name: Zintia

texts.es:
Zintia es socia del Banco Comunal Llamkasum que significa Trabajemos en quechua.
Zintia es soltera, tiene 22 años y vive con sus padres, esta estudiando secretariado, Zintia vende frutas variadas las cuales las pela y vende por pociones, sus ventas los realiza ambulatoriamente para lo cual cuenta con una carretilla.
Zintia necesita un préstamo de 600 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de piña, melón y papaya.
Los sueños de Zintia son estudiar la carrera profesional de Contabilidad y ampliar su negocio.
texts.en:
Zintia is a member of the community bank Llamkasum that means let’s work in Quechua. Zintia is 22 years old and single. She lives with her parents and is studying to become a secretary. Zintia sells a variety of peeled and portion fruit. She is a street vendor, and uses a cart.

Zintia is asking for a loan of $200 which will be invested in the purchase of pineapple, melon and papaya. Zintia’s dreams are to study Accounting and expand her business.

Translated from Spanish by Adriana Pierce, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy pineapple, melon and papaya

loans.name: Kely

texts.es:
Kely es socia del Banco Comunal Llamkasum que significa Trabajemos en quechua.
Kely es soltera, tiene 20 años y vive con sus padres, estudia turismo en la universidad, Kely junto a su papa tienen una tienda de repuestos en un local alquilado, el cual esta ubicado cerca del taller mecánico de su papa.
Kely necesita un préstamo de 2100 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de repuestos para la apertura de un nuevo local.
Los sueños de Kely son terminar su carrera, especializarse en gastronomía y tener mas sucursales.
texts.en:
Kely is a member of the community bank Llamkasum that means let’s work in Quechua. Kely is 20 years old and single. She lives with her parents and studies tourism at a university. Kely and her dad own a car parts store, which is located in a rented place near her father’s mechanics workshop.

Kely is asking for a loan of $700 which will be invested in the purchase of spare parts for the opening of new car parts stores. Kely’s dreams are to finish her career, specialize in gastronomy and to open more branches.

Translated from Spanish by Adriana Pierce, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of spare parts

loans.name: Eliana

texts.es:
Eliana es socia del Banco Comunal Llamkasum que significa Trabajemos en quechua.
Eliana es casada, tiene 30 años y 4 hijos, Iliana se dedica a la compra de cacao, maní y café, actividad que realiza en la selva ayacuchana y junto a su esposo, los productos los comercializa en la ciudad de Ayacucho y Huancayo. Además Eliana tiene un carro el cual realiza transporte publico en la ciudad de Ayacucho.
Eliana necesita un préstamo de 1050 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de neumáticos para su carro.
Eliana sueña con aumentar su negocio, educar a sus hijos y construir su casa.
texts.en:
Eliana is a client of the community bank Llamkasum that means let’s work in Quechua. Eliana is 30 years old, married and has 4 children. She is dedicated to the purchase of cocoa, coffee and peanuts, which she performs in the Ayacuchana jungle with her husband. The products are sold in the city of Ayacucho and Huancayo. Eliana has a car for public transportation in the city of Ayacucho.

Eliana is asking for a loan of $350 which will be invested in the purchase of tires for her car. Her dreams are to grow her business, give an education to her children and build their home.

Translated from Spanish by Adriana Pierce, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of tires for her car

loans.name: Abena

texts.en:
Abena G. is forty-two years old and married with two children. Her husband is a mason and they live together in a suburb community at Kasoa. Abena has supported one of her children to finish senior high school and the other is currently in school.

Abena sells kenkey and groceries. Kenkey is prepared from milled maize grains, cooked and taken with hot pepper and fried fish. She has many customers since many Ghanaians enjoy kenkey as breakfast, lunch and supper. She wants to use the loan to buy more raw materials like bags of maize, meat, fish, vegetables and firewood.

Abena hopes to raise increased income to support her children’s education. She belongs to the community group called Sure Trust Group. In this group, members guarantee for one another as social collateral to access a loan and provide peer pressure to repay the loan.

loans.use: To  buy more raw materials like bags of maize, meat, fish, vegetables and firewood

loans.name: Victoria

texts.es:
Victoria es socia del Banco Comunal Llamkasum que significa Trabajemos en quechua.
Victoria es casada, tiene 34 años y 5 hijos, Victoria vive en la selva ayacuchana en donde tiene una tienda en su casa en donde vende abarrotes, verduras, frutas, actividad que realiza todos los días. Victoria también compra y vende cacao, café.
Victoria necesita un préstamo de 1050 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de café y cacao.
Los sueños de Victoria son aumentar su negocio y comprar una computadora para sus hijos.
texts.en:
Victoria is a member of the community bank Llamkasum, which means "we work" in Quechua. Victoria is married, has 5 children and is 34 years old. Victoria lives in the Ayacucho jungle where she has a shop in her home where she works every day selling groceries, vegetables and fruit. Victoria also buys and sells cocoa and coffee. Victoria needs a loan of 1050 soles to purchase coffee and cocoa. Victoria's dream is to grow her business and buy a computer for her children.

Translated from Spanish by Tim Hassett, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase coffee and cocoa

loans.name: Francisca

texts.es:
La señora Francisca G. tiene 54 años y tiene 5 hijos todos mayores de edad.  Ella es madre soltera y mantiene a su hogar con mucho sacrificio.  Ella da de comer a 40 personas por día en su local ubicado en el mercado de San Lorenzo. Abre su local a las 5 de la mañana, ya que ofrece desayuno, media mañana y almuerzo.  

Ella necesita el crédito para la compra de mercaderías en cantidad y re-modelar su local.
texts.en:
The señora Francisca G. is 54 years old and has 5 older children. She is a single mother and maintains her home with many sacrifices. She gives food to 40 people a day in her premises, located in the market of San Lorenzo. She opens her store at 5 in the morning, now that she offers breakfast, morning tea and lunch. Francisca needs a loan to buy grociers in quantity and remodel her premises.

Translated from Spanish by Jane McCrory, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy meat, flour, pasta, rize, oil, chicken, chorizo etc

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy merchandise

loans.name: Cécile

texts.fr: T. Cécile est née vers 1971 à Adjohoun dans la Vallée de l'Ouémé. Cécile est mariée à DJOTAN Joseph. Cécile est mère de quatre enfants tous à la charge de son mari et elle. Cécile vit avec sa famille à Cotonou, Capitale Économique du Bénin. Cécile vend des fromages de soja qu'elle fait elle-même chez elle. C'est de façon ambulante que Cécile vend ses fromages desoja. Le fromage de soja est une nourriture très appréciée par la population du Bénin. Cécile reçoit des commandes de fromage de soja des bonnes dames qui font de la restauration populaire. Mais Cécile n'arrive pas à satisfaire ces commandes par manque de moyens financiers pour acheter le soja en conséquence. Alors Cécile s'est rapprochée de ALIDé pour avoir de crédit afin de gagner ce marché.
texts.en:
T. Cécile was born around 1971 in Adjohoun, in the Ouémé Valley. She is married to DJOTAN Joseph and is the mother of four children, all of whom she and her husband support. She lives with her family in Cotonou, the economic capital of Benin. Cécile sells soy cheese that she makes herself at home. Going door-to-door is how she sells soy cheese, a highly appreciated food by the people of Benin. She receives orders for soy cheese from women in the food catering business. But Cécile isn't able to satisfy the orders due to a lack of financial means. So she inquired with ALIDÉ to obtain a loan in order to succeed in the market.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy three 50-kg sacks of soybeans

loans.name: Blanca

texts.es:
Blanca O. es soltera, vive en su casa propia, y se dedica a la abogacia.
 
Tiene su propio estudio juridico.  Desde muy joven se inicio en esta actividad ya que trabajaba como ayudante en una empresa del mismo rubro y hace ocho años que logro independizarse luego de muchos años de trabajo.

En el futuro sueña con un local propio donde pueda dar mas fuente de trabajo.
texts.en:
Blanca O. is unmarried, lives in her own house, and practices law. She has her own legal practice and has worked in the legal field since she was young. She started her career as a legal aide but opened her own practice eight years ago after gaining many years of experience. She dreams of having her own office in the near future so that she can increase her business.

Translated from Spanish by Matthew Raimondi, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To expand her house to include a law office.

loans.name: Rebecca

texts.en: Rebecca P., 38, is a divorced mother of three children, a daughter and two sons attending the junior high and the primary schools. She lives with her children in a rented apartment in Goaso, one of the busy business centres in the Brong Ahafo Region of Ghana.  Rebecca is a trader, operating a roadside provisions store in her community. She buys her provisions in Kumasi. In business now for two years, Rebecca is requesting a loan to procure goods in bulk to increase her stock. She hopes to expand the business and give her children a good education.

loans.use: To buy provisions in bulk.

loans.name: Samuel

texts.en:
Samuel D. is 33 years old. He is single and dependent. Samuel is a dealer in mobile phones and accessories. He says the sale of mobile phones has become a very lucrative business in Ghana because almost every Ghanaian desires to possess a mobile phone for easy and fast communication. He buys his supplies from importers at wholesale prices and sells to his customers at retail prices. Samuel has been in this business for four years now.

Samuel requests a loan to enable him to procure an increased stock of mobile phones and accessories. He hopes the loan will help him to increase his savings and enable him to expand his shop to include the sale of phone cards.

Samuel belongs to the community group called Thank You Trust Group. In this group, members agree to guarantee for each other as social collateral to repay the loan.

loans.use: To procure increased stock of mobile phones and accessories

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy ingredients

loans.name: Rose

texts.en:
Rose A. is forty-two years of age. She is married and has given birth to three children: one son and two daughters. She says they are in the senior high, junior high and primary schools. Rose lives with the children and her husband in a very busy commercial town called Goaso in the Brong Ahafo Region of Ghana.

Rose is a trader. She works very hard to support her husband to provide for the family. Rose trades in ladies’ clothes such as dresses, underwear, etc. She also sells bed sheets. She buys from Kumasi and hawks (goes door to door) to sell in her community. Rose says she also treks to other towns to sell on their market days. She has been in business for two years.

Rose is hopeful to expand her business and increase her profit margin. She desires to sponsor her children in school to high levels.

loans.use: To buy secondhand clothes to sell

loans.name: Gifty

texts.en:
Gifty is thirty years old and married with two children. She is currently living with her husband and the children in a rented two bedroom house at Kasoa where they live. Her husband is a commercial driver.

Gifty realizes the need to support her family with additional income so she decided to start a trade. She has been selling Frytol cooking oil and fresh and tinned tomatoes for the past five years at Kasoa’s new market. She buys her supply of Frytol vegetable cooking oil and tomatoes from wholesalers and retails them to her customers who are mostly households, food vendors, etc.

With the loan, Gifty wants to buy vegetable oil and tomatoes in bulk to cater for the demands of her customers. She wants to use the proceeds from her operation to support the children in school.

Gifty is a member of the group called Kronkron which means Holy. Members agree to guarantee and support one another to repay their loans.

loans.use: To buy vegetable oil and tomatoes in bulk

loans.name: Dative

texts.en:
Greetings from M. Dative, 38 years old. She is single and she has two children, 12 and 7 years old. She lives in Nyarugenge district of Kigali the capital of Rwanda.

Ms. M. owns a shop in Nyarugenge district and her shop sells drinks. She has been doing the same business since 2004. She hired one employee to help her in this business. She starts her daily business at 8:00 a.m. and finishes at 10:00 p.m.

She is requesting her first loan worth 400,000 Rwf from Vision Finance Company and with this loan she will buy more drinks for her store.

Ms. M. has a monthly profit of approximately $455 and she will continue to reinvest the increased profit.

loans.use: To buy more drinks for her store

loans.name: Cecilia

texts.en:
Cecilia is 49 years old. She is a widow and mother with four children who are currently in school. She trades in cereals like maize and beans in the local market of Kasoa, a town in the Central region of Ghana.

Life has become a bit of a challenge to her and it has become very difficult for her to cater to her children especially with their education and their basic needs.

She requests the loan to enable her buy an increased stock of maize to grow her business and scale up sales. She hopes to increase her savings to support the children’s education so as to give them a better future and career opportunities.

She belongs to the community group called Sure Trust Group. In this group, members guarantee for one another as social collateral and assist one another to repay the loan.

loans.use: To buy an increased stock of cereals like maize and beans

loans.name: Florence

texts.en:
Florence S. is thirty-nine years old, married, and the mother of four children: two sons and two daughters. According to her, some of her children are in senior high school while others are in junior high school and primary school. She lives with her husband and children in a family house in Goaso in the Brong Ahafo Region. Goaso is one of the busy business centres in the region. Her husband is a trader.

Florence runs a provision store in her community. She says her store is by the roadside. She buys her provisions from Kumasi. She has been in business for over ten years and wants a loan to procure provisions in bulk to increase her stock. She is hopeful to expand her business and give her children a good education.

loans.use: To procure provisions in bulk

loans.name: Ruth

texts.en:
Ruth, a 32-year-old trader, is married with three children who are in school. She is a very resourceful wife and mother.

Ruth supports her husband in providing for the household through the sale of used clothing and sachet (polythene-bagged) drinking water. The selling of used clothing has a very big market in Ghana as brand new clothes are very expensive for the economically active poor. Therefore, the selling of used clothing has created a market for many Ghanaian women like Ruth.

Ruth wants to use the loan to buy more bales of used clothing and shoes to increase her inventory. She believes this loan will help her to save more for her children’s education and also enable her to rent a store to trade in.

Ruth is member of the group called odo ye de (love is sweet). Members agree to guarantee and support one another to repay the loan.

loans.use: To buy more bales of used clothing and shoes to increase her inventory

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy ingredients

loans.name: Germaine

texts.fr: B. Germaine est née le 29/05/1975 à Adjohoun dans la Valée de l'Ouémé. Germaine est mère de quatre enfants dont un est déjà majeur. Germaine est veuve depuis deux ans environ. Germaine vit avec ses enfants à Cotonou, Capitale Économique du Bénin. Germaine est dans le secteur de la restauration. C'est à Cotonou au quartier appelé Zone des Ambassades que Germaine a ouvert son restaurant. Germaine a une clientèle importante et fidèle mais Germaine manque de moyens financiers nécessaire pour développer son restaurant. C'est pourquoi Germaine sollicite le soutient financier de ALIDé pour y arriver.
texts.en:
B. Germaine was born on May 29, 1975 in Adjohoun, in Ouémé Valley. She is the mother of four children, one of whom is of age. Germaine has been a widow for about two years. She lives with her children in Cotonou, the economic capital of Benin. She is in the restaurant business. There, in Cotonou in a district called Zone des Ambassades, she opened her restaurant. She has a sizable and loyal customer base, but she lacks the financial means necessary to develop her restaurant. This is why she's requesting financial support from ALIDÉ to do so.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy six 5-kg sacks of Gino rice, three 500-mg boxes of Gino spaghetti, a box of canned tomatoes, five cases of brewery drinks, and some sauce condiments

loans.name: Claver

texts.en:
Greetings from H. Claver, a Rwandan entrepreneur. He is 43 years old and married. He and his wife have two children, ages 25 and 17 years old, and one 14-year-old orphan. This entrepreneur lives in the Nyarugenge district of Kigali, the capital city of Rwanda.
Mr. H. owns a retail shop in his district. He has one and half years of experience in this business and has one regular worker to help him. His monthly profit is approximately $275 and his wife produces a monthly income of $55. He starts working at 5:00 am and closes at 10:00 pm. He is seeking his first loan of 500,000 RWF from Vision Finance Company. With this loan he will buy more merchandise for expanding his shop. He will be reinvesting his profit in the same business.

loans.use: To diversify and expand inventory

loans.name: Luz

texts.es: La señora Luz G. tiene 27 años, es soltera, y tiene 2 hijos menores, los cuales mantiene gracias a su trabajo.  Ella empezó realizando los trabajos de peluquería a domicilio y así con mucho esfuerzo y sacrificio logro montar una pequeña peluquería.  Hoy en día ya tiene una clientela formada y necesita de este crédito para ampliar su local, y en un futuro poder perfeccionar sus conocimientos y dar un mejor servicio a sus clientes. El deseo mas ambicioso de ella es tener su spa.
texts.en:
Ms. Luz G. is a 27-year-old single mother with two young children, whom she supports thanks to her job. She started out by offering in-home hair care services. After much hard work and sacrifice, she managed to set up a small hair salon. Today she has established a client-base, and she needs this loan in order to expand her business space. In the future, she hopes to be able to perfect her skills and give her customers better services. Her biggest ambition is to run her own spa.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase hair dye, cream hair treatment, hot oil treatment tubes, nail polish, etc.

loans.name: Edma Clarisa

texts.es: La Señora Edma Clarisa T. tiene la edad de 86 años, su estado civil es soltera. La actividad económica de Doña Edma es la compra y venta de mercadería en general. Hace más de 10 años que se dedica a este negocio. La ubicación de su negocio es de manera ambulante, por lo que ha sido muy difícil a su edad dedicarse a este negocio, pero Doña Edma le gusta mucho su manera de ganarse la vida. Los propósitos de Doña Edma son de invertir en productos nuevos para mostrar a sus clientes. El financiamiento es destinado para capital de trabajo y así comprar en Managua camisas, pantalones, ropa interior, faldas y además calzado. El sueño de Edma es mantener su negocio ya que por medio de este ha logrado sufragar sus gastos.
texts.en:
Edma Clarisa T. is 86 years old and she is unmarried. She buys and sells general merchandise, and has been doing this for more than 10 years. She is a walking saleswoman, which is why it has been hard for her to do this work at her age. However, she really likes earning a living in this way. Doña Edma proposes to invest in new products to show to her customers. The loan will be used for working capital to buy Managua shirts, pants, underwear, skirts and shoes. Edma's dream is to continue her business since she been able to defray her expenses through her business.

Translated from Spanish by Jennifer Chong, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Georgina

texts.en:
Georgina M. is 30 years old and divorced, with one son in primary school. She and her son live in a rented apartment in Goaso, in the Brong Ahafo region of Ghana. Goaso is a busy business center within the region. 

Georgina is a professional seamstress. She has a workshop by the roadside, where she tailors for clients and sews items for retail sale. She has six apprentices in training.  She has been in business for three years, and is requesting a loan to purchase fabrics and other work materials in bulk. She hopes to expand her business and provide a good education for her son.

loans.use: Purchase materials for sewing business

loans.name: Gladys

texts.en: Gladys is 25 years old and single. She is a seamstress. She sews ladies clothing of various types and styles that suit the tastes of her customers: kaba and slit, wedding dresses, funeral clothing, etc. She is seeking a loan to purchase additional sewing supplies (linen, threads, thimbles, etc.) to increase her output and efficiency. She hopes to raise her income and expand her shop - she has two apprentices she is training. She is a member of the community group called Sharp Trust Group. In this group, members guarantee for one another as social collateral to access and repay the loan.

loans.use: Purchase sewing supplies like linen, threads, thimbles, etc.

loans.name: Mariama

texts.en:
Mariama A. is 42 years old. She is married and the mother of three children. She has one daughter and two sons attending primary and senior high schools. She lives with her husband and children in a rented apartment in the very busy commercial town of Goaso, in the Brong Ahafo region of Ghana. 

Mariama is a food vendor. She has been in business for over 20 years. She runs a chop bar in her community, where she prepares and sells all kinds of local dishes. She buys food items such as cassava, plantain, rice, and other ingredients from the local market. She is requesting a loan so she can procure ingredients in bulk. 

Mariama hopes to be able to expand her business and increase her profit margin. It is her desire to sponsor her children through high levels of education.

loans.use: Buy ingredients in bulk

loans.name: Eder

texts.es:
El Sr. E. tiene 24 años, es soltero, y vive en alquiler en la ciudad de San Lorenzo. No tiene hijos.

Tiene un puesto de ventas de verduras y frutas en la ciudad de San Lorenzo hace 4 años.  Esta actividad lo heredo de sus padres quienes tambien se dedicaban a esta actividad.

Es una persona que ha progresado mucho en la vida y agradece a la Fundaciòn Paraguaya por el apoyo que le ha brindado.

Su deseo es seguir progresando.
texts.en:
Mr E. is 24 years old and single and he rents a place in the city of San Lorenzo. He has no children.

He has had a fruit and vegetable stall in San Lorenzo for four years. His parents also ran a fruit and vegetable stall, and they passed down this activity to him.

He is a person who has come very far in life and he is grateful to the Fundaciòn Paraguaya for the support that they have given him.

His desire is to continue making progress.

Translated from Spanish by Jennifer Chong, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying vegetables

loans.name: Bertha

texts.en:
Bertha is a retailer of charcoal and vegetables in her neighborhood. Charcoal is a very popular source of energy for cooking in almost all traditional Ghanaian homes. Bertha obtains her supply of charcoal from the village of Kasoa and sells it to her customers.

Bertha is 44 years old and married with five children who are all in school. She is a very hardworking and resourceful mother. She wants to use this loan to buy charcoal and vegetables in bulk. She hopes to increase her savings to pay for her children’s educational fees. She belongs to the "Odo ye De" (Love is Sweet) Trust Group. In this group, members guarantee for one another as social collateral to repay their loans.

loans.use: To buy a bulk supply of charcoal and vegetables

loans.name: Zenabu

texts.en: Zenabu A. trades in ladies’ underwear – blouses, chemisettes, bras, etc. She buys from Kumasi and hawks in her community. She also treks to other towns to sell on their market days. Zenabu is 29 years of age. She is single and lives independently. She says she is caring for her brother’s child. She lives in a rented apartment in the very busy commercial town of Goaso in the Brong Ahafo Region of Ghana. She is a very hardworking young lady. She has been in business for nine years. She is hoping to expand her business and increase her profit margin. It is her desire to increase her savings for the future.

loans.use: To buy ladies’ wear

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en: Margaret is a food vendor who sells waakye. Waakye is a cooked rice and beans dish enjoyed with stew, macaroni and fish. It is sold in the mornings as breakfast. It is very tasty and satisfying and almost all tribes in Ghana enjoy waakye. Margaret is 34 years old and married with five children who are currently in school. She wants to use this loan to buy more bags of rice, vegetable oil, beans, and macaroni to prepare good waakye for her customers. She believes this will provide her with increased income to send her first son to medical school this year. She belongs to the Sharp Trust Group. In this community group, members guarantee for one another as social collateral to access loans and there is peer pressure to repay the loan.

loans.use: To buy more bags of rice, vegetable oil, beans and macaroni

loans.name: Neide

texts.es:
La Sra. Neide tiene 27 años.  Ella es madre soltera y vive en la casa de sus padres en San Lorenzo, donde queda con su hija de 3 años.

La Sra. Neide se dedica a la fabricacion y venta de desodorantes para auto hace 6 años. Sus ventas lo realiza en las estaciones de servicio de distintas ciudades.  Esta actividad lo aprendio en el colegio.
Este credito es para la compra de mayor cantidad de insumos a precios mas bajos para la fabricacion de sus productos.

Es una persona que ha progresado mucho en la vida y agradece a la Fundaciòn Paraguaya por el apoyo que le ha brindado.
texts.en:
Neide is 27 years old. She is a single mother who lives in her parents' home in San Lorenzo, where she stays with her three-year-old daughter. Neide has been manufacturing and selling car air-fresheners for six years. She sells them in service stations in various cities. She learned this activity in school. This loan is for the purchase of a greater quantity of inputs at lower prices to make her products. She is a person that has progressed very much in her life and thanks Fundación Paraguaya for all it has given her.

Translated from Spanish by Trisha Bury, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase scents, rings and rivets

loans.name: Akwasi

texts.en: Akwasi P. trades in machetes. He buys machetes directly from the manufacturers in Kumasi. He hawks them in his community and also treks to many farming communities to sell. Akwasi is 52 years old and married with five children – two daughters and three sons. All are currently in senior high, junior high and primary schools. He lives with his wife and children in a rented apartment in Goaso, in the Brong Ahafo Region. Goaso is one of the busiest business centres in the region. His wife is a trader while he is also a farmer. Akwasi has been in the machete business for ten years. He is hoping to give his children a good education with proceeds from his business when he receive the loan to revive the business.

loans.use: To buy machetes

loans.name: Osei

texts.en:
Osei A. is a retailer of spare parts for cars. He buys from suppliers in Accra and sells to his customers. However, he currently does not have adequate funds to support his business, especially with the recent price hikes. He therefore needs this loan to remain in business. 
Osei is 50 years old, married and has four kids who are currently in school.  With this loan, he wants to purchase new stock of spare parts and scraps to serve his customers. He believes the loan will enable him to save more to finance his kids’ education. 
He is a member of the Sure Trust Group. In this community group, members guarantee and support one another for repayment of loans.

loans.use: To purchase new stock of spare parts and scraps

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchase goods

loans.name: Nelida

texts.es:
La Sra. Nelida tiene 43 años.  Ella es soltera y vive en su casa propia en la ciudad de San Lorenzo y es madre soltera de 2 hijos mayores de edad.

La Sra. Nelida tiene una despensa en su casa hace 5 años. Anteriormente trabajaba en una casa comercial que luego se decidio a salir de dicha empresa para montar su propio negocio a quien le esta resultando muy bien.

Este credito es para la compra de mercaderias en general.  Nelida es una persona que ha progresado mucho en la vida y agradece a la Fundaciòn Paraguaya por el apoyo que le ha brindado.
texts.en:
Nelida is 43 years old. She is single and lives in her own house in the city of San Lorenzo. She is the mother of two grown children. Nelida has had a store in her home for five years. Previously, she worked in a home business, but decided to leave it to start her own business, which has worked out well for her. This loan is for the purchase of general merchandise. Nelida is a person who has progressed a great deal in her life, and she thanks Fundación Paraguaya for the support it has given her.

Translated from Spanish by Trisha Bury, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase meats, beverages, dairy products, etc.

loans.name: Abena

texts.en:
Abena B. runs a cold store in her community. She sells fresh fish and all kinds of meat – beef, turkey, chicken, etc. She buys her products from big cold stores in Kumasi. 
She is 46 years old, married and has four children – two daughters and two sons. Some of the children are in senior high school while others are in junior high and primary schools. Her husband is a farmer. She lives with her husband and children in a rented apartment in the very busy commercial town of Goaso in the Brong Ahafo Region of Ghana. 
She has been in business for over two years and wants a loan to procure goods in bulk. Abena is hoping to expand her business and increase her profit margin. It is her desire to sponsor her children through school to tertiary levels.

loans.use: To buy fresh fish and meat

loans.name: Kwabena

texts.en:
At age 35, Kwabena K. is still single and lives independently. Kwabena is disabled; he is a hunchback and also one of his legs is crippled. Though in a deplorable situation, Kwabena is a hardworking young man. In Ghana, many people in a similar, or even better, situation than Kwabena will choose to beg for alms. 
Kwabena sells provision in a small kiosk on one of the streets in his community to make ends meet. He buys his provisions from the nearby wholesale supermarkets. He lives alone in a rented apartment in Goaso in the Brong Ahafo Region of Ghana. Goaso is one of the busiest business centres in the region. Kwabena has been in business for six years and wants a loan to procure goods in bulk to increase his stock. He is hoping to expand his business. He will be very grateful to any philanthropist who will lend him a helping hand in any way to better his life.

loans.use: To buy provisions

loans.name: Christiana

texts.en:
Christiana A. is a food vendor and sells banku. Banku is prepared from milled maize grains, cooked and eaten with hot peppers and fried fish or soup. She has many customers because banku is enjoyed by many Ghanaian as breakfast, lunch or supper. 

She is sixty years old. She is married with one child. She lives with her child and husband in their apartment. Her husband is sick and cannot work as he used to. She wants to use this loan to buy more ingredients like bags of maize, meat, fish, vegetables and firewood. She hopes to increase her income to support her business. She would be grateful for your support. 

Christiana is a member of Sharp Trust Group. In this community group, members guarantee for one another as social collateral to access loans and there is peer pressure to repay the loans.

loans.use: To buy more ingredient like bags of maize, meat, fish, vegetables and firewood

loans.name: Sekou

texts.en: Sekou M. is a photographer. He takes photographs of clients who call for his services at functions like parties, ceremonies, etc. He has been in business for fifteen years. He is 45 years old, married and has four children – two daughters and two sons. All are currently in senior high, junior high and primary schools. His wife is a food vendor. He lives with his wife and children in a rented apartment in Goaso in the Brong Ahafo Region. Goaso is one of the busiest business centres in the region. Sekou wants a loan to buy cameras, film, etc. Sekou is hoping to give his children a good education.

loans.use: To buy photographic materials

loans.name: Evelyn

texts.en:
Evelyn G. trades in palm oil. She buys her palm oil from wholesalers and retails for her customer’s benefit. Palm oil is produced from palm nut fruits. The palm oil is processed through various stages to obtain the palm oil which is used to prepare many local dishes like fried fish and pastries. She supplies food vendors to use to prepare their meals.
Evelyn is 56 years old and married with four children. Three of her children are working and the last child is currently in her third year at university. She works very hard and with passion to provide a brighter future for her children. 
She wants to use this loan to buy more palm nut fruits and gallons of palm oil to sell in small portions to avoid price hikes from the current food crisis in the country. 
She belongs to the Ruth Trust Group. In this community group, members guarantee for one another as social collateral to access loans and there is peer pressure to repay the loans.

loans.use: To buy more palm nut fruits and gallons of palm oil

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchase goods

loans.name: Juliana

texts.en:
Juliana P. is thirty-four years old. She is married and has two children – a daughter and a son. She says her children are currently in junior high and primary school. She lives with her husband and children in a rented apartment in a very busy commercial town called Goaso in the Brong Ahafo Region of Ghana.

Her husband is a trader. Juliana is also a trader. She buys all kinds and sizes of wood from saw mills in her community. She sells to carpenters and wood workers. Juliana has been in business for two years and wants a loan to procure wood in bulk. She is hopeful to expand her business and increase her profit margin. It is her desire to pay for a higher education for her children.

loans.use: Buy wood in bulk

loans.name: Lydia

texts.en:
Lydia A. is fifty–two years old. She is a divorced mother of three children – a son and two daughters. She says the first born is a teacher while the other two are in the polytechnic and senior high school. She lives with her children in a rented apartment in a very busy commercial town called Goaso in the Brong Ahafo Region of Ghana.

Lydia is a trader. She trades in ladies slippers and footwear. She buys from Kumasi and hawks her wares to sell. Lydia says she also treks to other towns to sell on their market days. Lydia has been in business for over twenty years and wants a loan to procure a variety of footwear in bulk. She is hopeful to expand her business and increase her profit margin. It is Lydia’s desire to sponsor a higher education for her children.

loans.use: Buy footwear in bulk

loans.name: Efua

texts.en:
Efua O. is a thirty-four-year old woman. She is married with a child. She sells jewelry and bottled ice kenkey. She sells iced kenkey to the community’s manual workers in the afternoon. Bottled ice kenkey is prepared from milled maize grains, boiled, mixed with sugar and milk and refrigerated. It is enjoyed with bread or meat pie. Many Ghanaian manual workers enjoy it as lunch.

Efua wants to use the loan to buy more bags of maize, sugar and soft drinks to increase her sales and make additional income. She is a member of the community group called Sharp Trust Group. In this group, members guarantee for one another as social collateral to access loans and to exert peer pressure to repay loans.

loans.use: Buy more ingredients and soft drinks

loans.name: Agnes

texts.en:
Agnes S. sells slippers and other footwear for ladies. She buys from Kumasi and hawks to sell. She says she also treks to other towns to sell on their market days. 
Agnes is 51 years old. She is the married mother of two children. At the moment, both of her daughters are in junior high school. Her husband is a commercial driver. She lives with her husband and daughters in a rented apartment in the very busy commercial town of Goaso in the Brong Ahafo Region of Ghana. 
Agnes has been in business for over fifteen years and wants a loan to procure a variety of footwear in bulk. She is hoping to expand her business and increase her profit margin. She wants to sponsor her children through school to higher education.

loans.use: To buy slippers

loans.name: Josphine

texts.en:
Josephine started her local restaurant a year ago in Kasoa, Ghana where she lives. She is one of the most popular food vendors in her neighborhood. She is 42 years old and married with three children, all of whom are currently in school.

She serves many kinds of local dishes, like fufu, rice balls, and banku, among others. Fufu is a starchy dumpling that is prepared from pounded cassava and plantains and is eaten with soup. Banku is prepared from ground maize grains and is eaten with hot pepper or soup.

Josephine wants to use this loan to buy more raw materials, such as maize, cassava, plantains, meat, fish, and firewood. She also hopes to use part of the proceeds to finance her children's education. She is a member of the Ruth Trust community group . In this group, members guarantee for one another as social collateral to access loans and provide peer pressure to repay the loans.

loans.use: To buy more raw materials, like maize, cassava, plantains, meat, fish, and firewood.

loans.name: Afia

texts.en:
Afia G. is sixty years of age. She is married and has given birth to ten children – seven daughters and three sons. Some of the children are in the senior high school while others are in the junior high school. She lives with her husband and children in a rented apartment in a very busy commercial town called Goaso in the Brong Ahafo Region of Ghana.

Afia is a trader. She sells maize. She buys bags of maize from nearby farming communities and sells it in the community market. She supplies maize to food vendors in her community and treks to other towns to sell.

Afia has been in business for twelve years and wants a loan to procure bags of maize in bulk. She hopes to expand her business and increase her profit margin. It is Afia’s desire to sponsor her children to high levels in school.

loans.use: To buy bags of maize

loans.name: Patricia

texts.en:
Patricia is 29 years old. She is a wife and the mother of three children who are currently in school. She operates a shop that has sold lace, linen, women slippers, dressing bags, and head scarves for the past seven years.

Patricia's ability to run her business is constrained by lack of funds. She needs a loan to enable her to inject more working capital into the business. She believes the loan will help her to purchase good quality in large quantities and to upgrade her inventory. With the loan, she wants to purchase lace, ladies' wear, head scarves and slippers.

Patricia belongs to the “Kronkron” (holy) Trust community group. Members of this group guarantee for one another as social collateral to access loans and provide peer pressure to repay the loans.

loans.use: To purchase lace, ladies' wear, headscarves and slippers to sell

loans.name: Aliatu

texts.en:
Aliatu H. is thirty-nine years of age. She is married and has given birth to three children – two daughters and one son. Some of the children are in the senior high school while others are in the junior high and the primary schools. She lives with her husband and children in a rented apartment in a very busy commercial town called Goaso in the Brong Ahafo Region of Ghana.

Aliatu is a trader. She sells maize. She buys bags of maize from nearby farming communities and sells it in the community market. She supplies maize to food vendors in her community and treks to other towns to sell on their market days.

Aliatu has been in business for twelve years and wants a loan to buy bags of maize in bulk. Aliatu hopes to expand her business and increase her profit margin. It is her desire to sponsor her children to high levels in school.

loans.use: To buy bags of maize

loans.name: Jiguisèmè1 Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe Jiguisseme 1  est un regroupement de femmes du village de Kampogosso dans la préfecture de San (quatrième région administrative du Mali) qui se connaissent bien par des relations de voisinage. Elles  vivent dans des grandes familles traditionnelles élargies avec leurs maris, autres parents, coépouses et enfants. Elles sont toutes mariées,  ont en moyenne 38 ans et au moins 6 enfants. 
Elles cultivent principalement  l’arachide et le maïs.
Pour satisfaire leurs besoins de semences, d’intrants et de petits  matériels agricoles, pour cette culture d’arachide et de maïs sur plus  d’une dizaine  d’hectares, les membres du groupe ont décidé d’intégrer le programme crédit de Soro Yiriwaso il y a deux  ans (deux prêts de campagne). Les deux prêts précédents ont  été correctement remboursés. 
Le prêt actuel sera utilisé pour acheter, des sacs d’arachide, de maïs, d’engrais  et des petits matériels agricoles au marché de Kimparana.
Après l’hivernage, les récoltes sont stockées pendant un temps pour qu’elles aient de la valeur avant d’être  vendues. 
Elles vendent les céréales  dans tous les marchés qui sont aux environs de Kimparana et au grand marché de San à une clientèle riche et variée. 
Les femmes du groupe Jiguisseme 1 comptent réaliser un bénéfice de 50 000 F CFA chacune après les récoltes.  
En plus du remboursement des prêts, elles utiliseront une partie du revenu  pour faire face aux dépenses courantes de la famille.
texts.en:
The group Jiguisseme 1 brings together women from the village of Kampogosso in the prefecture of San (fourth administrative region of Mali) who are well known to each other because they are neighbors. They live in big extended traditional families with their husbands, other relatives, co-spouses and children. They are all married with an average age of 38 and at least 6 children. They mainly grow peanuts and maize.

To satisfy their needs in terms of seed, intrants, and other agricultural necessities for this cultivation of peanuts and maize on more than 10 hectares, the members of the group decided to join the loan program of Soro Yiriwaso two years ago (two rural loans). The two preceding loans have been correctly reimbursed. This loan will be used to buy sacks of peanuts, maize, fertilizer, and other minor agricultural necessities in the marketplace at Kimparana.

After the hot rainy season, the harvests are stocked for a time so that they will be more valuable when sold. They sell the cereals in all the marketplaces around Kimparana and the big open-air market of San to a rich and varied clientele.

Each of the women of the Jiguisseme 1 group expects to make a profit of 50,000 F CFA after the harvest. Besides reimbursing the loan, they will use a part of that income to cover everyday expenses for their families.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase of intrants, seeds, and minor agricultural materials

loans.name: Comfort

texts.en:
Comfort T. is thirty-three years of age. She is married and has given birth to three children – one daughter and two sons. Some of the children are in the senior high school while others are in the junior high and the primary schools. She lives with her husband and children in a rented apartment in a very busy commercial town called Goaso in the Brong Ahafo Region of Ghana.

Comfort is a trader. She sells maize. She buys bags of maize from nearby farming communities and sells it in the community market. Comfort supplies maize to food vendors in her community and treks to other towns to sell on their market days. She has been in business for ten years and wants a loan to buy bags of maize in bulk.

Comfort hopes to expand her business and increase her profit margin. It is her desire to sponsor her children to high levels in school.

loans.use: To buy bags of maize

loans.name: Cynthia

texts.en:
Cynthia Amoquando is 45 years old. She is married and has six children who are all in school. She is a very hard-working and resourceful mother.

Cynthia sells oranges in her neighborhood. She buys her oranges from farmers in nearby villages and supplies them to her customers. She peels them and arranges them on a metal stand to attract customers.

She wants to use the loan to buy more oranges to avoid frequent traveling to the farms. She hopes to increase her savings to pay her children’s educational fees. She belongs to the community group called “Kronkron” (holy) Trust Group. In this group, members guarantee for one another as social collateral to repay their loans.

loans.use: To buy more oranges in bulk

loans.name: Afia

texts.en:
Afia A. is thirty-eight years of age. She is married and has given birth to two children, one daughter and one son. Both of her children are in the primary school. She lives with her husband and children in a rented apartment in a very busy commercial town called Goaso in the Brong Ahafo Region of Ghana.

Afia is a trader. She sells maize. She buys bags of maize from nearby farming communities and sells in the community market. She supplies maize to the food vendors in her community and also treks to other towns to sell.

Afia has been in business for over twenty years. She wants a loan to buy bags of maize in bulk. She hopes to expand her business and increase her profit margin. It is Afia’s desire to sponsor her children to high levels in school.

loans.use: To buy maize in bulk

loans.name: Grace

texts.en:
Grace is fifty-four years old. She is divorced and has five children who are all currently in school. She lives with her family in Kasoa in the central part of Ghana.

Grace sells palm oil and palm nuts in the local market in Kasoa. Grace buys the palm nuts from farmers in her community and in surrounding villages. She wants a loan to buy palm fruits in bulk so that she can distribute them to more of her customers.

Grace belongs to a trust bank group called God’s Blessings. The group members guarantee for one another as collateral to access the loan.

loans.use: To buy a bulk supply of palm nut fruits.

loans.name: Asana

texts.en:
Asana A. is forty-four years of age. She is married and has given birth to five children, one daughter and four sons. Some of her children are in the senior high school while others are in the junior high and the primary schools. She lives with her husband and children in a family house in a very busy commercial town called Goaso in the Brong Ahafo Region of Ghana.

Asana is a trader. She sells maize. She buys bags of maize from nearby farming communities and sells in the community market. She supplies maize to food vendors in her community and also treks to other towns to sell. Asana has been in business for over twenty years and wants a loan to buy bags of maize in bulk. She hopes to expand her business and increase her profit margin so she can help her husband provide for their family.

loans.use: To buy bags of maize

loans.name: Vivian

texts.en:
Vivian T. is twenty-nine years of age. She is divorced and has given birth to three children, one daughter and two sons. All of her children are currently in the primary school. Vivian lives with her children in a rented apartment in a very busy commercial town called Goaso in the Brong Ahafo Region of Ghana.

Vivian is a trader. She sells maize. Vivian buys bags of maize from nearby farming communities and sells in the community market. She supplies maize to food vendors in her community and also treks to other towns to sell.

Vivian has been in business for five years and wants a loan to buy bags of maize in bulk. She hopes to expand her business and increase her profit margin. It is her desire to sponsor her children to high levels in school.

loans.use: To buy bags of maize

loans.name: Renacer Ayar Maca Group

texts.es:
Los socios del banco comunal “RENACER AYAR MACA”, viven en la comunidad Ayar Maca desde su nacimiento, ellos están situados a 20 minutos en auto de la localidad de Chincheros y ubicados a 1 hora de la ciudad del Cusco.

Nuestros socios alternan sus diferentes actividades del hogar, con la agricultura, ganadería y el comercio minorista, dentro del comercio ellos tienen la venta de tubérculos, animales menores, tales como las aves de coral y cuyes. Los socios solicitan el préstamo para poder reinvertir en sus mismos negocios, como capital de trabajo y así seguir superándose día a día y mejorando su calidad de vida el de ellos y de sus propias familias.

Los socios agradecen y valoran el préstamo otorgado mediante este medio y se comprometen en cumplir con el pago definitivo de sus de sus deudas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
The members of the communal bank "Renacer Ayar Maca" have lived in the Ayar Maca community since birth. They are located a 20-minute car ride from Chincheros and one hour from the city of Cusco. The members alternate their domestic activities with agriculture, livestock and retail, including the sale of tubers and small animals like fowl and guinea pigs. The members are seeking this loan in order to reinvest working capital in their own businesses, and thus continuing improving their quality of life and that of their families day after day. The members are grateful for this loan and value this lending method. They promise to repay their debt within the established timeline.

Translated from Spanish by Trisha Bury, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: TO BUY GOODS

loans.name: Efua

texts.en: Efua B. sells smoked fish in Elmina. Efua has received a primary-school education. She is married and has seven dependents. Her husband is a commercial driver who lives on a small income. Efua has been selling smoked fish since 1997. She supports the children in paying their school fees. Her loan will be used to buy more fresh fish to sell. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to save and build a house.

loans.use: Her loan will be used to buy more fresh fish to sell

loans.name: Zansi

texts.fr: K. Zansi est née le 15/08/1969 à Ekpè dans la Commune de Sèmè-Kpodji. Zansi est marié à KEGNIDE William, un soudeur de profession. Zansi et William ont trois enfants tous scolarisés et avec lesquels ils vivent à Cotonou, Capitale Économique du Bénin. C'est du poissons fumés que Zansi vend. Zansi passe de ménage en ménage, le plateau de poisson sur la tête pour vendre ses poissons. Zansi a déjà bénéficié de deux crédits pour renforcer son activité. Zansi a bien remboursé ces crédits et a pu amener à un stade supérieur son activité. Zansi veut un troisième crédit pour augmenter le volume de son activité. .
texts.en:
K. Zansi was born on August 15, 1969 in Ekpè, in the town of Sèmè-Kpodji. She is married to KEGNIDE William, a welder by profession. Zansi and William have three children, all in school. They all live together in Cotonou, the economic capital of Benin. Smoked fish is what Zansi sells, going from household to household, with a tray of fish on her head. She has already benefited from two loans for bolstering her business. She has repaid these loans and was able to bring her business to a higher level. She wants a third loan to increase her business volume.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy five boxes of fish and some firewood

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: TO BUY GOODS

loans.name: Porvenir Group

texts.es:
El comité Porvenir esta en el segundo ciclo del programa de Mujeres Emprendadoras de Fundacion Paraguaya.  Ellas tienen un ahorro de Gs.550.000.  Todas son señoras muy trabajadoras y responsables, que viven en el barrio San Luis de Capiata.  Ayudan a su barrio con actividades quincenales y también a las personas que necesitan dentro del comité.

Las integrantes son: 

Evarista G..	Venta de chipas.
Nancy L..	Venta de carteras.
Placida Ferreira.	Venta de joyas .
Lorena A..	Venta de frutas.
Sonia G..	Venta de comidas.
Marta G..	Venta de comidas.
Julia R..	Venta de artesanias.
Benicia Nuñez.	Costurera.
Del Pilar M..	Venta de ropas para niños.
Rumilda G..	Venta de comidas.
Fraxedes R..	Despensa.
Basilica C..	Venta de comestible.
Norma O..	Trabaja en una fruteria, venta de cosmeticos.
Mabel V..	Venta  de bebidas.
Celina R..	Venta de ropas.
Victoria M..	Venta de ropas.
texts.en:
The Porvenir committee is in its second loan cycle with the Entrepreneurial Women program of Fundacion Paraguaya. They have saved Gs. 550.00 and they are all hardworking, responsible women that live in the San Luis neighborhood of Capiata. They help their neighborhood by holding activities every 15 days and they also help out other committee members when needed. The members are: Evarista G.. Sells chipas (cheese bread) Nancy L.. Sells wallets. Placida Ferreira. Sells jewelry. Lorena A.. Sells fruit. Sonia G.. Sells prepared food. Marta G.. Sells prepared food. Julia R.. Sells handicrafts. Benicia Nuñez. Seamstress. Del Pilar M.. Sells children’s clothes. Rumilda G.. Sells prepared food. Fraxedes R.. Grocery store. Basilica C.. Sells food. Norma O.. Works in a fruit stand and sells cosmetics. Mabel V.. Sells drinks. Celina R.. Sells clothes. Victoria M.. Sells clothes.

Translated from Spanish by Rachel Crouch, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: various: food, jewelry, supplies, drinks, etc

loans.name: Mujeres Unidas Group

texts.es:
El comité Mujeres Unidas nace gracias al a señora María L. quien con mucho entusiasmo informo a sus vecinas y amigas acerca del proyecto comité de mujeres.  Ellas estuvieron muy contentas y puntuales en sus reuniones, plantaron el arbolito, y se comprometieron a ser un grupo responsable y solidario. Ellas están en el primer ciclo del programa de la Fundacion Paraguaya. 

Las integrantes del grupo son: 

María L..	Peluquera.
Ceferina A..	Venta de carteras.
Mercedes Tilleria.	Venta de joyas y ropas.
Zunilda A..	Venta de frutas, verduras.
Cristina A..	Venta de comidas.
Carmen A..	Venta de comidas.
Felicita P..	Venta de escobas.
Ramona A..	Costurera.
Ingrit C..,	Venta de ropas para niños.
Dionisia A.	Venta de comidas.
Cristina C..	Copetín.
Norma C..	Venta de comestible.
Valeria A..	Venta de cosméticos.
Luciana S..	Venta  de merceria
María C..	Venta de bijuterie.
texts.en:
The Mujers Unidas (United Women) group is born thanks to Mrs. Maria L. who, with a lot of enthusiasm, informed her neighbors and friends about this women’s group. They were all content and punctual at their meetings, and they planted a small tree and promised to be a responsible group in solidarity. This is their first loan with Fundacion Paraguaya. The members of the group are: María L.. Hair Salon Ceferina A.. Sells wallets. Mercedes Tilleria. Sells jewelry and clothes. Zunilda A.. Sells fruits and vegetables. Cristina A.. Sells food. Carmen A.. Sells food. Felicita P.. Sells brooms. Ramona A.. Seamstress. Ingrit C.., Sells children’s clothes. Dionisia A. Sells food. Cristina C.. Sells drinks. Norma C.. Sells food. Valeria A.. Sells cosmetics. Luciana S.. Retail. María C.. Retail.

Translated from Spanish by Rachel Crouch, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: various:  food, jewelry, vegetables, drinks, materials, etc

loans.name: Agueda

texts.en:
Mrs. Agueda J. is 45 years old and married. She has lived for a long time in her own home that is located in the Arroyo Pora Vivienda neighborhood of the Cambyreta district.

Mrs. Agueda is the owner of a dress shop that she has in her home, where she also recently started a small kiosk, or a drink stand. She makes dress garments, especially uniforms that are ordered because of the large number of private schools in the area. With this work, she can maintain her home and cover costs. She has children that work for her and also help her mother. Her husband works in the city of Buenos Aires and comes home every once in a while. He also contributes to the family income.

Mrs. Agueda is currently asking for credit in order to buy fabric, as she already has many orders for uniforms for the parade on May 14th. She is applying for 2,000,000 Gs.

loans.use: The purchase of fabric

loans.name: Aura Del Socorro

texts.es: Doña Aura es soltera, de 43 años de edad, tiene 3 hijos, todos casados, habita con una hija, pero quiere construir un cuarto para darle privacidad a su hija.  Trabaja como conserje desde hace 11 años en la escuela de San Patricio, es reconocida por sus compañeras de labores como una persona muy honesta y responsable iniciando por su trabajo, esta solicitando su 5to credito para iniciar con la construccion de un cuarto, ya que necesita una independencia en casa de su hija, esta tiene su compañero quien le ayuda con los gastos del hogar, sus creditos anteriores los cancelo en tiempo y forma sin presentar atrasos.  Su horario de trabajo es de 7:00 am. a 5:00 pm. de lunes a viernes, su entrada es a esa hora porque deja hecho el trabajo desde el dia anterior.

loans.use: Iniciar construccion de un cuarto

loans.name: Cerefina

texts.en:
Mrs. Ceferina A. is 43 years old and has been married for many years to Mr. Seferino Alvarenga. They live in their own house that is located in the Chaipe district of the city of Encarnacion.

Mrs. Ceferina is the owner of a local business that sells drinks and basic goods. This business is located in her house and is attended by her as well as her daughter, who helps out. With this job, she can maintain the family and cover the costs that present themselves. Her husband is a construction worker and thanks to his job, he can also contribute to covering the costs of the home.

Mrs. Ceferina is currently applying for credit to invest in her business space due to the fact that she has many clients and would like to have it well stocked. The amount applied for is 2,000,000 Gs.

loans.use: The purchase of beverages and basic necessities

loans.name: Cleto

texts.en:
Mr. Cleto P. is 44 years old and has been married to Mrs. Carmen Servin for quite some time. They live in their own home in the Santa Rita district of San Juan del Parana. Mr. Cleto is a taxi driver and has been working for many years in this vocation. He owns his own vehicle. Because of this job, he has always been able to sustain the family and has been able to bring peace to the family, covering all of the costs that present themselves.

Mr. Cleto is currently applying for credit for the maintenance of his car. It is in the middle of its usable life and needs to be in good condition in order for him to give good service. The amount applied for is 3,000,000 Gs.

loans.use: Car repairs

loans.name: Guillermina

texts.es: La señora Guillermina tiene 60 años.  Ella se dedica a proveer de materiales para las oficinas de las Fuerzas Armadas, Camara de Diputados y Algunos Ministerios del Estado.  Ella es divorciada y cuenta con 2 (dos) hijos ya mayores quienes la ayudan en el trabajo. La misma se iniciò con una oficina en la Ciudad de San Lorenzo y ahora ya esta continuando con su actual emprendiendo  de abrir la segunda oficina en el interior del paìs. El crédito será de ayuda para seguir adelante con su negocio, y poder ampliar su empresa.
texts.en:
Guillermina is 60 years old. She provides office supplies to the offices of the Armed Forces, Legislature and some of the State Departments. She is divorced and has 2 grown children who help her with her job. She began her business with an office in the city of San Lorenzo and she continues it now by opening a second office in the interior of her country. The loan will help her move her business forward and allow her to expand her company.

Translated from Spanish by Rachel Crouch, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Office supplies like folders, paper, envelopes, etc.

loans.name: Elisa

texts.en: This applicant is Mrs. Elisa F., a widow who owns her own house and lives with her two older children. The children have professional jobs with fixed salaries, which helps to diminish the family's expenses.  She is an entrepreneur, as she is the owner of a small grocery store and also runs a diner that feeds about 15 people per day.  These have been open for three years and have allowed her to earn a good income. She applied for 3,000,000 Gs over 12 months to buy flour, herbs, sugar and oil from the city of Posadas, where things are cheaper, in order to gain a larger profit from her operation.

loans.use: The purchase of basic goods for sale

loans.name: Maria Eulogia

texts.es:
La señora María Eulogia tiene 23años.  Está casada con el Señor Cristhian Román y ellos tienen un hijo menor de edad. Ellos tienen una despensa en su domicilio desde el año 2006. Venden todo tipo de productos comestibles, bebidas, alimentos a granel, entre otros. El Señor Cristhian posee un pequeño equipamiento de discoteca, el cual alquila los fines de semana a pequeños eventos del barrio, también se dedica a la poda de arboles para la ANDE (Administración Nacional de Electricidad).

Este crédito será de mucha utilidad para aumentar el stock de mercaderías en la despensa, así como también para la adquisición de una consola para el equipamiento de discoteca,, con lo cual podrán generar mejores ingresos para su familia y podrán cumplir lentamente su anhelo de terminar la construcción de su casa.
texts.en:
Ms. María Eulogia is a 23-year-old woman who is married to Mr. Cristhian Román, with whom she has a young son. She and her husband have run a general store in their home since 2006. They sell all types of edible products, drinks, and food in bulk, among other goods. Mr. R. has his own D.J. equipment, which he rents on weekends for neighborhood events. He also provides tree trimming services for the ANDE (National Electricity Administration).

This loan will be useful in increasing inventory for his general store, as well as purchasing a mixer for his D.J. equipment, with which he will be able to generate better profits for his family so that they can slowly realize their dream of finishing construction of their house.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase goods for general store

loans.name: Ferdinand's Group

texts.en: M. Ferdinand is the leader of the Bulera development group. He is a hardworking elderly man and an achiever. Ferdinand is a farmer with sugarcane plantations, pineapples, matooke, beans, maize, and plantains as well as keeping animals like pigs, cows, poultry and sheep; that is why his home is always full of commotion, both from people and animals. He started his businesses in 1970 after he resigned from work in the tea factories. He started very small, and a few years down the road, he did not regret his move. But again, life these days is more favorable, as he is able to get money to employ labor on his farms as well as paying school fees for his children and grand children. He is a married man with 7 children, 3 of whom are still in school. He also pays school fees for 5 grandchildren, since their parents past on. He is grateful that most of his customers come to him for their produce; hence, he does not have to incur more costs on transport, regardless of his old age. In all his businesses, he works hand in hand with his wife and together they have managed to come this far. Ferdinand needs a loan to hire more manpower on his farms for quick and better crop yields, and paying school fees.

loans.use: Hire labor on his farms and pay school fees for his children and grandchildren

loans.name: Claudio

texts.es: Claudio tiene 42 años, vive con su esposa y sus 8 hijos en su casa propia. Desde hace 20 años se dedica a la siembra de papa con la ayuda de su familia, a pesar de lo difícil de su labor y de las largas jornadas bajo el intenso sol, Claudio disfruta de su trabajo, el cual luego de 6 meses aproximadamente ve los frutos durante sus cosechas. Por ello considera muy importante cuidar el proceso de crecimiento de sus plantas, y esta dedicación hacia la agricultura se la ha transmitido a sus hijos. Para más adelante, Claudio quiere adquirir otros terrenos de cultivo para aumentar su producción. Esta  es la primera vez que tiene un préstamo con MFP, y está conformando su banco comunal porque desea seguir creciendo como persona y aprender sobre el trabajo en equipo. Con el dinero solicitado es para la compra de abono para la fertilización de sus tierras.
texts.en:
Claudio is a 42-year-old man who lives with his wife and 8 children in his own home. For 20 years, he has been growing potatoes with the help of his family. Despite how difficult it is and despite his long workdays under the intense sun, Claudio enjoys his job, whose fruits he sees after about 6 months. For this reason, he thinks it is important to watch over the growth of his crops, and he has transmitted this dedication to agriculture to his children. In the future, Claudio would like to obtain more crop fields in order to increase production. This is the first time that he requests a loan from MFP, and he is joining this microfinance institute because he hopes to keep growing as a person and learn about teamwork. The money that he is requesting will be used to purchase fertilizer for his crop fields.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase fertilizer

loans.name: Germán

texts.es: German tiene 45  años, vive con su esposa y su pequeño hijo en su casa propia. Desde su niñez se ha dedicado a las tareas agrícolas, y ahora es la actividad con la que sostiene a su familia. Con la ayuda de su esposa, trabaja muy duro para que sus cosechas les traigan buenas ganancias, cultiva principalmente papa. Adicionalmente, cría ovejas, las cuales lleva muy lejos para que se alimenten en pastizales frescos, esta labor del pastoreo también requiere de mucho esfuerzo físico, pues la distancia que tiene que caminar le lleva alrededor de 3 horas. German está planeando para el futuro continuar con sus actividades agrícolas y ganaderas, con una mayor inversión para aumentar su producción. Esta es la primera vez que esta solicitando un préstamo con MFP, y su experiencia en su banco comunal también es nueva, y hasta el momento está muy satisfecho. El dinero que solicita será para la compra de sacos de abono para su próxima siembra, y debido a que es una cantidad grande lo que necesita, el dinero que le falte, lo podrá él mismo de sus ahorros.
texts.en:
German is a 45-year-old man who lives with his wife and young son in their own home. Ever since his childhood, he has been involved in agriculture, and today, this is the activity with which he supports his family. With the help of his wife, he works very hard so that his crops will bring him good earnings. He grows mainly potatoes. Additionally, he raises sheep, which he takes to far distances so that they can feed on fresh pastures. Shepherding also requires physical effort because the distance he has to walk takes around 3 hours. German is planning to continue with his agricultural and cattle ranching businesses in the future, hoping to invest more in order to increase production. This is the first time that he requests a loan from MFP. This is also his first experience with a microfinance institute, and he is satisfied up until now.
