The money that he is requesting will be used to purchase sacks of fertilizer for his next sowing season. Because of the large amount of fertilizer that he needs, he will pay with his own savings for whatever the loan will not cover.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase fertilizer for crop fields

loans.name: Ever Ignacio

texts.en:
The participant is Mr. Ever G., 23, accompanied by Mrs. Alicia, 30.  They have a newborn son and live in a house owned by their parents. They also have their own land, on which they are building a house.

Mr. Ever began working very young, and worked for someone else for approximately two years until he realized that he could not excel. He then became self-employed, and has been working for four years selling clothing and footwear for women, men and children.  He has been selling throughout the Encarnación and Cambyreta area, and the business is going pretty well.

The loan will go toward the purchase of seasonal goods to sell.  As the cold season is coming, he needs jackets and pullovers, and does not want to lose any clients.

loans.use: To purchase goods for sale

loans.name: Neder

texts.es: Neder tiene 23 años, vive con sus padres en la casa de ellos. Creció en una familia de agricultores realizando las tareas del campo, y ahora es el brazo derecho de sus padres que ya son ancianos, por lo que actualmente es el sostén de su casa. Neder se encarga del cuidado de cada uno de sus cultivos para que sus productos sean bien cotizados al momento de su comercialización; asimismo poseen vacas, por las que él también vela para que produzcan abundante leche y de buena calidad, que a su vez vende. Con estas actividades, es que Neder genera los recursos económicos para su familia. Este es su primer crédito con MFP, y por lo tanto, ser parte de un banco comunal es una nueva experiencia para él, pero desde que comenzó, ha hecho votos de ser responsable con sus pagos y con las actividades encomendadas por su asesor de crédito. El dinero que solicita será para la compra de fertilizantes y medicinas para sus tierras de cultivo, y debido a que el costo es mayor, Neder cubrirá el monto faltante con sus ahorros.
texts.en:
Neder is 23 years old and lives with his parents. He grew up in an agricultural family, working the fields. He is now his parents’ right hand because they are elderly, which means that he is the breadwinner of the household. Neder is in charge of taking care of each one of his crops so that they can be sold at a good price. They also own cows that he looks after so that they can produce abundant amounts of good quality milk for him to sell. With these two jobs, Neder earns a living for his family. This is his first loan with MFP. As such, being part of a microfinance institute is a new experience for him, but since he joined, he has vowed to be responsible with his payments and with the activities entrusted in him by his credit consultant. The money will be used to purchase fertilizer and other products for his crop fields. Because these are expensive things, Neder will have to pay for the rest of the costs with his own savings.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase fertilizer and other products for crop fields

loans.name: Jose

texts.es:
Mr. Jose G. T. is 60 years old, and has been married to Mrs. Claudelina Nuñez for many years.  They live in their own home in the neighborhood Arroyo Pora Vivienda from the Cambyreta district. 

Mr. G. is the owner of a stand that sells underwear and socks for men in the lower part of the city Encarnación.  He has been doing this for over 10 years.  Additionally, at night he works as a night watchman for various local businesses in the same zone.  Due to his two jobs, he has been able to sustain his family and has been able to settle any expenses that present themselves. 

This man is currently applying for credit in order to purchase more goods and to increase his capital for work, as he already has a large clientele that buys from his stand.  The amount applied for is 2,000,000 Gs.

loans.use: The purchase of goods for sale

loans.name: Cheril

texts.es: Cheril tiene 26 años, es madre soltera de un hijo de 8 años, quien desarrolla sus estudios primarios y en sus tiempos libres la apoya mucho. Desde hace 2 años se dedica a la venta de diversos platos de comida, durante las noches, en un espacio que acondiciona diariamente fuera de su vivienda, además cuenta con el apoyo de una de sus hermanas como ayudante de cocina. Le gusta mucho su trabajo porque se siente útil y activa, además que entabla muy bonitas amistades con sus comensales recurrentes, quienes aprecian su buena sazón. Cheril considera que su negocio es rentable porque se encuentra ubicada en un lugar por donde transitan muchas personas, y es la única con este tipo de negocio, entones no tiene competencia, por lo que le va muy bien. Posteriormente, quiere mandar a construir un local para instalar su restaurante, y así tener un espacio más cómodo, tanto para ella, como para sus clientes. Esta es la primera vez que tiene un crédito con MFP, y está muy entusiasmado con el  trabajo de su banco comunal porque desde su formación todos se han comprometido a ser muy responsables con sus pagos y con las labores encomendadas por su asesor de crédito. Con el dinero que solicita comprará cubiertos y otros utensilios de cocina, tales como ollas, platos, tazas y otros.
texts.en:
Cheril, 26, is a single mother. Her eight year old son is in elementary school, and in his free time he helps her a lot. For two years she has been selling various dishes (food) in the evenings. She sets up a space outside of her home every day. One of her sisters helps her in the kitchen. She really likes her work because she feels useful and active. Also, she makes nice friendships with her regular customers who appreciate her flavorful food. Cheril thinks her business is profitable because it is located in a well traveled area. Also, she is the only one with this type of business, so she does not have competition. Things are going well. In the future she wants to build a place for her restaurant. Then she would have a more comfortable space, not just for her, but for her customers as well. This is her first loan with MFP. She is very enthusiastic about her community bank’s work. From the beginning they have promised to be very responsible with their payments and with the work entrusted to them by their loan consultant. With the loan she will buy cutlery and other kitchen utensils such as pots, plates, cups, and others.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy kitchen utensils

loans.name: Cheryl

texts.es: Cheryl tiene 25 años, vive con su pareja, quien se dedica al transporte de pasajeros, y tienen un pequeño hijo que ya va al colegio. La casa donde están viviendo por el momento, es de su suegra. Desde hace 2 años se dedica a la venta de “juanes”, platillo típico de la selva peruana, hecho a base de carne de pollo, arroz, aceitunas y huevo, envueltos en una hoja especial. Este platillo lo vende en la parte de afuera de un aserradero, donde sus principales consumidores son las personas que trabajan allí. Para esta labor, Cheryl cuenta con el apoyo de su suegra, y le gusta mucho su trabajo porque se relaciona con todo tipo de personas, y sobre todo, porque le es muy rentable, ya que todas las porciones que hace, se venden fácilmente. Para más adelante, Cheryl quiere alquilar un local e instalar un restaurante que se especialice sólo en platos regionales, como el juane. Este es su 4to crédito con MFP, y le gusta trabajar con su grupo porque sus compañeros y compañeras son solidarios y muy responsables en sus pagos. Con el dinero que solicita comprará los ingredientes e insumos necesarios para incrementar su producción y venta de juanes.
texts.en:
25-year old Cheryl lives with her husband who works in transportation. They have a small son who attends school. The house they live in at the moment belongs to Cheryl’s mother-in-law. For the last two years Cheryl has been selling ‘juanes’, a dish traditionally eaten in the Peruvian rainforest. It’s made from chicken, rice, olives, and eggs and wrapped in a special leaf. She sells the juanes outside a sawmill so the majority of her customers are the people who work there. Her mother-in-law also helps with the work. Cheryl enjoys her job because she gets to meet lots of people, and most importantly, because it’s a very profitable business—the juanes that she makes sell easily. In the future Cheryl wants to rent premises and open a restaurant specializing in local dishes like juanes. This is her fourth loan with Kiva partner, MFP. She enjoys working with the group because her fellow members are supportive and reliable with their repayments. She will use the loan to buy the ingredients and supplies needed to increase production and sale of juanes.

Translated from Spanish by Jane Agg, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy ingredients to make juanes, a local delicacy

loans.name: Diana

texts.es: Diana tiene 28 años, vive junto a su pareja y padre de sus 2 hijos, quien es profesor y trabaja en una institución educativa de su localidad. Desde hace un año se viene dedicando a la venta de zapatos para damas, los cuales vende al contado o al crédito, encargándose de visitar constantemente a sus clientas, tanto para ofrecer nuevos modelos, como para hacer sus cobrazas. Diana se esmera mucho en dar un buen trato a sus clientas, y está al pendiente de que los zapatos que ofrezca sean de buena calidad para que no tenga reclamos luego de su venta; por ello, ha aprendido mucho acerca de materiales y modelos de calzado. Pero para este negocio, Diana no está sola, ya que cuenta con la ayuda de su cuñada, con quien incrementa sus ventas grandemente, generando juntas muy buenos ingresos. Su deseo a futuro es tener es tener un local para instalar una zapatería. Este es su primer préstamo con MFP, y está muy interesada en aprender más acerca del trabajo en equipo que se fomenta en su banco comunal, además que desde su formación ha habido mucha coordinación y comunicación entre todos. Con el dinero que solicita comprará más zapatos para mantener sus ventas en constante crecimiento.
texts.en:
Diana, 28, lives with her husband and their two children. Her husband is a professor, and he works in an educational institution in their area. For one year she has been selling shoes for women. She sells for cash or credit. She visits her customers regularly to offer new styles and to make collections. Diana takes great care in treating her customers well. She is dependent upon the good quality of the shoes that she sells so that there will be no complaints after a sale. For this reason, she has learned a lot about the materials and styles of footwear. She is not alone in her business. Her sister-in-law, with whom sales increase tremendously, works with her. Together they generate very good incomes. In the future, she would like to have a place to set up a shoe store. This is her first loan with MFP. She is very interested in learning more about working as a team as encouraged by her community bank. From the beginning there has been a lot of coordination and communication between all of them. The loan is to buy more shoes to be able to keep up with her sales that are constantly growing.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase merchandise

loans.name: Maria Betina

texts.en: The applicant is Mrs. Maria Benita E., who is married and owns her own home in the Asentamiento de Nuevea district of Amanecer San Miguel Cambyreta.  She is a businesswoman who owns her own grocery store. The store is two years old, with a large inventory of goods.  She has a well-established clientele and has a steady income.  The client applied for our assistance so that she can buy basic goods such as sugar, oil, flour and herbs from the city Posadas, where products are cheaper, and the sale of them would give her a larger profit.

loans.use: The purchase of goods for sale (oil, herbs, sugar, etc)

loans.name: Gemima

texts.es: Gemima tiene 33 años, vive junto a su esposo y sus dos hijos, quienes cursan estudios primarios. Desde hace un año se dedica a la venta de pescado de forma ambulatoria por los distintos lugares de su zona. Trabaja desde las 6 de la mañana hasta las 11, y por las tardes vende vasitos con gelatina y chupetes en un parque cercano a su casa. A Gemima le gusta mucho su trabajo porque se mantiene activa, y su esfuerzo se debe al deseo de sacar a delante a sus hijos. Su negocio le es rentable porque cuenta con clientes regulares que constantemente le compran pescado, por otro lado, los postres y chupetes que ofrece, se venden muy rápido debido al clima caluroso de su región. Para más adelante, Gemima quiere mandar a construir un kiosco para vender con mayor tranquilidad sus productos, y dejar de caminar y exponerse al terrible sol. Con MFP, ya tiene 3 préstamos, y está muy contento con su banco comunal porque todos compañeros y compañeras trabajan responsable y solidariamente. Su esposo se dedica a proveer de pescado a los puestos de uno de los mercados de su ciudad, él vende al por mayor; y con el dinero que Gemima viene solicitando, incrementará tanto la mercadería de su esposo, como la cantidad que ella vende personalmente.
texts.en:
33-year old Gemima lives with her husband and their two children who attend primary school. For the last year she has been working as a street vendor selling fish in various places in the area. She does this work from six to eleven in the morning, and in the afternoons she sells jello and lollipops in a park close to her house. Gemima enjoys her work as it keeps her active; she puts in a lot of effort because of her wish to make a better life for her children. Her business is profitable as she has regular customers who buy fish from her, and also the desserts and lollipops sell very quickly because of the region’s hot climate. In the future, Gemima wants to have a stall built so that she can sell her products more peacefully, and not have to walk the streets in the terrible sun. She has already had three loans with Kiva partner, MFP, and is very happy with the community bank because all her fellow members work hard and are reliable. Her husband’s job is to provide the fish for the stalls at one of the markets in the town; he sells the fish at wholesale prices. With the loan Gemima plans to both increase her husband’s products and also the amount that she herself sells.

Translated from Spanish by Jane Agg, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy more merchandise

loans.name: Godfrey's Group

texts.en: M. Godfrey is a hardworking young man and the leader of Bulera development group. He has run a business of transporting goods by motorcycle for a period of 6 years now, which he started as a young man, soon after he was married. Before this, he was only a farmer. Since farming took a long time to yield produce, he resorted to boda-boda in order to fetch something for his family to eat. Before he could own his motorcycle, he was happy to work for someone else, but with his savings, he now owns a motorcycle of his own. His wife mostly manages the workers on their farm as well as caring for their 4 kids, since in most cases, he works late from his stage in Mityana town. Godfrey needs a loan to help with labour on the farm and paying school fees for their 3 school going children.

loans.use: Employing labor on Godfrey's farm and paying school fees.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: TO BUY GOODS

loans.name: Kenelma

texts.es: Kenelma tiene 33 años, vive con su esposo y sus tres hijos, quienes la ayudan en todo lo posible. Ella es una mujer muy activa y con muchos deseos de superación. Desde hace un año se viene dedicando a la venta de productos de belleza por catálogo, con está labor debe visitar de casa en casa a sus clientes recolectando sus pedidos para llegar a su meta mensual de ventas. Kenelma está muy contenta porque gracias a esta actividad ha podido generar los ingresos económicos necesarios, que junto al trabajo de su esposo, alcanzan para solventar las necesidades de su familia, además es una labor que no le toma mucho tiempo. Y gracias a su carisma y jovialidad al vender ha ganado una buena cantidad de clientes regulares, a quienes suele concederles crédito, según la responsabilidad que le demuestren en sus pagos.  Para más adelante, a Kenelma le gustaría tener una tienda de ropa donde también pueda vender variedad de perfumes y cosméticos. Con MFP, ya tiene 6 préstamos, y le gusta ser parte de su banco comunal porque en estos años (3) de trabajo solidario se comprenden muy bien y tienen responsabilidad en sus pagos. El dinero que ahora solicita es para la compra de más productos de belleza y una vitrina de exhibición.
texts.en:
Kenelma, 33, lives with her husband and their three children. They help her as much as possible. She is a very active woman with a great desire to improve. For one year she has been selling beauty products by catalog. In her work she must go house to house to visit her customers to gather her orders. She does this to reach her monthly sales’ goal. Kenelma is very happy. Thanks to this work, along with her husband’s work, she has been able to generate the enough income for the family’s necessities. Also, this work does not take too much time. Thanks to her charm and joviality when selling, she has won a good number of regular customers. She usually gives them credit based on their demonstrated responsibility about paying. In the future she would like to have a clothing store where she could also sell a variety of perfumes and cosmetics. She has had six loans with MFP. She likes being part of her community bank because in her years of working (3) in a supportive manner, they understand each other very well and are responsible about their payments. The loan she is now asking for is to buy more beauty products and a display case.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase merchandise and disply case

loans.name: Leydi

texts.es: Leydi tiene 32 años, es madre soltera y vive con sus dos hijos y su madre. Desde hace 7 años se dedica a la venta de juguetes en todas sus variedades, de forma ambulante, y generalmente afuera de los colegios, contando con la compañía y apoyo de su madre. Lo que le gusta de su trabajo es que conoce varios lugares y muchas veces mantiene conversaciones muy entretenidas con las personas que va conociendo durante su camino. Leydi considera que la rentabilidad de su negocio de debe a que tiene ventas diarias, con las que sostiene las necesidades básicas de su familia. Para el futuro, quiere alquilar un local para su juguetería. Este es su 3er préstamo con MFP, y le gusta trabajar con su banco comunal porque entre todos se apoyan y existe mucha comunicación entre sus miembros. Con el dinero que viene solicitando comprará más juguetes de los últimos modelos para incrementar sus ventas.
texts.en:
Leydi is 32 and a single mother. She lives with her two children and her mother. For seven years she has been selling all types of toys. She is a street vendor, and she generally sells outside of schools. Her mother accompanies her and helps. What she likes about her work is that she knows lots of places, and she often has very engaging conversations with the people that she meets along the way. Leydi thinks her business is profitable because she has daily sales, which support the family’s basic needs. In the future she wants to rent a space for a toy store. This is her third loan with MFP. She likes working with her community bank because they are supportive, and there is good communication between members. The loan she is asking for is to buy more of the latest model toys to increase her sales.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase merchandise

loans.name: Nelly

texts.en: Miss Nelly Vázquez was born in the city of Valenzuela.  She has four older brothers and sisters, one brother who is in the military and three sisters who are nurses.  She now lives in the city of Capiatá with her older sister, Raquel.  She is a businesswoman, and two years ago started a business selling clothes and accessories for women.  She does business out of her house, but also makes her sales in the interior of the country, where she has a large number of clients.  Thanks to the loan given through the Foundation, Nelly hopes to grow her business and consequently her family income.

loans.use: To purchase clothes, accessories, and other goods to sell

loans.name: Zacarias

texts.en: Mr. Zacarias is married and owns his own house with all of the basic necessities of a home. He works delivering breads from a bakery, “The Farm.”  At the same time, he sells basic goods like sugar, herbs, oil, etc.  He is applying for a sum of 3,500,000 Gs which would be used for the purchase of these products from the city of Posadas, where goods are cheaper and he can make a larger profit.

loans.use: The purchase of goods for sale such as oil, herbs, sugar, etc.

loans.name: Miria

texts.es: Miria es madre soltera, tiene 34 años y vive junto a sus 4 hijos en su casa propia. Desde hace 2 años se dedica a la venta de productos de belleza de una línea cosmética muy reconocida, y debido a que es una persona muy dinámica y carismática, no tiene problemas en conseguir fácilmente la cantidad de pedido para lograr su meta mensual. Miria nos cuenta que su principal estrategia para mantener a sus clientes  es atenderlos muy bien, y tratar en lo posible de satisfacer sus necesidades de acuerdo al producto que estén interesados en comprar. Para el futuro, a Miria le gustaría tener, adicionalmente, una tienda donde venda ropa y zapatos, ya que considera que estas prendas y los productos que vende actualmente, se complementan muy bien. Con MFP ya tiene 5 créditos, y le gusta trabajar con su grupo porque todos sus integrantes son buenas personas y responsables en sus pagos. Con el dinero que solicita comprara más productos de belleza, y con otra parte mandará a arreglar algunas estructuras de su casa.
texts.en:
Miria is a single mother of 34 years old, and lives with her 4 children in her own house. For the past 2 years, she has been working as a cosmetics saleswomen for a well-known brand, and due to her dynamism and charisma, she has no problem reaching her monthly sales goals. Miria tells us that her principal strategy to maintain her clients is to serve them very well, and try to satisfy their necessities regarding the product(s) they're interested in purchasing. For the future, Miria would like to have a store where she sells clothes and shoes in addition to her cosmetics, as she believes that these products complement each other very well. She has already received 5 loans through MFP, and she likes to work with her group because all of the group members are good people and responsible with their payments. With the money she currently requests, Miria will buy more cosmetics and also fix up some things in her home.

Translated from Spanish by Scott Lucas, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase business inventory and fix up her home

loans.name: Rosa

texts.es: Rosa tiene 27 años, es madre de 2 hijos y de otro que viene en camino, vive a lado de su esposo en su casa propia. Desde hace un año se viene dedicando a la venta de productos de belleza por catálogo, para poder realizar esta labor tiene que salir constantemente a visitar a sus clientes para recolectar todos los pedidos que la lleven a alcanzar su meta mensual de ventas. A Rosa le gusta ver a sus clientes contentos y satisfechos con los cosméticos que les vende, por ello se preocupa de informarles al detalle de los beneficios de cada tipo de producto para que la elección sea la más adecuada. Por ese tipo de atención es que se ha ganado una gama de clientes regulares, quienes a su vez la recomiendas y así va incrementando sus ventas cada mes. Este es su 3er préstamo con MFP, y le gusta trabajar con su banco comunal porque los integrantes son personas honestas y muy puntuales con sus reuniones de pago. El dinero que solicita es para la compra de más productos de belleza y una vitrina de exhibición donde guardarlos.
texts.en:
Rosa is 27 years old, has 2 children and a 3rd on the way. She lives with her husband in their own home. For the past year, Rosa has been selling cosmetics by catalog. In order to do this work, Rosa has to constantly leave her home to visit her clients and collect their requests in order to reach her monthly sales goal. Rosa likes to see her clients happy with the products they've purchased, and so she tells them everything about each product so the client can choose what will best suit them. Due to the extraordinary attention she gives to her clients, Rosa has a group of regular costumers who recommend her products to other people, and Rosa's sales continue to climb each month. This is her third loan with MFP. She likes to work with her communal bank because its members are honest people, and very timely with their loan repayments. Rosa will use her loan proceeds to purchase more cosmetics, and a glass showcase to display them.

Translated from Spanish by Scott Lucas, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase cosmetics and a glass display case

loans.name: Matilde

texts.en: Mrs. Matilde has been married to Mr. Luciano Torres, with whom she has three children, for 28 years. In 1996, Matilde decided to open her own sewing workshop with the help of her husband, who is a government employee. With few resources, they resorted to the Foundation to apply for credit to buy fabric. Currently Matilde makes military and police uniforms thanks to the circle of friends that her husband, Luciano, has.

loans.use: Purchase of fabric

loans.name: Rosario

texts.es: Rosario tiene 39 años, es madre soltera, vive con sus 2 hijos en su casa propia. Desde hace un año se viene dedicando a la venta de ropa de segundo uso, estas prendas las lleva a los caseríos que se encuentran en zonas alejadas de la ciudad. A Rosario le gusta mucho su trabajo porque puede conocer todos aquellos bonitos lugares llenos de vegetación donde están ubicadas las casas de sus clientes. Además su negocio es rentable, porque su mercadería la compra a precios muy bajos, y sin incrementar mucho el precio, ya que sabe que las personas a las que vende no tienen mucho dinero, aun así obtiene muy buenas ganancias porque en cada viaje todas sus prendas se venden. Para más adelante, Rosario quiere comprar un carro para movilizarse con mayor cantidad de ropa, ya que por ahora sólo vende lo que puede cargar por sí misma. Este es su primer préstamo con MFP, y está muy interesada en trabajar con su banco comunal porque ha notado que son personas muy dinámicas y responsables. Con el dinero que solicita comprará mayor cantidad de ropa para seguir incrementando sus ventas.
texts.en:
Rosario is 39 years old. She is a single mother of two children, and lives in her own home. For the past year, Rosario has been selling second-hand clothing to people who live far outside the city. Rosario likes her work, because it allows her to visit beautiful areas full of vegetation where her clients live. Furthermore, her business is profitable, because she buys her products at cheap prices, and although she doesn't raise her prices much because she knows that her clients don't have much money, she is able to sell all of her items during each trip and therefore earn a good amount of money. In the future, Rosario wants to purchase a car in order to carry more clothing with her on her sales trips, as she currently sells only what she can carry on herself. This is her first loan with MFP. She is very interested in working with her communal bank, as she sees that its members are dynamic and responsible. With the loan proceeds, Rosario will purchase more clothing in order to increase her sales.

Translated from Spanish by Scott Lucas, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase inventory for her business.

loans.name: Juan

texts.en:
The applicant is Mr. Juan C. who is 34 years old and single. He has no children, but lives in his own house in the most popular neighborhood in the city. He has all of the necessities of a home, and he is in a relationship and therefore he has no motivation to leave.

He is a businessman and works selling basic needs such as flour, sugar, oil, sodas, and wines that he buys in Posadas, Argentina. He has his own vehicle to deliver the goods, and has been working in this business for 15 years.

The credit applied for is for the purchase of goods on sale that are offered at a lower price. He does not want to lose the opportunity to improve his profit margins.

loans.use: To purchase goods on sale

loans.name: Sara

texts.es: Sara tiene 43 años, es técnica en enfermería y trabaja en un puesto de salud cerca de su casa, y en la actualidad vive con sus dos hijos. Adicionalmente a su carrera profesional, se dedica a la crianza de pollos en un espacio que implementó en su propia casa, Sara vela con esmero, por el buen desarrollo de sus aves, para que éstas alcancen el peso y tamaño necesario para pedir por ellas un buen precio al momento de su comercialización. Esta actividad la viene realizando desde hace 2 años y cuenta con el apoyo de sus hijos, Sara se muestra contenta por todo lo que ha aprendido al respecto de su negocio y del crecimiento de los pollos, además, esta actividad no le toma mucho tiempo, y puede complementarla, sin problemas, con su trabajo matutino. Asimismo, considera que la rentabilidad de su negocio, se debe a que cada 45 días sus aves ya están listas para la venta y cuenta con una numerosa cartera de clientes regulares. Con MFP, ya tiene 5 créditos, y le gusta trabajar con su banco comunal porque todos sus integrantes se conocen muy bien, además de ser buenas personas y responsables con sus pagos. Con el dinero que solicita comprará pollos bebé y alimentos adecuados para su crianza.
texts.en:
Sara is 43, and she is a Nurse Technician. She works in a health station close to her house. She currently lives with her two children. In addition to her professional career, she raises chickens in a space she set up in her own home. Sara watches over them in a caring way so that her birds develop well and gain the necessary weight and size. Then she can ask a good price for them when it is time to sell them. She has been doing this for two years. Her children help her. Sara is happy for everything that she has learned about the business and the growth of chickens. Also, this activity does not take a lot of time. She can do this work and her morning work without problems. She feels that her business is profitable because every forty five days her birds are ready to be sold. She has a long list of regular customers. She has had five loans with MFP. She likes working with her community bank because all of its members know each other very well. Also, they are good people who are responsible about their payments. She will use the loan to buy baby chickens and adequate food to raise them.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy baby chickens and balanced food

loans.name: Gloria

texts.en:
Mrs. Gloria has been married for 17 years to Mr. Romualdo Lugo, with whom she has five children.  

Gloria decided to become a street vendor five years ago when her husband got a job as a painter and could not provide for and sustain the family.  It was then that she went from house to house in the neighborhood where she lived, offering her goods, as she was very well accepted by the community.  She decided to resort to the Foundation in order to capitalize and be able to buy more goods to satisfy the demands of her clients. 

Very soon, Gloria wants to build her own salesroom in her house.

loans.use: Purchase of jeans, t-shirts, shirts, blouses, etc.

loans.name: Carla Patricia

texts.es:
la Sra. Carla R. tiene 25 años de edad, ella vive en la colonia pedregal de la ciudad de comayaguela, es una zona bien poblada, las casas son todas unidas y cuentan con todos los servicios publicos. su negocio esta ubicado cerca de su casa de habitacion, ella compra la harina de maiz y la leña a un carro que pasa repartiendo este producto. esto hace que no gaste en transporte para trasladar la materia prima para hacer sus tortillas.
ella tiene una produccion diaria la cual la distribuye a restaurantes, pulperias, ella tiene un carro y su esposo le ayuda a transportar la mercaderia para dejarla en los diferentes lugares en donde le compran su producto.
Carla actualmente esta estudiando en la universidad y el proximo año se gradua de Lic. en Contaduria publica, ella cuenta con el apoyo de su esposo para el sustento de su familia, ellos tienen una hija de 4 años.
El credito lo necesitan para comprar una tortillera a base de gas LPG de chimbo, una plancha y un toldo, ya que ellos empezaron con un fogon de tierra.
ella necesita ampliar mas su negocio y este tipo de herramientas seran de mucha ayuda para la fabricacion de las tortillas.
texts.en:
Sra. Carla R. is 25 years old. She lives in the Pedregal nieghborhood in the city of Comayaguela. This area is very poor, the houses are all attached and depend on public services. Carla's business is located close to her home. She buys cornmeal and firewood from a car that passes through selling these products. This way she does not have the expense of transporting the ingredients to make her tortillas.

Carla produces her tortillas daily, and distributes them to restaurants and bodegas. She has a car, and her husband helps her deliver the merchandise at the various places that buy from her. Carla is currently studying at University, and next year will graduate with a degree in Public Accounting. She depends on her husband's support to sustain their family, as they have a 4-year-old daughter.

Carla's loan will be used to purchase an LPG-gas powered tortilla pan and a grill with a hood, since they began with only a clay oven. Carla needs to increase her business, and these types of tools are very helpful in the production of tortillas.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Novesky, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase cornmeal, firewood, cooking equipment

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Nelsa Leticia

texts.es:
Doña Nelsa tiene 43 años de edad, ella vive en la colonia Luis Andres Zuniga dela ciudad de comayaguela, es una zona donde hay bastante demanda, ya que su negocio esta ubicado en un lugar estrategico donde circula bastante gente, es madre soltera, vive con su hijo de cinco años y su hija quien estudia pintura, ella le ayuda a elaborar cuadros ya que doña Nelsa esta vendiendo cuadros de pintura, los clientes compran los materiales y su hija los elabora, sra. Nelsa necesita el credito para comprar Pollos, manteca, ella quiere instalar una venta de pollo ya que anteriormente ella trabajaba en una cafeteria, su hija la va apoyar en este negocio.
También quiere comprar zapatos y así mejorar mas su negocio. ella tiene clientes fijos, tambien sale a vender a Danli, toma un bus para llegar hacias esa ciudad que se tarda dos horas, también anda de casa en casa vendiendo y de esta forma ha podido sacar adelante su negocio.
el sueño de ella es ver mas grande su negocio.
texts.en:
Nelsa is 43 years old and lives in the Luis Andres Zuniga colony of the city of Comayaguela. This is a zone where there is great demand, given that her business is in a strategic location in an area with a great deal of people. She is a single mother, and lives with her five year old son and a daughter who studies art. Her daughter helps make pictures, since Nelsa is selling artwork. The customers buy the materials, and her daughter does the painting. Nelsa needs the loan to buy chickens and butter. She wants to start selling chicken, since she previously worked at a restaurant. Her daughter is going to help her with this business. She also wants to buy shoes to further improve her enterprise. She has repeat customers, and also goes out to sell in Danli. She takes a bus to get to this city late in the day, and they also travel door-to-door selling their products. In this manner, she has managed to slowly help her business get ahead. Her dream is to expand her enterprise.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn Malaby, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase women's shoes and sandals.

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy materials.

loans.name: Laura Emperatriz

texts.es:
la sra. Laura tiene 54 años de edad, vive en la colonia Luis Andres Zuniga, esta es una zona que esta bien poblada, su negocio esta ubicado en su casa, tiene siete años de tener su negocio, sus clientes son sus vecinos, asi mismo viaja a los pueblos del sur del pais como ser Ampala, nacaome, perpire, etc. ella toma un bus para ir a vender a estos pueblos que se tardan tres horas y media en bus y veinte minutos en lancha,  su estadia es de una semana y alquila un local, de esta forma hace sus ventas, ya que tiene clientes fijos, la sra invierte mensualmente $ 686.00 y esto le genera una ganancia de $400.00, ella vive con su hija de 17 años que esta estudiando en un colegio cercano a la colonia, cursa el primer año de comercio, la Sra. laura es madre soltera y también apoya a un muchacho a darle los estudios, es compañero de su hija.
La sra. Necesita el credito para comprar Microndas, Percoladortas, vajillas, tostadoras, hornos, cameras y accesorios ya que a la cliente le robaron la mercaderia y necesita nuestro apoyo para volver a levantar su negocio, ya que el sueño de ella es ver mas grande su negocio, ella es muy amable y querida por sus clientes.
texts.en:
Laura is 54 years old and lives in the Luis Andres Zuniga colony, a much-populated zone. Her business, which she has had for seven years, is located in her home. Her customers are her neighbors, and she also travels to the towns in the southern part of the country such as Ampala, Nacaome, Perpire, etc., to sell her products. To get there, she must travel 3 ½ hours by bus and another 20 minutes by dinghy. Her stay lasts for a week, during which time she rents a site to sell from as she has many repeat customers. She invests $686.00 per month, and this generates a profit of $400.00. She lives with her 17-year old daughter, who is studying her first year of business at a school close to the colony. Laura is a single mother, and also supports a young man who is her daughter’s friend, in his education. Laura needs a loan to buy microwave ovens, coffee makers, dishes, toasters, ovens, cameras and accessories, given that she was robbed and needs our support to re-establish her enterprise. Her dream is to grow her business. She is very friendly, and well-liked by her customers.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn Malaby, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase electrical household appliances.

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Leili

texts.es:
LEILI M. M., pertenece al Banco Comunal “LAS FLORES”, vive en el Asentamiento Humano BEATRIZ BARDALES Mz.B. Lt.10. del distrito de YARINACOCHA, tiene 36 años y 4 hijos de los cuales 2 son mayores de edad.

Se inicio vendiendo pescado en las calles con la ayuda de un triciclo.  Su primer préstamo fue de S/.300.00 Nuevos Soles, esto fue hace 3 años, con dicho dinero compró pescado para vender y afianzó su negocio, pero por algunos inconvenientes, dejó por un tiempo el negocio y hoy se encuentra vendiendo abarrotes y prendas de vestir a domicilio, esto lo hace con la ayuda de una moto que tiene para movilizarse. 

Con este préstamo de S/. 2,000.00 Nuevos Soles, invertirá en la compra de más ropas y abarrotes, y parte del dinero lo utilizará para dar mantenimiento a su movilidad (moto).

En el poco tiempo que esta con Manuela Ramos se siente contenta, por la ayuda que da a las mujeres para salir adelante, gracias a ello puede ayudar a sus hijos y en la economía del hogar.
texts.en:
Leili M. M. belongs to “The Flowers” cooperative bank. She lives in the Yarinacocha district, is 36 years old, and has 4 children, 2 of whom are now grown. She started out selling seafood in the street using a tricycle. Her first loan of 300.00 soles was 3 years ago, and she used the funds to buy fish and to strengthen her business. Due to a few inconveniences, she left the enterprise for a time and today finds herself selling groceries and clothing door-to-door. She does this with the help of a motorcycle she uses for transportation. With this loan of 2,000.00 soles she will invest in the purchase of more clothing and groceries. Part of the funds will also be used to maintain her mode of transportation (motorcycle). In the small amount of time she has been with Manuela Ramos, she feels glad for the help given to women so they can try to get ahead. Thanks to this support, she can help her children and take care of the finances of her household.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn Malaby, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy clothing.  To buy groceries.  To repair her motorcyle.

loans.name: Naidya

texts.es:
Doña Naidya tiene 39 años de edad, vive en la ciudad de comayaguela, es una zona bien poblada, ella se dedica a la venta de mercaderia nueva, como ser pantalones, camisas de moda, vestidos de niña, pantalones de niña (o), camisas de niña (o) desde hace trece años.
asi mismo labora en un hotel de tegucigalpa entra a las 3:00 de la Tarde y sale a las 10:00 p.m. Sus clientes son sus vecinos, compañeros de trabajo, y huespedes del hotel, la cliente invierte en su negocio $ 475.00 y obtiene una ganancias de $ 385.00 mensualmente, ella vive con su esposo quien labora ahí mismo y viven con sus tres hijos, quienes dos están en la escuela y el tercero que tiene cuatro años, necesita el credito para comprar zapatos y pantalones jeams de dama para incrementar mas sus ventas el sueño de la cliente es ver bien surtido su negocio.
texts.en:
Naidya is 39 years old, and lives in the well-populated city of Comayaguela. For the past thirteen years, she has dedicated herself to selling new merchandise such as pants, shirts, and girl’s dresses, pants and shirts. Concurrently, she works at a hotel in Tegucigalpa from 3:00 pm until 10:00 pm. Her customers are her neighbors, work colleagues, and guests at the hotel. She invests $475 into her business, and earns $385 per month. She lives with her husband, who works right there, and they have three children; two are in school, and the third is four years old. She needs the loan to buy shoes and women’s jeans to increase her sales. Her dream is to have a well-stocked business.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn Malaby, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase clothing.

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase more clothing and offer more variety to her customers

loans.name: Liliam

texts.es:
LILIAM NUÑEZ D. S., pertenece al Banco Comunal “LAS GEMAS II” vive en Jr. Piura Nº 131, en la ciudad D. Pucallpa, tiene 47 años D. edad, 03 hijos mayores , y su pareja se dedica al comercio D. bebidas.

Se inició en el negocio D. artículos para belleza y venta D. perfumes, lo hace a través D. catálogos.  El primer préstamo fue D. S/.300.00 Nuevos Soles, con el cual compró una pequeña vitrina para poder mostrar sus productos, ella es técnica farmacéutica y su negocio ha ido creciendo.  Paralelamente está ingresando, D. algún modo, al negocio D. la botica (venta D. medicinas)  en conjunto con su familia.

A la fecha el negocio D. venta D. medicinas ha mejorado e incrementado las ventas, por lo que requiere D. un mayor capital.  Con este préstamo D. S/.1,000.00 Nuevos Soles,  invertirá en la compra D. perfumes, cosméticos y medicina.

“Manuela Ramos me dio muchas oportunidades entre ellas trabajar conjuntamente con mi familia donD. además D. tener un ingreso económico también estamos unidos para seguir adelante.” refirió.
texts.en:
Liliam Nunez D. S. lives in the city of Pucallpa and is a member of the communal bank called Las Gemas II. She is 47 years old and has three grown children. Her husband sells beverages for work. She began her business selling beauty products and perfumes through catalogs. With her first loan, she purchased a small display case to show her products. Liliam is a pharmacy technician and her business has been growing. In parallel to her investment in selling beauty products, she also works together with her family selling medicines.

To date, medicine sales have improved and have increased sales, and now she needs more capital to invest in cosmetics, perfumes as well as more medicine. She says that Manuel Ramos has given her many opportunities to work together with her family, not only providing a source of income, but uniting them in improving their quality of life.

Translated from Spanish by Emily Charnes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase cosmetics, perfumes and medicines for her business

loans.name: Jenny Flor

texts.es:
JENNY FLOR S. R., pertenece al Banco Comunal “NUESTRA SRA DE LA ESPERANZA” vive en el Jr. Apurímac Nº 224 , Distrito de Calleria, tiene 37 años y 2 hijos menores.

	Ella  tiene su negocio instalado en su propia casa, el primer préstamo que recibió de Manuela Ramos fue de S/.300.00 Nuevos Soles, el mismo que invirtió en comprar algunos abarrotes para surtir su pequeño negocio.  Ella trabaja con Manuela Ramos desde hace 2 años, desde entonces su negocio ha ido creciendo cada vez  más,  por eso le ha sido necesario subir el monto de sus préstamos.

Con este  préstamo  de S/. 1,000.00 Nuevos Soles,  invertirá en comprar víveres como azúcar, fideos y artículos de limpieza.

Agradece a Manuela Ramos, por ser una institución que sirve a la comunidad y contribuye con las mujeres de esta región.
texts.en:
Jenny is a member of the communal bank called "Our Lady of Hope". She is 37 years old, has two young children, and they live in the district of Calleria. Jenny has set up a business in her home. With the first loan she received, she invested in stocking her small general store. She has been working with the communal bank for two years now, and since then her business has continued to grow. This is why it's been necessary to increase the amounts of the loans. With the new loan, she will purchase grocery items such as sugar, noodles, and household cleaning products. She appreciates the communal bank for serving the community and helping the women of this region.

Translated from Spanish by Emily Charnes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase grocery items such as noodles, sugar, as well as household cleaning products to stock her small general store

loans.name: Gabriela Leonor

texts.es:
GABRIELA LEONOR C. P., pertenece al Banco Comunal “NUESTRA SEÑORA DE LA ESPERANZA” vive en el Jr.Sucre Nº 855 , en la ciudad de Pucallpa, tiene 21 años de edad y es soltera.
Es una mujer emprendedora que apoya a su familia. 

Se inició en el negocio de venta de comida a domicilio, y con el primer préstamo de S/.300.00 Nuevos Soles, compró vivieres para preparar comida, cuenta con clientes frecuentes  y su negocio está creciendo.

Ella esta progresando junto a su familia y el negocio va mejorando.  Con este préstamo de S/.1,000.00 Nuevos Soles, invertirá en la compra de víveres e insumos para la elaboración de sus alimentos.

“Manuela Ramos es una institución que  da oportunidades a muchas mujeres que permite tener un negocio para cubrir las necesidades de la familia” refirió.
texts.en:
Gabriela Leonor C. P. belongs to the Comunal Bank group "NUESTRA SEÑORA DE LA ESPERANZA," or Our Lady of Hope. She lives in the city of Pucallpa, Peru. She is 21 years old and single. She is an entreprising young woman who supports her family.

She began her business selling food at her home, and with her first loan she bought supplies with which to prepare food. She has frequent customers and her business is growing.

She is progressing, along with her family, and the business is improving. With her loan of $350, she will purchase goods and supplies she will use to prepare her food.

Gabriela said of Kiva partner Manuela Ramos: "It is an organization that gives opportunities to many women and assists them in owning a business that will help cover the cost of necesities for a family."


Translated from Spanish by Kristin Connor, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase goods and supplies.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: TO BUY GOODS

loans.name: Jacha Apachita Group

texts.es: La asociación denominada "Jacha Apachita" ha encontrado en la elaboración de alimentos una actividad lucrativa que les permite solventar económicamente a sus familias. Ofrecen  variedad de almuerzos en pensiones, también en puestos ubicados en mercados y calles de la ciudad de El Alto, también elaboran pollos broaster y hamburguesas. Este grupo se reúne cada dos semanas en el centro focal Alto Lima ubicado en la ciudad de El Alto, desean mejorar sus ventas por lo que necesitan capital para la compra de insumos.
texts.en:
The association "Jacha Apachita" has found that the preparation of food goods can be a very lucrative activity that can help them to solve their family's economic problems. They offer a variety of lunches in boarding houses as well as at stands located in markets and streeets in the city of El Alto,Bolivia. They also make roast chicken and hamburgers. The group meets every other week at the meeting place Alto Lima, also located in the city of El Alto. They would like to improve their sales, but to do so need more investment capital to purchase supplies.

Translated from Spanish by Kristin Connor, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: NECESITAN COMPRAR INSUMOS

loans.name: Amanda

texts.es:
AMANDA Q. H., pertenece al Banco Comunal “RUMBO AL ÉXITO II-CAF” vive en la AA.HH.EL ENCANTO.Mz.C.Lt.6. en la ciudad de Pucallpa, tiene 40 años de edad, 04 hijos, y su esposo es moto taxista (transportista).

Con el primer préstamo de S/.300.00 Nuevos Soles inició en el negocio de venta de salchipapas (comida al paso) por las tardes y noches.  Con el pasar de tiempo su carrito salchipapero se malogró, actualmente durante el día vende frutas y verduras.  

La buena atención y carisma que la caracteriza ha hecho que tenga muchos clientes y ha sido necesario incrementar su capital.
Con este  préstamo de S/. 1,200.00 Nuevos Soles, lo invertirá en reparar su carrito salchipapero y el resto en insumos para la preparación de sus alimentos.

Dice que Manuela Ramos es la única Institución con la que trabaja por los bajos intereses que tiene, y la facilidad que les da al obtener un préstamo.
texts.en:
Amanda Q. H. belongs to the “Rumbo al Éxito II-CAF” Communal Bank and lives at AA.HH. El Encanto, Mz. C., Lt. 6 in the city of Pucallpa. She is 40 years old, has 4 children, and her husband is a moto-taxi driver.
With her first loan of S/.300.00 nuevos soles, she started her business selling salchipapas (street food) in the afternoons and evenings. With the passing of time her salchipapero cart has broken down and now she sells fruits and vegetables during the day.
Her good service and charisma have attracted many customers and it has been necessary to increase her capital. With this loan of S/.1,200.00 nuevos soles, she will repair her salchipapero cart and use the rest to purchase ingredients used in making her dishes.
She says that Manuela Ramos is the only organisation she works with because they provide low interest and make it easy to access a loan.

Translated from Spanish by Carolyn McCaffrey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase ingredients and to repair her street cart.

loans.name: Manuela De Jesus

texts.es:
SE ENCUENTRA CASADA Y SIN HIJOS.

SE DEDICA A LA VENTA DE ABARROTES, SU GRAN ENTUSIASMO Y LAS GANAS DE SEGUIR ADELANTE, SIEMPRE HA TRATADO DE APOYAR A SU ESPOSO CON LOS GASTOS DE HOGAR, YA QUE SU ESPOSO NO TIENE POR AHORA UN EMPLEO ESTABLE, DESDE EL AÑO 2006 SE DEDICA A ESTAS VENTAS, AHORA CON LA AYUDA DE EL CREDITO, PIENSA EN INVERTIR EN MAS MERCANCIA Y ASI PODER OFRECER MAS PRODUCTOS A SUS FIELES CLIENTES.
texts.en:
Manuela is married and has no children. She devotes herself to the sale of groceries. Manuela has great enthusiasm and a desire to move forward, and has always tried to help her husband with their living expenses, since he does not have a stable job right now. She has been selling groceries since 2006. With the help of this loan, she would like to invest in more inventory, in order to be able to offer more products to her regular customers.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Novesky, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: TO BUY GOODS

loans.name: Yolita

texts.es:
YOLITA A. D. T., pertenece al Banco Comunal “LAS GEMAS II”, con domicilio ubicado en el Asentamiento Humano LAS MERCEDES Mz.6. Lt.9, D. la ciudad D. Pucallpa, tiene 44 años D. edad,. Se dedica a la costura, tiene 5 hijos, dos D. ellos menores.  Su esposo se dedica a la fabricación D. botes.

             Ella tiene casi dos años en Manuela Ramos y el primer préstamo que obtuvo fue D. S/ 300 Nuevos Soles, lo utilizó para el mantenimiento D. su máquina D. coser y poder seguir desarrollando su pequeño negocio. 

           Actualmente, continua con la costura y con el préstamo D. S/ 1,000. Nuevos Soles, comprará materiales para confeccionar y diseñar todo tipo D. ropa, sabanas (telas, hilos, etc.).

           Se encuentra agradecida con Manuela Ramos, porque nunca alguna entidad financiera le otorgó un crédito; mientras que Manuela Ramos sin tanto papeleo,  confió en ella y la motiva a ser responsable en sus pagos.
texts.en:
YOLITA A. D. T., a client of the Community Bank “LAS GEMAS II”, lives in the Las Mercedes Mz. 6 Lt.9 neighborhood in the city of Pucallpa. She is 44 years old, and devotes herself to sewing. She has 5 children, two of whom are still minors. Her husband manufactures boats.

Yolita has been with Manuela Ramos for nearly two years, and the first loan she received was for S/ 300 Nuevos Soles. She used it to maintain her sewing machine and to continue to develop her small business.

Currently, Yolita continues sewing, and with a loan of S/ 1,000. Nuevos Soles, she will purchase material to design and complete all types of clothing, sheets (fabric, thread, etc.).

Yolita is grateful to Manuela Ramos, because no other financial institution every granted her credit; whereas Manuela Ramos, without a lot of red tape, trusted her, and this motivated her to be responsible in making her payments.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Novesky, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase materials (fabric, thread) to manufacture clothing.

loans.name: Rocio Del Carmen

texts.es:
ROCIO del CARMEN O. G., pertenece al Banco Comunal “RUMBO AL ÉXITO-CAF” con domicilio en la Urb. JJ MUÑOS Mz.F Lt.12, tiene 33 años, 03 hijos (2 de ellos menores), y su esposo tiene una chacra donde trabaja diariamente.

Tenía un negocio de venta de pescado y la primera vez obtuvo un préstamo de S/.300.00 Nuevos Soles, hace 1 1/2 año, con este dinero compro un triciclo para vender pan y abarrotes, con ello afianzo su negocio.

Actualmente  continúa con el negocio de venta de panes  y con este préstamo  de S/.1,700.00 Nuevos Soles,  invertirá en la compra de una vitrina mas grande para exhibir sus panes así como en la compra de harinas y  otros insumos necesarios para que trabaje y crezca su negocio. 

Pese al poco tiempo que esta con Manuela Ramos se siente contenta, por la ayuda que da a las mujeres para salir adelante, gracias a ello puede ayudar a su esposo e hijos, y sobre todo aportar en la economía del hogar.
texts.en:
ROCIO del CARMEN O. G., is a client of the Community Bank “RUMBO AL ÉXITO-CAF." She lives in Urb. JJ MUÑOS Mz.F Lt.12, is 33 years old, and has 3 children (2 are minors). Her husband has a farm, where he works every day.

Rocio had a business selling fish. She received her first loan of S/.300.00 Nuevos Soles a year and a half ago, and with this money purchased a bicycle cart to sell bread and groceries, which financed her business.

Currently, Rocio continues selling bread. With this loan of S/.1,700.00 Nuevos Soles, she will invest in a larger display case to exhibit her bread, and also in the purchase of flour and other ingredients that she needs in order to work and grow her business.

Despite the short time she has been with Manuela Ramos, Rocio is happy with the help she gives for women to succeed. Thanks to this assistance, Rocio can help her husband and children, and above all can contribure to their home finances.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Novesky, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase a display case, and ingredients like flour and others.

loans.name: Las Alondras Group

texts.es:
La Sra. Julia S. socia entusiasta y emprendedora natural de cuzco, tiene 40 años de edad, separada,  tiene 3 hijos  que son el motivo de su vida, su domicilio esta ubicado en UCV 22 Lt. 8 Zona A -  Huaycan distrito de Ate departamento de Lima.  Actualmente ocupa el cargo de presidenta de la alcancía comunal “las alondras” la cual esta formado por 11 socios quienes se dedican a diversas actividades: venta de productos de belleza, wawa wasi, a la venta de ropas y otros, la alcancía comunal  trabaja con EDAPROSPO - Prosperidad desde hace  2 años y 11 meses. 
Julia se dedica a la venta de ropa importada al por mayor y menor tiene 8 años en este negocio, ella comenzó a raíz que se separa de su esposo por problemas conyugales y empezó a vender  a sus amigas poco a poco con la idea de salir adelante  y no hundirse en la depresión. Con el préstamo de S/1000.00, lo  invertirá en  la compra de ropas de invierno. Julia tiene 2 anhelos obtener su  local propio y darles mejor educación a sus hijos para que sean buenos profesionales.
texts.en:
Sra. Julia S. is an enthusiastic and enterprising native of Cuzco. She is 40 years old, separated, and has three children, who are the inspiration in her life. Her home is located in UCV 22 Lt. 8 Zona A - Huaycan district of Ate in the state of Lima. Currently, Julia is president of the communal bank "Las Alondras", which is made up of 11 members devoted to diverse activities. These include the sale of beauty products, a nursery school, the sale of clothing and more. The communal bank has worked with EDAPROSPO - Prosperidad for 2 years and 11 months.

Julia devotes her time to the wholesale and retail sale of imported clothing, and has been in business for 8 years. She began the business after separating from her husband due to marital problems. She began by selling to her friends little by little with the idea of moving forward without falling into a depression. With a loan of S/1000.00, she will invest in winter clothes. Julia has two great desires: to obtain her own shop, and to give her children a good education so that they can become professionals.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Novesky, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Invest in winter clothes

loans.name: Isaías

texts.es: Isaías tiene 49 años, es separado, tiene 4 hijos; Amparo de 26, Jorge de 22, Lisbeth de 18 y Alberto de 14 años, quienes viven con su expareja. Desde hace 25 años se dedica a brindar el servicio de taxi, de 8 de la noche a  8 de la mañana en un auto que alquila y por el que paga parte de sus ganancias. Isaías ha reiniciado su vida y tiene una nueva pareja, la cual lo apoya mucho, es así que ahora, aparte de trabajar para las necesidades de sus hijos, también vela por su futuro al lado de su pareja. El trabajo nocturno es un riesgo, una vez lo asaltaron y fue gravemente herido, pero felizmente se ha repuesto y sigue firme trabajando para conseguir sus metas. Él dice no ser miedoso y ofrece un buen servicio a sus clientes, ya que sin importar la zona los deja en su destino. Para el futuro quiere comprar su propio carro, para no tener que seguir pagando alquiler. Este es su primer préstamo individual con MFP, ya que anteriormente fue parte de un banco comunal, siendo muy puntual con los pagos. Con el dinero que solicita comprará lubricantes para su el carro con el que trabaja, además de invertir en el restaurante de su esposa para que juntos salgan adelante.
texts.en:
Isaías is a 49-year old father of four children: 26-year-old Amparo, 22-year-old Jorge, 18-year-old Lisbeth, and 14-year-old Alberto. He is separated and his children live with his ex-wife. Isaías has driven a taxi for 25 years. He works from eight at night until eight in the morning in a rented car (a car he pays for from his earnings). Isaías has started his life anew and has a new wife who is very supportive. This is why, in addition to working to support his children, he is also starting to think about his future with his new partner. Working at night is dangerous and Isaías suffered serious injuries in an attack one time. Happily, he recovered and continues to work toward his goals. He reports that he is not a coward and will take his passengers wherever they need to go, even if it is a dangerous area. He would like to buy his own car in the future so he doesn’t have to keep paying rent. This is his first individual loan with MFP. Before this, he was a member of a communal bank and was always punctual with his payments. He will buy lubricants for the car with the loan money and also invest some in his wife’s restaurant so they can both get ahead.

Translated from Spanish by Shelly Hubman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Compra de lubricantes para auto e inversión en el restaurante de su esposa

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Peregrina

texts.es:
PEREGRINA P. T., pertenece al Banco Comunal “RUMBO AL ÉXITO-CAF” su domicilio está ubicado en la Urb.JJ MUÑOS , tiene 43 años, 5 hijos, 4 de ellos menores, y su esposo es coadministrador del negocio.

	Ella se inicio vendiendo frutas aproximadamente hace tres años, el primer préstamo que recibió de Manuela Ramos fue de S/.300.00 Nuevos Soles, que invirtió en compra de aguaje (fruta de la zona), para vender en el parque de su barrio, en la actualidad tiene una pequeña bodega en su casa, la cual le genera mejores ingresos que sus negocio anterior

Con este préstamo de S/.1,700.00 Nuevos Soles,  invertirá en compra de una congeladora para su local y el resto lo invertirá en comprar abarrotes para surtir su tienda.

Agradece a Manuela Ramos, por ser una institución que sirve a la comunidad y contribuye con las mujeres de esta región.
texts.en:
Peregrina P. T. belongs to the Rumbo Al Éxito-CAF Community Bank. Her home is located in the Urb. JJ Muños. She is 43 and has five children. Four of the children are minors. Her husband is co-administrator of the business. She started selling fruit about three years ago. The first loan she received from Manuela Ramos was for 300 PEN, which she used to buy “aguaje” (fruit from her zone) to sell in the neighborhood park. She currently has a small market in her house. The market generates better income than her previous business. With this loan for 1,700 PEN she will buy a freezer for her place. With the rest she will buy groceries to stock her store. She is grateful to Manuela Ramos for being an institution that serves the community and contributes to the women of this region.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy a freezer.  Buy groceries (various items).

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To Buy Goods.

loans.name: Gina

texts.en:
Gina B. is from the village of Migcanaway, Tangub City. She is 32 years old. Gina is married and has four school-aged children. To make a living, Gina owns & operates a fish selling business. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from fishing and fish vending. Gina has been engaged in her business for over seven years and earns approximately 4500 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Gina joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Gina is requesting a new loan of 3000 PHP, which will be used to purchase new fishing nets for fishing. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Gina from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business and to sustain her family's basic needs. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase fishing nets for fishing

loans.name: Charlie

texts.en:
"I started tilling a small parcel of farm. Now, My wife and I are busy preparing the farm for our next planting. Our harvest has really helped us to provide for our family’s needs. Our income has helped us send our children to school," says Charlie L., 27-year old father of two children. 

He would like to ask for a loan of PHP 10,000. He will use the loan to purchase fertilizers, Muriate of Potash and herbicides to improve his harvest. "I want to buy another farm. I hope that this loan will help me fulfill my dream", he says.

CEVI helps small business grow. CEVI provides not just loans but training and insurance coverage as well.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers, Muriate of Potash and herbicides for farming.

loans.name: Arlene

texts.en:
"Our last harvest has given us plenty of food for our family. Now, we are busy preparing the land for our next planting. Our farm is the only thing that sustains our family. We dream to buy another farm and be able to send our children to college", says Arlene A., 38-year-old mother of three children.

She would like to ask for a loan of PHP 10,000. She will use the loan to purchase herbicides, fertilizers, and insecticides. The loan will really help her achieve a better harvest and increased income for the whole family.

CEVI helps small business grow. It provides financial services as well as training and insurance coverage as well.

loans.use: To purchase herbicides, fertilizers, and insecticides for farming.

loans.name: Ung's Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Ung Y. is a borrower who has been recruited to be leader of the group loan by other borrowers. She is 48 years old, a married woman and the mother of three children. All of her children are single and are employed as garment workers. She is a good housewife who cares for the children. The whole family’s daily expenses are contributed by Ung Y.’s husband who works as a civil service official. Ung Y. hopes to earn another profit by using her loan for capital in order to invest in a business as a merchandise trader in the village. 
The other borrowers who have joined this loan are:
S. P., who is 66 and earns a living providing small loans with a specific schedule repayment, will use the loan money for her service.
T. will use the money to accrue her business capital of selling vegetable.

loans.use: To invest in a business as a merchandise trader in the village

loans.name: Edna

texts.en:
Edna A. is from the village of Danao. She is 46 years old. Edna is married and has one adult child. To make a living, Edna owns & operates a fishing business. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from harvesting & selling ocean-caught fish in the local community. Edna has been engaged in her business for over eight years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2008, Edna joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Edna is requesting a new loan of 7000 PHP, which will be used to purchase fishing equipment, including hooks & nets. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Edna from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase fishing equipment including hooks & nets

loans.name: Josefina

texts.en: Josefina has just started a hog raising business and sells vegetables at the same. She is requesting a loan of PHP 7,000 for the maintenance of her two businesses. Josefina is 51 years old and married to Romeo L. Sr., who is a house carpenter and a farmer in their village. She will be very thankful if her loan request is approved soon. The couple is blessed with six children, Roselyn is 28 years old and a high school graduate, Sonny is 21 years old, Jonie is 18 years old, Ginalyn is 14 years old, and the youngest, Rosalyn, is 7 years old. Like other entrepreneurs, Josefina believes that through patience, her family will someday surpass the hardship of life they are going through.

loans.use: Business Maintenance

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en: Josephine, 51, and her husband, Leonardo Sr., live in Barangay, Liwayway Diffun Quirino. They work very hard at their charcoal-making business to meet their daily needs. Josephine requests a loan of PHP 5,000 as working capital for her business. Aside from making charcoal, Josephine also sells vegetables and will use a part of her loan to increase this business as well. She hopes to expand her business so that someday her children will lead a better life. She is blessed with four children and a good husband and is very thankful to all of them. Josephine believes that patience and hard work can make her successful someday.

loans.use: Business Capital

loans.name: Erma

texts.en:
Erma A., 39, is from the village of Migcanaway, Tangub City. She is married and has four school-aged children. To make a living, Erma owns and operates a business venture in the food sector running a fishing business. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from fishing and selling of fish. Erma has been engaged in this business for over two years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month.

In 2009, Erma joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Erma is requesting a new loan of 4,000 PHP to purchase materials to fix her fishing net. This loan will be Erma’s first loan from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to expand her business and to support her family's basic needs.

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase materials to fix the fishing net

loans.name: Jesusa

texts.en:
Jesusa P., 47, is married and has four school-aged children. She lives in the village of Danao. To make a living, Jesusa owns and operates a business venture in the food sector operating a fishing business. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from harvesting and selling ocean-caught fish in the local community. Jesusa has been engaged in this business for over 10 years and earns approximately 13,000 PHP a month.

In 2006, Jesusa joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Jesusa has successfully repaid a previous loan of 10,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to invest in expanding the business. Jesusa is now requesting a new loan of 20,000 PHP to purchase a fishing boat. This will be Jesusa’s fourth loan from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve her family’s general living conditions. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase a fishing boat

loans.name: Ligaya

texts.en:
Ligaya S. operates a general store in her rural village of Liwayway Diffun, Quirino. She lives with husband Fernando (45 years old) and their three children and grandchildren. Her youngest child, Cherry Fe, is now 17 years old and is studying in college.

To further meet her youngest child’s educational needs, Ligaya also maintains a hog-raising business aside from managing her general store. She is requesting a loan from lenders of PHP 12,000 so that she will able to further expand her business and become a successful entrepreneur someday.

loans.use: To further expand her business

loans.name: Lilia

texts.en:
Lilia lives in Barangay Liwayway Diffun, Quirino which is a mountainous province. She both raises hogs and sells food items in her village. She is married to Ernesto Sr. and has nine children. Out of their nine children, seven are already married and two are still single and patiently doing their best to finish their studies.

According to Lilia, her hog raising business is doing well however, the business is too small to provide for their important necessities. She is requesting a loan amounting to PHP 7,000 as additional capital for her hog-raising business. She will use the loan to purchase more hogs and more feed so that she can sell them at a higher price. Lilia hopes to increase her family’s standard of living by doing her best in the business she operates.

loans.use: To purchase more hogs and more feed

loans.name: Ludivina

texts.en:
Ludivina is 35 years old and has a stand where she sells sim cards and minutes for two local cell phone companies. Ludivina has been running this stand for three years and it has been a big help to her family, especially for the education of her three children in school.

Ludivina is requesting a loan of PHP 8,000 as working capital for her business and to help repair her husband’s motorcycle transport.

loans.use: To use as working capital for her business and to repair her husband’s motorcycle transport

loans.name: Liezel

texts.en: Liezel M. is from the village of Danao. She is 29 years old, married, and has four infant children. Liezel owns and operates a fishing business, primarily harvesting and selling ocean-caught fish in the local community. Liezel is just starting this business. In 2008, Liezel joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 10,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to to purchase fishing equipment including hooks and nets. Liezel is requesting a new loan of 15,000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This loan will be her third loan PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding the business

loans.name: Myrna

texts.en:
Myrna T. is a charcoal and snack vendor. She is 40 years old and married to Romeo T.. She would like additional capital for her to buy more sacks of charcoal to retail.

Myrna is requesting a loan of PHP 12,000 as additional working capital for the business so that she will be able to generate higher profit. Myrna is from the rural village of Liwayway Diffun, Quirino province, a place that is mountainous and where upland farming is the major sources of income. 

Myrna is blessed with three children who are all currently in school and require a lot of money. Her eldest, Ronnie Mae, is 14 years old and in his second year high school. Rovie Mher is 12 years old and in grade school. The youngest, Rona Angelina, is 9 years old and in grade four.

Myrna and Romeo hope to support the schooling of their children through college by exerting more effort in their business, which should allow them to expand and earn more income.

loans.use: To buy more sacks of charcoal to retail

loans.name: Roselle

texts.en:
“Strong determination is the most important attribute for a businesswoman to have when managing a business,” said Roselle. She is a young and faithful wife to her husband Roberto. The couple is blessed with two children: Robert is 7 years old and in grade school and Michael Laron is 6 years old and is an upcoming pupil of the primary school.

Roselle is 27 years old and, even at her young age, she is able to manage their tricycle transport business and at the same time help her husband in their rice farming business, which is their largest source of income.

For two years, Roselle has been managing their tricycle transport business. She wants to increase her daily income in the business so she is requesting a loan of PHP 8,000 to repair their motorcycle.

loans.use: To repair their motorcycle transport

loans.name: Rufina

texts.en:
Rufina said, “It is through hardwork and patience in managing her general store business, that one can achieve progress.” 

Rufina is 52 years old and married to Ricardo who is a farmer in their village of Liwayway Diffun Quirino. She manages a store in their village and, because she wants her business to grow, she is requesting a loan of PHP 10,000. She has been running the business for eight years and she hopes she can continue to sustain it and even expand it.

She is thankful because she is blessed with five children: her two eldest are already married; her third child is Rochelle who is 20 years old and a college graduate who is working at Centro mall as a sales lady; Rickson is 18 years old and finished a two-year course in college; and the youngest, Russel John, is 16 years old.

Rufina hopes that her children will someday develop her retailing business so that the family can afford to send Russel John to college.

loans.use: To expand her business

loans.name: Cherlie

texts.en:
