"We are tenant farmers. We are tilling the land that we will never own. Farming is the only thing that sustains our family. We use our harvest to feed our family and to buy the things we need. Now, we only have a small farm and owned by our friend. Someday, our wish is to buy our own farm to be able to support our children better," says Cherlie M., a 34-year-old mother of three children. 

She would like to ask for a loan of PHP 10,000 from CEVI. She will use the loan to purchase complete fertilizers and herbicides. The loan will really help her to improve their harvest. She is also interested to venture into another business loan in the future.

CEVI helps small business grow. CEVI provides their clients with not just loans but training and insurance coverage as well.

loans.use: To purchase complete fertilizers and herbicides for farming.

loans.name: Jeneve

texts.en:
Jeneve S., a 31-year-old married mother of four infant-aged children, is from the village of Danao where she owns and operates a fishing business. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from harvesting and selling ocean-caught fish in the local community. Jeneve has been engaged in her business for over six years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month.

In 2009, Jeneve joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Having repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from PMPC, she is now requesting a new loan of 10000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional fish to sell. Jeneve plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional fish to sell.

loans.name: Daisy

texts.en:
Daisy D. G. is managing a food vending business located in the public market of Cauayan City. She said that for an entrepreneur to become successful, one should work hard and be patient in everything. Married to Patricio, an ice vendor in the market, they have six children: Dexter, Patrick, Devine, Daniel, Diana and Rose, four of whom are already in high school and elementary school. Her children also assist her in the business, for they want to achieve their goal to become successful someday.

Daisy is now requesting a loan of PHP25, 000 that she will use as additional capital in her food vending business. She believes that this amount will play a great part in the development of her enterprise.

loans.use: Business Capital

loans.name: Joan Jean

texts.en: Joan Jean is 29 years old and a single mother.  She and her child are living with her supportive mother in Luna, Isabela. Every day, she wakes up very early in the morning to open her store in the public market of Cauayan City. She has managed a clothing business for almost 13 years and her mother is also helping her. She is doing her best to become a successful entrepreneur for the education of her child.  For this reason, Joan Jean is asking for the support of the lenders by borrowing a loan of PHP 20,000. She is hoping that her loan will be granted as it will really benefit her business and her family.

loans.use: Business Capital

loans.name: Marilou

texts.en:
Marilou is engaged in a direct selling business.  She sells different products from NATASHA, AVON, BOARD WALK and MSE, located in the public market of Tumauni, Isabela. She would like to avail a loan amounting to PHP 50,000 for the improvement of her business outlet and also to purchase more stock that she can offer to her customers and dealers. She hopes that her business will grow and that she will become a successful manager of her own enterprise.  She is hoping that through her direct selling, she may able to generate higher income to save for the education of her son and for the renovation of their house to give her family a safe and comfortable place to live. 

Marilou is 33 years old and her husband, Eljune, is working as a security guard. They have a five-year-old son named Jhun Zach.  Her family is living a happy and healthy life in the municipality of Luna, Isabela.  She and her husband want the best for their son and they help each other to earn enough money for his education and also for their future children.

loans.use: Business Improvement

loans.name: Jeffy  A

texts.en:
Jeffy A. S. is from the village of Poblacion 4 Clarin Misamis Occidental. She is 35 years old. Jeffy A. is married and has 3 school-aged children. To make a living, Jeffy A. owns & operates a "sari-sari" or general store. The main source of income for the business comes from selling a variety of different products like soap, shampoo, toothpaste etc. in the local community. Jeffy A. has been engaged in her business for over 5 years and earns approximately 31,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2005, Jeffy A. joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and to have the ability to engage in business activities. Jeffy A. has successfully repaid a previous loan of 10,000 PHP from GDMPC. Jeffy A. is requesting a new loan of 12000 PHP which will be used to purchase dried fish to sell in her "sari-sari" store. This loan will be the 16th loan taken out by Jeffy A from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business and to support her family's basic needs. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding the business.

loans.name: Tit

texts.en: Tit H. is 43 years old, has owned a medium house located in the Pursat Province for years and lives with her family members. She and her husband currently cultivate a variety of crops on farmland that was inherited from their grandparents. From the farming work, the family has made an income to feed their children from the time they were young until they have ready married. The family has been farming since 1990 but they have faced a problem in plowing the farmland because they have not owned a buffalo. Therefore, Tit H. is applying for a loan to buy a pair of buffalo for farm activities. She will rent the buffalo out to other farmers for a profit. Mrs. Tit H.'s husband is pictured because she was not available for the photograph.

loans.use: To buy a pair of buffalo for farm activities.

loans.name: Gloria

texts.en:
Gloria M. is from the village of Clarin. She is 40 years old. Gloria is married and has 4 school-aged children. To make a living, Gloria raises livestock. Her business is raising pigs for sale. Gloria has been engaged in her business for over 10 years and earns approximately 10,000 PHP a month from these activities.

In 1999, Gloria joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and to have the ability to engage in business activities. Gloria has successfully repaid a previous loan of 20,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to purchase baby livestock to raise & sell. Gloria is requesting a new loan of 35000 PHP. This loan will be used to purchase livestock feed & other supplies. This will be the 16th loan taken out by Gloria from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of the her family. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase livestock feed & other supplies

loans.name: Pacita

texts.en:
Pacita G. is from the village of Clarin. She is 51 years old. Pacita is married and has 3 adult-aged children. To make a living, Pacita owns & operates a service-based business. This business provides construction services to local community members. Pacita has been engaged in her business for over 10 years and earns approximately 8,000 PHP a month from these activities.

In 1999, Pacita joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and to have the ability to engage in business activities. Pacita has successfully repaid a previous loan of 20,000 PHP from PMPC. Pacita is requesting a new loan of 20000 PHP. This loan will be used to purchase materials needed to provide service. This will be the 18th loan taken out by Pacita from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of the her family. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase materials needed to provide service.

loans.name: Erlinda

texts.en:
"My parents are farmers. I learned everything about how to plant rice and harvest the grains from them. Before I had a very sad experience from borrowing money from informal lenders. They charged me high interest and I found it hard to recover. Now, I'm over it.", says Erlinda S., a 27year-old mother of five children.

She requests a loan of Php 10,000. She will use it to purchase fertilizers, herbicides and molluscides. The loan will also help her start a new business. 

CEVI is reaching out small farmers to sustain their livelihood. CEVI provides not only loans but training and insurance coverage as well.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers, herbicides and molluscides

loans.name: Leah

texts.en:
Leah E., 41, married and the mother of two adult-aged children, is from the village of Poblacion 1 Clarin Misamis Occidental where she owns and operates a "sari-sari" or general store. The main income for the business comes from selling daily use products such as soap, toothpaste, shampoo etc. to the local community. Leah has been engaged in her business for over 16 years and earns approximately 1000 PHP a month.

In 2004, Leah joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Having recently repaid a previous loan of 10728.34 PHP from GDMPC, she is now requesting a new loan of 11500 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be Leah’s tenth from GDMPC, and she plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business and to support her family's basic needs.

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding the business.

loans.name: Irish

texts.en:
" My husband and I started farming using a 1-hectare farm. We are just tenants and our earnings come from the share we received from the real owner of the farm. Someday, our wish is to buy our own farm", says Irish A., a 23 year-old mother of four children.

She will use the loan of 10,000 from CEVI to purchase fertilizers, Urea and insecticides. The loan will really help her achieve better yields and income for the family.

CEVI helps small businesses grow. CEVI also provides their clients financial services, training and insurance coverage.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers, Urea and insecticides

loans.name: Elia

texts.es: Elia G. D. G. resiD. en Zaragoza junto a sus dos pequeñas nietas, las cuales se dedican a estudiar, Elia tiene una hija la cual es madre D. las nietas con las que vive Elia, pero ella resiD. en Los Estados Unidos. Elia posee una venta D. flores naturales en el mercado D. Santa Tecla desD. hace ya 25 años. Ella solicita un préstamo con el que desea poder comprar más flores para surtir su negocio, ya que debe mejorar las condiciones D. debido a que es su mayor fuente D. ingresos, ya que a pesar que su hija le envía dinero D. Los Estados Unidos, este dinero es sobre todo para sus nietas ya que Elia se encarga D. cuidarlas, es por esto que Elia desea mejorar las condiciones D. su negocio y obtener mayores ganancias.
texts.en:
Elia Gonzalez Gomez lives in Zaragoza with her two small granddaughters, who go to school. Elia’s daughter who is the mother of the granddaughters lives in the United States. Elia has had a flower shop at the Santa Teclas market for the last 25 years .

She requested a loan in order to buy more flowers for her shop. She wants to improve her business because it is her main source of income. Elia's daughter sends money to her from the United States but it is mainly for her grandchildren since she takes care of them. This is why Elia wants to improve the conditions of her business and gain higher profits.

Translated from Spanish by Adriana Pierce, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy flowers for her shop

loans.name: Porferia

texts.en:
" Before, my family suffered from financial difficulties. Now, at least  we have a farm that we use to supply our daily needs. Now we are busy preparing the farm for our next planting. My wish is that we will again have an abundant harvest and good weather conditions" says Porferia D., a mother of three children.

She requests a loan of Php 10,000 from CEVI, which she will use to purchase Urea  and complete fertilizers, herbicides, and other farm inputs. 

CEVI has been providing financial services to rural communities. CEVI provides  loans as well as training and insurance coverage.

loans.use: To purchase Urea  and complete fertlizers, herbicides, and other farm inputs

loans.name: Michal

texts.en:
Michal S. is from the village of MANGA, TANGUB CITY. She is 46 years old. Michal is married and has 2 school-aged and adult-aged children. To make a living, Michal owns & operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising pigs for sale. Michal has been engaged in her business for over 4 years and earns approximately 4000 PHP a month from these activities.

In 2008, Michal joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and to have the ability to engage in business activities. Michal has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5000 PHP from GDMPC. Michal is requesting a new loan of 7000 PHP. This loan will be used to purchase feed for the pigs. This will be the second loan taken out by Michal from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase feed for feeding pigs.

loans.name: Mariafe

texts.en:
Mariafe R. manages a small parcel of land. Before, she and her late husband has rented a land. Now, she gets income from a share of harvest that the real owner gives them. She is 52 years old, and a widow already.

She requests a loan of Php 10,000 from CEVI, which she will use to purchase herbicides, insecticides and complete fertilizers. The loan will greatly help her whole family improve their harvest.

CEVI has been providing financial services to rural communities. CEVI offers loans as well as training and insurance coverage.

loans.use: To purchase herbicides, insecticides and complete fertilizers

loans.name: Jesna

texts.en: Mrs. Jesna D. is 44 years of age, married, and a resides in Baybay Triunfo, Ozamiz City. Her husband is presently enjoying his monthly pension, but still, this pension is not enough to support the daily needs of her family. She decided to open a Sari-sari Store to support her husband and children. She started this business with a capital of PHP 1,500 that she borrowed from one of her friends. She has now expanded into another type of business, which is the eatery business. She also owns and operates a motor cab for hire and is engaged in rice trading. She is applying for an amount of PHP 30,000 to add to the capital on her existing eatery, Sari-sari Store and rice trading businesses. Her future dream is to provide a better future for her children and she is planning to improve her business from an eatery to a restaurant.

loans.use: Additional capital for her Eatery, Sari-sari Store and rice trading businesses.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase fertilizers, insecticides and herbicides

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
"My husband is a farmer and I am helping him manage our small rice farm. When we got married, we bought 2-hectares of land. Now, we are still using it to produce rice for our family’s needs. We are currently preparing our farm. We will soon plant young rice and hopefully it will give us an abundant harvest in the future," says Elizabeth M..

She is asking for a loan of PHP 10,000 from CEVI. She will use the loan to purchase fertilizers, Ammonium Sulfate and herbicides. The loan will definitely improve their harvest and increase their income as well.

CEVI has been providing financial services to rural communities. CEVI gives not just loans but training and insurance coverage as well.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers, Ammonium Sulfate and herbicides.

loans.name: Rosalie

texts.en:
"My parents have a farm. When I got married to my husband, they gave me a small parcel of land that my husband and I could use to support our family. Now, we have four hectares of farming land. Our harvest is mainly for family consumption. If there is excess, we sell the crops to our neighbors." says Rosalie C., 44-year-old mother of three children.

She is asking a loan of PHP 10,000 from CEVI. She will use the loan to purchase seeds, fertilizers, gasoline, insecticides and foliar fertilizers. Aside from that, she is also interested in venturing into other possible income areas to further help her family.

CEVI provides financial services to rural communities. CEVI gives not just loans but training and insurance coverage as well.

loans.use: To purchase seeds, fertilizers, gasoline, insecticides and foliar (soluble) fertilizers.

loans.name: Kaggwa

texts.en: Kaggwa K. is a 34 year old, married man with four children. He sells fish and has a fish stall in Kalisizo main market. He also owns SANYU Restaurant located in Kalisizo main market. He is using the loan to purchase a refrigerator, food items for the restaurant and better quality fishing nets for his fish business. His future hope is to make a bigger restaurant and expand his market stall for fish and to start transporting the fish both to Kampala and Kasese.

loans.use: To purchase a refrigerator, food items for the restaurant and better quality fishing nets for his fish business.

loans.name: Cresanta

texts.en:
Cresanta P. is a resident of Sinacaban, Misamis Occidental. She is married and has 3 children. She has been a good member of Paglaum Cooperative since August 2008. She has requested a loan amounting to PHP10,000 with which she intends to buy fertilizer for corn production. 
She is also thankful to PAGLAUM micro finance for their programs and services that help the poor people and encourage them to work hard for their future. She wishes to have better living conditions in the future and to be able to give her children a good future.

loans.use: To purchase corn fertilizer.

loans.name: Nida

texts.en: Nida M. resides at Manil, Leon B. Postigo. She is 48 years old and currently operates a small business store in her community. She has been able to raise four children, three of whom are already married. Her husband is a fisherman. Her store serves as the focal store in their community due to the fact that she is selling only primary commodities. She is planning to expand her store by selling also fishing equipment, since fishing is the primary source of income in their community. She hopes that she can provide more services to her neighbors.

loans.use: Additional capital on her sari-sari or retail business store.

location.town: Manil, Leon B. Postigo, Zamboanga del Norte

loans.name: Mariafe

texts.en: Hardworking and industrious, Mariafe B. is 24 years old, a single mother of one child and presently lives at Tudela, Misamis Occidental. She joined PAGLAUM last April 2009 to secure financial assistance for her sari-sari store to buy additional stock such as laundry items, seasonings, goodies, toiletries, drinks and other household items. She aims to have a successful business with a concrete store and to provide for her child to finish a college degree and have a good future.

loans.use: additional capital for sari-sari store

loans.name: Marka

texts.en:
Marka J. currently sells ice cream and is requesting for a loan to buy a fridge and more sugar to make tea in order to enhance her business. She is 34 years old and married to a man who is a driver. Marka has four children who all go to school. With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to build a house to rent.

BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, and human rights and legal services which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as a measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions. In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: Buy a fridge and purchase more sugar to make tea.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase stock for her shop, such as shirts, trousers, suitcases, different types of mattresses, men shoes, etc.

loans.name: Silman

texts.en:
Silman M. is currently in the business of selling bread and is requesting for a loan to open up a restaurant. She is 25 years old and single. With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to buy a lorry to hire. 

BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, and human rights and legal services which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as a measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions.  In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: open up a resturant

loans.name: Eugenia

texts.en: Eugenia T. is 43 years old and lives in Clarin, Misamis Occidental, Philippines. She is married with one child. Her husband is a government employee. She has been a member of Paglaum MPC since October 2007, having a very good repayment performance. She needs additional capital to expand her "carenderia" (restaurant) business. She wants her business to grow and to be able to manage it well for the future of her family.

loans.use: Additional capital for restaurant.

loans.name: Odeyo

texts.en:
Odeyo S. sells beans at the market and wants this loan to expand her business in such a way that she will stock more beans and open up her own shop in a good location. She is 38 years-old and married to a chief.  Odeyo has five children, two are in secondary school and three still in primary level. With the extra profits from her loan, she intends to pay school fees for her children untill they finish the university level.

 BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education , and human rights and legal services which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions.  In 2007, BRAC started operations in southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: To open a bean shop.

loans.name: Neljean

texts.en: Mrs. Neljean Q. is 38 years-old and lives in Sinacaban in the Misamis Occidental province of the Philippines. She is married to an auto mechanic and they have 8 children studying in elementary and secondary level.  She is a new member of Paglaum MPC under the microfinance program. She requests a loan in the amount of PHP 10,000 which she will use to purchase additional stock for her "sari-sari," or mini grocery store, were she sells assorted goods. She hopes to improve her business and be able to give a decent life to her children.

loans.use: To purchase additional stock for her store.

loans.name: Beatriz

texts.en: Beatriz P. is 43 years-old and is from Tudela in Misamis Occidental province of the Philippines.  She is married and the mother of 9 children. Her husband is a farmer. She has been a member of PAGLAUM MPC under the microfinance program since September 2006 and has a very excellent loan repayment record.  She now requests a loan in the amount of 5,000 PHP to purchase additional stock for her "sari-sari," or mini market, in order to please her customers.  She hopes one day her children might finish college so that they can have a brighter future and help support the family.

loans.use: To buy more goods for her mini market.

loans.name: Neema

texts.en:
Neema is a rice seller in the Nzovwe neighborhood of Mbeya. She belongs to the Tumaini group loan. She currently earns very little monthly profit. Every day, she works at her business for 12 hours.

She is requesting her first loan from BRAC Tanzania, a Kiva partner, so that she can buy more rice for resale. She is hoping that through this loan, her profits will increase and she will be able to grow her business.

Neema is a 33-year-old widow with three children, ages 13, 7 and 5.

loans.use: To buy more rice for resale

loans.name: Nzovwe Group

texts.en:
Lyoda is an animal-feed selller in the Nzovwe neighborhood of Iringa. She belongs to the Nzovwe group loan. She currently earns very little monthly profit. Every day, she works at her business for 12 hours.

She is requesting her first loan from BRAC Tanzania, a Kiva partner, so that she can buy more animal feed for resale to expand her business. She is hoping that through this loan, her profit will increase and she will be able to grow her business.

Lyoda is 45 years old, married and has six children: ages 22, 18, 17, 15, 10 and 9. She will be sharing this loan with her fellow group member, Patricia, who has her own small business selling animal feed in Zanzibar.

loans.use: To buy more animal feed for resale

loans.name: Resureccion

texts.en: Mrs. Resureccion P. is 59 years old and married with seven children. She is from Jimenez, Misamis Occidental, Philippines. She has been a member of PAGLAUM MPC since August 2008. She is seeking PHP10,000 for additional capital for her sari-sari (general variety) store to buy additional stock such as laundry items, seasonings, goodies, toiletries and other household items. With her previous loans, she demonstrated outstanding loan repayment. She aims to have a successful business with a concrete store and to be able to send her children to college and have a good future.

loans.use: Additional capital for sari-sari store

loans.name: Jerisa

texts.en:
Jerisa J. is a 42-year-old woman married to a peasant who grows crops on the shore of the Nile river in Juba. She is currently in the business of selling fruits like apples, bananas, oranges, and tomatoes at the market of Konyokonyo, which is around the Freedom Square.  She requests a loan in order to purchase more fruits to sell.  She has three children who all go to school and with the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to build a house.

 BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, and human rights and legal services which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions.  In 2007, BRAC started operations in southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: To purchase more fruit to sell.

loans.name: Christie Ellen

texts.en:
"I have been a farmer for a long time already. My husband and I are tenants and we are just tilling the land that we do not own. Mr. Yorsua, the owner of the farm, will just give us a share of the harvest. This is what we use to feed and clothe our family. Our wish is that someday we will be able to buy our own farm to better support the needs of our children," says Christie Ellen A..

She would like to ask for a loan of PHP 10,000 from CEVI. She will use the loan to purchase Urea fertilizers, herbicides and a sprayer. The loan will really help her improve their harvest and income as well. 

CEVI is providing financial services to rural communities. CEVI provides not just loans but training and insurance coverage as well.

loans.use: To purchase Urea fertilizers, herbicides and a sprayer.

loans.name: Elena

texts.en: Elena A.’s main business is raising hogs. The business has become a big help in sending her children to school. She is 28 years-old and is married to Eduardo A. Jr.  Elena is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP in order to purchase more feed for her hogs. She will use the extra income she earns from her larger pigs to meet the needs of her family. The couple is working very hard together to increase their income so that they can send their children to college. At the moment, Elena lives in the village of Liwayway Diffun, Quirino with her happy family. She is hoping that her business will expand in the future and their standard of living will increase.

loans.use: To buy feed for her hogs.

loans.name: Majorine's Group

texts.en: S. Majorine is the leader of Myanzi Tukolerewamu group in Mityana. She is a strong and hard working lady and by the time I visited the group, she had just given birth to a baby girl but she managed to come and attend to her duties in the group.  She has a retail shop in the Myanzi trading center where she sells sugar, salt, cooking oil, flour and cold drinks plus many other items.  She has been doing this for 9 years.  She has been in the lending group for 4 years, and she has seen a change. She has been able to increase the stock of her shop as well as buying animals like cows, goats, and hens that she keeps at home. She is in need of a loan to buy more stock for her shop.

loans.use: To buy more stock for her retail shop.

loans.name: Victoria

texts.en: Victoria D. is single and resides at Poblacion in Leon B. Postigo, which is in Zamboanga Del Norte province of the Philippines.  Currently she is engaged in tailoring and dress repair services and it serves as her livelihood.  She inherited a house and her niece lives with her and also helps her in running her business. She started with only one sewing machine, catering to dress repair and smaller clothing items such as school uniforms and short pants. She is planning to buy an additional machine so that she can accept more clients. She is very positive that her business will continue to grow.  Her business is really viable and sustainable in their community because of their quality tailoring service.

loans.use: To purchase an additional sewing machine.

location.town: Poblacion, Leon B. Postigo, Zamboanga Del Norte

loans.name: Lamini

texts.en: Lamini G. is a widow with two children. She has no formal education.  Lamini is a trader who sells second-hand clothing as a hawker, which she has done for 4 years.  Lamini uses her income to pay for feeding and clothing her family.  Lamini will use the loan to buy more second-hand clothing to sell.  With the new profits from her expanded business, Lamini plans to put the profit into savings and pay school fees for the children.

loans.use: To buy more second-hand clothing to sell.

loans.name: Theresa

texts.en: Theresa A. is married and has two children. She has received schooling through senior high. Theresa has been a trader in second-hand clothing for two years. Her husband is a commercial driver. Theresa uses her income to pay for food and clothing for the family. Theresa will use the loan to buy more second-hand clothing to sell.  With the additional profits resulting from the loan, Theresa plans to reinvest into her business and also use part to pay school fees for the children.

loans.use: Tto buy more second-hand clothing to resell.

loans.name: Richel Mae

texts.en: Richel Mae D.  is 26 years old, single, and presently resides at Clarin, Misamis Occidental. Her loan is intended to buy vitamins and feed for her hogs. She has been a member of PAGLAUM MPC since February 2008 and she says that with the help of PMPC-Micofinance Program, her business has grown in a way that she has better income now than before. She hopes to have her own family someday and able to provide a decent life in the future.

loans.use: to purchase feed and vitamins for her hogs

loans.name: Ladu

texts.en:
Ladu V. sells tea at a restaurant and is requesting a loan to stock up on more sugar and powdered milk to continuously make tea to sell. She is 21 years old and single. In the future, she wants to use the extra profits for opening up a bigger restaurant.

BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, and human rights and legal services which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations.

BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as a measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions. In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The micro-finance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: stock up on sugar and powdered milk to make tea to sell

loans.name: Doris

texts.en:
Doris A. is married and has 4 dependents. She has received schooling through junior high. Doris is a petty trader who sells second-hand clothing, which she has done for 5 years. Her husband is a petty trader, too. Doris uses her income to pay for food and clothing for her dependants.

Doris will use the loan to purchase more second-hand clothing for resale. With the new profits from her expanded business, Doris plans to re-invest, pay taxes, and put aside some savings out of her profit.

loans.use: purchase more second-hand clothing for resale

loans.name: Esi

texts.en:
Esi A. sells charcoal at Abura. A. has received Junior High School education. She is married and has 5 dependents. Her husband is a carpenter. A. has been selling charcoal since 2005. She is responsible for paying school fees and utility bills for her family.

Her loan will be used to buy charcoal for resale to make more profit. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to reinvest to increase her capital so that she can pay her water bill and light bill with ease.

loans.use: buy charcoal for resale

loans.name: Lucita

texts.en:
Lucita A. is a fish vendor. She sells fish to earn enough money to buy their needs. She is a 45 year old mother of four children. She has been selling fish for eight years already. Her husband is a fisherman. Both of them work very hard to support their children educational needs. In addition to selling fish, they have a small sari-sari store to supplement their income.

She would like to ask a loan of PHP 8,000 from CEVI. She will use the loan to buy fish to sell. Aside from that, the loan will help a lot in repairing their boat.

CEVI is providing financial services to rural communities. CEVI provides not just loans but trainings and insurance coverage as well.

loans.use: To buy fish to sell and to repair their boat.

loans.name: Theresa

texts.en:
Theresa F. is a seamstress and also sells clothing at Abura. Theresa has received Junior High School education. She is married and has 5 dependents. Her husband is an electrician.

Theresa has been in the clothing business since 1988. She is responsible for paying water bill, light bills and other family expenses. Her loan will be used to buy more cloth and sewing materials to expand her business to generate more income and profits. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to reinvest, save, and then for payment of school fees and taking care of other bills.

loans.use: buy more cloth and sewing materials

loans.name: Nzovwe 1 D Group

texts.en:
Sarah is an animal feed seller in the Nzovwe neighborhood of Mbeya. She belongs to Nzovwe 1 group loan (Group code 2018). She currently earns very little monthly profit. Every day she works at her business for 12 hours.

She is requesting her first loan from BRAC Tanzania so that she can buy more animal feed to add to her current stock for the improvement of her business. She is hoping that through this loan, her profit will increase and she will be able to grow her business.

Sarah is 40 years old, widowed, and has three children, ages 18, 12 and 5. She will be sharing this loan with her fellow group member, Mwamvua, who has her own small business, a hair dressing salon in Mbeya.

loans.use: To buy more animal feed to add to her current stock

loans.name: Eunice

texts.en:
Eunice S. is married to a driver and has 3 dependents. She has received schooling through Primary School level. Eunice sells hair creams, body creams and other cosmetics. She has been in this business since 2003.

Eunice uses her income to pay for food and housekeeping expenses. Eunice will use the loan to purchase hair creams for resale. With the new profits from her expanded business, Eunice plans to reinvest to increase her profits.

loans.use: purchase hair creams for resale

loans.name: Kong's Group

texts.en:
This is a small loan for five members who live in the Province of Siem Reap, Cambodia. Mrs. Kong L. has been selected to be group leader by the other members. 

Kong L. is currently a humble villager who earns a living planting a variety of vegetables on her own farmland. She has been running this farm for six years. The other source of income is her husband’s business selling used goods. He also uses his old motorcycle to buy the used goods from his customer's homes. He purchases the goods at the cheapest price and then resells them for profit where used goods are offered for sale in bulk.

Recently, Kong L.’s husband’s business was not running smoothly because his motorcycle was frequently broken down. Therefore, Kong L. has decided to ask for a loan in order to repair the old motorcycle.

The other borrowers who have joined this loan are listed below:
S. will use his amount of loan to purchase piglets to raise in her own stall.
R. is a pig farmer, who seeks a loan to buy other pigs to raise.
R. is a local cake seller, requesting a loan to buy a motorcycle for the family's riding needs.
C. sells groceR. out of her home and she is applying for a loan to increase the quantity of groceR. items to sell. She was not available for the photograph so her husband is in the photo instead.

loans.use: To repair an old motorcycle.

loans.name: Massitan

texts.fr:
Madame  Massitan H. est une femme mariée de 44 ans, mère de 5 enfants qui habite avec son mari et ses enfants dans le quartier ATTbougou de la ville  de Ségou (4ème  région administrative de la république du Mali).
Elle n’a pas fréquenté l’école par refus de son père traditionaliste  qui voyait en l’école, un chemin d’amoindrissement de l’éducation des  filles. Alors depuis sa tendre enfance elle embrassa les activités génératrices de revenus auprès de ses parents. Elle a vendu des jus pour sa mère qui gérait un réfrigérateur. Après plusieurs années d’apprentissages passées auprès de cette dernière, elle devient  très riche  en expériences. Elle décida  d’évoluer seule en menant des activités d’achat et de vente d’habits et de chaussures depuis maintenant 10 ans. Elle jouit d’une grande réputation dans son lieu de résidence et  bien d’autres endroits de la ville. Les femmes viennent constamment acheter jusqu’à domicile.
Dans l’intention d’augmenter son fonds de commerce elle fait recours à Soro Yiriwaso. Elle est en relation avec cette dernière depuis 36 mois. Après 4 prêts solidaires et 1 prêt individuel tous correctement remboursés, elle est à son 2ème prêt individuel.
Elle compte utiliser ce prêt pour acheter, 10 complets de brodés et plusieurs paires de chaussures au Burkina Faso. Madame Massitan H. vend au comptant et à crédit à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes.
Avec ce prêt, elle compte réaliser un bénéfice mensuel de 40 000 FCFA qui lui permettra de prendre bien de dépenses familiales (nourritures et habillements). 
Son ambition est de construire une maison à usage d’habitation.
texts.en:
Mrs. Massitan H. is a married woman of 44, mother of 5 children, who lives with her husband and children in the ATTbougou neighborhood of the town of Ségou (4th administrative region of the Republic of Mali).

She did not attend school because her traditional-minded father refused to let her, seeing schools as a way to diminish a girl's education. So from her young days she began to work at earning money alongside her parents. She sold juice for her mother who had a refrigerator. After some years of such apprenticeship with her mother, she gained a lot of rich experience. She decided to go out on her own, selling clothing and shoes for 10 years now. She has a good reputation where she lives and in many other places around town. Women come constantly to buy her goods in her home.

With the intention of adding to her working capital, she turned to Soro Yiriwaso. She has been working with us for 36 months. After 4 solidarity loans and 1 individual loan, all correctly reimbursed, she is on her second individual loan. She expects to use this loan to buy 10 embroidered outfits and several pairs of shoes in Burkino Faso.

Mrs. Massitan H. sells for cash or credit to a clientele composed of men and women. With this loan she hopes to make a monthly profit of 40,000 F CFA which will allow her to cover many family expenses (food and clothing). Her ambition is to build a house to live in.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase of outfits and shoes for resale

loans.name: Philomina

texts.en:
Philomina S. is married and has 2 dependents. She has received schooling through primary education. S. sells plastic items. She has been in this business since 2007. Her husband is a carpenter by profession.

S. uses her income to pay for housekeeping expenses. She will use the loan to purchase more plastic items for resale. With the new profits from her expanded business, she plans to reinvest to increase her capital base and profits.

loans.use: purchase more plastic items for resale

loans.name: Ernestina

texts.en:
E. A. Ernestina is married and has 4 dependents. She has received schooling through Junior High. Ernestina sells clothing at Akotokyir. She has been in this business since 2005. Her husband is a security guard. Ernestina uses her income to pay for housekeeping expenses.

Ernestina will use the loan to purchase more clothes for resale for more profits. With the new profits from her expanded business, Ernestina plans to reinvest for more profits.

loans.use: purchase more clothes for resale

loans.name: Emelda

texts.en: Emelda A.  is 35 years old, married with 3 children, and presently resides at Clarin, Misamis Occidental, Philippines. She operates her hog-raising business, their primary activity. She has requested a loan amounting to Php 5,000 intended to buy vitamins and feed for the hogs. She is a member of Paglaum MPC since April 2009. She hopes to improve their living conditions in order to have a decent life in the future and able to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase hog  feed and vitamins

loans.name: Afful

texts.en:
Afful M. is married and has 3 dependents. She has received schooling through Junior High. M. sells Milo (a cocoa drink powder), sugar, soft drinks, and toffees at Akotokyir, which she started doing in 2009. Her husband is a contractor.

M. uses her income to pay the children’s school fees and utility bills. M. will use the loan to purchase more provisions for resale. With the new profits from her expanded business, M. plans to expand her business to yield more profit.

loans.use: purchase more provisions for resale

loans.name: Gladays

texts.en:
Gladays Q. is married and has 6 dependents. She has received schooling through Junior High School education. Gladays sells clothing at Kotokraba. She has been selling clothing since 2000. Her husband is a petty trader.

Gladays uses her income to pay for housekeeping expenses. Gladays will use the loan to purchase bales of clothes to expand her business to increase her profit. With the new profits from her expanded business, Gladays plans to reinvest and save to enable her to meet her financial obligations such as payment of school fees, water bill, light bill and other domestic expenses.

loans.use: purchase bales of clothes to expand her business

loans.name: Hakimova

texts.ru:
Хакимова Мукадас 1974 года рождения. Замужем имеет 3 детей. Мукадас работает в школе № 34. Муж подрабатывает на стройке или где предложат работу.  В настоящее время муж сидит дома, поэтому она посоветовашись с мужем решила получить кредит на бизнес скота.
 С Микроинвест сотрудничает с 2008 года. Кредит получила на покупку скота. Бизнес начинала 5 лет назад, с покупки 1 бычка. Когда бычок подрос продали и закупили большую корову.  И такой цикл купли продажи продолжает до сих пор. (На фото муж Хакимовой)
texts.en:
M. Hakimova was born in 1974. She is married and has three children. M. works in school #34. Her husband takes side jobs in construction or wherever he can find work. He is currently sitting at home without work, so M., after discussing it with her husband, decided to take out a loan for a livestock business. She has been working with Microinvest since 2008. She received a loan to purchase livestock. The business began five years ago, with the purchase of 1 bull calf. When the calf was finished they sold it and bought a large cow. That cycle of buying and selling continues. (Hakimova's husband is pictured)

Translated from Russian by Anna Brown, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Business expansion

loans.name: Asha

texts.en:
Asha R. sells tea and is requesting for a loan to set up a little restaurant. She is 45 years old and married to a businessman. R. is the mother of one child who goes to school. With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to pay school fees for her child.

BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, and human rights and legal services which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations.

BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as a measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions. In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The micro-finance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: opening a little restaurant

loans.name: Charles

texts.en:
Charles S. is married and has 5 dependents. He has received schooling through Junior High. Charles sells boutique materials at Kotokraba, which he has done since 2007. His wife is a petty trader.

Charles uses his income to pay school fees and utility bills. Charles will use the loan to purchase more boutique materials to resell. With the new profits from his expanded business, Charles plans to reinvest.

loans.use: purchase more boutique materials to resell

loans.name: Mamdy

texts.fr:
Monsieur Mamdy O. est  âgé de 29 ans et vit avec son enfant et son épouse dans une famille nucléaire dans le quartier Pelengana sud de la ville de  Ségou (4ème  région du Mali).
Ayant abandonné l’école en classe de 11ème  (correspondant à la seconde dans le système éducatif français), Mamdy pour s’insérer dans la vie active  décide d’apprendre la fabrication du savon local auprès d’un cousin qui avait une grande réputation dans le domaine. Cet apprentissage qui a durée 2 ans a été le tremplin pour lui d’apprendre à bien faire n’importe quelle variété de savons. Évoluant seul depuis 5 ans, il jouit d’une grande notoriété publique qui dépasse la ville de Ségou. Il a, à sa disposition 5 apprentis bien rodés dans le travail. Pour faire le savon « Koulikoro » il besoin d’un fût d’huile de palme + 40 kg de soudes caustiques + 1 litre de parfums+ silikalé qui durcie la pâte de savon, le tout sera  chauffé dans une barrique pendant 1heure et ½ pour en fin donner du  savon  prêt pour la vente.
Dans le  souci de faire face à la demande de sa clientèle de plus en plus grandissante, il fait recours à Soro Yiriwaso. Il est à son 1er prêt individuel  et compte l’utiliser pour payer 2 barriques d’huile de  palme et 10 sacs de soude caustique. Il s’approvisionne en matières premières sur place à Ségou. Monsieur Mamdy O. vend, en détail au comptant et à crédit à une grande clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes. 
Il compte réaliser un bénéfice mensuel 100 000FCFA qui sera utilisé pour fonds de roulement et pour prendre en charge ses dépenses familiales. 
Son ambition est d’ouvrir une usine de fabrique de savons.
texts.en:
Mr. Mamdy O., age 29, lives with his child and wife in a nuclear family in the Pelengana Sud district of the city of Ségou (fourth region of Mali). Having dropped out of school in grade 11 (corresponding to la seconde in the French educational system), he decided to learn how to make local soap, so as to enter the working world. He learned this work from a cousin, who had a great reputation in that domain. This apprenticeship lasted two years and was the springboard for him to make really any kind of soap. Improving on his own for five years, he enjoys public recognition beyond the city of Ségou. He has available to him five well-tested apprentices at work. To make koulikoro soap, he needs a palm oil drum, 40 kg of caustic soda, a liter of perfume, plus silikalé for hardening the soap paste. All of this is then heated in a drum for an hour and a half, thus producing soap ready for sale. Concerned about addressing the growing customer demand, he turned toward Soro Yiriwaso and is now on his first individual loan. He intends to use it to buy two palm oil drums and ten sacks of caustic soda. Supplies of ingredients are gotten locally in Ségou. Mr. O. sells at the retail level, cash or credit accepted from customers composed of men and women. He plans to realize a monthly profit of 100,000 francs CFA that will be used as working capital and to cover family expenses. His ambition is to open a factory for making soaps.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy raw materials for making local soaps

loans.name: Richard

texts.en:
Richard M. is married and has 2 children. He has received schooling through University level. Richard sells fabrics and clothing for men and women in Kotokraba, which he has done since 1999. His wife is a seamstress. Richard uses his income to pay school fees and housekeeping expenses.

Richard will use the loan to purchase more fabrics and clothing for resale. With the new profits from his expanded business, Richard plans to reinvest in the business.

loans.use: purchase more fabrics and clothing for resale

loans.name: Dina

texts.en:
Dina O. is married and has 3 dependents. She has received schooling through Junior High. Dina sells soft drinks at Pedu, which she has done since 2007. Her husband is a commercial driver.

Dina uses her income to pay their water bill, light bill and other family expenses. Dina will use the loan to purchase more crates of soft drinks. With the new profits from her expanded business, Dina plans to pay school fees and other housekeeping expenses.

loans.use: purchase more crates of soft drinks
